original: Pañcaviṃśatisāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā II
analyzed: pañcaviṃśati sāhasrikā prajñāpāramitā
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: atha khalu ye 'smiṃs trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau mahārājānas te sarve 'nekair devaputrasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ tatraiva pariṣadi saṃnipatitā
analyzed: atha khalu ye smin tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau mahā rājānaḥ te sarve nekaiḥ deva putra sahasraiḥ sārdham tatra eva pariṣadi saṃnipatitā
translated: Then, all the great kings in this great trichiliocosm, together with many thousands of sons of gods, assembled right there in that assembly.

original: evaṃ śakro devānām indro yāmās tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartino brahmapārṣadyā
analyzed: evam śakraḥ devānām indraḥ yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇa ratayaḥ paranirmita vaśavartinaḥ brahma pārṣadyā
translated: Likewise Śakra, lord of the gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Brahmapurohita gods,

original: yāvan mahābrahmāṇo ye ceha trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau parīttābhā yāvac chuddhāvāsakāyikāś
analyzed: yāvat mahābrahmāṇaḥ ye ca iha tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau parītta ābhāḥ yāvat śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ
translated: up to the Mahābrahmā gods, and the Parīttābha gods up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods in this great trichiliocosm,

original: ca devaputrā anekaiḥ śuddhāvāsakāyikair devaputrakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ sārdhaṃ
analyzed: ca deva putrāḥ anekaiḥ śuddhāvāsa kāyikaiḥ deva putra koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ sārdham
translated: and the sons of gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm, together with many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of sons of gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm,

original: tatraiva pariṣadi saṃnipatitā / yaś ca teṣāṃ cāturmahārājakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ / kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva pariṣadi saṃnipatitāḥ yaḥ ca teṣām cāturmahārājakāyikānām deva putrāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: assembled right there in that assembly. And the radiance of the bodies of those sons of gods of the Cāturmahārājika realm, born from the ripening of karma,

original: yaś ca trayastriṃśānāṃ yāmānāṃ tuṣitānāṃ nirmāṇaratīnāṃ paranirmitavaśavartināṃ yāvac chuddhāvāsakāyikānāṃ devaputrāṇāṃ karmavipākajaḥ kāyāvabhāsaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca trayastriṃśānām yāmānām tuṣitānām nirmāṇaratīnām paranirmitavaśavartinām yāvat śuddhāvāsakāyikānām devaputrāṇām karma vipāka jaḥ kāya avabhāsaḥ
translated: And the radiance of the bodies of the gods of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods, born from the ripening of karma,

original: sa tathāgataprakṛtiprabhāyāḥ śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti sahasratamīm api śatasahasratamīm
analyzed: sa tathāgata prakṛti prabhāyāḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm
translated: does not approach even a hundredth part of the natural radiance of the Tathāgata, does not approach even a thousandth, a hundred-thousandth part,

original: api koṭīśatasahasratamīm api saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām apy upamām apy upaniṣadam api nopaiti /
analyzed: api koṭī śata sahasratamīm api saṃkhyām api kalām api gaṇanām api upamām api upaniṣadam api nā upaiti
translated: does not approach even a koṭi-hundred-thousandth part, does not approach a count, a fraction, a calculation, a comparison, or an illustration.

original: na kṣamate tathāgataprabhāyāḥ purataḥ sā devānāṃ prabhā / tathāgataprabhaivāgrākhyate
analyzed: na kṣamate tathāgata prabhāyāḥ puratas sā devānām prabhā tathāgata prabhā eva agrā ākhyate
translated: The radiance of the gods cannot bear the radiance of the Tathāgata. The Tathāgata's radiance is declared to be foremost,

original: jyeṣṭhā śreṣṭhā varā pravarā praṇītā anuttarā niruttarā uttarottarā cākhyāyate / tadyathāpi
analyzed: jyeṣṭhā śreṣṭhā varā pravarā praṇītā anuttarā niruttarā uttarottarā ca ākhyāyate tat yathā api
translated: supreme, best, excellent, sublime, unsurpassed, unexcelled, and ever superior. Just as,

original: nāma jambūnadasya suvarṇasya purataḥ kṛṣṇalauhaṃ na bhrājate na tapati na virocate /
analyzed: nāma jambūnadasya suvarṇasya puratas kṛṣṇa lauham na bhrājate na tapati na virocate
translated: for example, in front of Jāmbūnada gold, black iron does not shine, does not gleam, does not glow.

original: evam eva tathāgatasya prakṛtiprabhāyāḥ purataḥ sā devānāṃ karmavipākajaprabhā na
analyzed: evam eva tathāgatasya prakṛti prabhāyāḥ puratas sā devānām karma vipāka ja prabhā na
translated: In the same way, in front of the natural radiance of the Tathāgata, the radiance born from the ripening of karma of the gods,

original: bhrājate na tapati na virocate / tathāgataprabhaiva teṣām agrākhyāyate jyeṣṭhākhyāyate🔽śreṣṭhā varā pravarā /
analyzed: bhrājate na tapati na virocate tathāgata prabhā eva teṣām agrā ākhyāyate jyeṣṭhā ākhyāyate  śreṣṭhā varā pravarā
translated: It does not shine, does not heat, does not illuminate. Only the light of the Tathāgata is said to be supreme, is said to be foremost,

original: praṇītā anuttarā niruttarā uttarottarā cākhāyate /
analyzed: praṇītā anuttarā niruttarā uttarottarā ca ākhāyate
translated: is said to be best, excellent, unsurpassed, unexcelled, and ever increasing.

original: iti dhyāmīkaraṇabhā deyānām
analyzed: iti dhyāmīkaraṇa bhā deyānām
translated: Thus, the radiance of the givers is outshone.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indra āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: ete bhadanta subhūte trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau ye cāturmahārājakāyikā devās
analyzed: ete bhadanta subhūte tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau ye cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ
translated: Reverend Subhūti, all the gods of the Four Great Kings,

original: trayastriṃśā yāmās tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartino devā yāvac chuddhāvāsakāyikā
analyzed: trayastriṃśāḥ yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ devāḥ yāvat śuddhāvāsa kāyikā
translated: the Thirty-Three, the Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para-nirmita-vaśa-vartin gods, up to the Śuddhāvāsa gods,

original: devaputrās te sarve saṃnipatitā āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ prajñāpāramitānirdeśaśravaṇāya
analyzed: deva putrāḥ te sarve saṃnipatitāḥ āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ prajñāpāramitā nirdeśa śravaṇāya
translated: have all assembled to listen to the Venerable Subhūti's teaching on the perfection of wisdom.

original: prajñāpāramitopadeśaṃ śrotukāmāḥ / kathaṃ ca bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā upadeśam śrotu kāmāḥ katham ca bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: They are eager to hear the instruction on the perfection of wisdom. Reverend Subhūti, how should a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: katamā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: katamā ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: And what is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: iti yogyatā
analyzed: iti yogyatā
translated: Thus, the suitability

original: evam ukte / āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Subhuti said to Sakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: tena hi kauśika upadekṣyāmi buddhānubhāvena buddhādhiṣṭhānena bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: tena hi kauśika upadekṣyāmi buddha anubhāvena buddha adhiṣṭhānena bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: Therefore, Kausika, I will teach the perfection of wisdom of the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas by the power of the Buddha, by the sanction of the Buddha, as the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ /🔽yaiś ca devaputrair anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ notpāditaṃ tair anuttarāyāṃ🔽samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayitavyam / ye punar avakrāntaniyāmās te 'pratibalā anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam  yaiḥ ca deva putraiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam na utpāditam taiḥ anuttarāyām  samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayitavyam ye punar avakrānta niyāmāḥ te pratibalāḥ anuttarāyām
translated: should stand in the perfection of wisdom.🔽And those sons of gods who have not yet produced the thought of supreme enlightenment should produce the thought of supreme

original: samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayituṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayitum tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: enlightenment. But those who have entered the fixed condition are not able to produce the thought of supreme enlightenment. Why is that?

original: baddhasīmāno hi te saṃsārasrotasaḥ /
analyzed: baddha sīmānaḥ hi te saṃsāra srotasaḥ
translated: For they are bound by the limits of the stream of samsara.

original: iti viṣayapratiniyamaḥ
analyzed: iti viṣaya pratiniyamaḥ
translated: Thus is the restriction to the object.

original: api tu khalu punas teṣām apy anumode te ced anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ / iti vyāptiḥ
analyzed: api tu khalu punar teṣām api anumode te ced anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayeyuḥ iti vyāptiḥ
translated: But I rejoice in those also if they should produce the thought of supreme enlightenment. Thus is the pervasion.

original: nāhaṃ teṣāṃ kuśalapakṣasyāntarāyaṃ karomi /iti svabhāvaḥ
analyzed: na aham teṣām kuśala pakṣasya antarāyam karomi iti svabhāvaḥ
translated: I do not create an obstacle for the wholesome side of those. Thus is the nature.

original: viśiṣṭebhyo dharmebhyo viśiṣṭatamā dharmā adhyālambitavyāḥ /
analyzed: viśiṣṭebhyaḥ dharmebhyaḥ viśiṣṭatamāḥ dharmāḥ adhyālambitavyāḥ
translated: One should rely on the most excellent dharmas from among the excellent dharmas.

original: iti kāritram ity uktāni dhyāmīkaraṇādīni
analyzed: iti kāritram iti uktāni dhyāmīkaraṇa ādīni
translated: Thus, the illuminating and so on have been explained as activities.

original: tatra kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya katamā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: tatra kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya katamā prajñāpāramitā
translated: There, Kauśika, what is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva?

original: iha bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ rūpam anityato
analyzed: iha bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ rūpam
translated: Here, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, with thoughts connected to omniscience, regards form as impermanent,

original: manasikaroti duḥkhato 'nātmataḥ śāntato rogato gaṇḍataḥ śalyato 'ghataḥ parataḥ pralopadharmataś
analyzed: manasikaroti duḥkhataḥ na ātmataḥ śāntataḥ rogataḥ gaṇḍataḥ śalyataḥ paratas pralopa dharmataḥ
translated: as suffering, as non-self, as peaceful, as a disease, as a tumor, as a dart, as misery, as alien, as disintegrating,

original: calataḥ prabhaṅgurato bhayata upasargata upadravato manasikaroti tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: calataḥ prabhaṅgurataḥ bhayataḥ upasargataḥ upadravataḥ manasikaroti tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: as fickle, as breaking up, as fearful, as a calamity, as an affliction, and he regards it as such by way of non-apprehension.

original: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā vijñānam / evaṃ cakṣuḥ śrotraṃ ghrāṇaṃ jihvā kāyo manaḥ /

original: evaṃ pṛthivīdhātur abdhātus tejodhātur vāyudhātur ākāśadhātur vijñānadhātum anityato manasikaroti duḥkhato /
analyzed: evam pṛthivī dhātuḥ ap dhātuḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ vāyu dhātuḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ vijñāna dhātum anityataḥ manasikaroti duḥkhataḥ
translated: likewise, the earth element, water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element, he regards as impermanent, as suffering,🔽as empty, as insubstantial.

analyzed: jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ saṃbhavanti evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ

original: sparśanirodhād vedanānirodho vedanānirodhāt tṛṣṇānirodhas tṛṣṇānirodhād upādānanirodha

translated: cease. Thus ceases this entire great mass of suffering. And that he contemplates as selfless,

original: śāntato viviktataḥ śūnyato 'nimittato 'praṇihitato 'nabhisaṃskārato manasikaroti
analyzed: śāntataḥ viviktataḥ śūnyataḥ nimittataḥ praṇihitataḥ manasikaroti
translated: as peaceful, as secluded, as empty, as signless, as wishless, as unconditioned.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikāraiḥ /🔽punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittena catvāri
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ  punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktena cittena catvāri
translated: And that by way of the yoga of non-apprehension, with thoughts connected with omniscience.

original: smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayati tac cānupalambhayogena / evaṃ catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catura
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayati tat ca anupalambha yogena evam catvāri samyakprahāṇāni catura
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva, with a thought connected with omniscience, cultivates the four establishments of mindfulness, and that by way of the yoga of non-apprehension. Likewise the four right efforts, the four

original: ṛddhipādān pañcendriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāni āryāṣṭāṅgamārgaṃ catvāry
analyzed: ṛddhipādān pañca indriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāni ārya aṣṭāṅga mārgam catvāri
translated: bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the four

original: apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasra ārūpyasamāpattīr daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri
analyzed: apramāṇāni catvāri dhyānāni catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattīḥ daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri
translated: immeasurables, the four meditations, the four formless attainments, the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four

original: vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikān /
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikān
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: buddhadharmān bhāvayati sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktair manasikārais tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: buddha dharmān bhāvayati sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ manasikāraiḥ tat ca an upalambha yogena
translated: He cultivates the buddhadharmas with mental activities joined to the knowledge of all aspects, and that by way of not apprehending anything.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktena cittotpādena
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktena citta utpādena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being, with a thought of arousal of Awakening joined to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dānapāramitāṃ carati tac cānupalambhayogena / evaṃ sarvajñatāpratisaṃyuktaiś cittotpādaiḥ
analyzed: dāna pāramitām carati tat ca anupalambha yogena evam sarvajña tā pratisaṃyuktaiḥ citta utpādaiḥ
translated: practices the perfection of giving, and that by way of the yoga of not apprehending anything. In the same way, with thoughts of arousal of Awakening joined to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: śīlapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: śīla pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: he practices the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom,

original: carati tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: carati tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: and that by way of the yoga of not apprehending anything.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evaṃdharmeṇa
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evaṃdharmeṇa
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva great being, practicing the perfection of wisdom, with a thought of arousal of Awakening joined to the knowledge of all aspects,🔽joins dharmas with dharmas. With a thought of arousal of Awakening joined to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dharmān yojayati / evaṃdharmeṇa dharmān abhiṣyandayan pariṣyandayan paripūrayan parisphāran
analyzed: dharmān yojayati evaṃdharmeṇa dharmān abhiṣyandayan pariṣyandayan paripūrayan parisphāran
translated: he moistens, thoroughly moistens, fills, and completely fills dharmas with dharmas.

original: pratyavekṣate nirātmakā hy ete sarvadharmā ātmātmīyavigatāḥ / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: pratyavekṣate nirātmakāḥ hi ete sarva dharmāḥ ātma ātmīya vigatāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: He investigates: “These dharmas are indeed without a self, without a being, without a soul, without a life-force, without a person, without a man, without a human, without a human being, without a descendant of Manu, without a ‘me,’ without a ‘mine,’ and without an inner being. Why is that?

original: tathā hi yad bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśalamūlacittaṃ tad bodhicittenāsamavahitaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi yat bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kuśala mūla cittam tat bodhi cittena asamavahitam
translated: Because the wholesome roots and mind of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva are not combined with the enlightenment mind,

original: yat pariṇāmanācittaṃ tad bodhicittakuśalamūlacittābhyām asamavahitaṃ yad bodhicittaṃ
analyzed: yat pariṇāmanā cittam tat bodhi citta kuśala mūla cittābhyām asamavahitam yat bodhi cittam
translated: and the mind of transformation is not combined with the enlightenment mind and wholesome roots mind. The enlightenment mind

original: tat pariṇāmanācittenāsamavahitaṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat pariṇāmanā cittena asamavahitam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: is not combined with the mind of transformation. Why is that?

original: yat kauśika bodhicittaṃ tat pariṇāmanācitte na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate / yat pariṇāmanācittaṃ
analyzed: yat kauśika bodhi cittam tat pariṇāmanā citte na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate yat pariṇāmanā cittam
translated: Kauśika, the enlightenment mind does not exist and is not found in the mind of transformation, and the mind of transformation

original: tad bodhicitte na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate / iyaṃ kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: tat bodhi citte na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate iyam kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: does not exist and is not found in the enlightenment mind. Kauśika, this is the perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattva

original: prajñāpāramitā yad evaṃ sarvadharmāṃś ca pratyavekṣate na ca kaṃcid dharmam abhiniviśate nopalabhate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā yat evam sarva dharmān ca pratyavekṣate na ca kaṃcid dharmam abhiniviśate na upalabhate
translated: who thus observes all dharmas but does not settle down on or apprehend any dharma.

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indraḥ sthaviraṃ subhūtim etad avocat /🔽kathaṃ bhadanta subhūte pariṇāmanācittaṃ bodhicittenāsamavahitaṃ /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ sthaviram subhūtim etat avocat  katham bhadanta subhūte pariṇāmanā cittam bodhi cittena asamavahitam
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said to the elder Subhūti:🔽Venerable Subhūti, how is the mind of transformation not combined with the enlightenment mind?

original: kathaṃ bodheś cittaṃ pariṇāmanācittenāsamavahitaṃ /
analyzed: katham bodheḥ cittam pariṇāmanā cittena asamavahitam
translated: How is the enlightenment mind not combined with the mind of transformation?

original: kathaṃ vā pariṇāmanācitte bodhicittaṃ na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: katham vā pariṇāmanā citte bodhi cittam na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate
translated: How is the Awakening Mind not found in the mind of transformation?

original: kathaṃ bodhicitte pariṇāmanācittaṃ na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: katham bodhi citte pariṇāmanā cittam na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate
translated: How is the mind of transformation not found in the Awakening Mind?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: yat kauśika pariṇāmanācittaṃ tad acittaṃ yad bodhicittaṃ tad acittaṃ na hy acittatācittatāyāṃ
analyzed: yat kauśika pariṇāmanā cittam tat acittam yat bodhi cittam tat acittam na hi acitta tā acitta tāyām
translated: Kauśika, the mind of transformation is not a mind, and the Awakening Mind is not a mind. For non-mind does not transform non-mind into

original: pariṇāmayati / iti hi yad acittaṃ tad acintyaṃ yad acintyaṃ tad acittam acittatācittatāyāṃ
analyzed: pariṇāmayati iti hi yat acittam tat acintyam yat acintyam tat acittam acitta tā acitta tāyām
translated: non-mind. Thus, what is not a mind is inconceivable, and what is inconceivable is not a mind. Non-mind transforms non-mind into

original: pariṇāmayati / iyaṃ kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: pariṇāmayati iyam kauśika bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā
translated: non-mind. This, Kauśika, is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva.

original: iti śrāvakamārgasya catuḥsatyālambanaṣoḍaśākāravyavasthānam /
analyzed: iti śrāvaka mārgasya catur satya ālambana ṣoḍaśa ākāra vyavasthānam
translated: Thus is the establishment of the śrāvaka path with its sixteen aspects based on the four noble truths.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti:

original: sādhu sādhu /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu
translated: Good, good it is, Subhūti!

original: subhūte sādhu khalu punas tvaṃ subhūte yas tvaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadiśasi /
analyzed: subhūte sādhu khalu punar tvam subhūte yaḥ tvam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām prajñāpāramitām upadiśasi
translated: It is indeed good that you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas,

original: utsāhaṃ dadāsi /
analyzed: utsāham dadāsi
translated: and give them encouragement.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: kṛtajñena mayā bhagavan bhavitavyaṃ nākṛtajñena /
analyzed: kṛtajñena mayā bhagavan bhavitavyam na a kṛtajñena
translated: I should be grateful, Blessed One, not ungrateful.

original: tathā hi bhagavan pūrvaṃ bodhisattvacaryāṃ caran pūrvakāṇāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan pūrvam bodhisattva caryām caran pūrvakāṇām tathāgatānām arhatām
translated: For thus, Blessed One, in the past, while practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva, in the presence of former Tathāgatas, Arhats,🔽and Perfectly Awakened Ones, those disciples were instructed, advised, shown,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike taiḥ śrāvakaiḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsv avavadito 'nuśiṣṭaḥ saṃdarśitaḥ🔽samuttejitaḥ saṃpraharṣitaḥ samādāpito niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpito yato bhagavān bodhisattvabhūtaḥ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhānām antike taiḥ śrāvakaiḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu avavaditaḥ nuśiṣṭaḥ saṃdarśitaḥ  samuttejitaḥ saṃpraharṣitaḥ samādāpitaḥ niveśitaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ yatas bhagavān bodhisattva bhūtaḥ
translated: exhorted, delighted, and established in the six perfections.🔽From there, the Blessed One, having been a bodhisattva,

original: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ / evam eva bhagavann
analyzed: ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu śikṣitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ evam eva bhagavan
translated: having trained in the six perfections, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. In the same way, Blessed One,

original: asmābhir api bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsv avavaditavyā anuśāsitavyāḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ api bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu avavaditavyāḥ anuśāsitavyāḥ
translated: we too should instruct and advise the bodhisattva mahāsattvas in the six perfections.

original: saṃdarśayitavyāḥ samādāpayitavyāḥ samuttejayitavyāḥ saṃpraharṣayitavyā niveśayitavyāḥ
analyzed: saṃdarśayitavyāḥ samādāpayitavyāḥ samuttejayitavyāḥ saṃpraharṣayitavyāḥ niveśayitavyāḥ
translated: We should show them, inspire them, delight them, establish them,🔽and firmly establish them in the six perfections. We too should instruct, advise, show,

original: pratiṣṭhāpayitavyā asmābhir api bodhisattvā mahāsattvā avavaditā anuśiṣṭāḥ saṃdarśitāḥ
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayitavyāḥ asmābhiḥ api bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ avavaditāḥ anuśiṣṭāḥ saṃdarśitāḥ
translated: and firmly establish the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: samuttejjitāḥ saṃpraharṣitāḥ samādāpitā niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: samuttejjitāḥ saṃpraharṣitāḥ samādāpitāḥ niveśitāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: and having been inspired, gladdened, urged on, and caused to enter, they will be established in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to Shakra, lord of the gods:

original: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣye yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: tena hi kauśika śṛṇu sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasikuru bhāṣiṣye yathā bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: Therefore, Kausika, listen well and remember, I will tell you how a Bodhisattva, a great being,

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ yathā pratipattavyaṃ rūpaṃ kauśika rūpeṇa śūnyaṃ vedanā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam yathā pratipattavyam rūpam kauśika rūpeṇa śūnyam vedanā
translated: should stand in the perfection of wisdom, how he should train. Form, Kausika, is empty of form, feeling

original: saṃjñā saṃskārā vijñānaṃ kauśika vijñānena śūnyaṃ bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam kauśika vijñānena śūnyam bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: is empty of feeling, perception is empty of perception, volitional formations are empty of volitional formations, consciousness is empty of consciousness, a Bodhisattva is empty of a Bodhisattva.

original: iti hi kauśika yā ca rūpaśūnyatā /
analyzed: iti hi kauśika yā ca rūpa śūnyatā
translated: Thus, Kausika, the emptiness of form,

original: yā ca vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskāravijñānaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā ca vedanā saṃjñā saṃskāra vijñāna śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness,

original: yā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā
translated: and the emptiness of a Bodhisattva,

original: advayam etad advaidhīkāram / evaṃ hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram evam hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: are not two, nor divided, nor are they broken apart. Thus, Kausika, should a Bodhisattva, a great being, stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika cakṣuś cakṣuṣā śūnyam / evaṃ śrotraṃ ghrāṇaṃ jihvā kāyo mano manasā śūnyaṃ bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika cakṣuḥ cakṣuṣā śūnyam evam śrotram ghrāṇam jihvā kāyaḥ manaḥ manasā śūnyam bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the eye is empty of the eye, and so the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of the mind, and the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: iti hi yā ca cakṣuḥśūnyatā /
analyzed: iti hi yā ca cakṣuḥ śūnyatā
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the eye

original: yā ca śrotraghrāṇajihvākāyamanaḥśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā ca śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāya manaḥ śūnya tā
translated: and the emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind,

original: yā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: yā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā
translated: and the emptiness of the bodhisattva,

original: advayam etad advaidhīkāram / evaṃ hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram evam hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: are non-dual, not divided into two. In this way, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika pṛthivīdhātuḥ pṛthivīdhātunā śūnyaḥ / evam abdhātus tejodhātur vāyudhātur ākāśadhātur vijñānadhātur vijñānadhātunā śūnyaḥ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika pṛthivī dhātuḥ pṛthivī dhātunā śūnyaḥ evam ap dhātuḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ vāyu dhātuḥ ākāśa dhātuḥ vijñāna dhātuḥ vijñāna dhātunā śūnyaḥ  /
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the earth element is empty of the earth element, and so the water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element,

original: bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: and the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: iti hi pṛthivīdhātuśūnyatā cābdhātuśūnyatā ca tejodhātuśūnyatā ca vāyudhātusūnyatā cākāśadhātuśūnyatā ca vijñānadhātuśūnyatā /
analyzed: iti hi pṛthivī dhātu śūnyatā ca ap dhātu śūnyatā ca tejaḥ dhātu śūnyatā ca vāyu dhātu sūnyatā ca ākāśa dhātu śūnyatā ca vijñāna dhātu śūnyatā
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the earth element, the emptiness of the water element, the emptiness of the fire element, the emptiness of the wind element, the emptiness of the space element, and the emptiness of the consciousness element,

original: ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / evaṃ hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram evam hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are not two nor divided, not broken apart nor cut apart. In this way, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika,

original: avidyāvidyayā śūnyā / evaṃ saṃskārā vijñānaṃ nāmarūpaṃ ṣaḍāyatanaṃ sparśo vedanā tṛṣṇopādānaṃ
analyzed: avidyā avidyayā śūnyā evam saṃskārāḥ vijñānam nāma rūpam ṣaṣ āyatanam sparśaḥ vedanā tṛṣṇā upādānam
translated: ignorance is empty of ignorance, and likewise formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping,

original: bhavo jātir jarāmaraṇaṃ jarāmaraṇena sūnyam / avidyānirodho 'vidyānirodhena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: bhavaḥ jātiḥ jarā maraṇam jarā maraṇena sūnyam avidyā nirodhaḥ vidyā nirodhena śūnyaḥ
translated: existence, birth, and old age and death are empty of old age and death. The cessation of ignorance is empty of the cessation of ignorance,

original: evaṃ saṃskārā vijñānaṃ nāmarūpaṃ ṣaḍāyatanaṃ sparśo vedanā tṛṣṇopādānaṃ bhavo jātir
analyzed: evam saṃskārāḥ vijñānam nāma rūpam ṣaṣ āyatanam sparśaḥ vedanā tṛṣṇā upādānam bhavaḥ jātiḥ
translated: and likewise the cessation of formations, consciousness, name and form, the six sense bases, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, existence, birth,

original: jarāmaraṇanirodho jarāmaraṇanirodhena śūnyaḥ bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: jarā maraṇa nirodhaḥ jarā maraṇa nirodhena śūnyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: and old age and death are empty of the cessation of old age and death. The bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: iti hy avidyāśūnyatā cāvidyānirodhaśūnyatā yāvaj jarāmaraṇaśūnyatā ca jarāmaraṇanirodhaśūnyatā
analyzed: iti hi avidyā śūnyatā ca avidyā nirodha śūnyatā yāvat jarā maraṇa śūnyatā ca jarā maraṇa nirodha śūnyatā
translated: Thus, the emptiness of ignorance and the emptiness of the cessation of ignorance, up to the emptiness of old age and death and the emptiness of the cessation of old age and death,

original: ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / evaṃ hi kauśika bodhisattvena
analyzed: ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram evam hi kauśika bodhisattvena
translated: and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are not two nor divided, not broken apart nor cut apart. In this way, Kauśika, the bodhisattva great being

original: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: A great being should stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika dānapāramitā dānapāramitayā śūnyā / evaṃ śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramitā dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika dāna pāramitā dāna pāramitayā śūnyā evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the perfection of giving is empty of the perfection of giving. Thus, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration,

original: prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitayā śūnyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitayā śūnyā
translated: the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: iti hi dānapāramitāśūnyatā ca śīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñāpāramitāśūnyatā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi dāna pāramitā śūnyatā ca śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the perfection of giving, the emptiness of the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva - this is non-dual, not divided into two.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika adhyātmaśūnyatādhyātmaśūnyatayā śūnyā / evaṃ bahirdhāśūnyatādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika adhyātma śūnyatā adhyātma śūnyatayā śūnyā evam bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the emptiness of inner emptiness is empty of inner emptiness, thus the emptiness of outer emptiness, the emptiness of inner and outer emptiness,

original: yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā śūnyā bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā śūnyā bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: up to the emptiness of the nature of non-existence is empty of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: iti hy adhyātmaśūnyatā ca bahirdhāśūnyatā cādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā ca yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi adhyātma śūnyatā ca bahirdhā śūnyatā ca adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā ca yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, the emptiness of the inner and outer, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika smṛtyupasthānāni smṛtyupasthānaiḥ śūnyāni / evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgābhijñāryasatyāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattidaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika smṛti upasthānāni smṛti upasthānaiḥ śūnyāni evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga abhijñā ārya satya apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness, and similarly, the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, path, higher knowledges, noble truths, immeasurables, concentrations, formless attainments, ten powers, confidences, aspects of awareness,

original: 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā aṣṭādaśabhir āveṇikair buddhadharmaiḥ śūnyā bodhisattvo
analyzed: ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ aṣṭādaśabhiḥ āveṇikaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ śūnyāḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, the bodhisattva

original: bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: iti hi smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatā ca yāvad āveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi smṛti upasthāna śūnyatā ca yāvat āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness, up to the emptiness of the distinct attributes of a buddha, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are non-dual, not divided into two.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika samādhiḥ samādhinā śūnyaḥ / dhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika samādhiḥ samādhinā śūnyaḥ dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, concentration is empty of concentration, the doors of retention

original: dhāraṇīmukhaiḥ śūnyāni bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: dhāraṇī mukhaiḥ śūnyāni bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ
translated: are empty of the doors of retention, the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva.

original: iti hi samādhiśūnyatā ca dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatā ca bodhisattvaśūnyatā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: iti hi samādhi śūnyatā ca dhāraṇīmukha śūnyatā ca bodhisattva śūnyatā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Thus, the emptiness of concentration, the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva—this is non-dual, not divided into two.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika śrāvakayānaṃ śrāvakayānena śūnyaṃ pratyekabuddhayānaṃ pratyekabuddhayānena
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika śrāvakayānam śrāvakayānena śūnyam pratyekabuddha yānam pratyekabuddha yānena
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the Śrāvakayāna is empty of the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyekabuddhayāna is empty of the Pratyekabuddhayāna,

original: śūnyaṃ mahāyānaṃ mahāyānena śūnyaṃ śrāvakaḥ śrāvakatvena śūnyaḥ pratyekabuddhaḥ pratyekabuddhatvena
analyzed: śūnyam mahāyānam mahāyānena śūnyam śrāvakaḥ śrāvaka tvena śūnyaḥ pratyekabuddhaḥ pratyekabuddha tvena
translated: the Mahāyāna is empty of the Mahāyāna, the Śrāvaka is empty of the Śrāvaka state, the Pratyekabuddha is empty of the Pratyekabuddha state,

original: śūnyaḥ bodhisattvo bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ buddho buddhatvena śūnyaḥ /
analyzed: śūnyaḥ bodhisattvaḥ bodhisattvena śūnyaḥ buddhaḥ buddhatvena śūnyaḥ
translated: the Bodhisattva is empty of the Bodhisattva, and the Buddha is empty of the Buddha state.

original: iti hi śrāvakayānaśūnyatā ca yāvan mahāyānaśūnyatā ca śrāvakaśūnyatā ca yāvad buddhaśūnyatā🔽cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / evaṃ hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: iti hi śrāvaka yāna śūnyatā ca yāvat mahāyāna śūnyatā ca śrāvaka śūnyatā ca yāvat buddha śūnyatā  ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram evam hi kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the Śrāvakayāna and up to the emptiness of the Mahāyāna, the emptiness of the Śrāvaka and up to the emptiness of the Buddha—🔽this is non-dual, not divided into two. In this way, Kauśika, the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva should

original: sthātavyam / ity uṣmagatam
analyzed: sthātavyam iti uṣma gatam
translated: stand in the perfection of wisdom. This is the stage of heat.

original: atha khalu sakro devānām indraḥ subhūtiṃ sthaviram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu sakraḥ devānām indraḥ subhūtim sthaviram etat avocat
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the elder Subhūti:

original: kathaṃ bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: How, Venerable Subhūti, should a bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: iha kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena rūpe na sthātavyaṃ na vedanāyāṃ na saṃjñāyāṃ
analyzed: iha kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena rūpe na sthātavyam na vedanāyām na saṃjñāyām
translated: Here, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand in form, should not stand in feeling, should not stand in perception,

original: na saṃskāreṣu vijñāne na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / cakṣuṣi na sthātavyaṃ rūpe na
analyzed: na saṃskāreṣu vijñāne na sthātavyam upalambha yogena cakṣuṣi na sthātavyam rūpe na
translated: should not stand in volitional formations, should not stand in consciousness, by way of apprehending something. Should not stand in the eye, should not stand in form,

original: sthātavyaṃ cakṣurvijñāne na sthātavyaṃ cakṣuḥsaṃsparśe na sthātavyaṃ cakṣuḥsaṃsparśajāyāṃ🔽vedanāyāṃ na sthātavyam /
analyzed: sthātavyam cakṣuḥ vijñāne na sthātavyam cakṣuḥ saṃsparśe na sthātavyam cakṣuḥ saṃsparśa jāyām  vedanāyām na sthātavyam
translated: should not stand in eye consciousness, should not stand in eye contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from eye contact,🔽which is born from the condition of eye contact.

original: evaṃ śrotraghrāṇajihvākāyamanasi na sthātavyaṃ dharmeṣu na sthātavyaṃ manovijñāne
analyzed: evam śrotra ghrāṇa jihvā kāya manasi na sthātavyam dharmeṣu na sthātavyam manaḥ vijñāne
translated: Thus, should not stand in the ear, should not stand in sound, should not stand in ear consciousness, should not stand in ear contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from ear contact,🔽which is born from the condition of ear contact. Should not stand in the nose, should not stand in smell, should not stand in nose consciousness, should not stand in nose contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from nose contact,🔽which is born from the condition of nose contact. Should not stand in the tongue, should not stand in taste, should not stand in tongue consciousness, should not stand in tongue contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from tongue contact,🔽which is born from the condition of tongue contact. Should not stand in the body, should not stand in tactility, should not stand in body consciousness, should not stand in body contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from body contact,🔽which is born from the condition of body contact. Should not stand in the mind, should not stand in dharmas, should not stand in mind consciousness,

original: na sthātavyaṃ manaḥsaṃsparśe na sthātavyaṃ manaḥsaṃsparśajāyāṃ vedanāyāṃ na sthātavyam
analyzed: na sthātavyam manaḥ saṃsparśe na sthātavyam manaḥ saṃsparśa jāyām vedanāyām na sthātavyam
translated: should not stand in mind contact, should not stand in the feeling that arises from mind contact,

original: upalambhayogena / pṛthivīdhātau na sthātavyaṃ abdhātau na sthātavyaṃ tejodhātau na
analyzed: upalambha yogena pṛthivī dhātau na sthātavyam ap dhātau na sthātavyam tejaḥ dhātau na
translated: which is born from the condition of mind contact. Should not stand in the earth element, should not stand in the water element, should not stand in the fire element,

original: sthātavyaṃ vāyudhātau na sthātavyam ākāśadhātau na sthātavyaṃ vijñānadhātau na sthātavyam
analyzed: sthātavyam vāyu dhātau na sthātavyam ākāśa dhātau na sthātavyam vijñāna dhātau na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand in the wind element, nor in the space element, nor in the consciousness element.

original: upalambhayogena / smṛtyupasthāneṣu na sthātavyam / evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgābhijñāryasatyāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattidaśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikabuddhadharmeṣu🔽na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / srotaāpattiphale na sthātavyam evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphale
analyzed: upalambha yogena smṛti upasthāneṣu na sthātavyam evam samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga abhijñā ārya satya apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇika buddha dharmeṣu  na sthātavyam upalambha yogena srotaāpatti phale na sthātavyam evam sakṛdāgāmi phale
translated: One should not stand in the applications of mindfulness, and so on up to: one should not stand in the knowledge and vision of liberation, by way of attachment.

original: 'nāgāmiphale 'rhattvaphale pratyekabuddhatvaphale yāvad buddhatve na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / iti mūrdhagatam
analyzed: na āgāmi phale rhat tva phale pratyekabuddha tva phale yāvat buddha tve na sthātavyam upalambha yogena iti mūrdha gatam
translated: One should not stand in the fruit of a stream-enterer, nor in the fruit of a once-returner, nor in the fruit of a non-returner, nor in the fruit of an arhat, nor in the fruit of a pratyekabuddha, up to: one should not stand in Buddhahood, by way of attachment. This is the summit.

original: rūpaṃ nityam iti na sthātavyam /
analyzed: rūpam nityam iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand in form as permanent,

original: evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham ity ātmety anātmeti śāntam ity aśāntam iti viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham iti ātmā iti anātmā iti śāntam iti aśāntam iti viviktam iti aviviktam iti na sthātavyam
translated: and similarly, one should not stand in form as impermanent, as happiness, as suffering, as self, as not-self, as peaceful, as not peaceful, as secluded, or as not secluded.

original: rūpaṃ śūnyam ity aśūnyam iti nimittam ity animittam iti praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
analyzed: rūpam śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti nimittam iti a nimittam iti praṇihitam iti a praṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: Form is empty, not empty, has a sign, is signless, has a wish, is wishless, one should not stand in the yoga of apprehension. Feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: vijñānam
translated: consciousness.

original: nityam iti na sthātavyam evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham ity ātmety anātmeti
analyzed: nityam iti na sthātavyam evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham iti ātmā iti anātmā iti
translated: Permanence, impermanence, happiness, suffering, self, not self,

original: śāntam ity aśāntam iti viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyam / vijñānaṃ śūnyam
analyzed: śāntam iti a śāntam iti viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam vijñānam śūnyam
translated: peace, not peace, secluded, not secluded, one should not stand. Consciousness is empty,

original: ity aśūnyam iti nimittam ity animittam iti praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam
analyzed: iti a śūnyam iti nimittam iti animittam iti praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam
translated: not empty, has a sign, is signless, has a wish, is wishless, one should not stand

original: upalambhayogena / evaṃ vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamupādāṅgeṣu pāramitāsu
analyzed: upalambha yogena evam vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamupādā aṅgeṣu pāramitāsu
translated: in the yoga of apprehension. Thus in the separate and combined aggregates, elements, sense bases, factors of dependent origination, perfections,

original: bodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣv apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu satyābhijñāsu samādhiṣu sarvadhāraṇīmukheṣu
analyzed: bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu satya abhijñāsu samādhiṣu sarva dhāraṇī mukheṣu
translated: factors of awakening, immeasurable, concentrations, formless attainments, truths, superknowledges, meditative absorptions, all dhāraṇī gateways,

original: daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvitsv aṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu yāvat sarvākārajñatāyāṃ
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvitsu aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyām
translated: powers, fearlessnesses, analytical knowledges, eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: sarveṣu teṣu nityam iti na sthātavyam evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham ity ātmeti🔽anātmeti śāntam ity aśāntam iti viviktam ity aviviktam iti na sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: sarveṣu teṣu nityam iti na sthātavyam evam anityam iti sukham iti duḥkham iti ātmā iti  anātmā iti śāntam iti a śāntam iti viviktam iti a viviktam iti na sthātavyam
translated: In all of them, one should not stand thinking 'permanently', 'impermanently', 'happy', 'unhappy', 'self',🔽'non-self', 'peaceful', 'not peaceful', 'isolated', 'not isolated'.

original: śūnyam iti aśūnyam iti nimittam ity animittam iti praṇihitam ity apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śūnyam iti a śūnyam iti nimittam iti animittam iti praṇihitam iti apraṇihitam iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not stand thinking 'empty', 'not empty', 'sign', 'signless', 'wishing', 'wishless', by way of apprehending.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika srotaāpattiphalam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam evaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika srotaāpatti phalam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam evam
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, one should not stand thinking 'the fruit of stream-entry is manifested by the unconditioned'. Similarly,

original: sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ pratyekabuddhatvam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyekabuddha tvam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam
translated: one should not stand thinking 'the fruit of once-returning', 'the fruit of non-returning', 'arhatship', 'individual enlightenment' is manifested by the unconditioned.

original: buddhatvam asaṃskṛtaprabhāvitam iti na sthātavyaṃ / srotaāpanno dakṣiṇīya iti na sthātavyam /
analyzed: buddhatvam a saṃskṛta prabhāvitam iti na sthātavyam srotaāpannaḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand thinking 'Buddhahood is manifested by the unconditioned'. One should not stand thinking 'the stream-enterer is worthy of offerings',

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmī /
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmī
translated: similarly, the once-returner,

original: anāgāmī /
analyzed: anāgāmī
translated: the non-returner,

original: arhan pratyekabuddhas tathāgato dakṣiṇīya iti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / iti kṣāntigatam
analyzed: arhan pratyekabuddhaḥ tathāgataḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena iti kṣānti gatam
translated: the arhat, the pratyekabuddha, the tathāgata is worthy of offerings, by way of apprehending. Thus, the section on patience.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamāyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prathamāyām bhūmau na sthātavyam
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand in the first stage,

original: evaṃ dvitīyāyāṃ bhūmau tṛtīyāyāṃ bhūmau caturthyāṃ bhūmau pañcamyāṃ bhūmau ṣaṣṭhyāṃ
analyzed: evam dvitīyāyām bhūmau tṛtīyāyām bhūmau caturthyām bhūmau pañcamyām bhūmau ṣaṣṭhyām
translated: and likewise in the second stage, in the third stage, in the fourth stage, in the fifth stage, in the sixth stage,

original: bhūmau saptamyāṃ bhūmāv aṣṭamyāṃ bhūmau navamyāṃ bhūmau daśamyāṃ bhūmau na sthātavyam
analyzed: bhūmau saptamyām bhūmau aṣṭamyām bhūmau navamyām bhūmau daśamyām bhūmau na sthātavyam
translated: in the seventh stage, in the eighth stage, in the ninth stage, in the tenth stage.

original: upalambhayogena / prathamacittotpāde sthitvā dānapāramitāṃ paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam /
analyzed: upalambha yogena prathama citta utpāde sthitvā dāna pāramitām paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand in the first production of the thought, thinking 'I will complete the perfection of giving.'

original: evaṃ śīlapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: evam śīla pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām vīrya pāramitām dhyāna pāramitām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Likewise, one should not stand in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom,

original: paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / evaṃ smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān
analyzed: paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena evam smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān
translated: thinking 'I will complete the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path,' by way of apprehending something.

original: paripūrayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / bodhisattvaniyāmam avakrāmayiṣyāmīti
analyzed: paripūrayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena bodhisattva niyāmam avakrāmayiṣyāmi iti
translated: One should not stand, thinking 'I will enter into the certainty of bodhisattvas,'

original: bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / bodhisattvaniyāmam avakramyāvinivartanīyabhūmau sthāsyāmīti /
analyzed: bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena bodhisattva niyāmam avakramya a vinivartanīya bhūmau sthāsyāmi iti
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in the idea that 'having entered into the certainty of the Bodhisattvas, I will stand on the irreversible stage'.

original: evam api bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / pañcābhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyāmīti🔽bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / pañcasu bodhisattvābhijñāsu
analyzed: evam api bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena pañca abhijñāḥ paripūrayiṣyāmi iti  bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena pañcasu bodhisattva abhijñāsu
translated: Thus also the Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in the idea that 'I will fulfil the five superknowledges'.

original: sthitvāsaṃkhyeyāny aprameyāny aparimāṇāni buddhakṣetrāṇy upasaṃkramiṣyāmīti / /🔽buddhāṃś ca bhagavato darśanāya vandanāya pūjanāya paryupāsanāya dharmaśravaṇāya
analyzed: sthitvā asaṃkhyeyāni aprameyāni aparimāṇāni buddhakṣetrāṇi upasaṃkramiṣyāmi iti  buddhān ca bhagavataḥ darśanāya vandanāya pūjanāya paryupāsanāya dharma śravaṇāya
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in the idea that 'having stood in the five superknowledges of the Bodhisattvas, I will go to innumerable, countless, immeasurable world systems in order to worship the Buddhas, the Lords, to see the Buddhas, the Lords, and to honour them'.

original: ca śrutvā ca tathatvāya pratipatsye pareṣāṃ ca dharmaṃ deśayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena
analyzed: ca śrutvā ca tathatvāya pratipatsye pareṣām ca dharmam deśayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena
translated: Having seen the Buddhas, the Lords, I will hear the Dharma, and having heard the Dharma as it should be learned, I will carry out the duties of a Bodhisattva in the ten directions'.

original: mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / yādṛśāni ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ
analyzed: mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena yādṛśāni ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: The Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in the idea that 'I will carry out the duties of a Bodhisattva in the ten directions'.🔽'Having stood in the perfection of wisdom and skill in means, I will go to the end of the world, and having gone to the end of the world, I will fully know the supreme enlightenment'.🔽The Bodhisattva, the great being, should not stand in the idea that 'having stood in the perfection of wisdom and skill in means, I will go to the end of the world, and having gone to the end of the world, I will fully know the supreme enlightenment'.

original: buddhakṣetrāṇi tādṛśāni niṣpādayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam🔽upalambhayogena / sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau paripācayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena
analyzed: buddhakṣetrāṇi tādṛśāni niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam  upalambha yogena sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau paripācayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena
translated: “I will create such buddha-fields,” the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should not stand in it, by way of a basis.🔽“I will ripen beings for supreme perfect enlightenment,” the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should not stand in it, by way of a basis.

original: mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / aprameyeṣv asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣv gatvā🔽tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān satkariṣyāmīti gurukariṣyāmīti mānayiṣyāmīti
analyzed: mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu gatvā  tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān satkariṣyāmi iti gurukariṣyāmi iti mānayiṣyāmi iti
translated: “Having gone to immeasurable, incalculable world systems,

original: puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākāduṣyakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrais
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā duṣya koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ
translated: I will honor the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones, I will respect, revere, worship, and make offerings to them, with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners, with koṭis of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of garments,

original: tāṃs tathāgatān pūjayiṣyāmīti /🔽evam api na sthātavyam aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān sattvān anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: tān tathāgatān pūjayiṣyāmi iti  evam api na sthātavyam aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān sattvān anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: I will make offerings to those Tathagatas,”🔽“I will establish immeasurable, incalculable beings in supreme perfect enlightenment,” the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should not stand in it.

original: pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyaṃ / pañca cakṣūṃṣi utpādayiṣyāmīti
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam pañca cakṣūṃṣi utpādayiṣyāmi iti
translated: “I will produce the five eyes,”

original: na sthātavyaṃ māṃsacakṣur divyacakṣuḥ prajñācakṣur dharmacakṣur buddhacakṣur utpādayiṣyāmīti🔽na sthātavyaṃ sarvasamādhīn niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyaṃ / yena yena punaḥ samādhinākāṅkṣiṣyāmi
analyzed: na sthātavyam māṃsa cakṣuḥ divya cakṣuḥ prajñā cakṣuḥ dharma cakṣuḥ buddha cakṣuḥ utpādayiṣyāmi iti  na sthātavyam sarva samādhīn niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam yena yena punar samādhinā ākāṅkṣiṣyāmi
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'I will produce the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the eye of wisdom, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.'

original: vikrīḍituṃ tena tena samādhinā vikrīḍiṣyāmīti na sthātavyaṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni niṣpādayiṣyāmīti
analyzed: vikrīḍitum tena tena samādhinā vikrīḍiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish all meditative absorptions.' One should not stand thinking, 'Wherever I wish to play with meditative absorption, I will play with that meditative absorption.' One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish all the doors of retention.'

original: na sthātavyam / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattir niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam / daśatathāgatabalāni🔽niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyaṃ / catvāri vaiśāradyāni niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: na sthātavyam apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiḥ niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam daśa tathāgata balāni  niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam catvāri vaiśāradyāni niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish the immeasurables, the dhyānas, and the formless concentrations.' One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish the ten powers of the Tathāgata.'🔽One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish the four fearlessnesses.'

original: catasraḥ pratisaṃvido niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam / aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān
analyzed: catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān
translated: One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish the four detailed and thorough knowledges.' One should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.'

original: pariniṣpādayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / mahāmaitrīṃ
analyzed: pariniṣpādayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena mahā maitrīm
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand thinking, 'I will accomplish great love.'

original: mahākaruṇāṃ niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam / dvātriṃśac ca mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāni kāye🔽niṣpādayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam / aśītyanuvyañjanāni niṣpādayiṣyāmīti bodhisattvena🔽mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / śraddhānusārī dharmānusāry aṣṭamakaḥ🔽srotaāpannaḥ saptakṛtvo bhavaparama iti na sthātavyam / kulaṃkula iti ekavīcika iti
analyzed: mahā karuṇām niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam dvātriṃśat ca mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni kāye  niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam aśīti anuvyañjanāni niṣpādayiṣyāmi iti bodhisattvena  mahāsattvena na sthātavyam upalambha yogena śraddhā anusārī dharma anusārī aṣṭamakaḥ  srotaāpannaḥ sapta kṛtvas bhava parame iti na sthātavyam kulaṃkulaḥ iti ekavīcikaḥ iti
translated: One should not stand thinking, ‘I will accomplish the thirty-two marks of a great person on my body.’ One should not stand thinking, ‘I will accomplish the eighty minor marks.’🔽A bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand in the stage of a faith-follower, the stage of a Dharma-follower, the eighth stage,🔽the stage of a stream-enterer, the stage of a once-returner, the stage of a non-returner, the stage of a solitary buddha, or the stage of a bodhisattva.🔽One should not stand thinking, ‘I will attain the stage of a worthy one.’ One should not stand thinking, ‘I will attain the stage of a pratyekabuddha.’ One should not stand thinking, ‘I will attain the stage of a buddha.’

original: na sthātavyam / samaśīrṣaḥ pudgala iti na sthātavyam / āyuḥkṣaye kleśakṣaye ca na sthātavyam /🔽srotaāpanno 'vinipātadharma iti na sthātavyaṃ / sakṛdāgāmī sakṛd imaṃ lokam āgamya🔽duḥkhasyāntaṃ kariṣyāntaṃ kariṣyāmīti na sthātavyam / anāgāmy anāgāmiphalaṃ sākṣātkriyāyai🔽pratipanna iti na sthātavyam / anāgāmī tatraiva parinirvāyīti na sthātavyam / arhann

original: arhatphalaṃ sākṣātkriyāyai pratipanna iti na sthātavyam / arhann /
analyzed: arhat phalam sākṣātkriyāyai pratipanne iti na sthātavyam arhan
translated: One should not stand [thinking], I am entering into the realization of the fruit of arhatship. I am an arhat.

original: ihaivānupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvāyīti na sthātavyam / pratyekabuddha iti na🔽sthātavyam / bodhisattvo 'tikramya śrāvakābhūmiṃ ca pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ ca bodhisattvabhūmau🔽ca sthāsyāmīti na sthātavyam / mārgajñatājñāne na sthātavyam upalambhayogena / sarvākāreṇa
analyzed: iha eva an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvāyī iti na sthātavyam pratyekabuddhaḥ iti na  sthātavyam bodhisattvaḥ u tikramya śrāvakā bhūmim ca pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca bodhisattva bhūmau  ca sthāsyāmi iti na sthātavyam mārga jña tā jñāne na sthātavyam upalambha yogena sarva ākāreṇa
translated: I will attain final nirvāṇa in this very life in the nirvāṇa realm without remainder. One should not stand [thinking], I am a pratyekabuddha.

original: sarvadharmān abhisaṃbuddhya sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśakṣayāt tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho
analyzed: sarva dharmān abhisaṃbuddhya sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśa kṣayāt tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: Having transcended the stage of the śrāvakas and the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, I will stand on the bodhisattva stage. One should not stand [thinking], By means of the knowledge of the path, I will stand [thinking], 'I will fully awaken to all phenomena in all their aspects, and by the destruction of the afflictions that are the latent tendencies and attachments, I will become a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha,

original: 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya dharmacakraṃ pravartayiṣyāmīti na sthātavyam /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhya dharmacakram pravartayiṣyāmi iti na sthātavyam
translated: having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect awakening, I will turn the wheel of the Dharma.'

original: buddhakṛtyaṃ kṛtvāsaṃkhyeyān aprameyān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: buddha kṛtyam kṛtvā asaṃkhyeyān aprameyān sattvān parinirvāpayiṣyāmi iti
translated: Having performed the deeds of a buddha, I will lead countless, immeasurable beings to final nirvāṇa.

original: evam api na sthātavyam / caturṣv ṛddhipādeṣv indriyeṣu sthitvā tathārūpaṃ samādhiṃ
analyzed: evam api na sthātavyam caturṣu ṛddhipādeṣu indriyeṣu sthitvā tathārūpam samādhim
translated: One should not stand [thinking] even thus. Having stood in the four bases of supernatural power and the faculties, having entered that kind of concentration,

original: samāpatsye yathārūpeṇa samādhinā gaṅgānadīvālukopamān kalpān sthāsyāmīti na sthātavyam
analyzed: samāpatsye yathārūpeṇa samādhinā gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamān kalpān sthāsyāmi iti na sthātavyam
translated: I will attain such a form, and will remain for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River through the power of concentration,' one should not abide [in that attainment].

original: upalambhayogena / aparimitaṃ ma āyuḥpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyatīti na sthātavyam upalambhayogena /
analyzed: upalambha yogena aparimitam me āyuḥ pramāṇam bhaviṣyati iti na sthātavyam upalambha yogena
translated: One should not abide in the yoga of apprehension, thinking, 'My lifespan will be immeasurable.'

original: dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇeṣv ekaikalakṣaṇaṃ śatapuṇyapariniṣpannaṃ bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇeṣu ekaika lakṣaṇam śata puṇya pariniṣpannam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: 'Each of the thirty-two marks of a great man will be perfected through a hundred merits,'

original: na sthātavyaṃ / yāvantaḥ pūrveṇa gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātava evaṃ dakṣiṇapaścimottareṇa🔽gaṅgānadivālukopamā lokadhātavas tāvat mamaikaikaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ bhaviṣyatīti na
analyzed: na sthātavyam yāvantaḥ pūrveṇa gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ evam dakṣiṇa paścima uttareṇa  gaṅgā nadi vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tāvat mama ekaikam buddhakṣetram bhaviṣyati iti na
translated: one should not abide [in that attainment]. As many world systems as there are in the east, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, and likewise in the south, west, and north,

original: sthātavyam / vajramayo me trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātur bhaviṣyatīti na sthātavyam /
analyzed: sthātavyam vajra mayaḥ me tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ bhaviṣyati iti na sthātavyam
translated: 'May each of those world systems be my buddha-field,' one should not abide [in that attainment]. 'May this trichiliocosm be made of diamond,' one should not abide [in that attainment].

original: bodhivṛkṣān me tādṛggandho niścared /
analyzed: bodhivṛkṣāt me tādṛś gandhaḥ niścaret
translated: 'May the fragrance of my bodhi tree spread

original: yas taṃ gandhaṃ ghrāyeta tasya sarvakāyasya na rāgo bādheta /🔽na dveṣo bādheta /
analyzed: yaḥ tam gandham ghrāyeta tasya sarva kāyasya na rāgaḥ bādheta  na dveṣaḥ bādheta
translated: such that for anyone who smells that fragrance, passion will not afflict the entire body,🔽aversion will not afflict [the body],

original: na moho bādheta /
analyzed: na mohaḥ bādheta
translated: and delusion will not afflict [the body].'

original: na kasyacic chrāvakacittaṃ vā pratyekabuddhacittaṃ vā syāt /
analyzed: na kasyacid śrāvaka cittam vā pratyekabuddha cittam vā syāt
translated: No one should have the thought of a śrāvaka or the thought of a pratyekabuddha.

original: sarve ca te sattvā niyatā bhaviṣyanty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ niyatāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: And all those beings should be destined for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: ye ca te sattvās taṃ gandhaṃ ghrāsyanti teṣāṃ na kaścid vyādhir bhaved iti evam api na sthātavyaṃ / tatra ca buddhakṣetre na rūpaśabdo /🔽na vedanāyā /
analyzed: ye ca te sattvāḥ tam gandham ghrāsyanti teṣām na kaścid vyādhiḥ bhavet iti evam api na sthātavyam tatra ca buddhakṣetre na  na vedanāyāḥ
translated: And for those beings who smell that fragrance, none should have any illness.' One should not stand in that way. And in that buddha-field, there should be no sound of form,🔽no sound of feeling,

original: na saṃjñāyā /
analyzed: na saṃjñāyāḥ
