analyzed: ātmanā ca catvāri smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayiṣyati
translated: He himself will cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: parāṃś ca smṛtyupasthānabhāvanāyāṃ samādāpayiṣyati /🔽smṛtyupasthānabhāvanāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: parān ca smṛti upasthāna bhāvanāyām samādāpayiṣyati  smṛti upasthāna bhāvanāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will encourage others to cultivate the establishments of mindfulness.🔽He will speak in praise of the cultivation of the establishments of mindfulness.

original: ye 'pi cānye smṛtyupasthānāni bhāvayiṣyanti teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye smṛti upasthānāni bhāvayiṣyanti teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: He will be a supporter and a speaker of praise for those who cultivate the establishments of mindfulness.

original: evam ātmanā ca catvāri samyakprahāṇāni bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: evam ātmanā ca catvāri samyakprahāṇāni bhāvayiṣyati
translated: In the same way, he himself will cultivate the four right efforts,

original: catura ṛddhipādān pañcendriyāṇi pañcabalāni saptabodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: caturaḥ ṛddhipādān pañca indriyāṇi pañca balāni sapta bodhyaṅgāni
translated: the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening,

original: āttnanā cāryāṣṭāṅgaṃ mārgaṃ bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: āttnanā cārya aṣṭāṅgam mārgam bhāvayiṣyati
translated: and will cultivate the noble eightfold path.

original: parāṃś ca mārgabhāvanāyāṃ samādāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca mārga bhāvanāyām samādāpayiṣyati
translated: He will inspire others to cultivate the path.

original: mārgabhāvanāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: mārga bhāvanāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will speak in praise of cultivating the path.

original: ye 'pi cānye mārgaṃ bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye mārgam bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: He will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who cultivate the path.

original: ātmanā ca catvāry āryasatyāni bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: ātmanā ca catvāri ārya satyāni bhāvayiṣyati
translated: He will cultivate the four noble truths himself.

original: parāṃś ca caturṣv āryasatyeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca caturṣu ārya satyeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati
translated: He will establish others in the four noble truths.

original: caturṇāṃ āryasatyānāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: caturṇām ārya satyānām ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will speak in praise of the four noble truths.

original: ye 'pi cānye catvāry āryasatyāni bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye catvāri ārya satyāni bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: He will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who cultivate the four noble truths.

original: ātmanā ca śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitān samādhīn bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: ātmanā ca śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitān samādhīn bhāvayiṣyati
translated: He will cultivate the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations himself.

original: parāṃś ca śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasamādhibhāvanāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samādhi bhāvanāyām pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati
translated: He will establish others in the cultivation of the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasamādhibhāvanāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samādhi bhāvanāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will speak in praise of the cultivation of the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: ye 'pi cānye śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitān samādhīn bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇavādi bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitān samādhīn bhāvayanti teṣām api varṇa vādi bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: And he will be one who speaks in praise of and approves of those others who cultivate the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: ātmanā cāṣṭavimokṣān samāpatsyate /
analyzed: ātmanā ca aṣṭa vimokṣān samāpatsyate
translated: And he will himself enter the eight deliverances.

original: parāṃś cāṣṭavimokṣasamāpattau samādāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca aṣṭa vimokṣa samāpattau samādāpayiṣyati
translated: And he will induce others to enter the eight deliverances.

original: aṣṭānāṃ ca vimokṣāṇāṃ varṇaṃ bhāsiṣyate /
analyzed: aṣṭānām ca vimokṣāṇām varṇam bhāsiṣyate
translated: And he will speak in praise of the eight deliverances.

original: ye 'pi cānye 'ṣṭavimokṣān samāpadyante teṣāṃ api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /🔽ātmanā ca navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ samāpatsyate /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye ṣṭa vimokṣān samāpadyante teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ  ātmanā ca nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ samāpatsyate
translated: And he will be one who speaks in praise of and approves of those others who enter the eight deliverances.🔽And he will himself enter the nine serial absorptions.

original: parāṃś ca navānupūrvavihārasamāpattau samādāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattau samādāpayiṣyati
translated: And he will induce others to enter the nine serial absorptions.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: And he will speak in praise of the nine serial absorptions.

original: ye 'pi cānye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīḥ samāpadyante teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ samāpadyante teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: And he will be one who speaks in praise of and approves of those others who enter the nine serial absorptions.

original: ātmanā ca daśatathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samāpatsyate /
analyzed: ātmanā ca daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samāpatsyate
translated: And he will himself enter the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, and the four detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: parāṃś ca daśatathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu samādāpayiṣyati🔽daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ caturṇāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: parān ca daśa tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu samādāpayiṣyati  daśānām tathāgata balānām caturṇām vaiśāradyānām catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: and will inspire others to the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, and the four analytical knowledges.🔽He will speak in praise of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, and the four analytical knowledges.

original: ye 'pi cānye daśatathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samāpadyante teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ samāpadyante teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: He will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who attain the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, and the four analytical knowledges.

original: ātmanā cāṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān samāpatsyate /
analyzed: ātmanā ca aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān samāpatsyate
translated: He will himself attain the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: parāṃś cāṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu samādāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu samādāpayiṣyati
translated: He will inspire others to the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will speak in praise of the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: ye 'pi cānye 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān samāpatsyante teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye ṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān samāpatsyante teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: He will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who attain the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: ātmanā cāsaṃmoṣadharmā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ātmanā ca a saṃmoṣa dharmā bhaviṣyati
translated: He will himself be one who has the quality of not forgetting.

original: parāṃś cāsaṃmoṣadharmatāyāṃ samādāpayiṣyati /
analyzed: parān ca a saṃmoṣa dharma tāyām samādāpayiṣyati
translated: He will inspire others to the quality of not forgetting.

original: asaṃmoṣadharmatāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: asaṃmoṣa dharmatāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will speak in praise of the Dharma of non-forgetfulness.

original: ye 'pi cānye 'saṃmoṣadharmatāyāṃ pratiṣṭāpitā bhavanti teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ /
analyzed: ye pi ca anye saṃmoṣa dharmatāyām pratiṣṭāpitāḥ bhavanti teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ
translated: And he will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who are established in the Dharma of non-forgetfulness.

original: ātmanā ca sarvākārajñatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhito bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ātmanā ca sarva ākārajña tāyām pratiṣṭhitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He himself will be established in omniscience.

original: parāṃś ca sarvākārajñatāyāṃ samādāpayiṣyati sarvākārajñatāyāś ca varṇaṃ bhāṣiṣyate /
analyzed: parān ca sarva ākārajña tāyām samādāpayiṣyati sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ ca varṇam bhāṣiṣyate
translated: He will inspire others to omniscience, and he will speak in praise of omniscience.

original: ye 'pi cānye sarvākārajñatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhitā bhavanti teṣām api varṇavādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ / iti mārge 'nvayajñānakṣāntiḥ
analyzed: ye pi ca anye sarva ākārajña tāyām pratiṣṭhitāḥ bhavanti teṣām api varṇa vādī bhaviṣyati samanujñaḥ iti mārge nvaya jñāna kṣāntiḥ
translated: And he will be one who speaks in praise of, and rejoices in, those others who are established in omniscience.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu caran yad dānaṃ dadāti🔽tat sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu caran yat dānam dadāti  tat sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati an upalambha yogena
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the six perfections, whatever gift he gives,🔽having made it common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: yac chīlaṃ rakṣati tat sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayaty /
analyzed: yat śīlam rakṣati tat sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: Whatever morality he guards, having made it common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: anupalambhayogena / yāṃ kṣāntiṃ bhāvayati tāṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: anupalambha yogena yām kṣāntim bhāvayati tām sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyām
translated: By way of non-apprehension. Whatever patience he cultivates, having made it common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayaty anupalambhayogena / yad vīryam ārabhate tat sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati an upalambha yogena yat vīryam ārabhate tat sarva sattva sādhāraṇam
translated: perfect enlightenment, by way of non-apprehension. Whatever effort he undertakes, having made it common to all beings,

original: kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayaty anupalambhayogena / yad dhyānaṃ samāpadyate
analyzed: kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati an upalambha yogena yat dhyānam samāpadyate
translated: he dedicates it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, by way of non-apprehension. Whatever meditation he enters,

original: tat sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayaty anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: tat sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati an upalambha yogena
translated: having made it common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, by way of non-apprehension.

original: yāṃ prajñāṃ bhāvayati tāṃ sarvasattvasādhāraṇaṃ kṛtvā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: yām prajñām bhāvayati tām sarva sattva sādhāraṇam kṛtvā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Whatever wisdom he cultivates, having made it common to all beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: pariṇāmayaty anupalambhayogena / evaṃ carataḥ kauśika kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur
analyzed: pariṇāmayati anupalambha yogena evam carataḥ kauśika kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ
translated: by way of non-apprehension. Thus, Kauśika, for the son of a good family or daughter of a good family who practices in this way,

original: vā ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu smṛtir evam utpadyate /
analyzed: vā ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu smṛtiḥ evam utpadyate
translated: memory arises thus regarding the six perfections:

original: yady ahaṃ dānaṃ na dāsyāmi /
analyzed: yadi aham dānam na dāsyāmi
translated: If I do not give gifts,

original: durgateṣu me kuleṣūpapattir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: durgateṣu me kuleṣu upapattiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: I will be reborn in unfortunate states of existence, among families of low status,

original: na ca me sattvaparipāko bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca me sattva paripākaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: and I will not be able to bring beings to maturity.

original: na ca me buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhanaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca me buddhakṣetram pariśodhanam bhaviṣyati
translated: I will not purify a Buddha-field.

original: na ca sarvajñatāṃ pratilapsye / tasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca sarvajña tām pratilapsye tasya evam bhavati
translated: I will not attain omniscience.” He thinks like this:

original: yady ahaṃ śīlaṃ na rakṣiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yadi aham śīlam na rakṣiṣyāmi
translated: “If I do not guard morality,

original: tisṛṇaṃ durgatīnāṃ me 'pāvṛtāni dvārāṇi bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: tisṛṇam durgatīnām me dvārāṇi bhaviṣyanti
translated: the doors to the three bad destinies will be opened for me.

original: na devamanuṣyopapattir me bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na deva manuṣya upapattiḥ me bhaviṣyati
translated: I will not be reborn as a god or human.

original: na sattvaparipāko na buddhakṣetrapariśodhanaṃ /
analyzed: na sattva paripākaḥ na buddhakṣetra pariśodhanam
translated: There will be no development of beings or purification of a Buddha-field.

original: kuta eva sarvajñatāpratilābhas / tasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kutas eva sarvajña tā pratilābhaḥ tasya evam bhavati
translated: How much less will I attain omniscience!” He thinks like this:

original: yady ahaṃ kṣāntiṃ na bhāvayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yadi aham kṣāntim na bhāvayiṣyāmi
translated: “If I do not cultivate patience,

original: indriyāṇi me paribhetsyante /
analyzed: indriyāṇi me pari bhetsyante
translated: my faculties will be impaired.

original: mukhamaṇḍalaṃ me dhyāmībhaviṣyati /
analyzed: mukha maṇḍalam me dhyāmībhaviṣyati
translated: My face will be pale.

original: na ca rūpasaṃpadaṃ pratilapsye /
analyzed: na ca rūpa saṃpadam pratilapsye
translated: I will not attain perfection of form.

original: yayā rūpasaṃpadā bodhisattvacārikāṃ me carataḥ / sattvāḥ saha darśanena niyatā bhaviṣyanty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yayā rūpa saṃpadā bodhisattva cārikām me carataḥ sattvāḥ saha darśanena niyatāḥ bhaviṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: By which perfection of form, while I am practicing the conduct of the bodhisattvas, beings will be destined for supreme perfect enlightenment upon merely seeing me.

original: na ca rūpasaṃpadā sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na ca rūpa saṃpadā sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi
translated: And I will not develop beings by means of the perfection of form.

original: na buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not purify a Buddha-field.

original: kutaḥ punaḥ sarvajñatāṃ pratilapsye / tasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kutas punar sarvajña tām pratilapsye tasya evam bhavati
translated: How will I attain omniscience? He thinks like this:

original: saced ahaṃ kusīdo bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: saced aham kusīdaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: If I become lazy,

original: naiva bodhisattvamārgaṃ bhāvayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na eva bodhisattva mārgam bhāvayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not cultivate the Bodhisattva path,

original: na vīryam ārapsye kathaṃ buddhadharmān paripūrayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na vīryam ārapsye katham buddha dharmān paripūrayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not strive with vigor, how will I fulfill the Buddha qualities?

original: kuta eva sarvajñatāṃ pratilapsye /
analyzed: kutas eva sarvajña tām pratilapsye
translated: How much less will I attain omniscience?

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:

original: saced ahaṃ vikṣiptacitto bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: saced aham vikṣipta cittaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: If I become one whose mind is scattered,

original: na śikṣiṣyāmi sarvasamādhipariniṣpādanāya /
analyzed: na śikṣiṣyāmi sarva samādhi pariniṣpādanāya
translated: I will not train in perfecting all meditative absorptions,

original: na sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not bring beings to maturity,

original: na buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: na buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣyāmi
translated: I will not purify the Buddha field,

original: kutaḥ punaḥ sarvajñatāṃ pratilapsye / tasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: kutas punar sarvajña tām pratilapsye tasya evam bhavati
translated: how much less will I attain omniscience? He thinks like this:

original: saced ahaṃ duṣprajño bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: saced aham duṣprajñaḥ bhaviṣyāmi
translated: If I become one with bad wisdom,

original: prajñopāyakauśalyena śrāvakabhūmiṃ pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ cātikramya sattvān paripācya
analyzed: prajñā upāya kauśalyena śrāvaka bhūmim pratyekabuddha bhūmim ca atikramya sattvān paripācya
translated: through skill in wisdom and means, having transcended the stage of the śrāvakas and the stage of the pratyekabuddhas, having brought beings to maturity,

original: buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhya sarvajñatām abhisaṃboddhuṃ nāhaṃ śikṣiṣyāmi sa evaṃ pratisaṃśikṣate /🔽ayuktam /
analyzed: buddhakṣetram pariśodhya sarvajña tām abhisaṃboddhum na aham śikṣiṣyāmi saḥ evam pratisaṃśikṣate  ayuktam
translated: having purified the Buddha field, I will not train to fully awaken to omniscience. He trains like this:

original: etat mama bhaved /
analyzed: etat mama bhaved
translated: This would not be right for me.

original: yo 'haṃ mātsaryavaśena dānapāramitāṃ na paripūrayeyam /
analyzed: yaḥ ham mātsarya vaśena dāna pāramitām na paripūrayeyam
translated: I will not fulfill the perfection of generosity due to the power of stinginess.

original: evaṃ dauḥśīlyavaśena śīlapāramitāṃ vyāpādavaśena kṣāntipāramitāṃ kauśīdyavaśena vīryapāramitāṃ
analyzed: evam dauḥśīlya vaśena śīla pāramitām vyāpāda vaśena kṣānti pāramitām kauśīdya vaśena vīrya pāramitām
translated: In the same way, I will not fulfill the perfection of morality due to the power of immorality, the perfection of patience due to the power of malice, the perfection of effort due to the power of laziness,

original: vikṣepavaśena dhyānapāramitāṃ dauṣprajñāvaśena prajñāpāramitāṃ na paripūrayeyaṃ /
analyzed: vikṣepa vaśena dhyāna pāramitām dauṣprajñā vaśena prajñāpāramitām na paripūrayeyam
translated: the perfection of meditation due to the power of distraction, and the perfection of wisdom due to the power of poor wisdom.

original: aparipūrayan dānapāramitām evaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ cāparipūrayan
analyzed: a paripūrayan dāna pāramitām evam śīlam kṣāntim vīryam dhyānam prajñāpāramitām ca a paripūrayan
translated: Not fulfilling the perfection of generosity, and in the same way not fulfilling the perfections of morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom,

original: na niryāsyāmi sarvākārajñatāyām / evaṃ hi kauśika sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadharmikān🔽sāṃparāyikāṃś ca guṇānuśaṃsān pratilabhate ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati vācayiṣyati
analyzed: na niryāsyāmi sarva ākāra jña tāyām evam hi kauśika sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭadharmikān  sāṃparāyikān ca guṇa anuśaṃsān pratilabhate yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati vācayiṣyati
translated: I will not attain omniscience. Thus, Kauśika, the son or daughter of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, recite it,

original: paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati likhiṣyati likhāpayiṣyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati likhiṣyati likhāpayiṣyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: master it, teach it, write it, and cause it to be written, and will properly pay attention to it,

original: avirahitaś ca bhaviṣyati sarvajñatācittena /
analyzed: avirahitaḥ ca bhaviṣyati sarvajña tā cittena
translated: and will not be separated from the thought of omniscience,

original: iti mārge 'nvayajñānam ity ukto bodhisattvadarśanamārgaḥ
analyzed: iti mārge nvaya jñānam iti uktaḥ bodhisattva darśana mārgaḥ
translated: Thus is the subsequent knowledge with regard to the path. Thus is explained the path of seeing for bodhisattvas.

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvad iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ paridamanāya pariṇamanāya ca pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: āścaryam bhagavan yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām paridamanāya pariṇamanāya ca pratyupasthitā
translated: It is amazing, Blessed One, that this perfection of wisdom is present for the taming and transformation of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kathaṃ punaḥ kauśika prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ paridamanāya pariṇamanāya ca pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: katham punar kauśika prajñāpāramitā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām paridamanāya pariṇamanāya ca pratyupasthitā
translated: Kauśika, how is the perfection of wisdom present for the taming and transformation of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas?

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: iha bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo laukikyāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ caran buddhebhyo bhagavadbhyaḥ pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ śrāvakebhyo dānāṃ dadāti /
analyzed: iha bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ laukikyām dāna pāramitāyām caran buddhebhyaḥ bhagavadbhyaḥ pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ śrāvakebhyaḥ dānām dadāti
translated: Here, Blessed One, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, practicing the mundane perfection of generosity, gives gifts to the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, the pratyekabuddhas, and the śrāvakas.

original: ahaṃ dānaṃ dadāmi buddhabodhisattvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhebhyaḥ kṛpaṇavanīkārthikayācanakebhyaḥ /
analyzed: aham dānam dadāmi buddha bodhisattva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhebhyaḥ kṛpaṇa vanīka arthika yācanakebhyaḥ
translated: I give gifts to the Buddhas, bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, the poor, the lowly, and the beggars.

original: sa etena dānenānupāyakauśalyenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: saḥ etena dānena an upāya kauśalyena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: With this generosity, due to lack of skillful means, he becomes proud. For that bodhisattva-mahāsattva,

original: laukikaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣata evaṃ bhavaty /🔽ahaṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ carāmi /
analyzed: laukikam śīlam rakṣate evam bhavati  aham śīla pāramitāyām carāmi
translated: “You should protect the worldly morality, thinking like this:🔽‘I am practicing the perfection of morality.

original: ahaṃ śīlapāramitāṃ paripūrayāmi /
analyzed: aham śīla pāramitām paripūrayāmi
translated: I am fulfilling the perfection of morality.’🔽He becomes proud because of that.

original: sa tenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikīṃ kṣāntiṃ bhāvayata evaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: sa tena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikīm kṣāntim bhāvayataḥ evam bhavati
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva, while developing worldly patience, thinks like this:

original: ahaṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ carāmi /
analyzed: aham kṣānti pāramitāyām carāmi
translated: ‘I am practicing the perfection of patience.

original: ahaṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ paripūrayāmi /
analyzed: aham kṣānti pāramitām paripūrayāmi
translated: I am fulfilling the perfection of patience.’🔽He becomes proud because of that.

original: sa tenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikaṃ vīryam ārambhamāṇasyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: sa tena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikam vīryam ārambhamāṇasya evam bhavati
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva, while undertaking worldly effort, thinks like this:

original: ahaṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ carāmi /
analyzed: aham vīrya pāramitāyām carāmi
translated: ‘I am practicing the perfection of effort.

original: ahaṃ vīryapāramitāṃ paripūrayāmi /
analyzed: aham vīrya pāramitām paripūrayāmi
translated: I am fulfilling the perfection of effort.’🔽He becomes proud because of that.

original: sa tenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpadyamānasyaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: sa tena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikam dhyānam samāpadyamānasya evam bhavati
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva, while attaining worldly meditation, thinks like this:

original: ahaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ carāmi /
analyzed: aham dhyāna pāramitāyām carāmi
translated: ‘I am practicing the perfection of meditation.

original: ahaṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ paripūrayāmi /
analyzed: aham dhyāna pāramitām paripūrayāmi
translated: I am fulfilling the perfection of meditation.’🔽He becomes proud because of that.

original: sa tenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya /
analyzed: sa tena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: “That bodhisattva mahāsattva, while developing worldly wisdom, thinks like this:

original: laukikyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carato 'nupāyakauśalyenaivaṃ bhavaty /
analyzed: laukikyām prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ n upāya kauśalyena evam bhavati
translated: For one practicing the perfection of wisdom of the world, without skillful means, it occurs like this:

original: ahaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carāmi /
analyzed: aham prajñāpāramitāyām carāmi
translated: I am practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ paripūrayāmi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām paripūrayāmi
translated: I am perfecting the perfection of wisdom.

original: sa tenonnatiṃ gacchati / tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikyāṃ smṛtyupasthānabhāvanāyāṃ sthitasyaivaṃ bhavaty /🔽ahaṃ smṛtyupasthānāni /
analyzed: sa tena unnatim gacchati tasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya laukikyām smṛti upasthāna bhāvanāyām sthitasya evam bhavati  aham smṛti upasthānāni
translated: For that bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the cultivation of the worldly applications of mindfulness, it occurs like this:

original: bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: bhāvayāmi
translated: I am cultivating the applications of mindfulness.

original: ahaṃ samyakprahāṇāni /🔽aham ṛddhipādān /🔽aham indriyāṇi /
analyzed: aham samyakprahāṇāni  aham ṛddhipādān  aham indriyāṇi
translated: I am cultivating the right efforts.🔽I am cultivating the bases of supernatural power.🔽I am cultivating the faculties.

original: ahaṃ balāni /
analyzed: aham balāni
translated: I am cultivating the powers.

original: ahaṃ bodhyaṅgāni /
analyzed: aham bodhyaṅgāni
translated: I am cultivating the factors of awakening.

original: aham āryāṣṭāṅgaṃ mārgaṃ bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: aham ārya aṣṭāṅgam mārgam bhāvayāmi
translated: I am cultivating the noble eightfold path.

original: ahaṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitasamādhiṃ bhāvayāmi /🔽ahaṃ sarvasamādhīn /
analyzed: aham śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita samādhim bhāvayāmi  aham sarva samādhīn
translated: I am cultivating the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.🔽I am cultivating all the meditative stabilizations.

original: ahaṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: aham sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: I am cultivating all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: aham apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīr bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: aham apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ bhāvayāmi
translated: I am cultivating the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions.

original: ahaṃ catvāry āryasatyāni bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: aham catvāri ārya satyāni bhāvayāmi
translated: I am cultivating the four noble truths.

original: aham abhijñā /🔽ahaṃ daśabalāni /
analyzed: aham abhijñā  aham daśa balāni
translated: I am cultivating the superknowledges.🔽I am cultivating the ten powers.

original: ahaṃ vaiśāradyāni /
analyzed: aham vaiśāradyāni
translated: I am cultivating the fearlessnesses.

original: ahaṃ pratisaṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: aham pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: I am cultivating the discernments.

original: aham aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: aham aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān bhāvayāmi
translated: I am cultivating the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: ahaṃ sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham sattvān paripācayiṣyāmi
translated: I will ripen beings.

original: ahaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham buddhakṣetram pariśodhayiṣyāmi
translated: I will purify a Buddha-field.

original: ahaṃ sarvākārajñatāṃ pariprāpsyāmi /
analyzed: aham sarva ākāra jña tām pariprāpsyāmi
translated: I will attain omniscience.

original: sa tenāhaṃkāramamakārābhiniveśenonnatiṃ gacchati / evaṃ hi bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo
analyzed: sa tena ahaṃkāra mamakāra abhiniveśena unnatim gacchati evam hi bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: Through that conceit and attachment to 'I' and 'mine', he becomes proud. In this way, Blessed One, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva,

original: laukikeṣu dharmeṣu carann unnatiṃ gacchati / ahaṃkāramamakārābhiniveśena / tasya khalu
analyzed: laukikeṣu dharmeṣu caran unnatim gacchati ahaṃkāra mamakāra abhiniveśena tasya khalu
translated: practicing in worldly dharmas, becomes proud through conceit and attachment to 'I' and 'mine'. However,

original: punaḥ prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pariṇāmanāya ca pratyupasthitā bhavati /
analyzed: punar prajñāpāramitā paridamanāya pariṇāmanāya ca pratyupasthitā bhavati
translated: for his taming and transformation, the perfection of wisdom is present.

original: iha punar bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo lokottareṣu dharmeṣu caran dānaṃ dadad dāyakaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: iha punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ lokottareṣu dharmeṣu caran dānam dadat dāyakam na upalabhate
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, here the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, practicing in supramundane dharmas, giving a gift, does not apprehend a giver,

original: pratigrāhakaṃ nopalabhate /
analyzed: pratigrāhakam na upalabhate
translated: does not apprehend a recipient,

original: deyaṃ ca nopalabhate / evaṃ hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran paridamanāya
analyzed: deyam ca na upalabhate evam hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran paridamanāya
translated: and does not apprehend a gift. In this way, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, is present

original: pratyupasthito bhavati pariṇāmanāya / evaṃ śīlaṃ rakṣan kṣāntiṃ saṃpādayamāno vīryam
analyzed: pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati pariṇāmanāya evam śīlam rakṣan kṣāntim saṃpādayamānaḥ vīryam
translated: for taming and transformation. Thus, guarding morality, accomplishing patience, making vigor

original: ārambhamāṇo dhyānaṃ dhyāyan prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayan prajñāṃ nopalabhate / evaṃ smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān
analyzed: ārambhamāṇaḥ dhyānam dhyāyan prajñāpāramitām bhāvayan prajñām na upalabhate evam smṛti upasthāna samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān
translated: Engaging in meditation, meditating, cultivating the perfection of wisdom, he does not apprehend wisdom. Thus, cultivating the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and path,

original: bhāvayan nopalabhate / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīḥ /
analyzed: bhāvayan na upalabhate a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ
translated: he does not apprehend them. Cultivating the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments,

original: āryasatyāny abhijñāṃ bhāvayan nopalabhate / balāni vaiśāradyāṃ pratisaṃvidaḥ /
analyzed: ārya satyāni abhijñām bhāvayan na upalabhate balāni vaiśāradyām pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: cultivating the noble truths, higher knowledges,

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān bhāvayan nopalabhate / sarvaśūnyatāḥ sarvasamādhin sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni🔽bhāvayan nopalabhate / evaṃ mahāmaitrīṃ mahākaruṇāṃ ca bhāvayan nopalabhate yāvat
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān bhāvayan na upalabhate sarva śūnyatāḥ sarva samādhin sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni  bhāvayan na upalabhate evam mahā maitrīm mahā karuṇām ca bhāvayan na upalabhate yāvat
translated: cultivating the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, all emptinesses, all concentrations, all doors of retention,

original: sarvākārajñatāṃ bhāvayan nopalabhate / evaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tām bhāvayan na upalabhate evam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: cultivating great loving-kindness and great compassion, he does not apprehend them. Thus, cultivating the knowledge of all aspects, he does not apprehend it. Thus, Blessed One, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: caran paridamanāya pariṇāmanāya ca pratyupasthito bhavati / iti sarvato damananamanakāritram
analyzed: caran paridamanāya pariṇāmanāya ca pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati iti sarvatas damana namana kāritram
translated: is present for the sake of taming and transforming. Thus, the activity of taming everywhere.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: yo hi kaścit kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ gambhīrāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan
analyzed: yaḥ hi kaścid kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām gambhīrām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan
translated: Kauśika, any son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up this deep perfection of wisdom,

original: vā dhārayan vā vācayan vā paryavāpnuvan vā pravartayan vā svādhyāyan vā yoniśo manasikurvan
analyzed: vā dhārayan vā vācayan vā paryavāpnuvan vā pravartayan vā su ādhyāyan vā yoniśas manasikurvan
translated: who bears it in mind, recites it, masters it, teaches it, studies it, and properly pays attention to it,

original: vā saṃgrāmaśīrṣam ārūḍhaḥ saṃgrāme vartamāne saṃgrāme 'vatīrṇo vā śayito vātikrānto
analyzed: vā saṃgrāma śīrṣam ārūḍhaḥ saṃgrāme vartamāne saṃgrāme vatīrṇaḥ vā śayitaḥ vā atikrāntaḥ
translated: whether mounted at the head of an army, in battle, having entered battle, lying down, or having passed by,

original: vā niṣaṇṇo vā sthito vā syāt /
analyzed: vā niṣaṇṇaḥ vā sthitaḥ vā syāt
translated: whether sitting or standing,

original: asthānaṃ kauśikānavakāśo yat tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām
analyzed: asthānam kauśika anavakāśaḥ yat tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: it is impossible, Kauśika, it cannot happen, that for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom,

original: udgṛhṇato dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayataḥ svādhyāyato yoniśo manasikurvato
analyzed: udgṛhṇataḥ dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ pravartayataḥ su ādhyāyataḥ yoniśas manasikurvataḥ
translated: who bears it in mind, recites it, masters it, teaches it, studies it, and properly pays attention to it,

original: vā kaścid eva kāṇḍaṃ vā śastraṃ vā loṣṭaṃ vā kṣipet kṣiptāni vā tasya tāni śarīre
analyzed: vā kaścid eva kāṇḍam vā śastram vā loṣṭam vā kṣipet kṣiptāni vā tasya tāni śarīre
translated: that any arrow, weapon, clod, or stone will be thrown at them, or that those weapons thrown at their body

original: praharaṇāni pateyuḥ /
analyzed: praharaṇāni pateyuḥ
translated: will fall on them.

original: paropakramena vāsya jīvitāntarāyo bhaven naitat sthānaṃ vidyate / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: para upakramena vā asya jīvita antarāyaḥ bhavet na etat sthānam vidyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Or that they will have an obstacle to life through the harm of others. There is no such possibility. Why is that?

original: tathā hi tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā dīrgharātram iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā
analyzed: tathā hi tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā dīrgharātram iha prajñāpāramitāyām caratā
translated: For, that son of good family or daughter of good family, who has practiced for a long time in this perfection of wisdom,

original: ātmano rāgakāṇḍāni rāgaśastrāṇi nirjitāni bhavanti / pareṣām api rāgakāṇḍāni rāgaśastrāṇi🔽nirjitāni / ātmano doṣakāṇḍāni doṣaśastrāni mohakāṇḍāni mohaśastrāṇi nirjitāni / pareṣām
analyzed: ātmanaḥ rāga kāṇḍāni rāga śastrāṇi nirjitāni bhavanti pareṣām api rāga kāṇḍāni rāga śastrāṇi  nirjitāni ātmanaḥ doṣa kāṇḍāni doṣa śastrāni moha kāṇḍāni moha śastrāṇi nirjitāni pareṣām
translated: has conquered the arrows of passion and the weapons of passion for himself, and also the arrows of passion and the weapons of passion for others,

original: api doṣakāṇḍāni doṣaśastrāṇi mohakāṇḍāni mohaśastrāṇi nirjitām / ātmano dṛṣṭikṛtakāṇḍāni
analyzed: api doṣa kāṇḍāni doṣa śastrāṇi moha kāṇḍāni moha śastrāṇi nirjitām ātmanaḥ dṛṣṭi kṛta kāṇḍāni
translated: has conquered the arrows of hatred and the weapons of hatred, the arrows of delusion and the weapons of delusion for himself, and also the arrows of hatred and the weapons of hatred, the arrows of delusion and the weapons of delusion for others,

original: dṛṣṭikṛtaśastrāṇi nirjitāni pareṣām api dṛṣṭikṛtakāṇḍāni dṛṣṭikṛtaśastrāṇi nirjitāni /
analyzed: dṛṣṭi kṛta śastrāṇi nirjitāni pareṣām api dṛṣṭi kṛta kāṇḍāni dṛṣṭi kṛta śastrāṇi nirjitāni
translated: has conquered the arrows of the deeds of views and the weapons of the deeds of views for himself, and also the arrows of the deeds of views and the weapons of the deeds of views for others,

original: ātmanaḥ paryutthānakāṇḍāni paryutthānaśastrāṇi nirjitāni / pareṣām api paryutthānakāṇḍāni🔽paryutthānaśastrāṇi nirjitāni / ātmano 'nuśayakāṇḍāny anuśayaśastrāṇi nirjitāni / pareṣām
analyzed: ātmanaḥ paryutthāna kāṇḍāni paryutthāna śastrāṇi nirjitāni pareṣām api paryutthāna kāṇḍāni 🔽paryutthāna śastrāṇi nirjitāni ātmanaḥ anuśaya kāṇḍāni anuśaya śastrāṇi nirjitāni pareṣām
translated: has conquered the arrows of agitation and the weapons of agitation for himself, and also the arrows of agitation and the weapons of agitation for others,🔽has conquered the arrows of latent tendencies and the weapons of latent tendencies for himself, and also the arrows of latent tendencies and the weapons of latent tendencies for others.

original: apy anuśayakāṇḍāny anuśayaśastrāṇi nirjitāni / anena kauśika paryāyeṇa tasya kulaputrasya

translated: Even if the weapons of the enemies of the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas were to be thrown, they would not fall on the body of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family.

original: vā kuladuhitur vā kāṇḍaṃ vā śastraṃ vā śarīre kṣiptaṃ na patati / iti kleśanirjayakāritram
analyzed: vā kula duhituḥ vā kāṇḍam vā śastram vā śarīre kṣiptam na patati iti kleśa nirjaya kāritram
translated: Thus, the function of conquering the afflictions.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika sacet kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati pravartayiṣyati 🔽yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /

translated: Moreover, Kauśika, if a son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it correctly, and thoroughly ponder it,🔽and if they were not separated from the mind of omniscience,

translated: or make a spell or a curse, or throw them into a pit of fire, or strike them with a weapon, or give them poison, or push them into water, none of these would affect them. Why is that?

original: mahāvidyaiṣā kauśika yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā vidyā eṣā kauśika yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This, Kauśika, is a great knowledge, namely the perfection of wisdom.

original: anuttaraiṣā /
analyzed: anuttarā eṣā
translated: This is unsurpassed.

original: kauśika vidyā yad uta prajñāpāramitā / atra hi kauśika śikṣamāṇaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā nātmavyābādhāya cetayate /

analyzed: na para vyābādhāya cetayate

original: nobhayavyābādhāya cetayate /
analyzed: na ubhaya vyābādhāya cetayate

original: ity upakramādhisahyatākāritram

original: tat kasya hetos /

translated: they do not apprehend feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness, up to they do not apprehend the individual and combined

Not apprehending, they do not intend to harm themselves,

analyzed: na para vyābādhāya cetayate
translated: they do not intend to harm others,

analyzed: api kṛtvā dhārayet tām ca puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: and would honor it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

translated: and all around with garlands of lamps, and with many kinds of worship, would revere it, would esteem it, would honor it, would worship it,

original: yaś ca tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati🔽pratiṣṭhāpya pratigṛhṇīyād dhārayed vācayet tāni ca satkuryād gurukuryād /
analyzed: yaḥ ca tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya parinirvṛtasya śarīrāṇi stūpeṣu pratiṣṭhāpayiṣyati  pratiṣṭhāpya pratigṛhṇīyāt dhārayet vācayet tāni ca satkuryāt gurukuryāt
translated: and whatever one would enshrine the relics of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, who has passed into Nirvāṇa, in stūpas,

original: mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: having enshrined them, would take them up, would bear them, would recite them, and would honor them with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: kataras tato bahupuṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: kataraḥ tatas bahu puṇyam prasavati
translated: Which one would produce more merit from that?

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: tena hi kauśika tvām evātra pratiprakṣyāmi /
analyzed: tena hi kauśika tvām eva atra pratiprakṣyāmi
translated: Well then, Kauśika, I will ask you about this.

original: yathā te kṣamate tathā vyākuryāḥ / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: yathā te kṣamate tathā vyākuryāḥ tat kim manyase
translated: You should answer as best you can. What do you think, Kauśika?

original: kauśika yeyaṃ tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajñatā yo cāyaṃ tathāgatasyātmabhāvo 'bhinirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: kauśika yā iyam tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya sarvajña tā ca ayam tathāgatasya ātmabhāvaḥ bhinirvṛttaḥ
translated: Is this omniscience of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, and this body of the Tathāgata that has come forth,

original: sa katarasyāṃ pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhenānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbuddhā ayaṃ cātmabhāvo 'bhinirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: sa katarasyām pratipadi śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā ayam ca ātmabhāvaḥ bhinirvṛttaḥ
translated: in which practice did the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One train, by which he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and this body came forth?

original: evam ukte śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: ihaiva bhagavan śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyām anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbuddhā ayaṃ cātmabhāvo 'bhinirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: iha eva bhagavan śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyām anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā ayam ca ātmabhāvaḥ bhinirvṛttaḥ
translated: Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, while training in just this perfection of wisdom, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment and this body came forth.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: So it is, Kauśika, so it is.

original: prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇena tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhenānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbuddhā ayaṃ cātmabhāvo 'bhinirvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇena tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā ayam ca ātmabhāvaḥ bhinirvṛttaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, while training in the perfection of wisdom, attained unsurpassed perfect awakening and manifested this very body.

original: tasmāt tarhi kauśika nānenātmabhāvaśarīrapratilambhena tathāgatas tathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika na anena ātma bhāva śarīra pratilambhena tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, the Tathāgata is not reckoned as a Tathāgata by virtue of this attainment of a physical body,

original: gacchati / sarvajñatāyāṃ tu pratilabdhāyāṃ tathāgatas tathāgata iti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: gacchati sarvajña tāyām tu pratilabdhāyām tathāgataḥ tathāgataḥ iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: but is reckoned as a Tathāgata when he has attained omniscience.

original: yeyaṃ kauśika sarvajñatā sā prajñāpāramitā nirjātā / evam ayam ātmabhāvaśarīrapratilābhas
analyzed: yā iyam kauśika sarvajña tā sā prajñāpāramitā nirjātā evam ayam ātma bhāva śarīra pratilābhaḥ
translated: And, Kauśika, that omniscience has arisen from the perfection of wisdom. In this way, this attainment of a physical body by the Tathāgata

original: tathāgatasya prajñāpāramitānirjātatvāt /
analyzed: tathāgatasya prajñāpāramitā nirjāta tvāt
translated: is the basis for the attainment of the knowledge of omniscience, because it has arisen from the perfection of wisdom.

original: sarvajñajñānasyāśrayabhūto bhavati / evaṃ cāśrayaṃ niśritya sarvajñajñānapratilābhaprabhāvanābuddhaprabhāvanādharmaprabhāvanāsaṃghaprabhāvanā
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya āśraya bhūtaḥ bhavati evam ca āśrayam niśritya sarvajña jñāna pratilābha prabhāvanā buddha prabhāvanā dharma prabhāvanā saṃgha prabhāvanā
translated: In this way, relying on that basis, the manifestation of the knowledge of omniscience, the manifestation of the Buddha, the manifestation of the Dharma, and the manifestation of the Saṅgha

original: bhavati / evam asya sarvajñajñānahetuko 'yam ātmabhāvapratilābhaḥ / āśrayabhūtatvāt
analyzed: bhavati evam asya sarvajña jñāna hetukaḥ yam ātma bhāva pratilābhaḥ āśraya bhūta tvāt
translated: come about. In this way, this attainment of a physical body is the cause for the knowledge of omniscience, because it is the basis.

original: sarvasattvānāṃ caityabhūto vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyo gurukaraṇīyo mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyo
analyzed: sarva sattvānām caitya bhūtaḥ vandanīyaḥ satkaraṇīyaḥ gurukaraṇīyaḥ mānanīyaḥ pūjanīyaḥ
translated: He has become a caitya to be worshipped, to be revered, to be honored, to be offered to, to be praised, to be shown respect, to be shown reverence, to be shown homage, by all beings.

original: 'rcanīyo 'pacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ / evaṃ ca mama parinirvṛtasyāpi sata eṣāṃ śarīrāṇāṃ pūjā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: rcanīyaḥ pacāyanīyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ evam ca mama parinirvṛtasya api sataḥ eṣām śarīrāṇām pūjā bhaviṣyati
translated: And thus, even after my parinirvāṇa, there will be worship of these relics.

original: tasmāt tarhi kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā satkāreṇa vācayiṣyati dhārayiṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā satkāreṇa vācayiṣyati dhārayiṣyati
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, if a son of good family or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom, having made it into a book, were to recite it, to bear it in mind,

original: puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ samantāc ca dīpamālābhir bahuvidhābhiś ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ samantāt ca dīpa mālābhiḥ bahuvidhābhiḥ ca pūjābhiḥ satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet  /
translated: to worship it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners, and with rows of lamps all around, and with many kinds of worship, were to honor it, revere it, respect it,

original: pūjayed arcayed apacāyet /
analyzed: pūjayet arcayet apacāyet
translated: worship it, praise it, and show reverence for it,

original: ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: he would produce merit that is much greater than that.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya hi kauśika tena kulaputreṇa vā /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya hi kauśika tena kula putreṇa vā
translated: Kauśika, it is because by that son of good family or daughter of good family, worship would have been made to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: kuladuhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhavet / yaḥ kaścit kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgatasya
analyzed: kula duhitrā vā pūjā kṛtā bhavet yaḥ kaścid kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgatasya
translated: Kauśika, if some son of good family or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom, having made it into a book, were to bear it in mind, to recite it, to master it, to copy it, to spread it, to teach it, to expound it, to explain it, to chant it, to fully reveal it, to unroll it, to show it, to explain it in detail, to illuminate it, to praise it, to make it clear, and to make it shine, and were to honor, revere, respect, worship, praise, and show reverence for it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners, and with rows of lamps all around, and with many kinds of worship,

original: parinirvṛtasya saptaratnamaye stūpe śarīraṃ pratiṣṭhāpayet saptaratnamaye vā samudge vā kṛtvā parivahet /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya sapta ratna maye stūpe śarīram pratiṣṭhāpayet sapta ratna maye vā samudge vā kṛtvā parivahet
translated: After the parinirvāṇa, they would enshrine the body in a stūpa made of the seven precious substances, or in a casket made of the seven precious substances.

original: tac ca satkuryād yāvad apacāyet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhir /
analyzed: tat ca satkuryāt yāvat apacāyet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: And they would honor it, venerate it, respect it, make offerings to it, and praise it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: yaś ca iha prajñāpāramitāyāṃ likhyāmānāyāṃ vā pustakagatāyāṃ vā satkāraṃ kuryād gurukāraṃ kuryād mānanāṃ pūjanām arcanām apacāyanāṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: yaḥ ca iha prajñāpāramitāyām likhyāmānāyām vā pustaka gatāyām vā satkāram kuryāt gurukāram kuryāt mānanām pūjanām arcanām apacāyanām kuryāt
translated: But someone who, when this perfection of wisdom is being written down, would honor, venerate, respect, make offerings to, praise, and revere the book,

original: ayaṃ tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: ayam tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: would produce even more merit than that.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvajñajñānasya tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati ato nirjātā hi pañcapāramitā /
analyzed: sarvajña jñānasya tena pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati atas nirjātā hi pañca pāramitā
translated: Because they would have made an offering to the knowledge of the Omniscient One. For from it come the five perfections.

original: ato nirjātā adhyātmaśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā adhyātma śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: From it come the inner emptinesses up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of own-being.

original: ato nirjātāni smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgābhijñāryasatyāni /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārga abhijñā ārya satyāni
translated: From it come the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, path, superknowledges, and noble truths.

original: ato nirjātā apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ ato nirjātāni daśatathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ atas nirjātāni daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: From this are born the immeasurables, the dhyānas, and the formless attainments. From this are born the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences, the four unhindered knowledges, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: ato nirjātāḥ sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇīmukhāni
translated: From this are born all the meditative absorptions and all the doors of dhāraṇīs.

original: ato nirjātaḥ sarvasattvaparipākaḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātaḥ sarva sattva paripākaḥ
translated: From this is born the development of all beings.

original: ato nirjātā buddhakṣetrapariśuddhiḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātā buddhakṣetra pariśuddhiḥ
translated: From this is born the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: ato nirjātā bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ kulasaṃpad bhogasaṃpad parivārasaṃpad /
analyzed: atas nirjātā bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām kula saṃpad bhoga saṃpad parivāra saṃpad
translated: From this is born the perfection of family, perfection of resources, and perfection of retinue of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: ato nirjātā mahāmaitrī mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā mahā maitrī mahā karuṇā
translated: From this is born great love and great compassion.

original: ato nirjātā kṣatriyamahāśālakulatā brāhmaṇamahāśālakulatā gṛhapatimahāśālakulatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā kṣatriya mahā śāla kula tā brāhmaṇa mahā śāla kula tā gṛhapati mahā śāla kula tā
translated: From this is born the status of a wealthy kṣatriya family, a wealthy brāhmaṇa family, and a wealthy householder family.

original: ato nirjātā cāturmahārājakāyikā devaputrās trāyastriṃśā yāmās tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartmo brahmapārṣadyā brahmapurohitā mahābrahmāṇo
analyzed: atas nirjātā cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devaputrāḥ trāyastriṃśāḥ yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartmaḥ brahma pārṣadyāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ
translated: From this are born the gods of the Caturmahārājika realm, the Trāyastriṃśa gods, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods, the Brahmapurohita gods, the Mahābrahmā gods,

original: yāvad akaniṣṭhā devaputrā /
analyzed: yāvat akaniṣṭhā deva putrā
translated: up to the Akaniṣṭha gods.

original: ato nirjātāḥ srotaāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāmino 'nāgāmino 'rhantaḥ pratyekabuddhā /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ srotaāpannāḥ sakṛdāgāminaḥ nāgāminaḥ rhantaḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ
translated: From this have come forth the stream-enterers, once-returners, non-returners, and arhats, the pratyekabuddhas.

original: ato nirjātā bodhisattvā mahāsattvā /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvā
translated: From this have come forth the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.

original: ato nirjātās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā
translated: From this have come forth the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly enlightened buddhas.

original: ato nirjātācintyā atulyā anuttarā niruttarā asamā asamasamā sarvākārajñatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā acintyā atulyā anuttarā niruttarā asamā asamasamā sarva ākārajña tā
translated: From this have come forth the inconceivable, incomparable, unsurpassed, unequaled, equal to the unequalled, knowledge of all aspects.

original: iti svārthādhimuktimṛdumṛddhī
analyzed: iti svārtha adhimukti mṛdu mṛddhī
translated: Thus is the weak-weak faith in one's own aim.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: ya ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ na satkurvanti na gurukurvanti
analyzed: ye ime bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām na satkurvanti na gurukurvanti
translated: Blessed One, those humans in Jambudvīpa who do not honor, respect,

original: na mānayanti na pūjayanti nārcayanti nāpacāyante puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ
analyzed: na mānayanti na pūjayanti na arcayanti na apacāyante puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: worship, revere, or venerate this perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: kiṃ nu bhagavañ jñāsyanti evaṃ maharddhikā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: kim nu bhagavan jñāsyanti evam maharddhikā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Blessed One, will they know that the worship of the perfection of wisdom will be so greatly powerful?

original: evaṃ mahānuśaṃsā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: evam mahā anuśaṃsā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Will they know that the worship of the perfection of wisdom will have such great benefits?

original: uta na jñāsyanti /
analyzed: uta na jñāsyanti
translated: Or will they not know?

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: tat kiṃ manyase kauśika kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kauśika kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhe vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatā
translated: What do you think, Kauśika? How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha,

original: ye dharme 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā /
analyzed: ye dharme vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatā
translated: are endowed with clear faith in the Dharma,

original: ye saṃghe 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā /
analyzed: ye saṃghe vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatā
translated: are endowed with clear faith in the Saṅgha,

original: ye buddhe niṣkāṅkṣā ye dharme niṣkāṅkṣā ye saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā /
analyzed: ye buddhe niṣkāṅkṣāḥ ye dharme niṣkāṅkṣāḥ ye saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā
translated: are free from doubt regarding the Buddha, are free from doubt regarding the Dharma, are free from doubt regarding the Saṅgha,

original: ye buddhe niṣṭhāṃgatā ye dharme niṣṭhāṃgatā ye saṃghe niṣṭhāṃgatāḥ /
analyzed: ye buddhe niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ ye dharme niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ ye saṃghe niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ
translated: have attained conviction regarding the Buddha, have attained conviction regarding the Dharma, have attained conviction regarding the Saṅgha?

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: alpakās te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā ye dharme 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā ye saṃghe 'vetyaprasādena🔽ye buddhe niṣkāṅkṣā ye dharme niṣkāṅkṣā ye saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhe vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatāḥ ye dharme vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatāḥ ye saṃghe vā iti aprasādena  ye buddhe niṣkāṅkṣāḥ ye dharme niṣkāṅkṣāḥ ye saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā
translated: Blessed One, those human beings in Jambudvīpa who are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha, who are endowed with clear faith in the Dharma, who are endowed with clear faith in the Saṅgha,🔽who are free from doubt regarding the Buddha, who are free from doubt regarding the Dharma, who are free from doubt regarding the Saṅgha,

original: ye buddhe niṣṭhāṃgatā ye dharme niṣṭhāṃgatā ye saṃghe niṣṭhāṃgatāḥ /
analyzed: ye buddhe niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ ye dharme niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ ye saṃghe niṣṭhā aṃgatāḥ
translated: who have attained conviction regarding the Buddha, who have attained conviction regarding the Dharma, who have attained conviction regarding the Saṅgha -🔽they are few, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said.

original: tat kiṃ manyase kauśika kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kauśika kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye saptatriṃśatām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām lābhinaḥ
translated: What do you think, Kauśika, how many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the thirty-seven factors of awakening?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye trayāṇāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye trayāṇām vimokṣa mukhānām lābhinaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the three doors to liberation?

original: kiyantas te jāmbādvīpakā manuṣyā ye 'ṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbādvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye ṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām lābhinaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the eight liberations?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām lābhinaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the nine successive meditative absorptions?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām lābhinaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the four analytical knowledges?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām lābhinaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are obtainers of the six supernormal knowledges?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye trayāṇāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāt srotaāpannā /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye trayāṇām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt srotaāpannāḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa, having abandoned the three fetters, are stream-enterers?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye rāgadoṣamohatanutvāt sakṛdāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye rāga doṣa moha tanu tvāt sakṛdāgāminaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa, having attenuated greed, hatred, and delusion, are once-returners?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye pañcānām avarabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād anāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye pañcānām avarabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt anāgāminaḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are non-returners due to abandoning the five lower fetters?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye pañcānām ūrdhvabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād arhantaḥ /🔽kiyantas te jāmbudvīpakā manuṣyā ye pratyekabodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye pañcānām ūrdhvabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt arhantaḥ  kiyantaḥ te jāmbudvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye pratyeka bodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are arhats due to abandoning the five higher fetters?🔽How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are set out for individual enlightenment?

original: kiyantas te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: How many of those human beings in Jambudvīpa are set out for supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: śakra āha / alpatarakās te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipakṣyāṃ dharmāṇāṃ lābhinaḥ /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha alpatarakāḥ te bhagavan jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye saptatriṃśatām bodhipakṣyām dharmāṇām lābhinaḥ
translated: Śakra said: Blessed One, very few of those human beings in Jambudvīpa attain the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye trayāṇāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ lābhinas /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye trayāṇām vimokṣa mukhānām lābhinaḥ
translated: Fewer still attain the three doors to liberation.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye 'ṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ lābhinas /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye ṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām lābhinaḥ
translated: Fewer still attain the eight liberations.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ lābhinas /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām lābhinaḥ
translated: Fewer still attain the nine successive meditative absorptions.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidāṃ lābhinas /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām lābhinaḥ
translated: Fewer still attain the four analytical knowledges.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ lābhinaḥ / tato 'lpatarakās jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye trayāṇāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāt srotaāpannāḥ /🔽tato 'lpatarakās te ye rāgadoṣamohatanutvāt /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām lābhinaḥ tatas lpatarakāḥ jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye trayāṇām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt srotaāpannāḥ  tatas lpatarakāḥ te ye rāga doṣa moha tanu tvāt
translated: Fewer than that have attained the six higher knowledges. Fewer than that are the humans of Jambudvīpa who, by abandoning the three fetters, are stream-enterers.

original: sakṛdāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminaḥ
translated: Fewer than that are those who, by weakening greed, hatred, and delusion, are once-returners.

original: tato 'lpatarakās te ye pañcānām avarabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād anāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ te ye pañcānām avarabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt anāgāminaḥ
translated: Fewer than that are those who, by abandoning the five lower fetters, are non-returners.

original: tato 'lpatarakās te ye pañcānām ūrdhvabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād arhantaḥ /🔽tato 'lpatarakās te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye pratyekabodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ te ye pañcānām ūrdhvabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt arhantaḥ  tatas lpatarakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye pratyeka bodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Fewer than that are those who, by abandoning the five higher fetters, are arhats.🔽Fewer than that are the humans of Jambudvīpa who are set out for the awakening of a solitary buddha.

original: tato 'lpatarakās te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ
translated: Fewer than that are the humans of Jambudvīpa who are set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat /🔽alpakās te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye buddhe dharme saṃghe 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat  alpakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye buddhe dharme saṃghe vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatāḥ
translated: So it is, Kauśika, so it is.🔽Few are the humans of Jambudvīpa who are endowed with clear faith in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣāḥ /
analyzed: ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣāḥ
translated: Few are those who are free from doubt regarding the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣṭhāṃgatāḥ / tebhyo 'py alpebhyo 'lpatarakās te ye daśakuśalakarmapathasevinas /
analyzed: ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣṭhāṃgatāḥ tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye daśa kuśala karma patha sevinaḥ
translated: Those who are intent on the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha are even fewer than that. Even fewer than that are those who practice the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: tebhyo 'lpebhyo 'lpatarakās te ye dānaśīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñābhāvanā yuktāḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ lpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye dāna śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñā bhāvanāḥ yuktāḥ
translated: Even fewer than that are those who are devoted to the cultivation of generosity, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.

original: tebhyo 'py alpebhyo 'lpatarakās te ye saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣān dharmān bhāvayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ te ye saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣān dharmān bhāvayanti
translated: Even fewer than that are those who cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: tebhyo 'py alpebhyo 'lpatarakā ye trīṇi vimokṣamukhāni bhāvayanti / tebhyo 'lpebhyo
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni bhāvayanti tebhyaḥ lpebhyaḥ
translated: Even fewer than that are those who cultivate the three doors to liberation. Even fewer than that

original: 'lpatarakā ye 'ṣṭa vimokṣāṃ bhāvayanti /
analyzed: ye vimokṣām bhāvayanti
translated: are those who cultivate the eight liberations.

original: tebhyo 'lpebhyo 'lpatarakā ye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr bhāvayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ lpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ bhāvayanti
translated: Even fewer than that are those who cultivate the nine successive absorptions.

original: tebhyo 'py alpebhyo 'lpatarakā ye catasraḥ pratisaṃvido bhāvayanti /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pi alpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ bhāvayanti
translated: Even fewer than that are those who cultivate the four analytical knowledges.

original: tebhyo 'lpebhyo 'lpatarakā ye ṣaḍ abhijñā bhāvayanti / tato 'lpatarakā ye srotaāpannāḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ lpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ bhāvayanti tatas lpatarakāḥ ye srotaāpannāḥ
translated: Even fewer than that are those who cultivate the six superknowledges. Even fewer than that are those who are stream-enterers.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye sakṛdāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye sakṛdāgāminaḥ
translated: Even fewer than that are those who are once-returners.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye 'rhantaḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye rhantaḥ
translated: Even fewer than that are those who are arhats.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye pratyekabuddhāḥ /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye pratyekabuddhāḥ
translated: Fewer than that are the pratyekabuddhas.

original: tato 'lpatarakā ye 'nuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ / tato 'lpebhyo 'lpatarakā ye bodhāya caranti /
analyzed: tatas lpatarakāḥ ye nuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye saṃprasthitāḥ tatas lpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye bodhāya caranti
translated: Fewer than that are those who have set out for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. Fewer than that are those who practice for awakening.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi taiḥ saṃsāre saṃsaradbhir na buddho dṛṣṭaḥ na dharmaḥ śrutaḥ na saṃghaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi taiḥ saṃsāre saṃsaradbhiḥ na buddhaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ na dharmaḥ śrutaḥ na saṃghaḥ
translated: Because, while transmigrating in cyclic existence, they have not seen a buddha, have not heard the Dharma, have not

original: paryupāsitaḥ / na dānaṃ dattaṃ na śīlaṃ rakṣitaṃ na kṣāntir bhāvitā na vīryam ārabdhaṃ
analyzed: paryupāsitaḥ na dānam dattam na śīlam rakṣitam na kṣāntiḥ bhāvitā na vīryam ārabdham
translated: worshipped the Saṅgha, have not given gifts, have not observed morality, have not cultivated patience, have not undertaken perseverance,

original: na dhyānaṃ sevitaṃ na prajñā bhāvitā /
analyzed: na dhyānam sevitam na prajñā bhāvitā
translated: have not cultivated concentration, have not cultivated wisdom.

original: na dānapāramitā śrutā evaṃ na śīlapāramitā na kṣāntipāramitā na vīryapāramitā na
analyzed: na dāna pāramitā śrutā evam na śīla pāramitā na kṣānti pāramitā na vīrya pāramitā na
translated: They have not heard of the perfection of giving, and likewise have not heard of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: dhyānapāramitā na prajñāpāramitā śrutā nopāyakauśalaṃ śrutaṃ nādhyātmaśūnyatā na
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā na prajñāpāramitā śrutā na upāya kauśalam śrutam na adhyātma śūnyatā na
translated: the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom. They have not heard of skillful means, have not heard of inner emptiness,

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā na yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā śrutā na
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā na yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā śrutā na
translated: have not heard of outer emptiness, have not heard of inner and outer emptiness, up to have not heard of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,🔽have not

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣā dharmāḥ śrutā na samādhayo na sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayāḥ🔽śrutā nāryasatyāni nābhijñā na balāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāṣṭādaśāveṇikā
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāḥ dharmāḥ śrutāḥ na samādhayaḥ na sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni na a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayāḥ  śrutāḥ na ārya satyāni na abhijñāḥ na balāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na aṣṭādaśā āveṇikā
translated: The thirty-seven factors of awakening have been heard, but not the concentrations, not the doors of dhāraṇī, not the immeasurables, dhyānas, and formless attainments.🔽The noble truths have been heard, but not the superknowledges, not the powers, not the confidences, not the analytical knowledges, not the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha.

original: buddhadharmāḥ śrutā na sarvajñatā śrutā na bhāvitā na bahulī kṛtāḥ /
analyzed: buddha dharmāḥ śrutāḥ na sarvajña tā śrutā na bhāvitāḥ na bahulīkṛtāḥ
translated: Omniscience has been heard, but not cultivated, not made much of.

original: anena kauśika hetunālpakās te sattvā ye buddhe 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā ye dharme 'vetyaprasādena samanvāgatā ye saṃghe 'vetyaprasādena🔽samanvāgatāḥ /
analyzed: anena kauśika hetunā alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ ye buddhe vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatāḥ ye dharme vā iti aprasādena samanvāgatāḥ ye saṃghe vā iti aprasādena  samanvāgatāḥ
translated: By this cause, Kauśika, few are those beings who have perfect confidence in the Buddha, who have perfect confidence in the Dharma, who have perfect confidence in the Saṅgha.

original: alpakās te sattvā ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣkāṅkṣā
translated: Few are those beings who are free from doubt regarding the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: alpakās te sattvā ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣṭhāṃgatā /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te sattvāḥ ye buddhe dharme saṃghe niṣṭhāṃga tā
translated: Few are those beings who have attained certainty regarding the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: alpakās te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye daśakuśalakarmapathasevinaḥ /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye daśa kuśala karma patha sevinaḥ
translated: Few are those human beings in Jambudvīpa who practice the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: alpakās te ye dānaśīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñābhāvanā yuktāḥ /
analyzed: alpakāḥ te ye dāna śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñā bhāvanāḥ yuktāḥ
translated: Few are those who are engaged in the cultivation of generosity, morality, patience, diligence, concentration, and wisdom.

original: alpakās te ye saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyāṃ dharmāṃ bhāvayanti / alpakās te ye trīṇi vimokṣamukhāni
analyzed: alpakāḥ te ye saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyām dharmām bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te ye trīṇi vimokṣa mukhāni
translated: Few are those who cultivate the thirty-seven factors of awakening. Few are those who cultivate the three doors to liberation.

original: bhāvayanti / alpakās te ye 'ṣṭa vimokṣāṃ bhāvayanti alpakās te ye navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr
analyzed: bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te ye vimokṣām bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te ye nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ
translated: Few are those who cultivate the eight liberations. Few are those who cultivate the nine successive absorptions.

original: bhāvayanti / alpakās te ye catasraḥ pratisaṃvido bhāvayanti / alpakās te ṣaḍ abhijñā
analyzed: bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te ye catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te ṣaṭ abhijñā
translated: Few are those who cultivate the four analytical knowledges. Few are those who cultivate the six superknowledges.

original: bhāvayanti / alpakās te jāmbūdvīpakā manuṣyā ye trayāṇāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇāt srotaāpannāḥ /
analyzed: bhāvayanti alpakāḥ te jāmbūdvīpakāḥ manuṣyāḥ ye trayāṇām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt srotaāpannāḥ
translated: Few are the humans of Jambudvīpa who, by abandoning the three fetters, are stream-enterers.

original: rāgadoṣamohatanutvāt sakṛdāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: rāga doṣa moha tanu tvāt sakṛdāgāminaḥ
translated: By the weakening of passion, hatred, and delusion, they are once-returners.

original: pañcānām avarabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād ānāgāminaḥ /
analyzed: pañcānām avarabhāgīyānām saṃyojanānām prahāṇāt ānāgāminaḥ
translated: By abandoning the five lower fetters, they are non-returners.

original: pañcānam ūrdhvabhāgīyānāṃ saṃyojanānāṃ prahāṇād arhantaḥ / alpakās te jāmbudvīpakā

analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ tebhyaḥ lpebhyaḥ lpatarakāḥ ye bodhāya caranti

original: āpadyante / tato 'lpatarakā ye prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranti / tato 'lpatarakā ye 'vinivartanīyāyāṃ
analyzed: āpadyante tatas lpatarakāḥ ye prajñāpāramitāyām caranti tatas lpatarakāḥ ye vinivartanīyāyām
translated: Of those, a still smaller number practice the perfection of wisdom. Of those, a still smaller number, having stood on the irreversible stage,

analyzed: bhūmau sthitvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyante

analyzed: sattvām anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ upāya kauśala virahitān

original: tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ

analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya bodhāya carataḥ upāya kauśala virahitāḥ tata

translated: For the most part, they stand either on the śrāvaka-bhūmi or the pratyekabuddha-bhūmi.

original: tat kasya hetor /

original: iti svārthādhimuktimṛdumadhyā
analyzed: iti sva artha adhimukti mṛdu madhyā
