translated: Brahmins, or wealthy householders. From then on, his body will always be adorned with the thirty-two major marks and eighty minor marks of a great being,

original: bhaviṣyati yatra vā lokadhātau buddhā bhagavanto bhaviṣyanti tatra buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati yatra vā lokadhātau buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bhaviṣyanti tatra buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: in whatever world system the Blessed Buddhas are present.

original: purataḥ padma aupapāduka upapatsyate / na jātv abhijñā virahito bhaviṣyati / sa ākāṅkṣaṃ
analyzed: puratas padmaḥ aupapādukaḥ upapatsyate na jātu abhijñā virahitaḥ bhaviṣyati saḥ ākāṅkṣam
translated: In front of him, a lotus will spontaneously appear. He will never be separated from the superknowledges.

original: buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyati
translated: He will go from buddhafield to buddhafield,🔽approaching those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in order to serve them and to hear the Dharma.

original: tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsituṃ dharmaṃ ca śrotuṃ buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkrāman sattvāṃś ca paripācayati /
analyzed: tān buddhān bhagavataḥ paryupāsitum dharmam ca śrotum buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetram saṃkrāman sattvān ca paripācayati
translated: Going from buddhafield to buddhafield, he will bring beings to maturity.

original: buddhakṣetraṃ ca pariśodhayiṣyati /
analyzed: buddhakṣetram ca pariśodhayiṣyati
translated: And he will purify the buddhafield.

original: tasmāt tarhi kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitā udgṛhītavyā dhārayitavyā
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitā udgṛhītavyā dhārayitavyā
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family should take up the perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā yoniśaś ca manasikartavyā sarvajñatācittena cāvirahitena
analyzed: vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā yoniśas ca manasi kartavyā sarvajña tā cittena ca avirahitena
translated: recite it, understand it, and wisely attend to it in the right way, not separated from the thought of the knowledge of all modes.

original: bhavitavyaṃ / sa etair dṛṣṭadhārmikair guṇaiḥ sāṃparāyikair guṇair avirahito bhaviṣyati
analyzed: bhavitavyam saḥ etaiḥ dṛṣṭa dhārmikaiḥ guṇaiḥ sāṃparāyikaiḥ guṇaiḥ avirahitaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not be separated from these present and future qualities

original: yāvan nānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbudhyate iti /
analyzed: yāvat na anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbudhyate iti
translated: until he fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.'

original: atha khalv anyatīrthikānāṃ parivrājakānāṃ śatam upārambhābhiprāyāṇāṃ yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāmati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu anya tīrthikānām parivrājakānām śatam upārambha abhiprāyāṇām yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati sma
translated: Then, a hundred non-Buddhist wandering mendicants approached the Blessed One with the intention of finding fault.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: idam anyatīrthikānāṃ parivrājakānāṃ śatam upārambhābhiprāyāṇāṃ yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāmati /🔽yan nūnam ahaṃ yāvanmātraṃ mayā bhagavato 'ntikāt prajñāpāramitāyā udgrahītaṃ tāvanmātraṃ svādhyāyeyaṃ yad etad anyatīrthikānāṃ /
analyzed: idam anya tīrthikānām parivrājakānām śatam upārambha abhiprāyāṇām yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmati  yat nūnam aham yāvanmātram mayā bhagavataḥ ntikāt prajñāpāramitāyāḥ udgrahītam tāvanmātram su ādhyāyeyam yat etat anya tīrthikānām
translated: Here a hundred non-Buddhist wandering mendicants are approaching the Blessed One with the intention of finding fault.

original: parivrājakānāṃ śataṃ na bhagavantam upasaṃkrāmeyur nāntarāyaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: parivrājakānām śatam na bhagavantam upasaṃkrāmeyuḥ na antarāyam prajñāpāramitāyām kuryuḥ
translated: What if I were to recite to myself as much of the perfection of wisdom as I have learned from the Blessed One, so that those non-Buddhist wandering mendicants would not approach the Blessed One and would not create obstacles for the perfection of wisdom?

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro yāvad anena bhagavato 'ntikāt prajñāpāramitāyā udgrahītaṃ tāvat svādhyāyati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ yāvat anena bhagavataḥ ntikāt prajñāpāramitāyāḥ udgrahītam tāvat su ādhyāyati sma
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, recited to himself as much of the perfection of wisdom as he had learned from the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu te 'nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakā dūrata eva bhagavantaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yenaiva mārgeṇāgatās tenaiva pratigatāḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu te nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakāḥ dūratas eva bhagavantam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yena eva mārgeṇa āgatāḥ tena eva pratigatāḥ
translated: Then those non-Buddhist wanderers, having circumambulated the Blessed One from afar, returned by the same path by which they had come.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: kim atra kāraṇaṃ yenaite 'nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakā upārambhābhiprāyā bhagavantaṃ dūrata eva pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yenaiva mārgeṇāgatās tenaiva pratigatāḥ /
analyzed: kim atra kāraṇam yena ete nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakāḥ upārambha abhiprāyāḥ bhagavantam dūratas eva pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yena eva mārgeṇa āgatāḥ tena eva pratigatāḥ
translated: What is the reason that these non-Buddhist wanderers, with the intention of finding fault, have circumambulated the Blessed One from afar and returned by the same path by which they came?

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāyāyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya āyuṣmantam śāriputram āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing with his mind the reflection in the mind of the Venerable Śāriputra, said to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: śakreṇa śāriputra devānām indreṇa iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā samanvāhṛtā yenaite 'nyatīrthikāḥ
analyzed: śakreṇa śāriputra devānām indreṇa iyam prajñāpāramitā samanvāhṛtā yena ete nyatīrthikāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, this perfection of wisdom has been contemplated by Śakra, Lord of the Gods, by which these non-Buddhist wanderers,

original: parivrājakā dūrata eva bhagavantaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yenaiva mārgeṇāgatās tenaiva pratigatāḥ
analyzed: parivrājakāḥ dūratas eva bhagavantam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya yena eva mārgeṇa āgatāḥ tena eva pratigatāḥ
translated: having circumambulated the Blessed One from afar, have returned by the same path by which they came.

original: na hi śāriputra teṣām anyatīrthikānāṃ parivrājakānām ekasyāpi śuklaṃ dharmaṃ samanupaśyāmi /
analyzed: na hi śāriputra teṣām anya tīrthikānām parivrājakānām ekasya api śuklam dharmam samanupaśyāmi
translated: Śāriputra, I do not see even one wholesome quality in those other tīrthika wanderers.

original: sarva ete 'nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakāḥ pratihatacittā upārambhābhiprāyā upasaṃkramitavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: sarve ete nyatīrthikāḥ parivrājakāḥ pratihata cittāḥ upārambha abhiprāyāḥ upasaṃkramitavyam maṃsyante
translated: All those other tīrthika wanderers will think to approach with hostile minds, intending to dispute.🔽Śāriputra, I do not see anyone in the world with its gods, Māras, and Brahmas, in this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans, who, with a hostile mind and intending to dispute,

original: nāhaṃ taṃ śāriputra samanupaśyāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ prajāyām imāṃ prajñāpāramitām upārambhābhiprāyaḥ 🔽pratihatacitta upasaṃkrāmen /
analyzed: na aham tam śāriputra samanupaśyāmi sa devake loke sa mārake sa brahmake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām prajāyām imām prajñāpāramitām upārambha abhiprāyaḥ  pratihata cittaḥ upasaṃkrāmet
translated: could approach this perfection of wisdom.

original: naitat sthānaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: na etat sthānam vidyate
translated: There is no such possibility.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi śāriputra ya iha trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājikās trāyastriṃśā
analyzed: tathā hi śāriputra yaḥ iha tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājikāḥ trāyastriṃśā
translated: Śāriputra, it is because in this great billionfold world system, the Cāturmahārājika gods, the Trāyastriṃśa

original: yāmās tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartino brahmakāyikā brahmapurohitā brahmapārṣadyā
analyzed: yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ brahmakāyikāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ brahma pārṣadyā
translated: , Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmakāyika, Brahmapurohita, Brahmapārṣadya

original: yāvad akaniṣṭhā devaputrā ye 'pi śrāvakā ye 'pi pratyekabuddhā ye 'pi bodhisattvā
analyzed: yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ deva putrāḥ ye pi śrāvakāḥ ye pi pratyekabuddhāḥ ye pi bodhisattvāḥ
translated: , up to the Akaniṣṭha gods, and also the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas

original: mahāsattvās tair apīyaṃ prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītā / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: mahāsattvāḥ taiḥ api iyam prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The great beings have also taken up this perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi te prajñāpāramitānirjātāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi te prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ
translated: Because they have been born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ śāriputra ye 'pi te pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu
analyzed: punar aparam śāriputra ye pi te pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu
translated: Furthermore, Śāriputra, in the world systems in the east, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: yāvad daśasu dikṣu gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣv ekaikasyāṃ diśi buddhā bhagavantaḥ
analyzed: yāvat daśasu dikṣu gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu ekaikasyām diśi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ
translated: up to in the world systems in the ten directions, numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in each direction, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: saśrāvakasaṃghāḥ sabodhisattvadevānāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragās tair
analyzed: sa śrāvaka saṃghāḥ sa bodhisattva deva anāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragāḥ taiḥ
translated: together with the community of disciples, the Bodhisattvas, the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: api sarvair iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītā / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: api sarvaiḥ iyam prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: they have all taken up this perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hi te prajñāpāramitānirjātāḥ sarve /
analyzed: tathā hi te prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ sarve
translated: Because they have all been born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: atha khalu mārasya pāpīyasa etad abhavad /
analyzed: atha khalu mārasya pāpīyasaḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the evil Māra:

original: imās tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catasraḥ pariṣadaḥ saṃmukhaṃ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: imāḥ tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya catasraḥ pariṣadaḥ saṃmukham sthitāḥ
translated: These four assemblies of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, are standing in front.

original: amī ca kāmāvacarā rūpāvacarāś ca devaputrāḥ saṃmukhaṃ sthitā niḥsaṃśayam atra bodhisattvā /
analyzed: amī ca kāmāvacarāḥ rūpāvacarāḥ ca deva putrāḥ saṃmukham sthitāḥ niḥsaṃśayam atra bodhisattvā
translated: And these gods belonging to the desire realm and the form realm are standing in front. Without a doubt, these are Bodhisattvas.

original: mahāsattvā vyākariṣyante 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: mahāsattvāḥ vyākariṣyante nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: the great beings will prophesy them for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yan nūnam ahaṃ yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāmeyaṃ vicakṣuḥkaraṇāyeti /
analyzed: yat nūnam aham yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmeyam vicakṣuḥkaraṇāya iti
translated: What if I were to go to the Blessed One to cause dissension?”

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyāṃś caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ nirmāya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkramitukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīyān caturaṅga balakāyam nirmāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: Then Māra the Bad, having created an army with four divisions, would want to approach the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: māro batāyaṃ pāpīyāṃś caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ nirmāya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkramitukāmaḥ /
analyzed: māraḥ bata ayam pāpīyān caturaṅga balakāyam nirmāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkramitu kāmaḥ
translated: “This Māra the Bad, having created an army with four divisions, wants to approach the Blessed One.

original: yo 'yaṃ mārasya pāpīyasaś caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyūhaḥ / na rājño bimbisārasya
analyzed: yaḥ yam mārasya pāpīyasaḥ caturaṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyūhaḥ na rājñaḥ bimbisārasya
translated: This is the kind of array of Māra the Bad’s army with four divisions, not the kind of array of King Bimbisāra’s

original: caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyūhaḥ /🔽na prasenajitaś caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyūhaḥ /🔽na śākyānāṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyūhaḥ /
analyzed: catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyūhaḥ  na prasenajitaḥ catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyūhaḥ  na śākyānām catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyūhaḥ
translated: army with four divisions.🔽Not the kind of array of Prasenajit’s army with four divisions.🔽Not the kind of array of the Śākyas’ army with four divisions.

original: na licchavīnāṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyūhaḥ /
analyzed: na licchavīnām catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyūhaḥ
translated: Not the kind of array of the Licchavis’ army with four divisions.

original: na mallānāṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo vyuhaḥ /
analyzed: na mallānām catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ vyuhaḥ
translated: The four-division army of the wrestlers did not have such an array.

original: yo 'yaṃ caturaṅgasya balakāyasyaivaṃrūpo māreṇa pāpīyasā nirmitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ yam catur aṅgasya balakāyasya evaṃrūpaḥ māreṇa pāpīyasā nirmitaḥ
translated: This four-division army that was created by the evil Māra did not have such an array.

original: dīrgharātraṃ khalu punar māraḥ pāpīyān bhagavato 'vatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī sattvānāṃ ca viheṭhanābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: dīrgharātram khalu punar māraḥ pāpīyān bhagavataḥ vatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī sattvānām ca viheṭhana abhiprāyaḥ
translated: For a long time, the evil Māra has been looking for a chance to harm the Blessed One and sentient beings.

original: yan nūnam aham imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ samanvāhareyaṃ smṛtyā svādhyāyaṃ kuryām /
analyzed: yat nūnam aham imām prajñāpāramitām samanvāhareyam smṛtyā svādhyāyam kuryām
translated: So now I will bring to mind and recite this perfection of wisdom with mindfulness.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indraḥ prajñāparamitāṃ samanvājahāra smṛtyā svādhyāyam akarot /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ prajñāparamitām samanvājahāra smṛtyā svādhyāyam akarot
translated: Then Śakra, lord of the gods, brought to mind and recited this perfection of wisdom with mindfulness.

original: yathā yathā śakro devānām indraḥ smṛtyā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ svādhyāyati sma tathā tathā māraḥ pāpīyāṃs tenaiva mārgeṇa tenaiva dvāreṇa punar
analyzed: yathā yathā śakraḥ devānām indraḥ smṛtyai imām prajñāpāramitām su ādhyāyati sma tathā tathā māraḥ pāpīyān tena eva mārgeṇa tena eva dvāreṇa punar
translated: As Śakra, lord of the gods, was reciting this perfection of wisdom with mindfulness, the evil Māra turned back by that very path, by that very door,

original: eva pratyudāvṛtto 'bhūt /
analyzed: eva pratyudāvṛttaḥ bhūt
translated: and went away.

original: atha khalu ye 'syāṃ pariṣadi cāturmahārājakāyikā devā yāvad akaniṣṭhā devās te divyāni puṣpāṇy abhinirmāyāntarīkṣagatā eva yena bhagavāṃs tenākṣipanti
analyzed: atha khalu ye syām pariṣadi cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ te divyāni puṣpāṇi abhinirmāya antarīkṣa gatāḥ eva yena bhagavān tena ākṣipanti  /
translated: Then, indeed, those gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings up to the Akaniṣṭha gods in this assembly, having created divine flowers, while remaining in the sky, scattered them

original: sma tenābhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: sma tena abhyavakiranti sma
translated: toward the Blessed One, and sprinkled them.

original: evaṃ ca vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣanta
translated: And they spoke these words:

original: ciraṃ bateyaṃ prajñāpāramitā jāmbūdvīpakānāṃ manuṣyāṇāṃ pracaratu yāvad iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: ciram bata iyam prajñāpāramitā jāmbūdvīpakānām manuṣyāṇām pracaratu yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Oh, may this Perfection of Wisdom circulate for a long time among the humans of Jambudvīpa, as long as

original: jāmbūdvīpakānāṃ manuṣyānāṃ pracariṣyati tāvan na tathāgatasyārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyāntardhānaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: jāmbūdvīpakānām manuṣyānām pracariṣyati tāvat na tathāgatasya arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya antardhānam bhaviṣyati
translated: this Perfection of Wisdom circulates among the humans of Jambudvīpa, for that long there will be no disappearance of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: saddharmaś cirasthitiko bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: saddharmaḥ cirasthitikaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: The true Dharma will remain for a long time.

original: saṃghasya loke prādurbhāvo bhaviṣyati / evaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau /
analyzed: saṃghasya loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhaviṣyati evam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau
translated: The appearance of the Saṅgha will occur in the world. In the same way, in the great trichiliocosm.

original: evaṃ daśasu dikṣu sarvabuddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvānāṃ caryāviśeṣaḥ prajñāsyate /
analyzed: evam daśasu dikṣu sarva buddhakṣetreṣu bodhisattvānām caryā viśeṣaḥ prajñāsyate
translated: In the same way, in the ten directions, in all the Buddha-fields, the special conduct of the bodhisattvas will be known.

original: yatra ca digbhāge imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā likhitāṃ dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti pustakalikhitām api kṛtvā sthāpayiṣyanti /🔽ālokajātā ca eṣā dig /🔽bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra ca digbhāge imām prajñāpāramitām te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā likhitām dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti pustaka likhitām api kṛtvā sthāpayiṣyanti  āloka jātā ca eṣā diś  bhaviṣyati
translated: In whatever direction those sons or daughters of good family will keep this perfection of wisdom written out, and will recite it, and will set up a book of the perfection of wisdom,🔽that direction will be full of light.

original: sanāthā vigatatamondhakārā ca eṣā dig bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa nāthā vigata tamaḥ undhakārā ca eṣā diś bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be a direction with a protector, a direction without darkness.

original: yatreyaṃ prajñāpāramitā pracariṣyati /
analyzed: yatra iyam prajñāpāramitā pracariṣyati
translated: In whatever direction this perfection of wisdom will be practiced.

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: yatra yatra diśi lokadhātuprasare iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā pracariṣyati /🔽pustakalikhitā ālokajātā ca eṣā dig bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra yatra diśi lokadhātu prasare iyam prajñāpāramitā pracariṣyati  pustaka likhitā āloka jātā ca eṣā diś bhaviṣyati
translated: In whatever direction in the spread of world systems this perfection of wisdom will be practiced,🔽that direction will be full of light.

original: sanāthā vigatatamondhakārā ca eṣā dig bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sa nāthā vigata tamaḥ undhakārā ca eṣā diś bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be a direction with a protector, a direction without darkness.

original: atha khalu te devaputrā divyāni kusumāny abhinirmāya yena bhagavāṃs tenābhyavakiranti sma /
analyzed: atha khalu te deva putrāḥ divyāni kusumāni abhinirmāya yena bhagavān tena abhyavakiranti sma
translated: Then those gods created divine flowers and scattered them over the Blessed One.

original: evaṃ ca vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: evam ca vācam abhāṣanta
translated: And they spoke these words:

original: yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati🔽vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati na tasya mārā vā mārakāyikā
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati  vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati na tasya mārā vā māra kāyikā
translated: Whoever, son of a good family or daughter of a good family, will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: vā devaputrā avatāraṃ lapsyante / vayam api bhagavaṃ tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur🔽vā satatasamitaṃ rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vā deva putrāḥ avatāram lapsyante vayam api tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ  vā satata samitam rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyāmaḥ
translated: recite it, study it, and attend to it wisely, Mara or Mara's deities will not find an opportunity to harm him or her. We too, Blessed One, will always provide protection, defense, and security for that son of a good family or daughter of a good family🔽who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and attend to it wisely.

original: śāstāram iti bhagavaṃs taṃ vayaṃ kulaputraṃ vā kuladuhitaraṃ vā maṃsyāmahe ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati 🔽yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: śāstāram iti bhagavan tam vayam kula putram vā kula duhitaram vā maṃsyāmahe yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati  / yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: Blessed One, we will think of that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and attend to it wisely as our teacher.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Shakra, lord of the gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: na te bhagavan kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vāvarakeṇa kuśalamūlena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: na te bhagavan kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā avarakeṇa kuśala mūlena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Blessed One, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will not be endowed with an inferior wholesome root.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas
translated: Those who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and attend to it properly,

original: ca manasikariṣyanti / pūrvajinakṛtādhikārās te bhagavan kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro
analyzed: ca manasikariṣyanti pūrva jina kṛta adhikārāḥ te bhagavan kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaro
translated: those sons or daughters of good family, Blessed One, will have served the Victors in the past.

original: vā bhaviṣyanti ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti🔽yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti / bahubuddhaparyupāsitāḥ kalyāṇamitraparigṛhītās te kulaputrāḥ
analyzed: vā bhaviṣyanti ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti  yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti bahu buddha paryupāsitāḥ kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhītāḥ te kula putrāḥ
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it,

original: kuladuhitaraś ca bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: kula duhitaraḥ ca bhaviṣyanti
translated: and attend to it properly will have attended on many Buddhas, and will have been taken hold of by good spiritual friends.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ato nirjātā hi sarvajñatā yad uta prajñāpāramitā nirjātā sarvajñatā nirjātā ca prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā hi sarvajña tā yat uta prajñāpāramitā nirjātā sarvajña tā nirjātā ca prajñāpāramitā
translated: For from this has come forth the knowledge of all modes, that is to say, from the perfection of wisdom has come forth the knowledge of all modes, and from the knowledge of all modes has come forth the perfection of wisdom.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi nānyā prajñāpāramitā nānyā sarvajñatā iti hi sarvajñatā ca prajñāpāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi na anyā prajñāpāramitā na anyā sarvajña tā iti hi sarvajña tā ca prajñāpāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom is not one thing and the knowledge of all modes another. Thus the knowledge of all modes and the perfection of wisdom are not two, nor divided.

original: evam ukte bhagavān sakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat / evam etat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān sakram devānām indram etat avocat evam etat
translated: When this had been said, the Blessed One said to Sakra, Chief of Gods: So it is, Kausika.

original: kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: kauśika evam etat
translated: Kauśika, it is just as you have said.

original: yathā vadasi sarvajñatā ca prajñāpāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram / iti svaparārthādhimuktir mṛdumadhyā
analyzed: yathā vadasi sarvajña tā ca prajñāpāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram iti sva para artha adhimuktiḥ mṛdu madhyā
translated: As you have said, this omniscience and the perfection of wisdom are non-dual, not divided into two. This is the weak-middling

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān ānando bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān ānandaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda said this to the Blessed One:

original: tathā hi bhagavān na dānapāramitāyā nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati na śīlapāramitāyā na
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavān na dāna pāramitāyāḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayati na śīla pāramitāyāḥ na
translated: Blessed One, it is because the Blessed One does not proclaim the name of the perfection of giving, nor the name of the perfection of morality,

original: kṣāntipāramitāyā na vīryapāramitāyā na dhyānapāramitāyā yathā prajñāpāramitāyā nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitāyāḥ na vīrya pāramitāyāḥ na dhyāna pāramitāyāḥ yathā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: nor the name of the perfection of patience, nor the name of the perfection of perseverance, nor the name of the perfection of concentration, as he proclaims the name of the perfection of wisdom.

original: na saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: na saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣāṇām dharmāṇām nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: He does not proclaim the name of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: nāryasatyānāṃ nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: na ārya satyānām na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: nor the name of the noble truths, nor the name of the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless attainments.

original: nāṣṭānāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: na aṣṭānām vimokṣa mukhānām na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: He does not proclaim the name of the eight liberations, nor the name of the nine successive absorptions.

original: na ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ na sarvāṇāṃ śūnyatānāṃ na samādhīnāṃ na sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: na ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām na sarvāṇām śūnyatānām na samādhīnām na sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: He does not proclaim the name of the six higher knowledges, nor the name of all the emptinesses, nor the name of the concentrations, nor the name of all the doors of retention.

original: na daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ na vaiśāradyānāṃ na pratisaṃvidāṃ nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati yathā prajñāpāramitāyā
analyzed: na daśānām tathāgata balānām na vaiśāradyānām na pratisaṃvidām na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām nāmadheyam parikīrtayati yathā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: He does not proclaim the names of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed understandings, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, as he proclaims the name of the perfection of wisdom.

original: nāmadheyaṃ parikīrtayati /
analyzed: nāmadheyam parikīrtayati
translated: Thus he proclaims the name of the perfection of wisdom.

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etad avocat /🔽prajñāpāramitā ānanda pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā yad uta ṣaṇṇāṃ pāramitānāṃ saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇām āryasatyānām apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam etat avocat  prajñāpāramitāḥ ānanda pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā yat uta ṣaṇṇām pāramitānām saptatriṃśatām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām ārya satyānām a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām
translated: When this was said, the Lord said to the venerable Ānanda:

original: pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā /
analyzed: pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Ānanda, is the forerunner and leader in that it is the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, and in that it is the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,🔽the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions,🔽the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signless, and wishless liberations, the six clairvoyances, and the four formless absorptions.

original: aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ navānām anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitānāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā /
analyzed: aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām navānām anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitānām vimokṣa mukhānām ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā
translated: It is the forerunner and leader in that it is the six clairvoyances, the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, the emptiness, signless, and wishless liberations, the six clairvoyances, and the four formless absorptions.

original: sarvaśūnyatānāṃ sarvasamādhīnāṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā /
analyzed: sarva śūnyatānām sarva samādhīnām sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā
translated: It is the forerunner and leader in that it is all the emptinesses, all the concentrations, and all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā /
analyzed: daśānām tathāgata balānām vaiśāradyānām pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā
translated: It is the forerunner and leader of the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sarvabuddhadharmāṇāṃ pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sarva buddha dharmāṇām pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā prajñāpāramitā
translated: It is the forerunner and leader of all buddhadharmas.

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think, Ānanda?

original: ānanda apariṇāmitaṃ dānaṃ sarvajñatāyāṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: ānanda apariṇāmitam dānam sarvajña tāyām pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: Is a gift that has not been dedicated to complete knowing given the name of a pāramitā?

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think, Ānanda?

original: apariṇāmitaṃ śīlaṃ apariṇāmitā kṣāntir apariṇāmitaṃ vīryam apariṇāmitaṃ dhyānam apariṇāmitā prajñā sarvajñatāyāṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: a pariṇāmitam śīlam a pariṇāmitā kṣāntiḥ a pariṇāmitam vīryam a pariṇāmitam dhyānam a pariṇāmitā prajñā sarvajña tāyām pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: Is morality that has not been dedicated, patience that has not been dedicated, perseverance that has not been dedicated, concentration that has not been dedicated, and wisdom that has not been dedicated given the name of a pāramitā in complete knowing?”

original: ānanda āha / no hīdaṃ bhagavan no hīdaṃ sugata /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha no hi idam bhagavat no hi idam sugata
translated: Ānanda said, “No indeed, Blessed One! No indeed, Sugata!”

original: kathaṃ punar bhagavan dānaṃ sarvajñatāpariṇāmitaṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: katham punar bhagavan dānam sarvajña tā pariṇāmitam pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: “But, Blessed One, how is a gift that has been dedicated to complete knowing given the name of a pāramitā?

original: kathaṃ punar bhagavan śīlaṃ kṣāntir vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ prajñā sarvajñatāyāṃ pariṇāmitā pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: katham punar bhagavan śīlam kṣāntiḥ vīryam dhyānam prajñā sarvajña tāyām pariṇāmitā pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: But, Blessed One, how is morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom that have been dedicated to complete knowing given the name of a pāramitā?”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Ānanda,

original: advayayogenānanda dānaṃ pariṇāmitaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntir vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ prajñā sarvajñatāyāṃ
analyzed: advaya yogena ānanda dānam pariṇāmitam śīlam kṣāntiḥ vīryam dhyānam prajñā sarvajña tāyām
translated: When giving is dedicated with the yoga of non-duality, and when morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom are dedicated to omniscience, they obtain the name of perfections.

original: pariṇāmitā pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate / anutpādayogenānupalambhayogena pariṇāmitaṃ
analyzed: pariṇāmitā pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate anutpāda yogena anupalambha yogena pariṇāmitam
translated: When giving is dedicated with the yoga of non-arising and the yoga of non-apprehension,

original: dānaṃ yāvat prajñā sarvajñatāyāṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: dānam yāvat prajñā sarvajña tāyām pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: up to when wisdom is dedicated to omniscience, it obtains the name of perfection.

original: ānanda āha / kathaṃ bhagavann advayayogena dānaṃ pariṇāmitaṃ sarvajñatāyāṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha katham bhagavan advaya yogena dānam pariṇāmitam sarvajña tāyām pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: Ananda said, Blessed One, how does giving dedicated with the yoga of non-duality obtain the name of perfection in omniscience?

original: evaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntir vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ kathaṃ bhagavan prajñādvayayogena pariṇāmitā sarvajñatāyāṃ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhate /
analyzed: evam śīlam kṣāntiḥ vīryam dhyānam katham bhagavan prajñā dvaya yogena pariṇāmitā sarvajña tāyām pāramitā nāmadheyam labhate
translated: In the same way, how does morality, patience, vigor, and meditation? Blessed One, how does wisdom dedicated with the yoga of non-duality obtain the name of perfection in omniscience?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rūpasyānanda advayayogena vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ vijñānasyādvayayogena yāvad bodheḥ /
analyzed: rūpasya ānanda advaya yogena vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām vijñānasya advaya yogena yāvat bodheḥ
translated: Ananda, it is through the yoga of non-duality of form, of feeling, of perception, of volitional formations, of consciousness, up to of enlightenment.

original: ānanda āha / kathaṃ bhagavan rūpasyādvayayogena /
analyzed: ānandaḥ āha katham bhagavan rūpasya advaya yogena
translated: Ananda said, Blessed One, how is it through the yoga of non-duality of form?

original: kathaṃ vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇāṃ advayayogena /
analyzed: katham vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ saṃskārāṇām advaya yogena
translated: How is it through the yoga of non-duality of feeling, of perception, of volitional formations?

original: kathaṃ vijñānasyādvayayogena /
analyzed: katham vijñānasya advaya yogena
translated: How is it through the yoga of non-duality of consciousness?

original: kathaṃ yāvad bodher advayayogena /
analyzed: katham yāvat bodheḥ advaya yogena
translated: How up to the non-dual union with enlightenment?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathā hi ānanda rūpaṃ rūpeṇa śūnyaṃ vedanā vedanayā śūnyā saṃjñā saṃjñayā śūnyā saṃskārāḥ saṃskāraiḥ śūnyā vijñānaṃ vijñānena śūnyam /
analyzed: tathā hi ānanda rūpam rūpeṇa śūnyam vedanā vedanayā śūnyā saṃjñā saṃjñayā śūnyā saṃskārāḥ saṃskāraiḥ śūnyā vijñānam vijñānena śūnyam
translated: Thus, Ānanda, form is empty of form, feeling is empty of feeling, perception is empty of perception, volitional factors are empty of volitional factors, consciousness is empty of consciousness.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi rūpaṃ ca vedanā ca saṃjñā ca saṃskārā ca vijñānaṃ ca pāramitāś cādvayam etad advaidhīkāraṃ yāvad bodhiś ca pāramitāś cādvayam etad
analyzed: tathā hi rūpam ca vedanā ca saṃjñā ca saṃskārāḥ ca vijñānam ca pāramitāḥ ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram yāvat bodhiḥ ca pāramitāḥ ca advayam etat
translated: Thus, form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and the perfections, are non-dual, they are not divided into two, up to enlightenment and the perfections are non-dual,

original: tasmāt tarhy ānanda prajñāpāramitā nu pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā sarvapāramitānāṃ sarvaśūnyatānāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi ānanda prajñāpāramitā nu pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā sarva pāramitānām sarva śūnyatānām
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner and leader of all the perfections, of all the emptinesses,

original: sarvasamādhīnāṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇām apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnām
analyzed: sarva samādhīnām sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām
translated: of all the meditative stabilizations, of all the dhāraṇī gateways, of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, of the immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions,

original: āryasatyānām aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ navānām anupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ trayāṇāṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ
analyzed: ārya satyānām aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām navānām anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām trayāṇām vimokṣa mukhānām
translated: of the noble truths, of the eight liberations, of the nine serial absorptions, of the three doors to liberation,

original: ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām
analyzed: ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām daśānām tathāgata balānām vaiśāradyānām pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām
translated: The six superknowledges, the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the analytical knowledges, the eighteen,

original: āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ yāvad bodheḥ sarvajñatāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā /
analyzed: āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām yāvat bodheḥ sarvajña tāyāḥ prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā
translated: the unshared qualities of the Buddha, up to enlightenment, omniscience, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner and leader.

original: tadyathāpi nāmānanda mahāpṛthivīṃ niśrāya sāmagrīvaśena bījāni virohanti / evam evānanda
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma ānanda mahā pṛthivīm niśrāya sāmagrī vaśena bījāni virohanti evam eva ānanda
translated: Just as, Ānanda, seeds grow in dependence on the great earth, by the power of the assemblage, so, Ānanda,

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ niśrāya prajñāpāramitām āgamya sarvāḥ / pāramitāḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām niśrāya prajñāpāramitām āgamya sarvāḥ pāramitāḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: in dependence on the perfection of wisdom, having come to the perfection of wisdom, all the perfections, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,🔽the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, the noble truths, the six superknowledges, all the doors of retention,

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattaya āryasatyāni ṣaḍabhijñāḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni virohanti / daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāveṇikā buddhadharmā virohanti
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ ārya satyāni ṣaḍabhijñāḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni virohanti daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvid āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ virohanti
translated: grow, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the analytical knowledges, the unshared qualities of the Buddha grow,

original: yāvat sarvajñatā /
analyzed: yāvat sarvajña tā
translated: up to omniscience.

original: virohati / sarvajñatāṃ pariniśrāya sarvapāramitāḥ sarvaśūnyatāḥ sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni
analyzed: virohati sarvajña tām pariniśrāya sarva pāramitāḥ sarva śūnyatāḥ sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇīmukhāni
translated: In dependence on omniscience, all the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the concentrations, all the doors of retention,

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmā apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, the formless attainments, the ten powers, the confidences, the unobstructed knowledges,

original: yāvad āveṇikā buddhadharmā virohanti / tasmād ānanda prajñāpāramitaivāsāṃ pāramitānāṃ
analyzed: yāvat āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ virohanti tasmāt ānanda prajñāpāramitā eva āsām pāramitānām
translated: up to the unique qualities of a Buddha grow. Therefore, Ānanda, the perfection of wisdom is the

original: pariṇāyikā yāvād aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ yāvat sarvākārajñatāyāḥ /
analyzed: pariṇāyikāḥ yāvāt aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām yāvat sarva ākārajña tāyāḥ
translated: leader of these perfections, up to the eighteen unique qualities of a Buddha, up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: iti svaparārthādhimuktir mṛdvadhimātrā
analyzed: iti sva para artha adhimuktiḥ mṛdu adhimātrā
translated: Thus, the weak-strong faith in one's own and others' aims.

original: śakra āha / na khalu punar bhagavaṃs tathāgatenārhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
analyzed: śakraḥ āha na khalu punar bhagavan tathāgatena arhatā samyaksaṃbuddhena prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: Śakra said: Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One has not

original: sarvagūṇāḥ parikīrtitāḥ yān guṇān sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā parigṛhṇāti imāṃ🔽prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan yoniśaś ca manasikurvan prajñāpāramitayā
analyzed: sarva gūṇāḥ parikīrtitāḥ yān guṇān sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā parigṛhṇāti imām  prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇan dhārayan vācayan paryavāpnuvan yoniśas ca manasikurvan prajñāpāramitayā
translated: fully proclaimed all the qualities that the noble son or noble daughter who takes up🔽this perfection of wisdom, who bears it in mind, recites it, masters it, and wisely attends to it in the right way,🔽Blessed One, by taking up, bearing in mind, reciting, mastering, and wisely attending to the perfection of wisdom in the right way, the noble son or noble daughter

original: bhagavann udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā paryavāptayā yoniśaś ca manasikṛtayā daśānāṃ
analyzed: bhagavan udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā paryavāptayā yoniśas ca manasi kṛtayā daśānām
translated: obtains ten qualities.

original: kuśalānāṃ karmapathānāṃ loke prādurbhāvo bhavati / caturṇāṃ dhyānānāṃ caturṇām apramāṇānāṃ
analyzed: kuśalānām karma pathānām loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati caturṇām dhyānānām caturṇām apramāṇānām
translated: The appearance of the wholesome courses of action in the world, the four meditations, the four immeasurables,

original: catasṛṇām ārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ saptatriṃśatāṃ bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇām āryasatyānām
analyzed: catasṛṇām ārūpya samāpattīnām saptatriṃśatām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām ārya satyānām
translated: the four formless attainments, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the noble truths,

original: aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ trayānaṃ vimokṣamukhānāṃ
analyzed: aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām tri yānam vimokṣa mukhānām
translated: the eight liberations, the nine successive attainments, the six superknowledges, the three doors to liberation,

original: sarvapāramitānāṃ sarvaśūnyatānāṃ sarvasamādhīnāṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhānāṃ daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ
analyzed: sarva pāramitānām sarva śūnyatānām sarva samādhīnām sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām daśānām tathāgata balānām
translated: all the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the concentrations, all the doors of retention, the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: caturṇāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ
analyzed: caturṇām vaiśāradyānām catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām
translated: the four confidences, the four unhindered knowledges, the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha,

original: loke prādurbhāvo bhavati / prajñāpāramitayā bhagavann udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā
analyzed: loke prādurbhāvaḥ bhavati prajñāpāramitayā bhagavan udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā
translated: appear in the world, Blessed One, through the perfection of wisdom, through taking it up, bearing it in mind, reading it aloud,

original: paryavāptayā yoniśaś ca manasikṛtayā gṛhapatimahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /🔽kṣatriyamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: paryavāptayā yoniśas ca manasi kṛtayā gṛhapati mahā śāla kulāni prajñāyante  kṣatriya mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: mastering it, and properly paying attention to it. Great merchant families are known.🔽Great warrior families are known.

original: brāhmaṇamahāśālakulāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kulāni prajñāyante
translated: Great priestly families are known.

original: cāturmahārājakāyikā devā yāvad akaniṣṭhā devāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante
translated: the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings up to the Akaniṣṭha gods are known.

original: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavann udgrahītayā yāvad yoniśo manasikṛtayā srotaāpannāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavan udgrahītayā yāvat yoniśas manasi kṛtayā srotaāpannāḥ prajñāyante
translated: Blessed One, by upholding the perfection of wisdom up to properly paying attention, stream-enterers are known.

original: sakṛdāgāmino 'nāgāmino 'rhantaḥ prajñāyante pratyekabuddhāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāminaḥ nāgāminaḥ rhantaḥ prajñāyante pratyekabuddhāḥ prajñāyante
translated: Once-returners, non-returners, arhats are known. Pratyekabuddhas are known.

original: bodhisattvāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ prajñāyante
translated: Bodhisattvas are known.

original: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavann udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā paryavāptayā yoniśaś ca manasikṛtayā tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loke prajñāyante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavan udgrahītayā dhāritayā vācitayā paryavāptayā yoniśas ca manasi kṛtayā tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke prajñāyante
translated: Blessed One, by upholding, carrying, reading, mastering, and properly paying attention to the perfection of wisdom, Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are known in the world.

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: na punaḥ kauśika yaiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitṛbhir vā iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā dhāritā vācitā paryavāptā yoniśaś ca manasikṛtā teṣām etāvata evaṃ
analyzed: na punar kauśika yaiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā iyam prajñāpāramitā dhāritā vācitā paryavāptā yoniśas ca manasi kṛtā teṣām etāvataḥ evam
translated: Kauśika, it is not so that by those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have upheld, recited, mastered, and properly paid attention to this perfection of wisdom, they have done what is to be done🔽with regard to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: apramāṇena hi kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā śīlaskandhena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: apramāṇena hi kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā śīla skandhena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it properly,

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas
translated: will be endowed with an immeasurable aggregate of morality,

original: ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajñatācittena cāvirahitā bhaviṣyanti / apramāṇena samādhiskandhena
analyzed: ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajña tā cittena ca avirahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti apramāṇena samādhi skandhena
translated: an immeasurable aggregate of concentration,

original: prajñāskandhena vimuktiskandhena vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhena samanvāgatā bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: prajñā skandhena vimukti skandhena vimukti jñāna darśana skandhena samanvāgatāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: an immeasurable aggregate of wisdom, an immeasurable aggregate of liberation, and an immeasurable aggregate of the vision and cognition of liberation.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś
analyzed: ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas
translated: Those who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it properly,

original: ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajñatācittena cāvirahitā bhaviṣyanti / tathāgatapratimās te
analyzed: ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajña tā cittena ca avirahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti tathāgata pratimāḥ te
translated: will be inseparable from the thought of the knowledge of all modes. They should be known, Kauśika, as being like Tathāgatas,

original: kauśika kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā veditavyā ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīyanti
analyzed: kauśika kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā veditavyāḥ ye imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīyanti
translated: those sons of good family or daughters of good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajñatācittena
analyzed: dhārayiyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti sarvajña tā cittena
translated: bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it properly, and will not be separated from the thought of the knowledge of all modes.

original: cāvirahitā bhaviṣyanti / yaś ca kauśika sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ śīlaskandhaḥ
analyzed: ca avirahitāḥ bhaviṣyanti yaḥ ca kauśika sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām śīla skandhaḥ
translated: and will not be separated from it. And, Kauśika, the aggregate of morality,

original: samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ /🔽yaś ca prajñāpāramitāvihāriṇāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ
analyzed: samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ  yaḥ ca prajñāpāramitā vihāriṇām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ
translated: the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,🔽and the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration,

original: prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ asya kauśika śīlaskandhasya
analyzed: prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ asya kauśika śīla skandhasya
translated: the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, and the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation of the sons of noble family and daughters of noble family who dwell in the perfection of wisdom, of this aggregate of morality,

original: samādhiskandhasya prajñāskandhasya vimuktiskandhasya vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhasya
analyzed: samādhi skandhasya prajñā skandhasya vimukti skandhasya vimukti jñāna darśana skandhasya
translated: this aggregate of concentration, this aggregate of wisdom, this aggregate of liberation, and this aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation,

original: sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ
analyzed: sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ
translated: the aggregate of morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation of all śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: śatatamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: does not approach a hundredth part.

original: sahasratamīm api śatasahasratamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti /
analyzed: sahasratamīm api śata sahasratamīm api kalām na upaiti
translated: It does not approach a thousandth part, a hundred thousandth part.

original: saṃkhyām api gaṇanām apy upamām apy upaniśām apy upaniṣadam api nopaiti /
analyzed: saṃkhyām api gaṇanām api upamām api upaniśām api upaniṣadam api na upaiti
translated: It does not approach any number, any calculation, any analogy, any comparison, any illustration.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmeś cittaṃ vimuktaṃ /
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmeḥ cittam vimuktam
translated: Because the minds of those sons of good family and daughters of good family are liberated from the stage of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: na ca kaścid dharmo nāvigato na jñātaḥ / ye kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā imāṃ
analyzed: na ca kaścid dharmaḥ na a vigataḥ na jñātaḥ ye kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā imām
translated: and no dharma is not known and not abandoned. Those sons of good family or daughters of good family, Kauśika, who will honor,

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhis
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām satkariṣyanti gurukariṣyanti mānayiṣyanti pūjayiṣyanti puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: revere, respect, and worship this perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: teṣām api kulaputrāṇāṃ /
analyzed: teṣām api kula putrāṇām
translated: they too, sons of good family,

original: kuladuhitṛṇāṃ ca ime dṛṣṭadhārmikāḥ sāṃparāyikāś ca guṇānuśaṃsāḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: kula duhitṛṇām ca ime dṛṣṭa dhārmikāḥ sāṃparāyikāḥ ca guṇa anuśaṃsāḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyāḥ
translated: daughters of good family, should expect these visible and future virtues and benefits.

original: iti svaparārthādhimuktimadhyamṛddhī

analyzed: lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ

analyzed: te tatra āgatya enām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti
translated: having come there, will take up this perfection of wisdom, will bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and master it,

original: manasikariṣyanti vandiṣyanti namaskṛtvā vanditvā ca punar eva prakramiṣyanti / evaṃ
analyzed: manasi kariṣyanti vandiṣyanti namaskṛtvā vanditvā ca punar eva prakramiṣyanti evam
translated: will pay homage to it, and having paid homage will depart again. In the same way

analyzed: trāyastriṃśāḥ yāmāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ brahmapāriṣadyāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ
translated: the Trāyastriṃśa, Yāma, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇarati, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the Brahmapurohita,

analyzed: mahābrahmāṇaḥ parīttābhāḥ apramāṇābhāḥ ābhāsvarāḥ parīttaśubhāḥ apramāṇaśubhāḥ śubhakṛtsnāḥ
translated: Mahābrahmā, Parīttābha, Apramāṇābha, Ābhāsvara, Parīttaśubha, Apramāṇaśubha, and Śubhakṛtsna gods,

analyzed: anabhrakāḥ puṇyaprasavāḥ brhatphalāḥ śuddhāvāsāḥ avṛhāḥ atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ
translated: the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Atapa gods, the Avṛha gods, the Puṇyaprasava gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Śubhakṛtsna gods, the Parīttābha gods, the Apramāṇābha gods, the Apramāṇacitta gods, the Asaṃjñisattva gods, the Bṛhatphala gods, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods,

analyzed: tatra ye kauśika mahābrahmāṇaḥ nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau kṛta praṇidhānāḥ te pi
translated: the Mahābrahmās who have made aspirations for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment in the ten directions, they too,

original: tatrāgatyemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā namaskṛtya
analyzed: tatra āgatya imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā namaskṛtya
translated: having come there, will take up, master, keep, read, and pay homage to this perfection of wisdom,

original: punar eva /🔽prakramiṣyanti / ye 'pi śuddhāvāsakāyikā avṛhā atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanā akaniṣṭhā
analyzed: punar eva  prakramiṣyanti ye pi śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ avṛhāḥ atapāḥ sudṛśāḥ sudarśanāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ
translated: and then depart again.🔽The gods of the Pure Abodes, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods,

original: devaputrās te 'pi tatrāgatyemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā
analyzed: deva putrāḥ te pi tatra āgatya imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā
translated: the gods of the Pure Abodes, the Avṛha gods, the Atapa gods, the Sudarśana gods, the Sudṛśa gods, the Akaniṣṭha gods, they too, having come there, will take up, master, keep, read, and pay homage to this perfection of wisdom,

original: namaskṛtya punar eva prakramiṣyanti / tena hi kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā
analyzed: namaskṛtya punar eva prakramiṣyanti tena hi kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā
translated: and then depart again. Therefore, Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family

original: evaṃ cittam utpādayitavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam cittam utpādayitavyam
translated: should arouse the thought in this way:

original: ye te daśadiglokadhātuṣu devaputrāś cāturmahārājakāyikā yāvad bṛhatphalā ye 'nuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: ye te daśa diś lokadhātuṣu deva putrāḥ cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ yāvat bṛhat phalāḥ ye nu ttarāyām
translated: 'Those gods of the Pure Abodes in the world systems of the ten directions, from the Cāturmahārājika gods up to the Bṛhatphala gods, who have made aspirations for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprashitā ye 'pi śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrā ye 'pi cānye devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragās
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprashitāḥ ye pi śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ ye pi ca anye deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragāḥ
translated: Those gods of the Pure Abodes who are intent on perfect enlightenment, and those other gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: te 'pīhāgatyemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahya paryavāpya dhārayitvā vācayitvā pūjayitvā punar gacchantu /

translated: may they come here, receive this perfection of wisdom, study it, bear it in mind, recite it, worship it, and then return.🔽May they be given this gift of the Dharma.

original: teṣām etad dharmadānaṃ dattaṃ bhavantu / ye 'pi daśadiglokadhātuṣu cāturmahārājakāyikā
analyzed: teṣām etat dharma dānam dattam bhavantu ye daśa diś lokadhātuṣu cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ
translated: Those gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: devaputrā yāvad bṛhatphalā devaputrā ye 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitā
analyzed: deva putrāḥ yāvat bṛhatphalāḥ deva putrāḥ ye nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitā
translated: up to those gods of the Bṛhatphala realm who are intent on perfect enlightenment,

original: ye 'pi śuddhāvāsakāyikā devaputrās te 'pi tatrāgatyemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti
analyzed: ye pi śuddhāvāsa kāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ te pi tatra āgatya imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti
translated: and those gods of the Pure Abodes, may they also come there and receive this perfection of wisdom,

original: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti vanditvā namaskṛtya pūjayitvā punar eva
analyzed: dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti vanditvā namaskṛtya pūjayitvā punar eva
translated: bear it in mind, recite it, study it, worship it, and then return.

original: prakramitavyaṃ maṃsyante / tasya khalu punaḥ kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā ya iha
analyzed: prakramitavyam maṃsyante tasya khalu punar kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā yaḥ iha
translated: For that son or daughter of good family, here in the world system of four continents,

original: trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikā devā yāvad akaniṣṭhā devā ye
analyzed: tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ ye
translated: In the great trichiliocosm, the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings up to the Akaniṣṭha gods,

original: 'pi te daśadiglokadhātuṣu cāturmahārājakāyikā devā yāvad akaniṣṭhā devās te 'pi tasya
analyzed: pi te daśa diś lokadhātuṣu cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ te pi tasya
translated: and also those gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings up to the Akaniṣṭha gods in the world systems of the ten directions, they too will provide protection, guard, and safety

original: kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā rakṣāvaraṇaguptiṃ saṃvidhāsyanti / nāpy asya kaścid
analyzed: kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā rakṣā āvaraṇa guptim saṃvidhāsyanti na api asya kaścid
translated: for that son or daughter of good family. And no one

original: avatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī avatāraṃ lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrvakarmavipākaṃ /
analyzed: avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī avatāram lapsyate sthāpayitvā pūrva karma vipākam
translated: will find an opportunity to harm them, except as a result of their past actions.

original: imān api kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti /
analyzed: imān api kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikān guṇān parigṛhṇāti
translated: Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family will also obtain these visible good qualities.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi ye devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitās te 'pi tatrāgantavyaṃ
analyzed: tathā hi ye deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ te pi tatra āgantavyam
translated: Because those gods who have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment will think that they should go there.

original: maṃsyante / tathā hi kauśika devaputrā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau sarvasattvānāṃ
analyzed: maṃsyante tathā hi kauśika deva putrāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau sarva sattvānām
translated: Because, Kauśika, those gods who have set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for the protection, benefit, and happiness of all beings,

original: traṇāya hitasukhāya saṃprasthitāḥ / iti svaparārthādhimuktir adhimātramadhyā
analyzed: hita sukhāya saṃprasthitāḥ iti sva para artha adhimuktiḥ adhimātra madhyā
translated: This is the medium of the great stage of devotion to one's own and others' welfare.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then indeed Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā jñāsyati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā jñāsyati
translated: Blessed One, how will a son of good family or a daughter of good family know
