analyzed: iha cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ deva putrāḥ āgacchanti yāvat akaniṣṭhāḥ deva putrāḥ āgacchanti iti  evam samantāt daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahītum vā dhārayitum vā vācayitum vā paryavāptum vā satkartum vā gurukartum vā mānayitum
translated: that the gods of the Four Great Kings have come here, up to the gods of the Akaniṣṭha heaven have come,🔽in the same way from the ten directions all around, to take up, bear in mind, read aloud, study,

original: vā pūjayituṃ vā /
analyzed: vā pūjayitum vā
translated: honor, revere, respect, and worship this perfection of wisdom?

original: evam ukte bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /🔽sacet kauśika /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat  saced kauśika
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā udāram avabhāsaṃ jñāsyati niṣṭhā tena gantavyā mahaujaskā🔽mahaujaskā devā āgātā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ vācayitum udgrahītuṃ paryavāptuṃ dhārayituṃ
analyzed: kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā udāram avabhāsam jñāsyati niṣṭhā tena gantavyā mahā ojaskā  mahā ojaskāḥ devāḥ āgātāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām vācayitum udgrahītum paryavāptum dhārayitum
translated: Kauśika, if a son of good family or a daughter of good family🔽knows a vast illumination, they should conclude that gods of great power🔽have come to read aloud, take up, study, bear in mind,

original: satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ vandituṃ namaskartum /
analyzed: satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum vanditum namaskartum
translated: honor, revere, respect, and worship this perfection of wisdom, and to pay homage and make offerings.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika sacet kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā amānuṣaṃ divyaṃ gandham anāghrātapūrvam🔽āghrāsyati niṣṭhā tena gantavyā mahaujaskā mahaujaskā iha devaputrā āgatā iti prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika saced kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā amānuṣam divyam gandham an āghrāta pūrvam  āghrāsyati niṣṭhā tena gantavyā mahā ojaskāḥ mahā ojaskāḥ iha deva putrāḥ āgatāḥ iti prajñāpāramitām
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if a son of good family or a daughter of good family smells a non-human, divine fragrance never smelled before,

original: vācayituṃ śrotum udgrahītuṃ paryavāptuṃ dhārayituṃ satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayitum /
analyzed: vācayitum śrotum udgrahītum paryavāptum dhārayitum satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum
translated: he or she should conclude, 'Devas of great splendor have come here to listen to, study, understand, uphold, honor, revere, and worship the perfection of wisdom.'

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā caukṣasamudācāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā caukṣa samudācāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family will be of pure conduct.

original: tasya tayā caukṣasamudācāratayā devatā āgatyemāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya dhārayitvā
analyzed: tasya tayā caukṣa samudācāra tayā devatāḥ āgatya imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya dhārayitvā
translated: The devas, having come because of that pure conduct, will take up, uphold,

original: vācayitvā satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā āttamanaskā bhaviṣyanti / yāś ca🔽tatra pṛthivīpradeśe 'lpaujaskā alpaujaskā devatā bhaviṣyanti tās tato 'pakramitavyaṃ
analyzed: vācayitvā satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā ātta manaskāḥ bhaviṣyanti yāḥ ca  tatra pṛthivī pradeśe lpa ojaskāḥ alpa ojaskāḥ devatāḥ bhaviṣyanti tāḥ upakramitavyam
translated: recite, honor, revere, and worship this perfection of wisdom. They will be delighted.🔽And those devas of little splendor and little splendor who are in that region will think to move away

original: maṃsyante / teṣāṃ mahaujaskānāṃ mahaujaskānāṃ devānāṃ tejaś ca śriyaś cāsahamānāḥ /
analyzed: maṃsyante teṣām mahā ojaskānām mahā ojaskānām devānām tejaḥ ca śriyaḥ ca a sahamānāḥ
translated: because they cannot bear the splendor and glory of those devas of great splendor and great splendor.

original: yathāyathā mahaujaskā mahaujaskā devatā upasaṃkramiṣyanti tathātathā te kulaputrāḥ
analyzed: yathā yathā mahā ojaskāḥ mahā ojaskāḥ devatāḥ upasaṃkramiṣyanti tathā tathā te kula putrāḥ
translated: As the gods of great splendor will approach, so those sons and daughters of good family

original: kuladuhitaro vā udārādhimuktikā bhaviṣyanti / tasmiṃś ca pṛthivīpradeśe 'caukṣasamudācāratā na pracārayitavyā /🔽puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacivaracchatradhvajapatākābhiś ca sa pṛthivīpradeśo
analyzed: kula duhitaraḥ vā udāra adhimuktikāḥ bhaviṣyanti tasmin ca pṛthivī pradeśe caukṣa samudācāra tā na pracārayitavyā  puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa civara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ ca sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ
translated: will have lofty aspirations. And in that place on earth, impure conduct should not be practiced.🔽That place on earth should be adorned with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: 'laṃkartavyaḥ gandhalipto muktapuṣpāvakīrṇaḥ kārayitavyaḥ / avasaktapaṭadāmakalāpaś
analyzed: laṃkartavyaḥ gandha liptaḥ mukta puṣpa avakīrṇaḥ kārayitavyaḥ avasakta paṭa dāma kalāpaḥ
translated: It should be made fragrant, strewn with loose flowers, hung with silk canopies,

original: cailavitānavitataḥ / anekaprakāraṃ ca sa pṛthivīpradeśo 'laṃkartavyaḥ /
analyzed: caila vitāna vitataḥ aneka prakāram ca sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ laṃkartavyaḥ
translated: and that place on earth should be adorned in many ways.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā kāyo na klānto bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā kāyaḥ na klāntaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the body of that son or daughter of good family will not be tired.

original: kāyasukhaṃ bhaviṣyati / kāyalaghutāṃ ca bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya pratipanno
analyzed: kāya sukham bhaviṣyati kāya laghu tām ca bahu jana hitāya bahu jana sukhāya pratipannaḥ
translated: There will be bodily happiness, and for the benefit and happiness of many people,🔽he or she will have undertaken bodily lightness and bodily agility.

original: bhaviṣyati / sa ca kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā kāyalaghutāṃ kāyakarmaṇyatāṃ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati sa ca kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā kāya laghu tām kāya karmaṇya tām
translated: And that son or daughter of good family will have bodily lightness and bodily agility,

original: kāyasukhatāṃ cittalaghutāṃ cittakarmaṇyatāṃ cittasukhatāṃ ca jñāsyati / sukhena sa
analyzed: kāya sukha tām citta laghu tām citta karmaṇya tām citta sukha tām ca jñāsyati sukhena sa
translated: He will know bodily ease, lightness of mind, workability of mind, and mental ease. With ease he

original: rātrau śayyāṃ kalpayiṣyati / imāṃ eva prajñāpāramitām āśayena kalpayan na pāpakān svapnān drakṣyati /
analyzed: rātrau śayyām kalpayiṣyati imām eva prajñāpāramitām āśayena kalpayan na pāpakān svapnān drakṣyati
translated: will go to bed at night, arranging this very perfection of wisdom in his mind, and will not see any bad dreams.

original: drakṣyaṃś ca punaḥ svapnena tathāgatān evārhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān drakṣyati dvātriṃśanmahāpuruṣalakṣaṇacitritagātrān🔽suvarṇavarṇena samucchrayeṇa bhikṣusaṃghaparivṛtān bodhisattvagaṇaparivṛtān dharmaṃ
analyzed: drakṣyan ca punar svapnena tathāgatān eva arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān drakṣyati dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇa citrita gātrān  suvarṇa varṇena samucchrayeṇa bhikṣu saṃgha parivṛtān bodhisattva gaṇa parivṛtān dharmam
translated: And when he sees, he will see in his dream the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, whose bodies are adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: deśayamānāṃs /
analyzed: deśayamānān
translated: with a golden-colored body, surrounded by a community of monks, surrounded by an assembly of bodhisattvas, teaching the Dharma.🔽From them he will hear a discourse connected with the six perfections,

original: tebhyaḥ ṣaṭpāramitāpratisaṃyuktām eva kathāṃ śroṣyati / saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyadharmapratisaṃyuktāṃ🔽yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmapratisaṃyuktām eva kathāṃ śroṣyati / tāsāṃ ca pāramitānām
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ṣaṣ pāramitā pratisaṃyuktām eva kathām śroṣyati saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣya dharma pratisaṃyuktām  yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma pratisaṃyuktām eva kathām śroṣyati tāsām ca pāramitānām
translated: connected with the thirty-seven factors of awakening,🔽up to a discourse connected with the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha. He will hear the meaning of those perfections,

original: arthaṃ śroṣyati yāvad aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām arthaṃ śroṣyati / bodhivṛkṣaṃ drakṣyati /
analyzed: artham śroṣyati yāvat aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām artham śroṣyati bodhivṛkṣam drakṣyati
translated: up to the meaning of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha. He will see the Bodhi tree.

original: bodhisattvaṃ mahāsattvaṃ bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkramamāṇaṃ drakṣyati / anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: bodhisattvam mahāsattvam bodhimaṇḍam upasaṃkramamāṇam drakṣyati anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: He will see the Bodhisattva, the Great Being, approaching the seat of awakening. He will see him fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbudhyamānaṃ drakṣyati / abhisaṃbudhyādvayaṃ dharmacakrapravartayamānaṃ drakṣyati /
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyamānam drakṣyati abhisaṃbudhya advayam dharma cakra pravartayamānam drakṣyati
translated: He will see him, having fully awakened, turning the wheel of the Dharma.

original: bahūni bodhisattvakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi drakṣyati dharmasaṃgītiratāni evaṃ sarvajñatā
analyzed: bahūni bodhisattva koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi drakṣyati dharma saṃgīti ratāni evam sarvajña tā
translated: He will see many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas engaged in the Dharma assembly. In this way, all-knowledge

original: parigrahītavyā evaṃ sattvāḥ paripācayitavyā evaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ pariśodhayitavyam
analyzed: parigrahītavyāḥ evam sattvāḥ paripācayitavyāḥ evam buddhakṣetram pariśodhayitavyam
translated: should be taken up, in this way beings should be brought to maturity, in this way the buddha-field should be purified.

original: iti / bahunāṃ buddhakoṭīniyutaśataśahasrāṇāṃ pūrvasyāṃ diśi śabdaṃ śroṣyati /
analyzed: iti bahunām buddha koṭī niyuta śata śahasrāṇām pūrvasyām diśi śabdam śroṣyati
translated: In this way, in the eastern direction, he will hear the sound of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas.

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ paścimāyām uttarasyām ūrdhvam adho vidikṣu bahūnāṃ buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇasyām paścimāyām uttarasyām ūrdhvam adhas vidikṣu bahūnām buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇām
translated: In the same way, in the south, west, and north, above and below, in the intermediate directions, he will hear the sound of many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas.

original: śabdaṃ śroṣyati / amuṣmin lokadhātau amuko nāma tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iyadbhir
analyzed: śabdam śroṣyati amuṣmin lokadhātau amukaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ iyadbhiḥ
translated: In such and such a world system, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One named so-and-so, with such and such a retinue of monks,

original: bodhisattvakoṭīśatasahasrair iyadbhiḥ śrāvakakoṭīniyutaśatasahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto🔽dharmaṃ deśayati / pūrvasyāṃ diśi bahūni buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi drakṣyati parinirvāyamāṇāni
analyzed: bodhisattva koṭī śata sahasraiḥ iyadbhiḥ śrāvaka koṭī niyuta śata sahasraiḥ parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ  dharmam deśayati pūrvasyām diśi bahūni buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi drakṣyati parinirvāyamāṇāni
translated: surrounded and revered by this many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of bodhisattvas and hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of śrāvakas,🔽he will see many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas in the eastern direction passing into parinirvāṇa,

original: yāvad daśasu dikṣu bahūni buddhakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi drakṣyati parinirvāyamāṇāni /
analyzed: yāvat daśasu dikṣu bahūni buddha koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi drakṣyati parinirvāyamāṇāni
translated: and so on up to: in the ten directions he will see many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of buddhas passing into parinirvāṇa.

original: teṣāṃ ca tathāgatānāṃ stūpān dhātudharān nānāratnamayān bahūni stūpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: teṣām ca tathāgatānām stūpān dhātudharān nānā ratna mayān bahūni stūpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: And he will see many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of stūpas of those tathāgatas, made of various jewels, containing relics.

original: drakṣyati / tāṃś ca stūpān satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: drakṣyati tān ca stūpān satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: And he will honor those stūpas, revere, respect, and make offerings to them with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: sa khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imān evaṃrūpān bhadrakāṃś ca svapnān
analyzed: sa khalu punar kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imān evaṃrūpān bhadrakān ca svapnān
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family

original: drakṣyati / sa sukham eva svapsyati sukhaṃ ca pratibhotsyate ojaḥprakṣiptaṃ ca kāyaṃ
analyzed: drakṣyati sa sukham eva svapsyati sukham ca pratibhotsyate ojaḥ prakṣiptam ca kāyam
translated: will see such auspicious dreams. He will sleep happily and wake up happily, his body filled with energy,

original: saṃjñāsyati / laghuṃ ca kāyaṃ saṃjñāsyati na guruṃ / na cāsya balavatī gṛddhir āhāre
analyzed: saṃjñāsyati laghum ca kāyam saṃjñāsyati na gurum na ca asya balavatī gṛddhiḥ āhāre
translated: He will perceive his body to be light, not heavy. And he will not have a strong attachment to food.

original: bhaviṣyati / na cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāśanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāragṛddhir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati na cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana aśana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāra gṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will not have a strong attachment to robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicine for curing the sick, and personal belongings.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kauśika yogācārasya bhikṣoḥ samādher vyutthitasya manasikārasaṃtarpitena
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kauśika yoga ācārasya bhikṣoḥ samādheḥ vyutthitasya manasikāra saṃtarpitena
translated: Just as, Kauśika, for a monk who is a practitioner of yoga, when he has arisen from concentration, his mind is satisfied with mental attention,

original: cittena na balavaty āhāre gṛddhir bhavati /
analyzed: cittena na balavati āhāre gṛddhiḥ bhavati
translated: and he does not have a strong attachment to food.

original: evam eva kauśika tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā na balavaty āhāre gṛddhir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam eva kauśika tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā na balavati āhāre gṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family will not have a strong attachment to food.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi tasyāmanuṣyā ojaḥ kāya upasaṃharanti / ye cāpi /
analyzed: tathā hi tasya amanuṣyāḥ ojaḥ kāye upasaṃharanti ye ca api
translated: Because non-humans will infuse vigor into his body. And those

original: daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantas te 'pi sadevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragāḥ
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te pi sa deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragāḥ
translated: buddhas, the blessed ones, in the ten directions, together with the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: ojaḥ kāye prakṣipanti / imaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā dṛṣṭadhārmikaṃ
analyzed: ojaḥ kāye prakṣipanti imam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā dṛṣṭa dhārmikam
translated: will also infuse vigor into his body. That son of good family or daughter of good family, Kauśika, will have this🔽in this very life.

original: guṇaṃ parigṛhṇīte ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīte paryavāpnoti dhārayati vācayati
analyzed: guṇam parigṛhṇīte yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīte paryavāpnoti dhārayati vācayati
translated: Whoever takes up, studies, bears in mind, recites,

original: yoniśaś ca manasikaroti avirahitaś ca sarvajñatācittena / iti svaparārthādhimuktir adhimātrādhimātrā
analyzed: yoniśas ca manasikaroti avirahitaḥ ca sarvajña tā cittena iti sva para artha adhimuktiḥ adhimātra adhimātrā
translated: and properly pays attention to this perfection of wisdom, and is not separated from the mind of complete knowing, has taken up the most superior benefit for self and others.

original: kiṃ cāpi sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ nodgṛhṇīyān na dhārayen
analyzed: kim ca api sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām na udgṛhṇīyāt na dhārayen
translated: Moreover, if that son or daughter of good family does not take up this perfection of wisdom, does not bear it in mind,

original: na vācayen na paryavāpnuyān na yoniśaś ca manasikuryān na parebhyaś ca saṃprakāśayed
analyzed: na vācayet na paryavāpnuyāt na yoniśas ca manasikuryāt na parebhyaḥ ca saṃprakāśayet
translated: does not recite it, does not study it, does not properly pay attention to it, and does not teach it to others,

original: api tu khalu punaḥ pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: api tu khalu punar pustaka likhitām kṛtvā satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: but rather, having written it in a book, would honor, revere, respect, and make offerings to it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: yaś ca kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyād dhārayed
analyzed: yaḥ ca kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāt dhārayet
translated: Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, bears it in mind,

original: vācayet paryavāpnuyād yoniśaś ca manasikuryāt parebhyaś ca saṃprakāśayet tāṃ ca likhitāṃ
analyzed: vācayet paryavāpnuyāt yoniśas ca manasikuryāt parebhyaḥ ca saṃprakāśayet tām ca likhitām
translated: recites it, studies it, properly pays attention to it, and teaches it to others, and that written form,

original: satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ
analyzed: satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: would honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: ayaṃ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tato nidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /🔽na tv eva yaḥ samantād daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān
analyzed: ayam sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatas nidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavet  na tu eva yaḥ samantāt daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān
translated: that noble man or noble woman would generate even more merit than that, Kauśika.🔽But it is not like someone who would honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to with robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the ill, and monastic requisites

original: satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet saśrāvakasaṃghāṃś cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāśanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ
analyzed: satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet sa śrāvaka saṃghān cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana aśana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ
translated: the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their Śrāvaka Saṅghas, in all the world systems in the ten directions,

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ ca teṣāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām ca teṣām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: and after the parinirvāṇa of those Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their Śrāvaka Saṅghas,

original: saptaratnamayān stūpān kārayet /
analyzed: sapta ratna mayān stūpān kārayet
translated: would have stūpas made out of the seven precious substances,

original: tāṃś ca satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: tān ca satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: and would honor, venerate, respect, and make offerings to them with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: iti parārthādhimuktir mṛdumṛddhi stūpasatkāraparivarto nāma tṛtīyaḥ
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimuktiḥ mṛdumṛddhi stūpasatkāraparivartaḥ nāma tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Thus the third chapter is concluded, called Honoring Stūpas, from the Chapter on the Superior Aspiration for the Benefit of Others.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: yady ayaṃ kauśika jambudvīpaḥ paripūrṇaś cūḍikābaddhas tathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadi ayam kauśika jambudvīpaḥ paripūrṇaḥ cūḍikā baddhaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām bhavet
translated: Kauśika, if this Jambudvīpa were completely filled with the relics of the Tathāgata, bound in bundles,

original: tāni te kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā upanāmayed /
analyzed: tāni te kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā upanāmayet
translated: and some son or daughter of good family were to offer them,

original: yaś cemāṃ te prajñāpāramitām upanāmayet /
analyzed: yaḥ ca imām te prajñāpāramitām upanāmayet
translated: and if someone were to offer this perfection of wisdom,

original: tatas tvaṃ tayor dvayor bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ kaṃ parigṛhṇīyāḥ /
analyzed: tatas tvam tayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ kam parigṛhṇīyāḥ
translated: then, having placed those two in front of you, which would you take?

original: śakra āha / saced me bhagavann ayaṃ jambudvīpaḥ paripūrṇaś cūḍikābaddhas tathāgataśarīrāṇām upanāmyeta /🔽iyaṃ ca prajñāpāramitā pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā upanāmyeta parikalpam upādāya imām evāhaṃ tayor dvayor /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha saced me bhagavan ayam jambudvīpaḥ paripūrṇaḥ cūḍikā baddhaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām upanāmyeta  iyam ca prajñāpāramitā pustaka likhitām kṛtvā upanāmyeta parikalpam upādāya imām eva aham tayoḥ dvayoḥ
translated: Śakra said, Blessed One, if this Jambudvīpa were completely filled with the relics of the Tathāgata, bound in bundles,

original: bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyāṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and if this perfection of wisdom were to be offered in written form, considering the alternatives, I would take this perfection of wisdom from those two placed in front of me. Why is that?

original: na mama bhagavaṃs teṣu tathāgataśarīreṣv agauravaṃ /
analyzed: na mama bhagavan teṣu tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: Blessed One, it is not that I have no respect for those relics of the Tathāgata.

original: nāhaṃ bhagavaṃs tathāgataśarirāṇi na satkartukāmo na gurukartukāmo na mānayitukāmo
analyzed: na aham bhagavan tathāgata śarirāṇi na satkartu kāmaḥ na gurukartu kāmaḥ na mānayitu kāmaḥ
translated: Blessed One, I do not wish to honor, respect, and venerate the Tathāgata's relics.

original: na pūjayitukāmo / api tu khalu punar me bhagavann evaṃ syāt prajñāpāramitānirjātāni
analyzed: na pūjayitu kāmaḥ api tu khalu punar me bhagavan evam syāt prajñāpāramitā nirjātāni
translated: I do not, Blessed One, wish to honor, respect, revere, and worship the Tathāgata's bodily relics, but rather, Blessed One, I would think thus: The Tathāgata's bodily relics have arisen from the perfection of wisdom,

original: tathāgataśarirāṇi yena tāni satkriyante gurukriyante mānyante pūjyante /
analyzed: tathāgata śarirāṇi yena tāni satkriyante gurukriyante mānyante pūjyante
translated: by which they are honored, respected, revered, and worshipped.

original: prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitāni tathāgataśarīrāṇi yena tāni pūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi yena tāni pūjām labhante
translated: The Tathāgata's bodily relics are suffused with the perfection of wisdom, by which they obtain worship.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: prajñāpāramitā kauśika agrāhyā anidarśanā apratighā ekalakṣaṇā yad utālakṣaṇā / tat
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā kauśika agrāhyā anidarśanā apratighā eka lakṣaṇā yat uta alakṣaṇā tat
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom is ungraspable, undemonstrable, unobstructing, and has one mark, which is to say, no mark.

original: kathaṃ tvam agrāhyāṃ prajñāpāramitām anidarśanām apratighām ekalakṣaṇāṃ yad utālakṣaṇām
analyzed: katham tvam agrāhyām prajñāpāramitām a nidarśanām apratighām eka lakṣaṇām yat uta alakṣaṇām
translated: So how do you think the ungraspable perfection of wisdom, undemonstrable, unobstructing, and having one mark, which is to say, no mark,

original: udgrahītavyāṃ manyase /
analyzed: udgrahītavyām manyase
translated: should be grasped?

original: tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: na hi prajñāpāramitā grahāya anugrahāya vā sthitā /
analyzed: na hi prajñāpāramitā grahāya anugrahāya vā sthitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom does not stand for the sake of grasping or not grasping.

original: na hānāya na vṛddhaye notkṣepāya na vikṣepāya na saṃkleśāya na vyavadānāya /
analyzed: na hānāya na vṛddhaye na utkṣepāya na vikṣepāya na saṃkleśāya na vyavadānāya
translated: Not for the sake of loss or increase, not for the sake of taking away or scattering, not for the sake of affliction or purification.

original: na buddhadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā /
analyzed: na buddha dharmāṇām dāyikā
translated: It is not the giver of the qualities of the Buddhas.

original: na pṛthagjanadharmāṇāṃ cchorikā /
analyzed: na pṛthagjana dharmāṇām chorikā
translated: It is not the taker away of the qualities of ordinary beings.

original: na bodhisattvadharmāṇāṃ na pratyekabuddhadharmāṇāṃ na śrāvakadharmāṇāṃ na śaikṣadharmāṇāṃ nāśaikṣadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā /
analyzed: na bodhisattva dharmāṇām na pratyekabuddha dharmāṇām na śrāvaka dharmāṇām na śaikṣa dharmāṇām na aśaikṣa dharmāṇām dāyikā
translated: It is not the giver of the qualities of Bodhisattvas, Pratyekabuddhas, or Sravakas, nor of the qualities of those in training or those beyond training.

original: na saṃskṛtadhāto dāyikā /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta dhātaḥ dāyikā
translated: It is not the giver of the compounded realm.

original: nāsaṃskṛtadhāto dāyikā /
analyzed: na a saṃskṛta dhātaḥ dāyikā
translated: It is not the giver of the uncompounded realm.

original: nādhyātmaśūnyatāyā yāvan nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyā dātrī /
analyzed: na adhyātma śūnyatāyāḥ yāvat na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ dātrī
translated: It is not the giver of the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: na pāramitānāṃ na smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgāṇāṃ🔽nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnāṃ na balavaiśāradyapratisaṃvidāṃ nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ
analyzed: na pāramitānām na smṛti upasthāna samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgāṇām  na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām na bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidām na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām
translated: It is not the giver of the perfections, the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, or the path.

original: buddhadharmāṇāṃ dātrī /
analyzed: buddha dharmāṇām dātrī
translated: It is not the giver of the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinctive qualities of a Buddha.

original: na sarvajñatāyā dātrī /
analyzed: na sarvajña tāyāḥ dātrī
translated: It is not the giver of all-knowledge.

original: śakra āha / evam etad bhadanta śāriputra yathā vadasi na prajñāpāramitā buddhadharmāṇāṃ dātrī yāvan na sarvajñatāyā dātrī / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha evam etat bhadanta śāriputra yathā vadasi na prajñāpāramitā buddha dharmāṇām dātrī yāvat na sarvajña tāyāḥ dātrī tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Śakra said: It is just as you say, Venerable Śāriputra, that the perfection of wisdom does not give the Buddha-qualities, up to that the knowledge of all modes does not give them. And why?

original: na hi prajñāpāramitā dvayaṃ pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: na hi prajñāpāramitā dvayam pratyupasthitā
translated: For the perfection of wisdom does not stand in duality.

original: advayā hi prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: advayā hi prajñāpāramitā
translated: For the perfection of wisdom is nondual.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā /🔽dānapāramitā na dvayaṃ pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā  dāna pāramitā na dvayam pratyupasthitā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of energy, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of giving does not stand in duality.

original: advayā hi dānapāramitā /
analyzed: advayā hi dāna pāramitā
translated: For the perfection of giving is nondual.

original: atha khalu bhagavān śakrasya devānām indrasya sādhukāram adāt /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān śakrasya devānām indrasya sādhukāram adāt
translated: Then the Lord gave his approval to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: sādhu sādhu kauśika evam etad yathā nirdiśasi na prajñāpāramitā dvayaṃ pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu kauśika evam etat yathā nirdiśasi na prajñāpāramitā dvayam pratyupasthitā
translated: Good, good, Kauśika! It is just as you say, that the perfection of wisdom does not stand in duality.

original: advayā hi prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: advayā hi prajñāpāramitā
translated: For the perfection of wisdom is nondual.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of energy,

original: kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā /🔽dānapāramitā na dvayaṃ pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā  dāna pāramitā na dvayam pratyupasthitā
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,🔽the perfection of giving does not stand in duality.

original: advayā hi dānapāramitā /
analyzed: advayā hi dāna pāramitā
translated: For the perfection of giving is nondual.

original: dharmadhātoḥ sa kauśika dvayam icched yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā dvayam icchet / tat kasya hetos /🔽tathā hi kauśika dharmadhātuś ca prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: dharmadhātoḥ sa kauśika dvayam icchet yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ dvayam icchet tat kasya hetoḥ  tathā hi kauśika dharmadhātuḥ ca prajñāpāramitā
translated: Kauśika, he who wishes for a duality in the perfection of wisdom wishes for a duality in the dharma-constituent. And why?

original: cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Kauśika, it is because the dharma-constituent and the perfection of wisdom are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā ca vīryapāramitā ca kṣāntipāramitā ca śīlapāramitā ca /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā ca vīrya pāramitā ca kṣānti pāramitā ca śīla pāramitā ca
translated: Similarly, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: dharmadhātuś ca dānapāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: dharmadhātuḥ ca dāna pāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: and the dharma-constituent and the perfection of generosity are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: tathatāyāḥ sa kauśika dvayam icched yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā dvayam icchet /
analyzed: tathatāyāḥ sa kauśika dvayam icchet yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ dvayam icchet
translated: Kauśika, he who wishes for a duality in the perfection of wisdom wishes for a duality in thusness.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika tathatā ca prajñāpāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika tathatā ca prajñāpāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: Kauśika, it is because thusness and the perfection of wisdom are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā ca vīryapāramitā ca kṣāntipāramitā ca śīlapāramitā ca /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā ca vīrya pāramitā ca kṣānti pāramitā ca śīla pāramitā ca
translated: Similarly, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: tathatā ca dānapāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathatā ca dāna pāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: and thusness and the perfection of generosity are non-dual, they are not divided into two.

original: bhūtakoṭer acintyadhātoḥ sa kauśika dvayam icched yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyā dvayam icchet /
analyzed: bhūtakoṭeḥ acintya dhātoḥ sa kauśika dvayam icchet yaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ dvayam icchet
translated: Kauśika, he who wishes for a duality in the perfection of wisdom wishes for a duality in the limit of reality and the inconceivable element.

original: tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why?

original: tathā hi kauśika bhūtakoṭiś cācintyadhātuś ca prajñāpāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bhūtakoṭiḥ ca acintya dhātuḥ ca prajñāpāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: For thus, Kauśika, the reality-limit and the inconceivable element and the perfection of wisdom are not two, nor are they divided, nor do they differ.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā ca vīryapāramitā ca kṣāntipāramitā ca śīlapāramitā ca /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā ca vīrya pāramitā ca kṣānti pāramitā ca śīla pāramitā ca
translated: Thus, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: bhūtakoṭiś cācintyadhātuś ca dānapāramitā cādvayam etad advaidhīkāram /
analyzed: bhūtakoṭiḥ ca acintya dhātuḥ ca dāna pāramitā ca advayam etat a dvaidhīkāram
translated: the reality-limit and the inconceivable element and the perfection of generosity are not two, nor are they divided, nor do they differ.

original: śakra āha / namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena namaskṛtāṃ
analyzed: śakraḥ āha namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitām sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena namaskṛtām
translated: Śakra said: I pay homage to the perfection of wisdom, which is bowed to by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: yatra śikṣitvā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: yatra śikṣitvā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ nuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: having trained in which the bodhisattva mahāsattva fully awakens to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yadāhaṃ bhagavan sudharmāyāṃ devasabhāyāṃ tasmin devendrāsane niṣaṇṇo bhavāmi svake🔽āsane tatra ye devaputrā mamopasthānāyāgacchanti te māṃ tatra sthaṃ namasyanti / yadāhaṃ
analyzed: yadā aham bhagavan sudharmāyām deva sabhāyām tasmin deva indra āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ bhavāmi svake  āsane tatra ye deva putrāḥ mama upasthānāya āgacchanti te mām tatra stham namasyanti yadā aham
translated: When I, Blessed One, am seated in that divine throne of the lord of gods in the divine assembly hall of Sudharmā, in my own🔽seat, then those gods who come to attend on me bow to me there. When

original: tatra na bhavāmi svake siṃhāsane tadā te devaputrās tat mamāsanaṃ namaskṛtya punar eva prakrāmanti /
analyzed: tatra na bhavāmi svake siṃhāsane tadā te deva putrāḥ tat mama asanam namaskṛtya punar eva prakrāmanti
translated: I am not there in my own lion throne, then those gods bow to that seat of mine and depart again.

original: iha śakro devānām indro dharmāsane niṣaṇṇas trāyastriṃśānāṃ devānāṃ dharmaṃ deśayāmāseti /
analyzed: iha śakraḥ devānām indraḥ dharma āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ trāyastriṃśānām devānām dharmam deśayāmāsa iti
translated: Here, Śakra, lord of the gods, seated on the Dharma seat, teaches the Dharma to the gods of the Thirty-Three.

original: evam eva bhagavan yatreyaṃ prajñāpāramitā likhitvā sthāsyate svādhyāsyate vā parebhyo vā saṃprakāśayiṣyate /
analyzed: evam eva bhagavan yatra iyam prajñāpāramitā likhitvā sthāsyate su ādhyāsyate vā parebhyaḥ vā saṃprakāśayiṣyate
translated: In the same way, Blessed One, wherever this Perfection of Wisdom is written down, recited, or taught to others,

original: tatra ye te daśabhyo digbhyo devaputrā devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragās te tāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ namaskṛtya punar eva prakramiṣyanti /
analyzed: tatra ye te daśabhyaḥ digbhyaḥ deva putrāḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ te tām prajñāpāramitām namaskṛtya punar eva prakramiṣyanti
translated: there the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas from the ten directions will bow to that Perfection of Wisdom and then depart again.

original: ato nirjātās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are born from this.

original: ato nirjātaṃ ca sarvasattvānāṃ sukhopadhānaṃ /
analyzed: atas nirjātam ca sarva sattvānām sukha upadhānam
translated: And from this is born the provision of happiness for all beings.

original: yad api tathāgataśarīrāṇi tad api prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitatvāt pūjāṃ pratilabhante / prajñāpāramitā bhagavan bodhisattvacaryāṃ carataḥ sarvajñānasyāśrayabhūtā /
analyzed: yat api tathāgata śarīrāṇi tat api prajñāpāramitā paribhāvita tvāt pūjām pratilabhante prajñāpāramitā bhagavan bodhisattva caryām carataḥ sarvajñānasya āśraya bhūtā
translated: And even the relics of the Tathāgata, because they are imbued with the Perfection of Wisdom, receive worship. The Perfection of Wisdom, Blessed One, is the basis of all knowledge for the bodhisattva practicing the bodhisattva conduct.

original: kāraṇabhūtā āhārikā prajñāpāramiteti /
analyzed: kāraṇa bhūtā āhārikā prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: It is the cause, the provider, the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: tasmād ahaṃ bhagavaṃs tābhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ pratyaṃśābhyāṃ prajñāpāramitām eva parigṛhṇīyām /
analyzed: tasmāt aham bhagavan tābhyām dvābhyām pratyaṃśābhyām prajñāpāramitām eva parigṛhṇīyām
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, I would choose the perfection of wisdom from those two parts.

original: imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya svādhyāyaṃ kuryān dharmāntargatena mānasena yasmin samaye
analyzed: imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya svādhyāyam kuryāt dharma antargatena mānasena yasmin samaye
translated: Having taken up this perfection of wisdom, one should recite it, with a mind absorbed in the Dharma, at whatever time

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ manasikaromi /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām manasikaromi
translated: one is attending to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmin samaye bhagavan nimittam eva na samanupaśyāmi bhayasya vā stambhitatvasya vā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tasmin samaye bhagavat nimittam eva na samanupaśyāmi bhayasya vā stambhita tvasya vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: At that time, Blessed One, I do not see even a sign of fear or paralysis. What is the reason for that?

original: animittā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā aliṅgā anabhilapyā /
analyzed: animittā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā aliṅgā an abhilapyā
translated: For, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is signless, without distinguishing marks, inexpressible.

original: apravyāhārā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: a pravyāhārā hi bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is inexpressible.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā
translated: In the same way, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: animittā hi bhagavan dānapāramitā aliṅgā anabhilapyā apravyāhārā hi bhagavan dānapāramitā yāvat sarvajñatā /
analyzed: animittā hi bhagavan dāna pāramitā aliṅgā an abhilapyā a pravyāhārā hi bhagavan dāna pāramitā yāvat sarvajña tā
translated: the perfection of generosity, Blessed One, up to omniscience, is signless, without distinguishing marks, inexpressible, and inexpressible, Blessed One.

original: saced bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sanimittā saliṅgā sābhilapyā sapravyāhārābhaviṣyan
analyzed: saced bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sa nimittā sa liṅgā sa abhilapyā sa pravyāhārā abhaviṣyan
translated: If, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom were with signs, with distinguishing marks, expressible, and with verbal expression,

original: nānimittā nāliṅgā nānabhilapyā nāpravyāhārā naiva tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
analyzed: na a nimittāḥ na a liṅgāḥ na an abhilapyāḥ na a pravyāhārāḥ na eva tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One is not without signs, not without indications, not inexpressible, not without verbal expression.

original: sarvadharmān animittān aliṅgān anabhilapyān apravyāhārān iti viditvā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: sarva dharmān a nimittān a liṅgān an abhilapyān a pravyāhārān iti viditvā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Having known all dharmas to be without signs, without indications, inexpressible, and without verbal expression, he

original: abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām animittam aliṅgam anabhilapyam apravyāhāraṃ dharmam adeśayiṣyat /
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām animittam a liṅgam an abhilapyam a pravyāhāram dharmam adeśayiṣyat
translated: attained the highest complete enlightenment and taught the Dharma to beings as without signs, without indications, inexpressible, and without verbal expression.

original: yasmād bhagavann iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā animittā aliṅgā anabhilapyā apravyāhārā tasmāt
analyzed: yasmāt bhagavan iyam prajñāpāramitā animittā aliṅgā an abhilapyā a pravyāhārā tasmāt
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is without signs, without indications, inexpressible, and without verbal expression.

original: tathāgataḥ sarvadharmān animittān aliṅgān anabhilapyān apravyāhārān viditvā anuttarāṃ
analyzed: tathāgataḥ sarva dharmān animittān a liṅgān an abhilapyān a pravyāhārān viditvā anuttarām
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata, having known all dharmas to be without signs, without indications, inexpressible, and without verbal expression,

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām animittam aliṅgam anabhilapyam apravyāhāraṃ dharmaṃ deśayet /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhya sattvānām animittam a liṅgam an abhilapyam a pravyāhāram dharmam deśayet
translated: attained the highest complete enlightenment and taught the Dharma to beings as without signs, without indications, inexpressible, and without verbal expression.

original: iti parārthādhimuktir mṛdumadhyā
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimuktiḥ mṛdu madhyā
translated: Thus, the superior devotion is of weak and medium strength.

original: tasmād bhagavann iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā sadevamānuṣāsureṇa lokena satkartavyā gurukartavyā
analyzed: tasmāt bhagavan iyam prajñāpāramitā sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa lokena satkartavyā gurukartavyā
translated: Therefore, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom should be honored, revered, and worshipped with flowers, incense,🔽perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, cloth, parasols, flags, and banners by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras.

original: mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacivaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa civara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: should be honored, worshipped, and offered flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: na cāsya narakatiryagyoniyamalokagatiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā /
analyzed: na ca asya naraka tiryagyoni yama loka gatiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā
translated: And one should not expect to go to the realms of hell-beings, animals, or hungry ghosts,

original: na śrāvakabhūmir na pratyekabuddhabhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: na śrāvaka bhūmiḥ na pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: nor should one expect the stage of a śrāvaka or the stage of a pratyekabuddha, until one fully awakens to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: abhisaṃbuddho bhaviṣyati / avirahitaś ca bhaviṣyati tathāgatadarśanena sattvaparipākena
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati avirahitaḥ ca bhaviṣyati tathāgata darśanena sattva paripākena
translated: And one will not be separated from seeing the Tathāgatas, from ripening beings,

original: yad uta buddhakṣetram upasaṃkrāmati /
analyzed: yat uta buddhakṣetram upasaṃkrāmati
translated: namely, from going to the Buddha-fields.

original: tāṃś ca tathāgatān satkartuṃ gurukartuṃ mānayituṃ pūjayituṃ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ / iti parārthādhimuktimṛdvadhimātrā
analyzed: tān ca tathāgatān satkartum gurukartum mānayitum pūjayitum puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ iti parārtha adhimukti mṛdu adhimātrā
translated: And from honoring those Tathāgatas, venerating them, respecting them, making offerings to them with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags. This is the weak-strong [type of] faith for the sake of others.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan yady ayaṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasro lokadhātus tathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇaś cūḍikābaddho 'pi me upanāmyeta /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan yadi ayam tri sāhasra mahā sāhasraḥ lokadhātuḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇaḥ cūḍikā baddhaḥ pi me upanāmyeta
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, if this great trichiliocosm were filled with the relics of the Tathāgata, bound into balls,

original: imāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakalikhitaṃ kṛtvā upanāmyeta /
analyzed: imām ca prajñāpāramitām pustaka likhitam kṛtvā upanāmyeta
translated: And having written out this perfection of wisdom in book-form, he would give it to the other.

original: aham anayor dvayor bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayor imām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ parigṛhṇīyāṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: aham anayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām parigṛhṇīyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: If I were offered a choice between these two alternatives, I would choose this perfection of wisdom. And why?

original: ato nirjātāni hi tathāgataśarīrāṇi / tena satkriyante gurukriyante mānayante pūjyante
analyzed: atas nirjātāni hi tathāgata śarīrāṇi tena satkriyante gurukriyante mānayante pūjyante
translated: For from it have come forth the relics of the Tathagata, and they are worshipped, revered, honored, and adored.

original: yena te kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca tāni satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā na
analyzed: yena te kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca tāni satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā na
translated: Those sons and daughters of good family who have worshipped, revered, honored, and adored them,

original: durgativinipāteṣūpapadyante /
analyzed: durgati vinipāteṣu upapadyante
translated: are not reborn in the unfortunate states of woe.

original: devamanuṣyasaṃpattīr anubhūya yathāpraṇidhānena nirvāsyanti śrāvakayānena vā pratyekabuddhayānena vā mahāyānena /
analyzed: deva manuṣya saṃpattīḥ anubhūya yathā praṇidhānena nirvāsyanti śrāvaka yānena vā pratyekabuddha yānena vā mahā yānena
translated: Having experienced the prosperity of gods and men, they will pass away according to their vow, either by the vehicle of the Disciples, or by the vehicle of the Pratyekabuddhas,🔽or by the great vehicle.

original: vā / api tu khalu punar bhagavan yac ca tathāgatadarśanaṃ yac ca prajñāpāramitādarśanaṃ tulyam etat /
analyzed: vā api tu khalu punar bhagavan yat ca tathāgata darśanam yat ca prajñāpāramitā darśanam tulyam etat
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, seeing the Tathagata and seeing the perfection of wisdom are the same.

original: tathā hi bhagavan yā prajñāpāramitā yaś ca tathāgato 'dvayam etad advaidhīkāram / iti parārthādhimuktir madhyamṛddhī
analyzed: tathā hi bhagavan yā prajñāpāramitā yaḥ ca tathāgataḥ dvayam etat a dvaidhīkāram iti para artha adhimuktiḥ madhyam ṛddhī
translated: For, Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom and the Tathagata are non-dual, not divided into two. Thus is the middling-weak devotion to the benefit of others.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan yaś ca tathāgato 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddhas tribhiḥ prātihāryair dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan yaḥ ca tathāgataḥ rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tribhiḥ prātihāryaiḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One teaches the Dharma with the three kinds of miracles,

original: yad uta dvādaśāṅgaṃ sūtraṃ geyaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ yāvad avadānopadeśā /
analyzed: yat uta dvādaśa aṅgam sūtram geyam vyākaraṇam yāvat avadāna upadeśā
translated: namely the twelve branches of the sūtras, the songs, the expositions, up to the accounts and instructions.

original: yaś ca sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya paryavāpya parebhyaś ca vistareṇa deśayeta tulyam etat / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhya paryavāpya parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa deśayeta tulyam etat tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And if that son or daughter of good family, having taken up this perfection of wisdom, having mastered it, were to teach it in detail to others, it would be the same. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātāni hi bhagavaṃs trīṇi prātihāryāṇi /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni hi bhagavan trīṇi prātihāryāṇi
translated: For, Blessed One, the three kinds of miracles arise from it.

original: tato nirjātaṃ sūtraṃ geyaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ yāvad avadānopadeśāḥ /
analyzed: tatas nirjātam sūtram geyam vyākaraṇam yāvat avadāna upadeśāḥ
translated: The sūtras, songs, expositions, up to the accounts and instructions arise from it.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan ye pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopamā buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ deśayanti yad uta sūtraṃ geyaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ yāvad avadānopadeśāḥ
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan ye pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmam deśayanti yat uta sūtram geyam vyākaraṇam yāvat avadāna upadeśāḥ
translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, as many as there are in the east, in worlds as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, who teach the Dharma, namely the sūtras, songs, expositions, up to the accounts and instructions,

original: tribhiḥ prātihāryair /
analyzed: tribhiḥ prātihāryaiḥ
translated: with the three kinds of miracles,

original: evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi paścimāyām uttarasyām ūrdhvam adho yāvad vidikṣu gaṅgānadīvālkopameṣu
analyzed: evam dakṣiṇasyām diśi paścimāyām uttarasyām ūrdhvam adhas yāvat vidikṣu gaṅgā nadī vā alka upameṣu
translated: in the same way in the south, west, north, above, below, up to the intermediate directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: lokadhātuṣu buddhā bhagavanto dharmaṃ deśayanti tribhiḥ prātihāryair yad uta sūtraṃ
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ dharmam deśayanti tribhiḥ prātihāryaiḥ yat uta sūtram
translated: In the world systems, the Blessed Buddhas teach the Dharma with the three kinds of miracles, namely the miracle of supernatural power, the miracle of mind-reading, and the miracle of instruction.

original: geyaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ yāvad avadānopadeśāḥ /
analyzed: geyam vyākaraṇam yāvat avadāna upadeśāḥ
translated: And the sutras, geyas, vyakarana, up to avadanas and upadehas come forth from that.

original: yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāt yāvat parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet tulyam etat / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāt yāvat parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet tulyam etat tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And, Blessed One, the son or daughter of good family who would take up this perfection of wisdom, up to would expound it in detail to others, that is the same. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātāni hi bhagavaṃs trīṇi prātihāryāṇi / tato nirjātaṃ sūtraṃ geyaṃ vyākaraṇaṃ yāvad avadānopādeśāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni hi bhagavan trīṇi prātihāryāṇi tatas nirjātam sūtram geyam vyākaraṇam yāvat avadāna upādeśāḥ
translated: For, Blessed One, the three kinds of miracles come forth from that, and from that come the sutras, geyas, vyakarana, up to avadanas and upadehas.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan yaś caikaikasyāṃ diśi yāvanto daśasu dikṣu sarvalokadhātuṣu
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan yaḥ ca ekaikasyām diśi yāvantaḥ daśasu dikṣu sarva lokadhātuṣu
translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, one who would honor, revere, respect, and worship as much as the atoms in all the world systems in the ten directions

original: gaṅgānadīvālukopamās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās tān satkuryād gurukuryāt
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tān satkuryāt gurukuryāt
translated: the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones equal to the sands of the Ganges River in each direction,

original: mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhir /
analyzed: mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: yaś cemāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā satkuryād gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhis
analyzed: yaḥ ca imām prajñāpāramitām pustaka likhitām kṛtvā satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: And if someone were to copy this perfection of wisdom, and to honor, revere, adore, and worship it with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: tulyam etat / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tulyam etat tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: this is equal. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātā hi tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ hi tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: Because the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are born from this.

original: iti parārthādhimukti madhyamadhyā
analyzed: iti
translated: Thus is the medium-medium faith in the benefit for others.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family who will take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it, and be devoted to it in the right way,

original: parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati /
analyzed: parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati
translated: and will also teach it extensively to others,

original: tasya na nirayatiryagyoniyamalokagatiḥ / pratikāṅkṣitavyā na śrāvakabhūmir na pratyekabuddhabhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā /
analyzed: tasya na niraya tiryagyoni yama loka gatiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā na śrāvaka bhūmiḥ na pratyekabuddha bhūmiḥ pratikāṅkṣitavyā
translated: for him or her, the states of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts are not to be expected, and the states of a Disciple or a Solitary Buddha are not to be expected.

original: tathā hi sa bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ sthito 'vinivartanīyāyāṃ bhūmau / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tathā hi sa bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ sthitaḥ vinivartanīyāyām bhūmau tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because, Blessed One, that Bodhisattva, that great being, is established in the irreversible stage. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā udgṛhṇāti dhārayati🔽vācayati paryavāpnoti yoniśaś ca manasikaroti tāṃ ca likhitāṃ satkaroti gurukaroti
analyzed: tathā hi sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā udgṛhṇāti dhārayati  vācayati paryavāpnoti yoniśas ca manasikaroti tām ca likhitām satkaroti gurukaroti
translated: For that son of a good family or daughter of a good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom, would take it up, bear it in mind,

original: mānayati pūjayati puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhis /
analyzed: mānayati pūjayati puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: recite it, master it, and wisely attend to it, and would honor, revere, respect, and worship that written [copy], with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: tasya na kutaścid bhayaṃ pratikāṅkṣitavyaṃ / tadyathāpi nāma bhagavan dhanikabhayabhītaḥ puruṣo rājānam upatiṣṭhet /
analyzed: tasya na kutaścid bhayam pratikāṅkṣitavyam tat yathā api nāma bhagavan dhanika bhaya bhītaḥ puruṣaḥ rājānam upatiṣṭhet
translated: One should not expect any danger to come from anywhere for him. It is just as, Blessed One, a man frightened by a creditor would attend on a king.

original: sa rājānaṃ sevamāno yebhya evāsya bhayaṃ bhavati tair eva sevyate na ca tebhyo bibheti / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: sa rājānam sevamānaḥ yebhyaḥ eva asya bhayam bhavati taiḥ eva sevyate na ca tebhyaḥ bibheti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Serving that king, he is served by those very ones from whom he was afraid, and he is not afraid of them. Why is that?

original: evam etat bhagavan balavati niśraye bhayaṃ na bhavati / evam eva bhagavan prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitāni
analyzed: evam etat bhagavan balavati niśraye bhayam na bhavati evam eva bhagavan prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitāni
translated: Blessed One, it is just so, when one has a powerful support, one is not afraid. Just so, Blessed One, the Tathāgata's bodily remains, consecrated by the perfection of wisdom,

original: tathāgataśarīrāṇi pūjāṃ labhante / tatra bhagavan yathā sa rājā evaṃ prajñāpāramitā draṣṭavyā /
analyzed: tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante tatra bhagavan yathā sa rājā evam prajñāpāramitā draṣṭavyā
translated: receive worship. There, Blessed One, the king should be seen as the perfection of wisdom.🔽Blessed One, it is just so, when one has a powerful support, one is not afraid. Just so, Blessed One, the Tathāgata's bodily remains, consecrated by the perfection of wisdom,

original: yathā sa rājaniḥśritaḥ puruṣaḥ pūjāṃ labhate / evam eva tathāgataśarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitāni
analyzed: yathā sa rāja niḥśritaḥ puruṣaḥ pūjām labhate evam eva tathāgata śarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitāni
translated: Just as a person who depends on a king obtains worship, in the same way, Blessed One, the relics of the Tathāgata, which are perfumed by the perfection of wisdom,

original: pūjāṃ labhante / yad api bhagavaṃs tat sarvajñajñānaṃ tad api prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitaṃ veditavyaṃ /
analyzed: pūjām labhante yat api bhagavan tat sarvajña jñānam tat api prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitam veditavyam
translated: obtain worship. And, Blessed One, that knowledge of all knowledge should be known as perfumed by the perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāt tayor dvayor bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ pratyaṃśam imām evāhaṃ prajñārapāmitāṃ parigṛhṇīyāṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tasmāt tayoḥ dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ pratyaṃśam imām eva aham prajñā rapā mitām parigṛhṇīyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Therefore, if those two parts were set out, I would choose just this perfection of wisdom as my portion. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātāni hi tathāgataśarīrāṇi /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni hi tathāgata śarīrāṇi
translated: Because the relics of the Tathāgata arise from it.

original: ato nirjātāni dvātriṃśad mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇāny /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni dvātriṃśat mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇāni
translated: The thirty-two marks of a great person arise from it.

original: ato nirjātāni daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: The ten powers of a Tathāgata, the four confidences, the four unhindered knowledges, the eighteen special qualities of a Buddha arise from it.

original: ato nirjātā mahāmaitrī mahākaruṇā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā mahā maitrī mahā karuṇā
translated: Great love and great compassion arise from it.

original: ato nirjātāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante /
analyzed: atas nirjātāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante
translated: The five perfections arise from it, and obtain the name of perfections.

original: ato nirjātā tathāgatasya sarvajñatā /
analyzed: atas nirjātā tathāgatasya sarvajña tā
translated: The omniscience of the Tathāgata arises from it.

original: yatra bhagavaṃs trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sattvā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti🔽dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyanti tatra teṣāṃ
analyzed: yatra bhagavan tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyanti  dhārayiṣyanti vācayiṣyanti paryavāpsyanti yoniśas ca manasikariṣyanti tatra teṣām
translated: Bhagavān, in the world system of a billion worlds, those beings who will take up this perfection of wisdom,

original: sattvānāṃ manuṣyā vā amanuṣyā vā avatāraprekṣiṇo 'vatāragaveṣiṇo 'vatāraṃ na lapsyante /
analyzed: sattvānām manuṣyāḥ vā amanuṣyāḥ vā avatāra prekṣiṇaḥ vatāra gaveṣiṇaḥ vatāram na lapsyante
translated: who will bear it in mind, recite it, study it, and attend to it properly, there those beings, whether human or non-human, who seek an opportunity and look for an opportunity, will not find an opportunity.

original: sarve ca te sattvā anupūrveṇa parinirvāṇadharmāṇo bhaviṣyanti / evaṃ maharddhikā bhagavann
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ anupūrveṇa parinirvāṇa dharmāṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti evam maharddhikāḥ bhagavan
translated: And all those beings will eventually have the nature of parinirvāṇa. Thus, Bhagavān, this perfection of wisdom is of great benefit.

original: iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā / yatra hi nāma bhagavann iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā trisāhasramahāsāhasre
analyzed: iyam prajñāpāramitā yatra hi nāma bhagavan iyam prajñāpāramitā tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre
translated: Bhagavān, in this perfection of wisdom, in the world system of a billion worlds,

original: lokadhātau ye sattvās teṣāṃ buddhakṛtyena pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: lokadhātau ye sattvāḥ teṣām buddha kṛtyena pratyupasthitā
translated: those beings for whom the activity of the Buddha is present,

original: buddhotpādo /
analyzed: buddha utpādaḥ
translated: the arising of the Buddha,

original: bhagavaṃs tatra lokadhātau pratikāṅkṣitavyo yatra lokadhātau iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: bhagavan tatra lokadhātau pratikāṅkṣitavyaḥ yatra lokadhātau iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Bhagavān, in that world system where this perfection of wisdom

original: pracariṣyati / tadyathāpi nāma bhagavann anarghaṃ yat maṇiratnaiḥ bhavet tat khalu
analyzed: pracariṣyati tat yathā api nāma bhagavan anargham yat maṇi ratnaiḥ bhavet tat khalu
translated: will be practiced, should be expected. Just as, Bhagavān, that which is priceless would be with priceless jewels, that indeed

original: punar mahāmaṇiratnam ebhir eva guṇaiḥ samanvāgataṃ bhavet / yatrayatra tan mahāmaṇiratnaṃ
analyzed: punar mahā maṇi ratnam ebhiḥ eva guṇaiḥ samanvāgatam bhavet yatra yatra tat mahā maṇi ratnam
translated: Moreover, that great jewel would be endowed with these very qualities. Wherever that great jewel would be placed,

original: sthāpyeta tatratatrāmanuṣyā avatāraṃ na labhante / yatrayatra cāmanuṣyagṛhītaḥ strī
analyzed: sthāpyeta tatra tatra amanuṣyāḥ avatāram na labhante yatra yatra ca amanuṣya gṛhītaḥ strī

original: vā puruṣo vā bhavet tatratatra tan mahāmaṇiratnaṃ praveṣyeta praveśitamātra eva tasmin🔽mahāmaṇiratne so 'manuṣyaḥ prakrāmet tasya mahāmaṇiratnasya tejo 'sahamānaḥ / pittena

analyzed: vā dahyamāne śarīre tat mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta tat api pittam nigṛhṇīyāt na vivardheta upaśāmyeta  vāta abhibhūte vā śarīre tat mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta tam api vātam nigṛhṇīyāt śleṣmaṇā
translated: that demon would depart, unable to bear the radiance of that great jewel. If the body is burning with bile, that great jewel would be placed there, and it would suppress that bile, it would not increase, it would subside.🔽If the body is afflicted by wind, that great jewel would be placed there, and it would suppress that wind. If the body is obstructed by phlegm,

analyzed: sa vyādhiḥ upaśāmyeta tat ca mahā maṇi ratnam rātra avabhāsam kuryāt uṣṇa kāle ca vartamāne
translated: that disease would also be pacified. And that great jewel-gem would give off light at night. When it is hot

analyzed: yatra pṛthivī pradeśe tat mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ śiśiraḥ parivarteta
translated: in the season, wherever that great jewel-gem is placed on the ground, that place on the ground would become cool.

original: śiśirakāle 'pi vartamāne yatra pṛthivīpradeśe tan mahāmaṇiratnaṃ sthāpyeta sa pṛthivīpradeśo
analyzed: śiśira kāle vartamāne yatra pṛthivī pradeśe tat mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta sa pṛthivī pradeśaḥ
translated: Even when it is cold in the season, wherever that great jewel-gem is placed on the ground, that place on the ground

original: gharmaḥ parivarteta / yatra ca tan mahāmaṇiratnaṃ sthāpyeta sa ca pṛthivīpradeśo nātyuṣṇo

original: nātiśītaḥ syāt ṛtusukho /
analyzed: na ati śītaḥ syāt
translated: or too cold, but would be pleasantly warm.

original: yatra pṛthivīpradeśe tan mahāmaṇiratṇaṃ tiṣṭhati tatra pṛthivīpradeśe nāśīviṣā upavicaranti vṛścikādīni vā sarīsṛpāṇi vā /

analyzed: upadarśyeta tasya saha darśanena eva tat viṣam vigacchet ebhiḥ evam ādibhiḥ guṇaiḥ

original: yuktaṃ tat mahāmaṇiratnaṃ bhaved /

analyzed: kaluṣe tat mahā maṇi ratnam sthāpyeta tat sarvam udakam prasādayet ebhiḥ evam ādibhiḥ

translated: the qualities of the knowledge of all modes, the qualities of the knowledge of paths, the qualities of the knowledge of all aspects, the qualities of the reality realm, the qualities of the Dharma element, the qualities of the establishment of the Dharma, the qualities of thusness, the qualities of the ultimate reality, the qualities of the inconceivable realm

analyzed: guṇāḥ yena parinirvṛtasya api tathāgatasya śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante sarvajña jñānasya
translated: The qualities by which the relics of a Tathāgata who has attained parinirvāṇa receive worship. Of the knowledge of all modes,

analyzed: sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśa prahāṇasya sadā upekṣā vihāri tāyāḥ asaṃpramuṣita dharma tāyāḥ eṣām
translated: of the abandonment of all afflictive emotions along with their traces and underlying tendencies, of the constant abiding in equanimity, of the undeluded nature of dharmas, these

analyzed: tathāgata śarirāṇi bhājana bhūtāni abhūvan tena etāni tathāgata śarīrāṇi pūjām labhante
translated: relics of the Tathāgata became the vessels. Therefore, these relics of the Tathāgata receive worship.

original: iti parārthādhimuktimadhyādhimātrā
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimukti madhya adhimātrā
translated: Thus, the medium and great [stages] of devotion to the welfare of others.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
