translated: Furthermore, Blessed One, let there be a great trichiliocosm filled with the relics of the Tathagata, bound in a topknot.

original: saced bhagavan gaṅgānadīvālukopamā lokadhātavas tathāgataśarīrāṇāṃ paripūrṇāś cūḍikābaddhā bhaveyur /
analyzed: saced bhagavan gaṅgā nadī vālukā upamāḥ lokadhātavaḥ tathāgata śarīrāṇām paripūrṇāḥ cūḍikā baddhāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, the world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges were filled with the relics of the Tathagata, bound in a topknot,

original: iyaṃ ca prajñāpāramitā pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā upanāmyeta /
analyzed: iyam ca prajñāpāramitā pustaka likhitām kṛtvā upanāmyeta
translated: and if this perfection of wisdom were offered,

original: tayor ahaṃ bhagavan dvayor bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayor imām eva prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyāṃ / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tayoḥ aham bhagavan dvayoḥ bhāgayoḥ sthāpitayoḥ imām eva prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: I would choose this perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, from among those two things that have been set out. Why is that?

original: ato nirjātāni hi tathāgataśarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitāparibhāvitāni pūjāṃ labhante /
analyzed: atas nirjātāni hi tathāgata śarīrāṇi prajñāpāramitā paribhāvitāni pūjām labhante
translated: Because the relics of the Tathagata, which have arisen from this, which are suffused with the perfection of wisdom, receive worship.

original: yaḥ punar bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgataśarīrāṇi satkuryād gurukuryāt
analyzed: yaḥ punar bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgata śarīrāṇi satkuryāt gurukuryāt
translated: And, Blessed One, if a son of a good family or daughter of a good family were to honor, venerate,

original: mānayet pūjayet sa tasya kuśalamūlasya parittīkṛtāni divyāni mānuṣyakāṇi ca sukhāni
analyzed: mānayet pūjayet sa tasya kuśala mūlasya parittīkṛtāni divyāni mānuṣyakāṇi ca sukhāni
translated: and worship the relics of the Tathagata, they would experience the divine and human happiness that results from that wholesome action,

original: pratyanubhūya kṣatriyamahāśālakuleṣu vā brāhmaṇamahāśālakuleṣu vā gṛhapatimahāśālakuleṣu
analyzed: pratyanubhūya kṣatriya mahāśāla kuleṣu vā brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kuleṣu vā gṛhapati mahāśāla kuleṣu
translated: having experienced happiness in the families of great kṣatriyas, or in the families of great brahmins, or in the families of great householders,

original: vā cāturmahārājakāyikeṣu vā trāyastriṃśeṣu yāmeṣu tuṣiteṣu nirmāṇaratiṣu paranirmitavaśavartiṣu
analyzed: vā cāturmahārājakāyikeṣu vā trāyastriṃśeṣu yāmeṣu tuṣiteṣu nirmāṇaratiṣu paranirmitavaśavartiṣu
translated: or among the gods of the Four Great Kings, or the Thirty-Three, or the Yāma gods, or the Tuṣita gods, or the Nirmāṇarati gods, or the Paranirmitavaśavartin gods,

original: deveṣu sukhaṃ pratyanubhūya tena kuśalamūlena duḥkhasyāntaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: deveṣu sukham pratyanubhūya tena kuśala mūlena duḥkhasya antam kariṣyati
translated: having experienced happiness there, by that wholesome root he will make an end to suffering.

original: tasya khalu punaḥ kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇato dhārayato vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvato yoniśaś ca manasikurvato 🔽dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: tasya khalu punar kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇataḥ dhārayataḥ vācayataḥ paryavāpnuvataḥ yoniśas ca manasikurvataḥ  dhyāna pāramitā
translated: Moreover, for that son or daughter of good family who takes up this perfection of wisdom, who bears it in mind, recites it, masters it, and attends to it in the correct manner,

original: paripūryate dhyānapāramitā paripūrṇā vīryapāramitā paripūryate vīryapāramitā paripūrṇā
analyzed: paripūryate dhyāna pāramitā paripūrṇā vīrya pāramitā paripūryate vīrya pāramitā paripūrṇā
translated: the perfection of meditation is fulfilled. The perfection of meditation being fulfilled, the perfection of perseverance is fulfilled. The perfection of perseverance being fulfilled,

original: kṣāntipāramitā paripūryate kṣāntipāramitā paripurṇā śīlaparamitā paripūryate śīlapāramitā
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā paripūryate kṣānti pāramitā paripurṇā śīla paramitā paripūryate śīla pāramitā
translated: the perfection of patience is fulfilled. The perfection of patience being fulfilled, the perfection of morality is fulfilled. The perfection of morality

original: paripūrṇā dānapāramitā paripūryate dānapāramitā paripūrṇā / evaṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā
analyzed: paripūrṇā dāna pāramitā paripūryate dāna pāramitā paripūrṇā evam saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyā
translated: being fulfilled, the perfection of giving is fulfilled. The perfection of giving being fulfilled, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are fulfilled.

original: dharmā yāvad aṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ paripūryante /
analyzed: dharmāḥ yāvat aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ paripūryante
translated: up to the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are fulfilled.

original: so 'tikramya śrāvakapratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ bodhisattvaniyāmam avakramya bodhisattvābhijñāḥ pratilabhya buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyati /
analyzed: saḥ u tikramya śrāvaka pratyekabuddha bhūmim bodhisattva niyāmam avakramya bodhisattva abhijñāḥ pratilabhya buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyati
translated: Having surpassed the stages of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, having entered the stage of the bodhisattvas, having attained the superknowledges of the bodhisattvas, he will travel from buddha-field to buddha-field.

original: samacintyātmabhāvān pratigṛhīṣyati /
analyzed: sama cintya ātma bhāvān pratigṛhīṣyati
translated: He will take up bodies that are inconceivable,

original: yair ātmabhāvaiḥ sattvān paripācayiṣyati / yadi vā cakravartyātmabhāvaṃ paigṛhya kṣatriya
analyzed: yaiḥ ātmabhāvaiḥ sattvān paripācayiṣyati yadi vā cakravartī ātmabhāvam kṣatriya
translated: by which he will bring beings to maturity. Whether he takes up the body of a universal monarch, having taken up the body of a kṣatriya

original: mahāśālakulātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhya brāhmaṇa mahāśālakulātmabhāvaṃ parigṛhya gṛhapatimahāśālakulātmabhāvaṃ
analyzed: mahāśāla kula ātmabhāvam parigṛhya brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kula ātmabhāvam parigṛhya gṛhapati mahāśāla kula ātmabhāvam
translated: great clan, having taken up the body of a brāhmaṇa great clan, having taken up the body of a householder great clan,

original: parigṛhya sattvān paripācayiṣyati / tasmād bhagavan na me tathāgataśarīreṣv agauravam
analyzed: parigṛhya sattvān paripācayiṣyati tasmāt bhagavat na me tathāgata śarīreṣu a gauravam
translated: having taken up the body of a great clan, he will bring beings to maturity. Therefore, Blessed One, I do not lack respect for the Tathāgata's relics.

original: eva me bhagavan nāpi na grahītukāmaḥ / api tu khalu punaḥ prajñāpāramitayā satkṛtayā
analyzed: eva me bhagavat na api na grahītu kāmaḥ api tu khalu punar prajñāpāramitayā satkṛtayā
translated: Blessed One, I do not wish to take them, but rather the perfection of wisdom,🔽having been honored, revered, respected, and worshipped, the Tathāgata's relics also become honored, revered,

original: gurukṛtayā mānitayā pūjitayā tathāgataśarīrāṇy api satkṛtāni bhavanti gurukṛtāni
analyzed: gurukṛtayā mānitayā pūjitayā tathāgata śarīrāṇi api satkṛtāni bhavanti gurukṛtāni
translated: respected, and worshipped.

original: mānitāni pūjitāni bhavanti /
analyzed: mānitāni pūjitāni bhavanti
translated: They are honored and worshipped.

original: punar aparaṃ bhagavan ye daśasu dikṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā asaṃkhyeyeṣv
analyzed: punar aparam bhagavan ye daśasu dikṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ asaṃkhyeyeṣu
translated: Moreover, Blessed One, those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the ten directions, in the innumerable

original: aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti / tāṃś ca
analyzed: aprameyeṣu lokadhātuṣu tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti tān ca
translated: and immeasurable world systems, who abide, bear, and maintain themselves, and teach the Dharma,

original: dharmakāyena ca rūpakāyena ca draṣṭukāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyodgrahītavyā
analyzed: dharma kāyena ca rūpa kāyena ca draṣṭu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā śrotavyā udgrahītavyā
translated: and those who wish to see them with the Dharma body and the form body, by them this very perfection of wisdom should be listened to, taken up,

original: dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā parebhyaś ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitavyā yoniśaś
analyzed: dhārayitavyā vācayitavyā paryavāptavyā parebhyaḥ ca vistareṇa saṃprakāśayitavyā yoniśas
translated: borne in mind, recited, mastered, and taught in detail to others, and it should be properly reflected upon.

original: ca manasikartavyā / sacet kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tān daśasu dikṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ
analyzed: ca manasi kartavyā saced kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tān daśasu dikṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ
translated: If a son of good family or a daughter of good family wishes to see those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones in the ten directions,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhān icched draṣṭuṃ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhān icchet draṣṭum
translated: they should see them by this very perfection of wisdom.

original: tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā buddhānusmṛtir bhāvayitavyā /
analyzed: tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām caratā buddha anusmṛtiḥ bhāvayitavyā
translated: By that son of good family or daughter of good family, practicing the perfection of wisdom, the recollection of the Buddha should be cultivated.

original: dharmatayā dve ime bhagavatāṃ dharmate / katame dve /
analyzed: dharmatayā dve ime bhagavatām dharmate katame dve
translated: There are these two natures of the Blessed Ones. Which two?

original: yad uta saṃskṛtadharmatā cāsaṃskṛtadharmatā ca /
analyzed: yat uta saṃskṛta dharma tā ca asaṃskṛta dharma tā ca
translated: Namely, the nature of conditioned phenomena and the nature of unconditioned phenomena.

original: tatra bhagavan katamā saṃskṛtadharmatā /
analyzed: tatra bhagavan katamā saṃskṛta dharmatā
translated: There, Blessed One, what is the nature of conditioned phenomena?

original: yad utādhyātmaśūnyatājñānaṃ bahirdhāśūnyatājñānam adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatājñānaṃ yāvad
analyzed: yat uta adhyātma śūnyatā jñānam bahirdhā śūnyatā jñānam adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā jñānam yāvat
translated: Namely, the knowledge of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the knowledge of the emptiness of external phenomena, the knowledge of the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena,

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatājñānaṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu yad āryasatyeṣu yad
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā jñānam saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu yat ārya satyeṣu yat
translated: up to the knowledge of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, the knowledge in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the knowledge in the noble truths,

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu yad daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu jñānaṃ /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu yat daśasu tathāgata baleṣu jñānam
translated: the knowledge in the four immeasurables, the four dhyānas, and the formless attainments, the knowledge in the ten powers of the Tathāgata,

original: yac caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsv aṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu /
analyzed: yat caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu
translated: the knowledge in the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha,

original: jñānaṃ / yat kuśalamūleṣu sāsravānāsraveṣu sāvadyānavadyeṣu laukikalokottareṣu saṃkleśavyavadānadharmeṣu jñānam iyam ucyate saṃskṛtadharmatā /
analyzed: jñānam yat kuśala mūleṣu sa āsrava anāsraveṣu sāvadya anavadyeṣu laukika lokottareṣu saṃkleśa vyavadāna dharmeṣu jñānam iyam ucyate saṃskṛta dharmatā
translated: the knowledge in the wholesome roots, with and without outflows, blameworthy and blameless, worldly and transcendent, and in the phenomena of defilement and purification. This is called the nature of conditioned phenomena.

original: tatra katamā asaṃskṛtadharmā ucyate /🔽yasya dharmasya notpādo na nirodho na sthitir nāsthiḥ /
analyzed: tatra katamāḥ asaṃskṛta dharmāḥ ucyate  yasya dharmasya na utpādaḥ na nirodhaḥ na sthitiḥ na asthiḥ
translated: There, what are the unconditioned phenomena said to be?🔽It is said that the unconditioned is that phenomenon which has no arising, no cessation, no duration, no change,

original: nānyathātvaṃ na saṃkleśo na vyavadānaṃ na hānir na vṛddhiḥ /
analyzed: na anyathātvam na saṃkleśaḥ na vyavadānam na hāniḥ na vṛddhiḥ
translated: no defilement, no purification, no decrease, and no increase.

original: yāvat sarvadharmāṇām abhāvasvabhāvatā / katamā sarvadharmāṇām abhāvasvabhāvatā /
analyzed: yāvat sarva dharmāṇām abhāva svabhāva tā katamā sarva dharmāṇām abhāva svabhāva tā
translated: up to the absence of own-being of all dharmas. What is the absence of own-being of all dharmas?

original: yā adhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā śūnyatāśūnyatā mahāśūnyatā
analyzed: yā adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā śūnyatā śūnyatā mahāśūnyatā
translated: It is the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the great emptiness,

original: paramārthaśūnyatā saṃskṛtaśūnyatā asaṃskṛtaśūnyatā atyantaśūnyatā anavarāgraśūnyatā
analyzed: paramārtha śūnyatā saṃskṛta śūnyatā asaṃskṛta śūnyatā atyanta śūnyatā anavara agra śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,

original: anavakāraśūnyatā prakṛtiśūnyatā sarvadharmaśūnyatā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatā anupalambhaśūnyatā
analyzed: anavakāra śūnyatā prakṛti śūnyatā sarva dharma śūnyatā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatā anupalambha śūnyatā
translated: the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of specific characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension,

original: abhāvaśūnyatā svabhāvaśūnyatā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā parabhāvaśūnyatā / yat sarvadharmāṇāṃ
analyzed: abhāva śūnyatā svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā para bhāva śūnyatā yat sarva dharmāṇām
translated: the emptiness of non-existence, the emptiness of own-being, the emptiness of the own-being of non-existence, and the emptiness of other-being. The emptiness of all dharmas

original: prakṛtiśūnyatātvam anupalambho yāvad yā sarvadharmāṇāṃ nirabhilapyatā apravyāhāratā
analyzed: prakṛti śūnyatā tvam anupalambhaḥ yāvat yā sarva dharmāṇām nirabhilapya tā apravyāhāra tā
translated: is the non-apprehension of all dharmas, up to the inexpressibility and non-utterance of all dharmas.

original: iyam ucyate asaṃskṛtadharmatā /
analyzed: iyam ucyate asaṃskṛta dharmatā
translated: This is called the nature of unconditioned phenomena.

original: iti parārthādhimuktir adhimātramṛddhī
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimuktiḥ adhimātram ṛddhī
translated: Thus, the superior devotion to the benefit of others is of great power.

original: atha khalu bhagavān sakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān sakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Blessed One said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat / ye 'pi te 'bhūvann atīte 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat ye pi te bhūvan atīte dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so. Those who were Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones in the past,

original: te 'pīmām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ / ye 'pi
analyzed: te pi imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ ye pi
translated: they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Those who

original: te bhaviṣyanty anāgate 'dhvani tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās te 'pīmām eva
analyzed: te bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ te pi imām eva
translated: will be Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones in the future, they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom,

original: prajñāpāramitām āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante / ye 'py etarhi daśadiglokadhātuṣu
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyante ye pi etarhi daśa diś lokadhātuṣu
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Enlightened Ones who are at present in the ten directions,

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmaṃ ca deśayanti
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti
translated: in the world systems, who abide, maintain themselves, and teach the Dharma,

original: te 'pīmām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ / ye 'pi
analyzed: te pi imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ ye pi
translated: they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Those who

original: te 'bhūvann atītānāgatāḥ śrāvakā ye ca pratyekabuddhās te 'pīmām eva prajñāpāramitām
analyzed: te bhūvan atīta anāgatāḥ śrāvakāḥ ye ca pratyekabuddhāḥ te pi imām eva prajñāpāramitām
translated: were in the past, and those who will be in the future, the disciples and the solitary buddhas, they too, having relied on just this perfection of wisdom,

original: āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbhotsyante /
analyzed: āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante
translated: have fully awakened, and will fully awaken, to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ye 'pi srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca /
analyzed: ye pi srotaāpatti phalam prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca
translated: Those who will attain the fruit of stream-entry, and those who are attaining it,

original: ye 'pi sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca / ye 'pi te daśadiśi loke 'saṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu śrāvakā /
analyzed: ye pi sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca ye pi te daśa diśi loke saṃkhyeyeṣu lokadhātuṣu śrāvakāḥ
translated: those who will attain the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and arhatship, and those who are attaining it, and those who are śrāvakas in the ten directions in innumerable world systems,

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhās tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te 'pīmām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya śrāvakabodhipratyekabodhiprāptās / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante yāpayanti te pi imām eva prajñāpāramitām āgamya śrāvaka bodhi pratyeka bodhi prāptāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: and those who are pratyekabuddhas who are present, supporting, and maintaining themselves, they too have attained the śrāvaka enlightenment and pratyekabuddha enlightenment by relying on just this perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: tathā hy /
analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Because

original: atra prajñāpāramitāyāṃ trīṇi yānāni vistareṇopadiṣṭāni /
analyzed: atra prajñāpāramitāyām trīṇi yānāni vistareṇa upadiṣṭāni
translated: in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are taught in detail.

original: tāni punar animittayogenānutpādānirodhayogenāsaṃkleśāvyavadānayogenānabhisaṃskārayogenānāyūhāniryūhayogenānutkṣepāprakṣepayogenānudgrahānutsargayogena /
analyzed: tāni punar a nimitta yogena an utpāda anirodha yogena a saṃkleśa a vyavadāna yogena an abhisaṃskāra yogena an āyūha a niryūha yogena an utkṣepa a prakṣepa yogena an udgraha an utsarga yogena
translated: And those are again by the yoga of signlessness, by the yoga of non-arising and non-cessation, by the yoga of non-defilement and non-purification, by the yoga of non-formation, by the yoga of non-attraction and non-repulsion, by the yoga of non-taking up and non-laying down, by the yoga of non-grasping and non-relinquishing.

original: tat punar lokavyavahāreṇa na punaḥ paramārthena / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat punar lokavyavahāreṇa na punar paramārthena tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And that is again by conventional truth, not by ultimate truth. Why is that?

original: na hi prajñāpāramitāyām apāraṃ vā pāraṃ vā sthalaṃ vā nimnaṃ vā samaṃ vā viṣamaṃ
analyzed: na hi prajñāpāramitāyām apāram vā pāram vā sthalam vā nimnam vā samam vā viṣamam
translated: Because in the perfection of wisdom there is no shore or near shore, no land or low land, no level or uneven,

original: vā nimittaṃ vā animittaṃ vā laukikaṃ vā lokottaraṃ vā saṃskṛtaṃ vā asaṃskṛtaṃ vā
analyzed: vā nimittam vā animittam vā laukikam vā lokottaram vā saṃskṛtam vā asaṃskṛtam vā
translated: whether with signs or signless, whether mundane or supramundane, whether compounded or uncompounded,

original: kuśalaṃ vā akuśalaṃ vā atītaṃ vā anāgataṃ vā pratyutpannaṃ vā prajñāyate / na ca kauśika
analyzed: kuśalam vā akuśalam vā atītam vā anāgatam vā pratyutpannam vā prajñāyate na ca kauśika
translated: whether wholesome, unwholesome, or indeterminate, whether past, future, or present, is perceived. And yet, Kauśika,

original: prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasya pradāyikā na pratyekabuddhadharmāṇāṃ nārhatvadharmāṇāṃ pradāyikā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasya pradāyikā na pratyekabuddha dharmāṇām na arhatva dharmāṇām pradāyikā
translated: the perfection of wisdom does not bestow any dharma at all, nor does it bestow the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, nor the dharmas of the arhats.

original: iti parārthādhimuktir adhimātramadhyā
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimuktiḥ adhimātra madhyā
translated: Thus, the superior devotion to the benefit of others is of medium intensity.

original: śakra āha / mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yad uta prajñāpāramitā / atra hi bhagavan bodhisattvā
analyzed: śakraḥ āha mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā atra hi bhagavan bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Śakra said: This perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is a great perfection, for in it the bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carantaḥ sarvasattvacittacaritāni prajānanti na ca
analyzed: mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ sarva sattva citta caritāni prajānanti na ca
translated: mahāsattvas, practicing the perfection of wisdom, know the activities of the minds of all beings, but do not

original: sattvam upalabhante /
analyzed: sattvam upalabhante
translated: apprehend a being.

original: na jīvaṃ na poṣaṃ na puruṣaṃ na manujaṃ na mānavaṃ na kārakaṃ na vedakaṃ na jānakaṃ na paśyakam upalabhante / na rūpam upalabhante /
analyzed: na jīvam na poṣam na puruṣam na manujam na mānavam na kārakam na vedakam na jānakam na paśyakam upalabhante na rūpam upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend a living being, a nourished being, a man, a human, a person, a doer, an experiencer, one who knows, or one who sees. They do not apprehend form,

original: na vedanāṃ na saṃjñāṃ na saṃskārān na vijñānam upalabhante / na pṛthivīdhātum upalabhante /
analyzed: na vedanām na saṃjñām na saṃskārān na vijñānam upalabhante na pṛthivī dhātum upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness. They do not apprehend the earth element.

original: nābdhātuṃ na tejodhātuṃ na vāyudhātuṃ nākāśadhātuṃ na vijñānadhātum upalabhante / na cakṣur upalabhante /
analyzed: na ap dhātum na tejaḥ dhātum na vāyu dhātum na ākāśa dhātum na vijñāna dhātum upalabhante na cakṣuḥ upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, or the consciousness element. They do not apprehend the eye.

original: na rūpam upalabhante /
analyzed: na rūpam upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend form.

original: na cakṣurvijñānam upalabhante /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ vijñānam upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend eye consciousness.

original: na cakṣuḥsaṃsparśam upalabhante /
analyzed: na cakṣuḥ saṃsparśam upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend eye contact.

original: yad api tac cakṣūrūpasaṃsparśapratyayād utpadyate vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā duḥkhaṃ vā🔽aduḥkhāsukhaṃ vā tad api nopalabhante / evaṃ śrotraṃ ghrāṇaṃ jihvāṃ kāyaṃ mano nopalabhante /
analyzed: yat api tat cakṣuḥ rūpa saṃsparśa pratyayāt utpadyate vedayitam sukham vā duḥkham vā  aduḥkha asukham vā tat api na upalabhante evam śrotram ghrāṇam jihvām kāyam manaḥ na upalabhante
translated: Whatever feeling arises due to the condition of eye, form, and eye contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either. Thus they do not apprehend the ear,🔽they do not apprehend sounds, they do not apprehend ear consciousness,🔽they do not apprehend ear contact, they do not apprehend whatever feeling arises due to the condition of ear, sound, and ear contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either. Thus they do not apprehend the nose,🔽they do not apprehend smells, they do not apprehend nose consciousness,

original: śabdagandharasaspraṣṭavyadharmān nopalabhante / śrotravijñānaṃ yāvan manovijñānaṃ /
analyzed: śabda gandha rasa spraṣṭavya dharmān na upalabhante śrotra vijñānam yāvat manaḥ vijñānam
translated: they do not apprehend nose contact, they do not apprehend whatever feeling arises due to the condition of nose, smell, and nose contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either. Thus they do not apprehend the tongue,🔽they do not apprehend tastes, they do not apprehend tongue consciousness,🔽they do not apprehend tongue contact, they do not apprehend whatever feeling arises due to the condition of tongue, taste, and tongue contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either. Thus they do not apprehend the body,🔽they do not apprehend tactile objects, they do not apprehend body consciousness,🔽they do not apprehend body contact, they do not apprehend whatever feeling arises due to the condition of body, tactile objects, and body contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either. Thus they do not apprehend the mind,🔽they do not apprehend mental phenomena, they do not apprehend mind consciousness,

original: śrotrasaṃsparśaṃ yāvan manaḥsaṃsparśaṃ nopalabhante yāvad yad api tan manodharmasaṃsparśapratyayād
analyzed: śrotra saṃsparśam yāvat manaḥ saṃsparśam na upalabhante yāvat yat api tat manaḥ dharma saṃsparśa pratyayāt
translated: they do not apprehend mind contact, they do not apprehend whatever feeling arises due to the condition of mind, mental phenomena, and mind contact, whether pleasant, painful, or neither-painful-nor-pleasant, they do not apprehend that either.

original: utpadyate vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā duḥkhaṃ vā aduḥkhāsukhaṃ vā tad api nopalabhante / smṛtyupasthānāninopalabhante /
analyzed: utpadyate vedayitam sukham vā duḥkham vā aduḥkha asukham vā tat api na upalabhante smṛti upasthānāni na upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend the arising of pleasant, unpleasant, or neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling. They do not apprehend the applications of mindfulness.

original: samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān nopalabhante / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīr
analyzed: samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān na upalabhante a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ
translated: They do not apprehend the right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or path. They do not apprehend the immeasurables, concentrations, or formless absorptions.

original: nopalabhante / nāryasatyāni nāṣṭavimokṣān na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīr na ṣaḍabhijñā🔽upalabhante / /
analyzed: na upalabhante na ārya satyāni na aṣṭa vimokṣān na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīḥ na ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ  upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend the noble truths, eight liberations, nine successive absorptions, or six superknowledges.

original: na daśatathāgatabalāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān upalabhante / nādhyātmaśūnyatām upalabhante /
analyzed: na daśa tathāgata balāni na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān upalabhante na adhyātma śūnyatām upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend the ten powers of the Tathāgata, confidences, aspects of awareness, or eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha. They do not apprehend inner emptiness,

original: na bahirdhāśūnyatāṃ nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ yāvan nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upalabhante /
analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatām na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām yāvat na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upalabhante
translated: they do not apprehend outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence.

original: na samādhīn na dhāraṇīmukhāny upalabhante / na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāny upalabhante /
analyzed: na samādhīn na dhāraṇī mukhāni upalabhante na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni upalabhante
translated: They do not apprehend concentrations or doors of retention. They do not apprehend emptiness, signlessness, or wishlessness.

original: na bodhiṃ na buddhaṃ na buddhadharmān upalabhante / na hi prajñāpāramitā upalambhayogena
analyzed: na bodhim na buddham na buddha dharmān upalabhante na hi prajñāpāramitā upalambha yogena
translated: They do not apprehend awakening, Buddha, or qualities of the Buddha. For the perfection of wisdom is not apprehended as a yoga of apprehension.

original: pratyupasthitā / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: pratyupasthitā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: is present. Why is that?

original: tathā hi svabhāvo na saṃvidyate nopalabhyate /
analyzed: tathā hi svabhāvaḥ na saṃvidyate na upalabhyate
translated: Because the intrinsic nature does not exist and is not found,

original: yenopalabhyeta yad upalabhyeta yatra copalabhyeta /
analyzed: yena upalabhyeta yat upalabhyeta yatra ca upalabhyeta
translated: by which one could be found, which one could be found, and where one could be found.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so.

original: tathā hi kauśika bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'nupalambhayogena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caran bodhim api nopalabhate prāg eva bodhisattvadharmān /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ n upalambha yogena prajñāpāramitāyām caran bodhim api nā upalabhate prāk eva bodhisattva dharmān
translated: For, Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom through the yoga of non-apprehension, does not even apprehend awakening, let alone the qualities of a bodhisattva.

original: śakra āha / kiṃ punar bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām eva carati nānyāsu pāramitāsu /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha kim punar bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām eva carati na anyāsu pāramitāsu
translated: Śakra said: But, Blessed One, does the bodhisattva mahāsattva practice only the perfection of wisdom, not the other perfections?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sarvāsu kauśika pāramitāsu bodhisattvo mahāsattvaś carati na kevalaṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: sarvāsu kauśika pāramitāsu bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ carati na kevalam prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattva practices in all the perfections, not only in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tac cānupalambhayogena sa dānapāramitāṃ nopalabhate dāyakam api nopalabhate pratigrāhakam api nopalabhate /
analyzed: tat ca anupalambha yogena sa dāna pāramitām nā upalabhate dāyakam api nā upalabhate pratigrāhakam api nā upalabhate
translated: And he does not apprehend the perfection of generosity, does not apprehend the giver, does not apprehend the recipient.

original: śīlapāramitāṃ nopalabhate śīlavantam api nopalabhate dauḥśīlyam api nopalabhate /
analyzed: śīla pāramitām nā upalabhate śīlavantam api nā upalabhate dauḥśīlyam api nā upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of morality, nor does he apprehend one who is moral, nor does he apprehend immorality.

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ nopalabhate kṣamiṇam api nopalabhate kṣamyam api nopalabhate vīryapāramitāṃ nopalabhate kartavyam api nopalabhate kāyacittam 🔽api nopalabhate /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām na upalabhate kṣamiṇam api nā upalabhate kṣamyam api nā upalabhate vīrya pāramitām nā upalabhate kartavyam api nā upalabhate kāya cittam  api na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of patience, nor does he apprehend one who is patient, nor does he apprehend what should be endured. He does not apprehend the perfection of perseverance, nor does he apprehend what should be done, nor does he apprehend body and mind.

original: dhyānapāramitāṃ nopalabhate cittam api nopalabhate samādhim api nopalabhate /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitām nā upalabhate cittam api nā upalabhate samādhim api nā upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of concentration, nor does he apprehend the mind, nor does he apprehend meditative absorption.

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ nopalabhate prajñāvantam api nopalabhate prajñayam api nopalabhate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām na upalabhate prajñāvantam api na upalabhate prajñayam api na upalabhate
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of wisdom, nor does he apprehend one who has wisdom, nor does he apprehend wisdom.

original: api tu khalu punaḥ kauśika prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: api tu khalu punar kauśika prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom is the forerunner and leader of the bodhisattva mahasattva🔽when he is practicing generosity. The perfection of wisdom is the forerunner of the bodhisattva mahasattva

original: dānaṃ dadataḥ / prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śīlaṃ rakṣataḥ
analyzed: dānam dadataḥ prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya śīlam rakṣataḥ
translated: when he is protecting morality,

original: kṣāntiṃ bhāvayato vīryam ārambhamāṇasya dhyānaṃ samāpadyamānasya dharmān vibhāvayato
analyzed: kṣāntim bhāvayataḥ vīryam ārambhamāṇasya dhyānam samāpadyamānasya dharmān vibhāvayataḥ
translated: when he is cultivating patience, when he is undertaking perseverance, when he is attaining concentration, when he is contemplating dharmas,

original: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā sarvadharmāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitā pūrvaṃgamā nāyikā sarva dharmāṇām an upalambha yogena
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the forerunner and leader of the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s all dharmas, by way of non-apprehension.

original: evaṃ vyastasamastānāṃ skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādāṅgānām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: evam vyasta samastānām skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām anupalambha yogena
translated: Thus, of the separate and combined aggregates, elements, sense fields, and links of dependent origination, by way of non-apprehension.

original: saptatriṃśatāṃ /
analyzed: saptatriṃśatām
translated: Of the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇām anupalanibhayogena / āryasatyānām apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīnām
analyzed: bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām anupala nibha yogena ārya satyānām a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām
translated: by way of non-apprehension. Of the noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, and the formless attainments,

original: anupalambhayogena / aṣṭānāṃ vimokṣāṇāṃ navānupūrvavihārasamāpattīnāṃ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitānāṃ
analyzed: anupalambha yogena aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitānām
translated: by way of non-apprehension. Of the eight liberations, the nine successive meditative absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām anupalambhayogena / daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ caturṇāṃ vaiśāradyānāṃ
analyzed: ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām anupalambha yogena daśānām tathāgata balānām caturṇām vaiśāradyānām
translated: by way of non-apprehension. Of the six higher knowledges, by way of non-apprehension. Of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four confidences,

original: catasṛṇāṃ pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇām anupalambhayogena /
analyzed: catasṛṇām pratisaṃvidām aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām an upalambha yogena
translated: the four unhindered knowledges, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, by way of non-apprehension.

original: sarvaśūnyatānāṃ sarvasamādhīnāṃ sarvadhāraṇīmukhānām anupalambhayogena / sarvajñatāyā
analyzed: sarva śūnyatānām sarva samādhīnām sarva dhāraṇī mukhānām an upalambha yogena sarvajña tāyāḥ
translated: Of all the emptinesses, all the meditative absorptions, and all the doors of retention, by way of non-apprehension. Of omniscience,

original: anupalambhayogena yāvat sarvadharmāṇām anupalambhayogena / tadyathāpi nāma kauśika
analyzed: anupalambha yogena yāvat sarva dharmāṇām anupalambha yogena tat yathā api nāma kauśika
translated: up to the non-apprehension of all dharmas. It is just as, Kauśika,

original: jāmbūdvīpakānāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ nānāpatrapalāśānāṃ nānāpuṣpaphalānāṃ nānārohasaṃsthānapariṇāhānāṃ
analyzed: jāmbūdvīpakānām vṛkṣāṇām nānā patra palāśānām nānā puṣpa phalānām nānā āroha saṃsthāna pariṇāhānām
translated: the trees in Jambūdvīpa, with their various leaves, flowers, and fruits, with their various heights, shapes, and circumferences,

original: na ca teṣāṃ vṛkṣāṇāṃ cchāyāyā viśeṣo vā nānākaraṇaṃ copalabhyate /
analyzed: na ca teṣām vṛkṣāṇām chāyāyāḥ viśeṣaḥ vā nānākaraṇam ca upalabhyate
translated: and no special or different treatment is perceived for those trees.

original: api tu cchāyā cchāyeti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati / evam eva kauśika pañcānāṃ pāramitānāṃ prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītānāṃ
analyzed: api tu chāyā chāyā iti saṃkhyām gacchati evam eva kauśika pañcānām pāramitānām prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītānām
translated: But still, they are counted as 'shade, shade.' In the same way, Kauśika, the five perfections, when taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom,

original: sarvajñātāpariṇāmitānāṃ na viśeṣo na nānākaraṇam upalabhyate 'nupalambhayogena /
analyzed: sarvajñāta apariṇāmitānām na viśeṣaḥ na nānākaraṇam upalabhyate n upalambha yogena
translated: when dedicated to omniscience, are not perceived to have any special or different treatment through the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: iti parārthādhimuktir adhimātrādhimātrety ukto adhimuktimanaskāraḥ guṇaparikīrtanaparivarto nāma caturthaḥ
analyzed: iti parārtha adhimuktiḥ adhimātra adhimātrā iti uktaḥ adhimukti manaskāraḥ guṇaparikīrtanaparivartaḥ nāma caturthaḥ
translated: Thus, the great, great faith in the benefit for others is said to be the mental attention of faith. The fourth chapter named The Praise of Qualities

original: śakra āha / mahāguṇasamanvāgatā bhagavann iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha mahā guṇa samanvāgatā bhagavan iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: Śakra said: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is endowed with great qualities.

original: sarvaguṇaparipūraṇī aprameyaguṇasamanvāgatā acintyaguṇasamanvāgatā atulyaguṇasamanvāgatā
analyzed: sarva guṇa paripūraṇī aprameya guṇa samanvāgatā acintya guṇa samanvāgatā atulya guṇa samanvāgatā
translated: It fulfills all qualities, is endowed with immeasurable qualities, endowed with inconceivable qualities, endowed with incomparable qualities,

original: aparimāṇaguṇasamanvāgatā aparyantaguṇasamanvāgateyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā / yaḥ
analyzed: aparimāṇa guṇa samanvāgatā aparyanta guṇa samanvāgatā iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā yaḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is endowed with immeasurable qualities, endowed with infinite qualities.

original: kaścid bhagavan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakalikhitām api
analyzed: kaścid bhagavan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām pustaka likhitām api
translated: Whoever, Blessed One, some son or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom in book form,

original: kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati /
analyzed: kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati
translated: would bear it in mind, would recite it, would master it,

original: tāṃ ca satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhir yathopadiṣṭāṃ ca
analyzed: tām ca satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ yathā upadiṣṭām ca
translated: and would honor, revere, worship, and adore it with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners, and would

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ yoniśo manasikuryād /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām yoniśas manasikuryāt
translated: contemplate the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught with proper attention,

original: yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā parasmai dadyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām pustaka likhitām kṛtvā parasmai dadyāt
translated: and whoever, some son or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom in book form, would give it to another -

original: kataras tayor bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: which one of the two would produce the greater merit?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tena hi kauśika tvām evātra pratiprakṣyāmi yathā te kṣamate tathā vyākuryāḥ / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tena hi kauśika tvām eva atra pratiprakṣyāmi yathā te kṣamate tathā vyākuryāḥ tat kim manyase
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, I will ask you about this in return, and as it may occur to you, so you may reply. What do you think?

original: kauśika / yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgataśarīrāṇi satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgata śarīrāṇi satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: Kauśika, if some son or daughter of good family would honor, respect, revere, and worship the relics of the Tathāgata with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā sarṣapaphalamātrakaṃ tathāgataśarīraṃ parasmai dadyāt saṃvibhāgaṃ kuryāt /🔽so 'pi kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tat sarṣapaphalamātrakaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā sarṣapa phala mātrakam tathāgata śarīram parasmai dadyāt saṃvibhāgam kuryāt  saḥ pi kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tat sarṣapa phala mātrakam
translated: and if another son or daughter of good family would give to another a relic of the Tathāgata the size of a mustard seed, and share it,

original: tathāgataśarīraṃ satkuryād gurukuryād mānayet pājayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: tathāgata śarīram satkuryāt gurukuryāt mānayet pājayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: and if that son or daughter of good family would honor, respect, revere, and worship that relic of the Tathāgata the size of a mustard seed with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: kataras tayor bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kataraḥ tayoḥ bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: which of the two would generate the greater merit?

original: śakra āha / yathāhaṃ bhagavan bhagavato bhāṣitasyārtham ājāneyāyaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgataśarīrāṇi svayaṃ satkuryād gurukuryād
analyzed: śakraḥ āha yathā aham bhagavan bhagavataḥ bhāṣitasya artham ājāneya ayam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgata śarīrāṇi svayam satkuryāt gurukuryāt
translated: Śakra said: As I understand the meaning of what the Blessed One has said, Blessed One, if a son or daughter of good family would themselves honor, respect, revere, and worship the relics of the Tathāgata,

original: mānayet pūjayed arcayed apacāyeta /
analyzed: mānayet pūjayet arcayet apacāyeta
translated: and

original: so 'pi sarṣapaphalamātrakaṃ tathāgataśarīraṃ parasmai dādyād ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ
analyzed: saḥ pi sarṣapa phala mātrakam tathāgata śarīram parasmai dādyāt ayam eva tatas bahutaram
translated: And if that person were to give to another the relic of the Tathāgata the size of a mustard seed, he would produce even more merit than that.

original: puṇyaṃ prasavet / evam arthavaśaṃ saṃpaśyamānena tathāgatena vajropamaṃ samādhiṃ samāpadya
analyzed: puṇyam prasavet evam artha vaśam saṃpaśyamānena tathāgatena vajra upamam samādhim samāpadya
translated: Seeing the power of the meaning in this way, the Tathāgata, having entered the vajra-like concentration,

original: ātmabhāvaṃ vajropamaṃ bhittvā tathāgataśarīrāṇy adhiṣṭhitāni mahākaruṇāṃ saṃjanaya
analyzed: ātma bhāvam vajra upamam bhittvā tathāgata śarīrāṇi adhiṣṭhitāni mahā karuṇām saṃjanaya
translated: having split his vajra-like body, consecrated the Tathāgata's relics, and having generated great compassion

original: sattvakāye tathāgatadhātuvainayikānāṃ sattvānām / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: sattva kāye tathāgata dhātu vainayikānām sattvānām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: for the beings in the realm of beings who are to be guided by the Tathāgata's relics. Why is that?

original: ye kecid bhagavan tathāgatasya parinirvṛttasyāntaśaḥ sarṣapaphalamātrakam api dhātuṃ
analyzed: ye kecid bhagavan tathāgatasya parinirvṛttasya antaśas sarṣapa phala mātrakam api dhātum
translated: Blessed One, whoever would worship even a relic of the Tathāgata the size of a mustard seed after the Tathāgata's parinirvāṇa,

original: pūjayiṣyanti sarveṣāṃ teṣāṃ na śakyaṃ tasya kuśalamūlasya paryanto 'dhigantuṃ yāvat parinirvāṇam iti /
analyzed: pūjayiṣyanti sarveṣām teṣām na śakyam tasya kuśala mūlasya paryantaḥ dhigantum yāvat parinirvāṇam iti
translated: the end of that wholesome root cannot be reached until parinirvāṇa.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat / yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so. Whoever, son of a good family or daughter of a good family, this perfection of wisdom,

original: satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyaty arcayiṣyaty apacāyiṣyate puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati pūjayiṣyati arcayiṣyati apacāyiṣyate puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: will honor, revere, respect, worship, and venerate it with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: parasmai ca likhitvā dadyād evaṃ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / iti prathamā stutimātra
analyzed: parasmai ca likhitvā dadyāt evam kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati iti prathamā stuti mātra
translated: And having written it out, will give it to others, that noble son or noble daughter will produce much more merit. Thus is the first praise alone.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ yathopadiṣṭāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām yathā upadiṣṭām
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, that noble son or noble daughter who, having been taught this perfection of wisdom as it was taught,

original: parebhyo gatvā ācakṣīta deśayet prakāśayed vibhajed uttānīkuryād ayaṃ sa kulaputro
analyzed: parebhyaḥ gatvā ācakṣīta deśayet prakāśayet vibhajet uttānīkuryāt ayam sa kula putraḥ
translated: having gone to others, would explain it, teach it, proclaim it, chant it, make it widely known, recite it, and illuminate it, that noble son

original: vā kuladuhitā vā tataḥ pūrvakāt kulaputrād vā kuladuhitur vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: vā kula duhitā vā tatas pūrvakāt kula putrāt vā kula duhituḥ vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: or noble daughter will produce much more merit than that previous noble son or noble daughter.

original: śāsteti vā pratikāṃkṣitavyaḥ /
analyzed: śāstā iti vā pratikāṃkṣitavyaḥ
translated: should be regarded as the Teacher.

original: anyatarānyataro vā gurusthānīyaḥ sabrahmacārī / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: anyatara anyataraḥ vā guru sthānīyaḥ sabrahmacārī tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: or any other spiritual teacher, a fellow celibate. Why is that?

original: eṣa evātra śāstā draṣṭavyo yeyaṃ prajñāpāramitā na hy anyaḥ śāstā anyā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva atra śāstā draṣṭavyaḥ yā iyam prajñāpāramitā na hi anyaḥ śāstā anyā prajñāpāramitā
translated: This very one should be seen as the Teacher here, namely this perfection of wisdom. The Teacher is not one thing, the perfection of wisdom another.

original: prajñāpāramitaiva śāstā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā eva śāstā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the teacher.

original: śāstaiva prajñāpāramitā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: śāstā eva prajñāpāramitā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the teacher itself. Why is that?

original: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitvā kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaro vā atītānāgatapratyutpannās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā loke prādurbhūtāḥ /
analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣitvā kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ vā atīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ loke prādurbhūtāḥ
translated: For here, having trained in this perfection of wisdom, sons and daughters of good family, the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past, future, and present have appeared in the world.

original: ye 'pi te 'bhijñāḥ sabrahmacāriṇo 'nyatarānyatare 'vinivartanīyatve sthitās /
analyzed: ye pi te bhijñāḥ sabrahmacāriṇaḥ nyatara anyatare vinivartanīya tve sthitāḥ
translated: And those who are endowed with the higher knowledges, the celibate practitioners, who are established in one or another of the irreversible stages,

original: te 'pi bodhisattvā mahāsattvā ihaiva prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣamāṇā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim /
analyzed: te pi bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ iha eva prajñāpāramitāyām śikṣamāṇāḥ anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: they too, the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, having trained in just this perfection of wisdom, have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: abhisaṃbuddhāḥ / atraiva kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāṃ śrāvakāḥ śikṣitāḥ /
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhāḥ atra eva kauśika prajñāpāramitāyām śrāvakāḥ śikṣitāḥ
translated: will fully awaken, and are fully awakening. Here, Kausika, in just this perfection of wisdom, the disciples have trained,

original: arhanto 'rhattvaṃ prāptāḥ /
analyzed: arhantaḥ arhat tvam prāptāḥ
translated: the Arhats have attained Arhatship,

original: pratyekabuddhāḥ pratyekabodhiṃ prāptā /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhāḥ pratyeka bodhim prāptā
translated: the Pratyekabuddhas have attained Pratyekabuddha-enlightenment,

original: bodhisattvā bodhisattvaniyāmam avakrāmanti avakrāntāś ca avakramiṣyanti ca / tasmāt
analyzed: bodhisattvāḥ bodhisattva niyāmam avakrāmanti avakrāntāḥ ca avakramiṣyanti ca tasmāt
translated: the Bodhisattvas have entered into the certainty of a Bodhisattva, have entered, and will enter. Therefore,

original: tarhi kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān saṃmukhaṃ
analyzed: tarhi kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān saṃmukham
translated: then, Kausika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family should face the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: satkartukāmena gurukartukāmena mānayitukāmena pūjayitukāmena puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: satkartu kāmena gurukartu kāmena mānayitu kāmena pūjayitu kāmena puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: One who wishes to honor, to venerate, to respect, to worship with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags,

original: iyam eva prajñāpāramitā pustakalikhitā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā
analyzed: iyam eva prajñāpāramitā pustaka likhitā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā
translated: this very perfection of wisdom, written out in book form, should be honored, venerated, respected, worshipped

original: puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatra dhvajapatākābhiḥ / imam api cārthavaśaṃ
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ imam api ca artha vaśam
translated: with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags. Seeing this very purpose,

original: saṃpaśyamānasya mamānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhasyaitad abhūt /
analyzed: saṃpaśyamānasya mama anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhasya etat abhūt
translated: when I fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, I thought:

original: kan nv ahaṃ dharmam upaniśritya vihareyaṃ satkuryāṃ gurukuryāṃ mānayeyaṃ pūjayeyam
analyzed: kad nu aham dharmam upaniśritya vihareyam satkuryām gurukuryām mānayeyam pūjayeyam
translated: On what Dharma should I dwell, honor, venerate, respect, and worship?

original: iti / so 'haṃ kauśika yadā nādrākṣaṃ sadevake loke sabrahmake samārake saśramaṇabrāhmaṇikāyāṃ
analyzed: iti saḥ ham kauśika yadā na adrākṣam sa devake loke sa brahmake sa mārake sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇikāyām
translated: When I did not see in the world with its gods,🔽Brahmā, and Māra, with its renunciants and brahmins,🔽with its gods, humans, and asuras, anyone similar to me, I thought:

original: prajāyāṃ sadevamānuṣāsurāyāṃ sadṛśam / tasya me sadṛśaṃ samanupaśyamānasya etad abhūt /
analyzed: prajāyām sa deva mānuṣa asurāyām sadṛśam tasya me sadṛśam samanupaśyamānasya etat abhūt
translated: Having not seen anyone similar to me, I should dwell, honor, venerate, respect, and worship the Dharma.

original: yan nūnam ahaṃ ya eva mayā dharmābhisaṃbuddhas tam eva dharmaṃ satkuryāṃ gurukuryāṃ mānayeyaṃ pūjayeyam iti /
analyzed: yat nūnam aham yaḥ eva mayā dharma abhisaṃbuddhaḥ tam eva dharmam satkuryām gurukuryām mānayeyam pūjayeyam iti
translated: What if I were to honor, venerate, respect, and worship that very Dharma which I have fully awakened to?

original: dharmam eva copaniśrāya vihareyam iti / ayam eva kauśika saddharmo yeyaṃ prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: dharmam eva ca upaniśrāya vihareyam iti ayam eva kauśika sat dharmaḥ yā iyam prajñāpāramitā
translated: And relying on the Dharma itself, I would dwell. This very true Dharma, Kauśika, is this perfection of wisdom.

original: aham eva kauśika imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ satkaromi gurukaromi mānayāmi pūjayāmi satkṛtya
analyzed: aham eva kauśikaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām satkaromi gurukaromi mānayāmi pūjayāmi satkṛtya
translated: Kauśika, I myself honor, venerate, respect, and worship this perfection of wisdom. Having honored,

original: gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśrāya ca viharāmi / kiṃ vā punaḥ kauśika kulaputreṇa
analyzed: gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśrāya ca viharāmi kim vā punar kauśika kula putreṇa
translated: venerated, respected, and worshipped it, I dwell relying on it. What more is there for a son of good family

original: vā kuladuhitrā vā anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhukāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: vā kula duhitrā vā anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃboddhu kāmena iyam eva prajñāpāramitā
translated: or a daughter of good family who desires to fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, Kauśika, than this very perfection of wisdom

original: na satkartavyā na gurukartavyā na mānayitavyā na pūjayitavyā puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: na satkartavyā na gurukartavyā na mānayitavyā na pūjayitavyā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: should not be honored, venerated, respected, and worshipped with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners. Why is that?

original: tathā hi śrāvakapratyekabuddhayānikaiḥ kulaputrair vā kuladuhitṛbhir vā iyam eva
analyzed: tathā hi śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yānikaiḥ kula putraiḥ vā kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā iyam eva
translated: Because sons and daughters of good family belonging to the vehicle of the hearers and solitary buddhas have trained in

original: prajñāpāramitā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā satkartavyā gurukartavyā mānayitavyā pūjayitavyā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvra chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be honored, revered, worshipped, venerated with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners. Why is that?

original: prajñāpāramitānirjātā hi bodhisattvā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nirjātāḥ hi bodhisattvāḥ
translated: Because the bodhisattvas are born from the perfection of wisdom.

original: bodhisattvanirjātāś ca tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās /
analyzed: bodhisattva nirjātāḥ ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ
translated: And the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones are born from the bodhisattvas.

original: tathāgatanir jātāś ca sarvaśrāvakapratyekabuddhās / tasmāt tarhi kauśika mahāyānikaiḥ
analyzed: tathāgata niḥ jātāḥ ca sarva śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ tasmāt tarhi kauśika mahāyānikaiḥ
translated: And all the Shravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are born from the Tathagata. Therefore, Kausika, the sons or daughters of good family who belong to the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas

original: kulaputrair vā kuladuhitṛbhir vā śrāvakayānikaiś ca iyam eva prajñāpāramitā satkartavyā🔽gurukartavyā mānayitavyā /
analyzed: kula putraiḥ vā kula duhitṛbhiḥ vā śrāvaka yānikaiḥ ca iyam eva prajñāpāramitā satkartavyā  gurukartavyā mānayitavyā
translated: and those who belong to the vehicle of the Shravakas should honor, revere, worship, and venerate just this perfection of wisdom with flowers, incense,

original: pūjayitavyā puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: pūjayitavyā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: yatra śikṣitvā kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbudhyante abhisaṃbhotsyante / iti dvitīyā stutimātrā
analyzed: yatra śikṣitvā kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbudhyante abhisaṃbhotsyante iti dvitīyā stuti mātrā
translated: Having trained in it, the sons and daughters of good family have fully awakened, are fully awakening, and will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. Thus the second expression of praise.

original: ekaṃ kauśika sattvaṃ srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpya aprameyaṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: ekam kauśika sattvam srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpya aprameyam puṇyam prasavati
translated: Kauśika, having established one being in the fruit of stream-entry, one produces immeasurable merit.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: But not so much by establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome actions. Why is that?

original: daśasu kauśika kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu sattvāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitā aparimuktā eva nirayatiryagyoniyamalokāsuragatibhyaḥ /
analyzed: daśasu kauśika kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu sattvāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ a parimuktāḥ eva niraya tiryagyoni yama loka asura gatibhyaḥ
translated: Kauśika, beings established in the ten wholesome actions are not yet liberated from the hells, animal wombs, the world of Yama, and the realms of the asuras.

original: srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ punaḥ sarvadurgatibhyo mukto bhavati / iti tṛtīyā stutimātrā
analyzed: srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ punar sarva durgatibhyaḥ muktaḥ bhavati iti tṛtīyā stuti mātrā
translated: But one who is established in the fruit of stream-entry is liberated from all bad destinies. Thus the third mere praise.

original: sakṛdāgāmiphale evaṃ sattvaṃ pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: sakṛdāgāmi phale evam sattvam pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Having established one being in the fruit of once-returning, one produces much more merit.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya / iti caturthī stutimātrā
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya iti caturthī stuti mātrā
translated: But not so much by establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome actions. Thus the fourth mere praise.

original: evam anāgāmiphale ekaṃ sattvaṃ pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: evam anāgāmi phale ekam sattvam pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Having established one being in the fruit of non-returning, one produces much more merit.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya / iti pañcamī stutimātrā
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya iti pañcamī stuti mātrā
translated: But not even by establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome courses of action. Thus the fifth is mere praise.

original: evam ekaṃ sattvam arhattve pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: evam ekam sattvam arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: In the same way, by establishing a single being in arhatship, one produces much more merit.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya / iti ṣaṣṭhī stutimātrā
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya iti ṣaṣṭhī stuti mātrā
translated: But not even by establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome courses of action. Thus the sixth is mere praise.

original: evam ekaṃ sattvaṃ pratyekabodhau pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: evam ekam sattvam pratyeka bodhau pratiṣṭhāpya bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: In the same way, by establishing a single being in individual enlightenment, one produces much more merit.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya / iti saptamī stutimātrā
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpya iti saptamī stuti mātrā
translated: But not even by establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome courses of action. Thus the seventh is mere praise.

original: yaḥ kaścit kauśika kulaputro vās kuladuhitā vā jāmbudvīpakān sattvān srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayet /
analyzed: yaḥ kaścid kauśika kula putraḥ kula duhitā vā jāmbudvīpakān sattvān srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: Kauśika, any son or daughter of good family who would establish the beings of Jambudvīpa in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: yo vānyaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā ekaṃ sattvam anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed ayan tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / tat kasya
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā ekam sattvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet ayan tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati tat kasya
translated: and another son or daughter of good family who would establish a single being in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment - this one would produce much more merit than that. Why is it so?

original: tathā hi buddhanetryāḥ so 'nupacchedāya pratyupasthito bhavati / iti aṣṭamī stutimātrā
analyzed: tathā hi buddha netryāḥ saḥ n upacchedāya pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati iti aṣṭamī stuti mātrā
translated: For thus he stands ready for the uninterrupted continuation of the lineage of the Buddhas. Thus the eighth is mere praise.

original: evaṃ yaḥ sarvajāmbudvīpakān sattvān sakṛdāgāmiphale pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: evam yaḥ sarva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān sakṛdāgāmi phale pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: Thus, if someone were to establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the fruit of once-returning,

original: yo vānya ekaṃ sattvam anuttarāyāṃ sanyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed ayan tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / iti navamī stutimātrety uktā stutiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ ekam sattvam anuttarāyām sanyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet ayan tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati iti navamī stuti mātrā iti uktā stutiḥ
translated: and if someone else were to establish just one being in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, the latter would produce much more merit than the former. Thus the ninth is mere praise. Thus the praise has been stated.

original: evaṃ yaḥ sarvajāmbudvīpakān sattvān anāgāmiphale pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: evam yaḥ sarva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān anāgāmi phale pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: Thus, if someone were to establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the fruit of non-returning,

original: yo vānya ekaṃ sattvam anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed ayan tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / iti prathamā stobhamātrā
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ ekam sattvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet ayan tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati iti prathamā stobha mātrā
translated: and if someone else were to establish just one being in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, the latter would produce much more merit than the former. Thus the first is mere eulogy.

original: evaṃ yaḥ sarvajāmbudvīpakān sattvān arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: evam yaḥ sarva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: Thus, if someone were to establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the state of an arhat,

original: yo vānya ekaṃ sattvam anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed ayan tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / iti dvitiyā stobhamātrā
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ ekam sattvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet ayan tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati iti dvitiyā stobha mātrā
translated: and if someone else were to establish just one being in unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, the latter would produce much more merit than the former. Thus the second is mere eulogy.

original: evaṃ yaḥ sarvajāmbudvīpakān sattvān pratyekabodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: evam yaḥ sarva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān pratyeka bodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: In the same way, one who were to establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in individual enlightenment,

original: yo vānyaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā ekaṃ sattvam anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayed ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / tat
analyzed: yaḥ vā anyaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā ekam sattvam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavati tat
translated: and another son or daughter of good family were to establish one being in highest genuine full Awakening, this one would produce very much more goodness than that.

original: tathā hi buddhanetryāḥ / so 'nupacchedāya pratyupasthito bhavati /
analyzed: tathā hi buddha netryāḥ saḥ n upacchedāya pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: Because of this, the lineage of Buddhas is not cut off.

original: ya ekaṃ sattvam apy anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yaḥ ekam sattvam api anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Whoever were to establish even one being in highest genuine full Awakening, why is it so?

original: bodhisattvanirjātā hi kauśika yāvantas tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ / tad anena
analyzed: bodhisattva nirjātāḥ hi kauśika yāvantaḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tat anena
translated: Because, Kauśika, all the Tathāgatas, Arhats, and Perfectly Awakened Ones are born from Bodhisattvas. For this reason,

original: kauśika paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyaṃ bodhisattvo 'pi pūjayitavyaḥ sadevamānuṣāsureṇa
analyzed: kauśika paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam bodhisattvaḥ pi pūjayitavyaḥ sa deva mānuṣa asureṇa
translated: Kauśika, it should be known that by this method, a Bodhisattva should be worshipped by the world with its gods, humans, and asuras,

original: lokena / iti tṛtīyā stobhamātrā
analyzed: lokena iti tṛtīyā stobha mātrā
translated: as the Tathāgata is. This is the third repetition section.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ / kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśakuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā jāmbudvīpakān sattvān daśa kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kim manyase
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, if some son or daughter of good family were to establish the beings of Jambudvīpa in the ten wholesome actions, what do you think?

original: kauśikāpi nu sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kauśika api nu sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Kauśika, would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate even more merit than that?”

original: śakra āha / bahu bhagavan bahu sugata /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha bahu bhagavan bahu sugata
translated: Śakra said, “A lot, Fortunate One, a lot, Sugata!”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Fortunate One said,

original: ataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: atas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: “Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would generate even more merit

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ pustakalikhitāṃ kṛtvā parasmai dadyād antaśo likhanāyāpi vācanāyāpi / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām pustaka likhitām kṛtvā parasmai dadyāt antaśas likhanāya api vācanāya api tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: than that, if they were to write out this perfection of wisdom, and give it to someone else, even just for the purpose of reading it, or for the purpose of writing it out. Why is that?

original: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām anāsravā dharmā vistareṇopadiṣṭā /
analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ vistareṇa upadiṣṭā
translated: Because in this perfection of wisdom the dharmas without outflows are taught in detail,

original: yatra kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca śikṣitvā samyaktvaniyāmam avakrāntāś cāvakramiṣyanti
analyzed: yatra kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca śikṣitvā samyaktva niyāmam avakrāntāḥ ca avakramiṣyanti
translated: whereby sons of good family and daughters of good family, having trained, have entered into the certainty of perfection, will enter into the certainty of perfection,

original: cāvakrāmanti ca / yāvad arhattvaṃ prāptāḥ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca / pratyekāṃ bodhiṃ
analyzed: ca avakrāmanti ca yāvat arhat tvam prāptāḥ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca pratyekām bodhim
translated: and are entering into the certainty of perfection. Having attained, will attain, and are attaining the state of a worthy one.🔽Having attained, will attain, and are attaining the awakening of a solitary buddha,

original: prāptāḥ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca / bodhisattvā bodhisattvaniyāmam avakrāntā avakramiṣyanti ca avakrāmanti /
analyzed: prāptāḥ prāpsyante prāpnuvanti ca bodhisattvāḥ bodhisattva niyāmam avakrāntāḥ avakramiṣyanti ca avakrāmanti
translated: and the bodhisattvas have entered into, will enter into, and are entering into the certainty of a bodhisattva.

original: anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca / katame ca te kauśika anāsravā dharmās /
analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhāḥ abhisaṃbhotsyante abhisaṃbudhyante ca katame ca te kauśika anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: have fully awakened, will fully awaken, and are fully awakening to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. And what are those uncontaminated dharmas?

original: tadyathā pāramitāḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāś catvāry āryasatyāni catvāry apramāṇāni
analyzed: tat yathā pāramitāḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ catvāri ārya satyāni catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: Namely, the perfections, the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the four noble truths, the four immeasurables,

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayo 'ṣṭa vimokṣā navānupūrvaṃ vihārasamāpattayaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitābhijñā
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ ṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrvam vihāra samāpattayaḥ śūnyatā nimittā apraṇihitā abhijñā
translated: the four formless attainments, the eight liberations, the nine successive attainments, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness,

original: adhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā🔽sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni daśa tathāgatabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā  sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni daśa tathāgata balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence,

original: pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā yāvad aparimāṇā buddhadharmā vistareṇopadiṣṭās
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ yāvat aparimāṇāḥ buddha dharmāḥ vistareṇa upadiṣṭāḥ
translated: all the concentrations, all the doors of retention, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of correct knowledge, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to the immeasurable attributes of a buddha, which are taught in detail,

original: tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ tad anenāpi te kauśika /
analyzed: tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ prajñāpāramitāyām tat anena api te kauśika
translated: by the tathāgatas, the arhats, the perfectly awakened ones, in the perfection of wisdom. Kauśika, through this🔽also, you should know that this perfection of wisdom is the most excellent of all the perfections.

original: paryāyeṇaivaṃ veditavyam / yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: paryāyeṇa evam veditavyam yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: It should be understood in this way in sequence. If a son of good family or a daughter of good family🔽

original: pustakalikhitām api kṛtvā parebhyo dadyāl likhanāyāpi vācanāyāpi ayan tato bahutaraṃ
analyzed: pustaka likhitām api kṛtvā parebhyaḥ dadyāt likhanāya api vācanāya api ayan tatas bahutaram
translated: It should be understood in this way in sequence. And if a son of good family or daughter of good family, having written out this perfection of wisdom in book form, were to give it to others to write out and to read, he or she would produce merit

original: puṇyaṃ prasavet / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: puṇyam prasavet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: much greater than that. Why is that?

original: tathā hi atra kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāṃ vistareṇa sarvadharmā upadiṣṭā /
analyzed: tathā hi atra kauśika prajñāpāramitāyām vistareṇa sarva dharmā upadiṣṭā
translated: Because, Kauśika, in this perfection of wisdom all dharmas are taught in detail.

original: yair dharmaiḥ kṣatriyamahāśālakulāni brāhmaṇamahāśālakulāni gṛhapatimahāśālakulāni prajñayante /
analyzed: yaiḥ dharmaiḥ kṣatriya mahā śāla kulāni brāhmaṇa mahā śāla kulāni gṛhapati mahā śāla kulāni prajñayante
translated: By means of those dharmas, the great merchant families of the kṣatriyas, the great merchant families of the brahmins, and the great merchant families of the householders are known.

original: cāturmahārājakāyikā devāḥ prajñāyante /🔽trāyastiṃśā yāmā tuṣitā nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartmo brahmapārṣadyā brahmapurohitā mahābrahmāṇo yāvan naivasaṃjñānāsaṃjñāyatanopagā
analyzed: cāturmahārājakāyikāḥ devāḥ prajñāyante  trāyastiṃśāḥ tuṣitāḥ nirmāṇaratayaḥ paranirmitavaśavartmaḥ brahma pārṣadyāḥ brahmapurohitāḥ mahābrahmāṇaḥ yāvat na eva saṃjñā na asaṃjñā āyatana upagāḥ
translated: The gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings are known.

original: devā prajñāyante /
analyzed: devā prajñāyante
translated: The gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, the Yāma gods, the Tuṣita gods, the Nirmāṇarati gods, the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin gods, the gods of the Brahmapāriṣadya realm, the gods of the Brahmapurohita realm, the Mahā-brahmā gods, up to the gods who go to the peak of existence🔽are known.

original: sarvapāramitāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: sarva pāramitāḥ prajñāyante
translated: All the perfections are known.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ prajñāyante
translated: The thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are known.

original: āryasatyāny aṣṭavimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: ārya satyāni aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ prajñāyante
translated: the noble truths, the eight liberations, and the nine successive meditative absorptions are known;

original: śūnyatānimitāpraṇihitāni ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ prajñāyante /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimita apraṇihitāni ṣaḍ abhijñāḥ prajñāyante
translated: emptiness, the absence of attributes, and the absence of aspiration, and the six superknowledges are known;

original: sarvaśūnyatāḥ sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni prajñāyante /
analyzed: sarva śūnyatāḥ sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni prajñāyante
