analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: atas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavati
translated: Kauśika, that son or daughter of good family would generate even more merit on that basis

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ likhitvā pustakagatāṃ kṛtvā parebhyo dadyād antaśo likhanāyāpi vācanāyāpi / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām likhitvā pustaka gatām kṛtvā parebhyaḥ dadyāt antaśas likhanāya api vācanāya api tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: if they were to give to others this perfection of wisdom, even just for copying or reading, after having written it out in book form. Why is that?

original: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām anāsravā dharmā vistareṇopadiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāramitāyām anāsravāḥ dharmāḥ vistareṇa upadiṣṭāḥ
translated: For in this Perfection of Wisdom, the undefiled dharmas are taught in detail.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, any son or daughter of good family who will take up this Perfection of Wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and contemplate it properly,

original: ca manasikariṣyati /🔽idan tena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasūtaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ca manasikariṣyati  idam tena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasūtam bhaviṣyati
translated: will produce much more merit than that.

original: na tv eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvāṃś cāturdvīpakān sāhasre dvisāhasre trisāhasre lokadhātau
analyzed: na tu eva jāmbudvīpakān sattvān cāturdvīpakān sāhasre dvi sāhasre tri sāhasre lokadhātau
translated: But not so much as establishing the beings of Jambudvīpa, the beings of the four continents, the beings of a world system of a thousand, a world system of a million, a world system of a billion,

original: sarvasattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karmapatheṣu dhyānāpramāṇeṣv ārūpyābhijñāsu pratiṣṭhāpya /
analyzed: sarva sattvān daśasu kuśaleṣu karma patheṣu dhyāna apramāṇeṣu ārūpya abhijñāsu pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: all the beings in the ten wholesome courses of action, the concentrations, the immeasurables, and the formless [absorptions].

original: tatrāyaṃ yoniśo manasikāro na dvayacarito bodhau prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
analyzed: tatra ayam yoniśas manasikāraḥ na dvaya caritaḥ bodhau prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati
translated: Here, this proper contemplation is not dualistic practice. In the enlightenment, one will take up the perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind,

original: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: recite it, master it, and contemplate it properly.

original: na dvayacarito bodhau dhyānapāramitāṃ /
analyzed: na dvaya caritaḥ bodhau dhyāna pāramitām
translated: Not dualistically practicing in the enlightenment, one will practice the perfection of concentration,🔽the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity.

original: vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām
translated: the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: na dvayacarito bodhau dānapāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati🔽yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati / na dvayacarito bodhau adhyātmaśūnyatāṃ bahirdhāśūnyatām
analyzed: na dvaya caritaḥ bodhau dāna pāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati  yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati na dvaya caritaḥ bodhau adhyātma śūnyatām bahirdhā śūnyatām
translated: will not practice the perfection of giving in a dualistic way for the sake of enlightenment, will take it up, bear it in mind, recite it, study it,🔽and wisely attend to it. He will not practice the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena,

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ yoniśo manasikariṣyati / na
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatām yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām yoniśas manasikariṣyati na
translated: and the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena in a dualistic way for the sake of enlightenment, up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-entities, and will wisely attend to them.

original: dvayacarito bodhau smṛtyupasthānasamyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān
analyzed: dvaya caritaḥ bodhau smṛti upasthāna samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān
translated: He will not practice the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of supernatural power, the faculties, the powers, the factors of awakening, and the path in a dualistic way for the sake of enlightenment,

original: yoniśo manasikariṣyati / na dvayacarito bodhau aṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān sarvākārajñatāṃ
analyzed: yoniśas manasikariṣyati na dvaya caritaḥ bodhau aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān sarva ākāra jña tām
translated: and will wisely attend to them. He will not practice the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the knowledge of all aspects in a dualistic way for the sake of enlightenment,

original: yoniśo manasikariṣyati / iti caturthī stobhamātrā
analyzed: yoniśas manasikariṣyati iti caturthī stobha mātrā
translated: and will wisely attend to them. This is the fourth exclamation.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā anekaparyāyeṇa prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā aneka paryāyeṇa prajñāpāramitām
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, some son or daughter of good family, by many kinds of methods, the perfection of wisdom,

original: parebhyo deśayiṣyati vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati bhāvayiṣyati vicariṣyati uttānīkariṣyati
analyzed: parebhyaḥ deśayiṣyati vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati bhāvayiṣyati vicariṣyati uttānīkariṣyati
translated: will teach it to others, will explain it in detail, will cultivate it, will analyze it, will make it clear.

original: artham upadekṣyati / tatrāyaṃ prajñāpāramitārtho 'dvaye na prajñāpāramitāṃ drakṣyati na dvaye /🔽na nimittato nānimittataḥ nāyūhato na niryūhataḥ /
analyzed: artham upadekṣyati tatra ayam prajñāpāramitā arthaḥ dvaye na prajñāpāramitām drakṣyati na dvaye  na nimittataḥ na animittataḥ na a yūhataḥ na niryūhataḥ
translated: There, this is the meaning of the perfection of wisdom: one will not see the perfection of wisdom as non-dual or dual,🔽not as having signs or signless, not as accumulating or dispersing,

original: notkṣepato na prakṣepataḥ /🔽na saṃkleśato na vyavadānataḥ /🔽notpādato na nirodhataḥ /
analyzed: na utkṣepataḥ na prakṣepataḥ  na saṃkleśataḥ na vyavadānataḥ  na utpādataḥ na nirodhataḥ
translated: not as elevating or casting down,🔽not as defiled or purified,🔽not as arising or ceasing,

original: na grāhato notsargataḥ /🔽na sthānato nāsthānataḥ /🔽na bhūtato nābhūtataḥ /
analyzed: na grāhataḥ na utsargataḥ  na sthānataḥ na asthānataḥ  na bhūtatas na a bhūtatas
translated: not as grasping or releasing,🔽not as abiding or not abiding,🔽not as real or unreal,

original: na yogato nāyogataḥ /
analyzed: na yogataḥ na ayogataḥ
translated: not as connected or unconnected,

original: na śeṣato nāśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: na śeṣatas na aśeṣatas
translated: not as remaining or not remaining,

original: na pratyaṃśato nāpratyaṃśataḥ na dharmato nādharmataḥ /
analyzed: na pratyaṃśataḥ na apratyaṃśataḥ na dharmataḥ na adharmataḥ
translated: not as partial or not partial, not as Dharma or non-Dharma,

original: na tathatāto nātathatātaḥ /
analyzed: na tathatātaḥ na a tathatātaḥ
translated: not as suchness or not suchness,

original: na bhūtakoṭito nābhūtakoṭitaḥ / ayam eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: na bhūta koṭitaḥ na abhūta koṭitaḥ ayam eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasaviṣyati
translated: not as the limit of reality or not the limit of reality. This son of good family or daughter of good family will produce much more merit on that basis.

original: ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ parebhyo vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati svādhyāsyati deśayiṣyati
analyzed: yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām parebhyaḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati su ādhyāsyati deśayiṣyati
translated: Whoever will teach this perfection of wisdom in detail to others, will recite it,

original: bhāvayiṣyati uttānīkariṣyati arthaṃ copadekṣyati / na tv eva yaḥ kevalam ātmane codgrahīṣyati
analyzed: bhāvayiṣyati uttānīkariṣyati artham ca upadekṣyati na tu eva yaḥ kevalam ātmane ca udgrahīṣyati
translated: will expound it, will meditate on it, will make it clear, and will explain the meaning, but not just for oneself will take it up,

original: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati / iti pañcamī stobhamātrā
analyzed: dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati iti pañcamī stobha mātrā
translated: will bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it wisely, this is the fifth exclamation of joy.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā svayaṃ prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśaś ca manasikariṣyati /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā svayam prajñāpāramitām udgrahīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati yoniśas ca manasikariṣyati
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, the son or daughter of good family who will themselves take up the perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, master it, and attend to it wisely,

original: tāṃ ca parebhyo vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati prajñāpayiṣyati prasthāpayiṣyati vibhāvayiṣyati uttānīkariṣyati arthaṃ copadekṣyati /
analyzed: tām ca parebhyaḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyati prajñāpayiṣyati prasthāpayiṣyati vibhāvayiṣyati uttānīkariṣyati artham ca upadekṣyati
translated: and will teach it in detail to others, will explain it, will establish it, will illuminate it, will make it clear, and will explain the meaning,

original: ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasaviṣyati
translated: this one will produce merit that is much greater than that.

original: śakra āha / evam etad bhagavann evam etat sugata /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha evam etat bhagavan evam etat sugata
translated: Śakra said: Thus it is, Blessed One, thus it is, Sugata!

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ khalu kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitā upadeṣṭavyā sārthā savyañjanā /
analyzed: evam khalu kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitā upadeṣṭavyā sa arthā sa vyañjanā
translated: Thus, Kauśika, the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family should teach the perfection of wisdom together with the meaning and the text.

original: evam upadiśan kauśika kulaputro vā /
analyzed: evam upadiśan kauśika kula putraḥ vā
translated: Thus, Kauśika, the son of a good family or the daughter of a good family who teaches

original: kuladuhitā vā aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāparimāṇena puṇyaskandhena samanvāgato bhaviṣyati / iti ṣaṣṭhī stobhamātrā🔽sacet kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā daśasu dīkṣv ekaikasyāṃ diśy aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān
analyzed: kula duhitā vā aprameyā asaṃkhyeya aparimāṇena puṇya skandhena samanvāgataḥ bhaviṣyati iti ṣaṣṭhī stobha mātrā  saced kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā daśasu dīkṣu ekaikasyām diśi aprameyān asaṃkhyeyān
translated: will be endowed with immeasurable, incalculable, and unlimited merit. Thus, the sixth exclamation of joy.🔽If, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to honor with offerings of happiness as long as they live the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, immeasurable, incalculable, and unlimited in the ten directions,

original: aparimāṇāṃs tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān yāvajjīvaṃ sukhopadhānena satkuryād
analyzed: aparimāṇān tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān yāvajjīvam sukha upadhānena satkuryāt
translated: one by one in each direction,

original: gurukuryād mānayet pūjayet puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: gurukuryāt mānayet pūjayet puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: with flowers, incense, perfumes, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, flags, and banners.

original: yaḍ ca khalu punaḥ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitām anekaparyāyeṇa
analyzed: ca khalu punar kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām aneka paryāyeṇa
translated: And if, Kauśika, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family were to teach this perfection of wisdom to others in many ways,

original: parebhyo vistareṇa deśayed artham asyā vijñāpayet saṃprakāśayed vibhāvayed vicared
analyzed: parebhyaḥ vistareṇa deśayet artham asyāḥ vijñāpayet saṃprakāśayet vibhāvayet vicaret
translated: to make its meaning clear, to illuminate it, to analyze it, to explain it,

original: uttānīkuryād ayam eva tataḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: uttānīkuryāt ayam eva tatas kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: This son of good family or daughter of good family would produce much more merit. Why is that?

original: atra hi prajñāpāpāramitāyāṃ śikṣitvā tair atītānāgatapratyutpannais tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ
analyzed: atra hi prajñāpāpāramitāyām śikṣitvā taiḥ atīta anāgata pratyutpannaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ
translated: Because, having trained in this perfection of wisdom, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past, future, and present

original: samyaksaṃbuddhair anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhir abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbuddhyate abhisaṃbhotsyate
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ abhisaṃbuddhā abhisaṃbuddhyate abhisaṃbhotsyate
translated: have fully awakened, are awakening, and will awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ca / iti saptamī stobhamātrā🔽punar aparaṃ kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā asaṃkhyeyān aparimāṇān kalpān dānaśīlakṣāntivīryadhyānaprajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: ca iti saptamī stobha mātrā  punar aparam kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā asaṃkhyeyān aparimāṇān kalpān dāna śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna prajñāpāramitām
translated: Thus, this is the seventh mere exclamation.

original: parebhyo vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet kathayed yāvat sūcayet tac cānupalambhayogena /
analyzed: parebhyaḥ vistareṇa saṃprakāśayet kathayet yāvat sūcayet tat ca anupalambha yogena
translated: Moreover, Kausika, a son of good family or a daughter of good family would explain, teach, demonstrate, make known, reveal, analyze, and make clear to others the perfection of giving, morality, patience, vigor, meditation, and wisdom for innumerable, incalculable eons,🔽and that without apprehending anything.🔽He or she would produce even more merit than that.

original: ayan tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet / tatra kauśika katama upalambhaḥ /
analyzed: ayan tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet tatra kauśika katamaḥ upalambhaḥ
translated: Now, Kausika, what is apprehending there?

original: yad bodhisattvasyopalambhayogena dānan dadataḥ /
analyzed: yat bodhisattvasya upalambha yogena dadataḥ
translated: When a Bodhisattva gives a gift through apprehending,

original: evaṃ bhavati /🔽ahaṃ dānan dadāmi /
analyzed: evam bhavati  aham dānan dadāmi
translated: he thinks like this:🔽I am giving a gift.

original: idaṃ dānan dadāmi /
analyzed: idam dānan dadāmi
translated: I am giving this gift.

original: parasmai dānan dadato dānam eva sthāsyati /
analyzed: parasmai dadataḥ dānam eva sthāsyati
translated: When giving a gift to another, only the giving remains.

original: na dānapāramitā / idaṃ śilam /
analyzed: na dāna pāramitā idam śilam
translated: Not the perfection of giving. This is morality.

original: ahaṃ śīlavān /
analyzed: aham śīlavān
translated: I am moral.

original: amūn sattvān rakṣāmi neyaṃ śīlapāramitā / ahaṃ kṣāntim ārabhe /
analyzed: amūn sattvān rakṣāmi na iyam śīla pāramitā aham kṣāntim ārabhe
translated: I protect these beings. This is not the perfection of morality. I undertake patience.

original: imāṃ kṣāntiṃ parasmai kṣamāmi /
analyzed: imām kṣāntim parasmai kṣamāmi
translated: I forgive this patience to another.

original: asyāṃ kṣāntau sthāsyāmi /
analyzed: asyām kṣāntau sthāsyāmi
translated: I will stand in this patience.

original: neyaṃ kṣāntipāramitā / ahaṃ vīryam ārabhe /
analyzed: na iyam kṣānti pāramitā aham vīryam ārabhe
translated: This is not the perfection of patience. I undertake effort.

original: idaṃ vīryam eṣām arthāya /
analyzed: idam vīryam eṣām arthāya
translated: This effort is for their sake.

original: asmin virye sthāsyāmi /
analyzed: asmin virye sthāsyāmi
translated: I will stand in this effort.

original: neyaṃ vīryapāramitā / ahaṃ dhyānaṃ samāpatsye /
analyzed: na iyam vīrya pāramitā aham dhyānam samāpatsye
translated: This is not the perfection of effort. I will attain concentration.

original: idaṃ dhyānam eṣām arthāya samāpatsye /
analyzed: idam dhyānam eṣām arthāya samāpatsye
translated: This concentration I will attain for their sake.

original: atra dhyāne sthāsyāmi /
analyzed: atra dhyāne sthāsyāmi
translated: I will stand in this concentration.

original: neyaṃ dhyānapāramitā / ahaṃ prajñāṃ bhāvayāmi /
analyzed: na iyam dhyāna pāramitā aham prajñām bhāvayāmi
translated: This is not the perfection of concentration. I will cultivate wisdom.

original: iyaṃ prajñā eṣām arthāya /
analyzed: iyam prajñā eṣām arthāya
translated: This wisdom is for their sake.

original: asyāṃ prajñāyāṃ sthāsyāmi /
analyzed: asyām prajñāyām sthāsyāmi
translated: I will stand in this wisdom.

original: nāyaṃ prajñāpāramitā / evaṃ hi kauśika upalambhe caritasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā na dānapāramitā paripūryate /
analyzed: na ayam prajñāpāramitā evam hi kauśika upalambhe caritasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā na dāna pāramitā paripūryate
translated: This is not the perfection of wisdom. Thus, Kauśika, for a son of good family or daughter of good family practicing with reference points, the perfection of giving is not fulfilled.

original: na śīlapāramitā na kṣāntipāramitā na vīryapāramitā na dhyānapāramitā /
analyzed: na śīla pāramitā na kṣānti pāramitā na vīrya pāramitā na dhyāna pāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of effort, the perfection of concentration,

original: na prajñāpāramitā paripūryate /
analyzed: na prajñāpāramitā paripūryate
translated: the perfection of wisdom is not fulfilled.

original: śakra āha / kathaṃ carato bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dānapāramitā paripūryate /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha katham carataḥ bhagavan bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya dāna pāramitā paripūryate
translated: Śakra said: Blessed One, how does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva practicing the perfection of generosity fulfill the perfection of generosity?

original: kathaṃ śīlapāramitā paripūryate /
analyzed: katham śīla pāramitā paripūryate
translated: How does he fulfill the perfection of morality?

original: kathaṃ kṣāntipāramitā /🔽paripūryate /🔽kathaṃ vīryapāramitā paripūryate /

analyzed: anityaḥ duḥkhaḥ na ātmā aśubhaḥ iti upadekṣyanti evam prajñāpāramitā anityā duḥkhā anātmā aśubhā iti

original: upadekṣyanti / evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā dānapāramitā
analyzed: upadekṣyanti evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā dāna pāramitā
translated: In this way they will teach that the perfection of concentration, perfection of perseverance, perfection of patience, perfection of morality, and perfection of generosity,

original: anityā duḥkhānātmāśubhety upadekṣyanti / evam apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīr anityā
analyzed: anityāḥ duḥkha anātma aśubhā iti upadekṣyanti evam apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ anityāḥ
translated: They will teach that the formless absorptions are impermanent,

original: duḥkhānātmānośubhā ity upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: iti upadekṣyanti
translated: suffering, empty, and without self.

original: prajñāpārmitāyāṃ carantaḥ / evam upadekṣyanti smṛtyupasthānāny anityāni duḥkhāny anātmāny
analyzed: prajñāpārmitāyām carantaḥ evam upadekṣyanti smṛti upasthānāni anityāni duḥkhāni anātmāni
translated: Practicing the perfection of wisdom, they will teach thus: 'The applications of mindfulness are impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self.

original: aśubhānīty upadekṣyanti / evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgān anityā🔽duḥkhā anātmāno 'śubhā ity upadekṣyanti prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caranto yāvat sarvākārajñatām
analyzed: aśubhāni iti upadekṣyanti evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgān anityā  duḥkhāḥ anātmānaḥ śubhāḥ iti upadekṣyanti prajñāpāramitāyām carantaḥ yāvat sarva ākāra jña tām
translated: Thus they will teach the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and path to be impermanent,🔽suffering, empty, and without self. Practicing the perfection of wisdom, they will teach thus up to the knowledge of all aspects,

original: anityā duḥkhānātmāśubhety upadekṣyanti / evaṃ ca vakṣyanti ya evaṃ carati sa prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratīti /
analyzed: anityā duḥkhā anātma aśubhā iti upadekṣyanti evam ca vakṣyanti yaḥ evam carati sa prajñāpāramitāyām carati iti
translated: teaching that it is impermanent, suffering, empty, and without self. And they will say, 'One who practices thus practices the perfection of wisdom.'

original: iyaṃ kauśika prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikā /
analyzed: iyam kauśika prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikā
translated: This, Kauśika, is a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśanta evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśantaḥ evam upadekṣyanti
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family teaching the perfection of wisdom will teach thus:

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya sa tvaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayamānaḥ prathamāyāṃ
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya sa tvam prajñāpāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ prathamāyām
translated: Come, son of a good family, develop the perfection of wisdom. You, developing the perfection of wisdom, will stand in the first

original: bhūmau sthāsyasi yāvad daśamyāṃ bhūmau sthāsyasi / evaṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ
analyzed: bhūmau sthāsyasi yāvat daśamyām bhūmau sthāsyasi evam dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām
translated: stage, and will stand in the tenth stage. In the same way, developing the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance,

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ bhāvayamānaḥ prathamāyāṃ bhūmau sthāsyasi
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ prathamāyām bhūmau sthāsyasi
translated: the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, you will stand in the first stage,

original: yāvad daśamyāṃ bhūmau sthāsyasi / tac ca nimittayogenopalambhayogena sarvākārasaṃjñayā
analyzed: yāvat daśamyām bhūmau sthāsyasi tat ca nimitta yogena upalambha yogena sarva ākāra saṃjñayā
translated: and will stand in the tenth stage. And that, through the yoga of signs, through the yoga of apprehension, with the notion of all aspects,

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayiṣyati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām bhāvayiṣyati
translated: you will develop the perfection of wisdom.

original: iyaṃ sā kauśika prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikā /
analyzed: iyam sā kauśika prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikā
translated: This, Kauśika, is the semblance of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā evam upadekṣyanti
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will instruct thus:

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya sa tvaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayamānaḥ śrāvakabhūmiṃ samatikramiṣyasi /
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya sa tvam prajñāpāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ śrāvaka bhūmim samatikramiṣyasi
translated: Come, son of a good family, develop the perfection of wisdom. You, developing the perfection of wisdom, will transcend the stage of the śrāvakas,

original: pratyekabuddhabhūmiṃ samatikramiṣyasi /
analyzed: pratyekabuddha bhūmim samatikramiṣyasi
translated: you will transcend the stage of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: iyaṃ sā kauśika prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikā /
analyzed: iyam sā kauśika prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikā
translated: This, Kauśika, is the semblance of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ mahāyānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ vā kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśanta evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām mahāyānikānām kula putrāṇām vā kula duhitṛṇām vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśantaḥ evam upadekṣyanti
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who teach the perfection of wisdom to those sons of good family or daughters of good family of the Great Vehicle, they should teach like this:

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya sa tvaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayamāno bodhisattvaniyāmam avakramiṣyasi /
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya sa tvam prajñāpāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ bodhisattva niyāmam avakramiṣyasi
translated: Come here, son of good family, cultivate the perfection of wisdom. You, cultivating the perfection of wisdom, will enter into the certainty of enlightenment for bodhisattvas.

original: iyaṃ sā kauśika prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikā /
analyzed: iyam sā kauśika prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikā
translated: This, Kauśika, is the counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśamānā evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā prajñāpāramitām upadiśamānāḥ evam upadekṣyanti
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family who are teaching the perfection of wisdom, they should teach like this:

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya sa tvaṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayamāno 'nutpattikadharmakṣāntiṃ
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya sa tvam prajñāpāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ n utpattika dharma kṣāntim
translated: Come here, son of good family, cultivate the perfection of wisdom. You, cultivating the perfection of wisdom, will attain the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas

original: pratilapsyase sa tvam anutpattikadharmakṣāntiṃ pratilabhya bodhisattvābhijñāsu sthāsyasi
analyzed: pratilapsyase sa tvam anutpattika dharma kṣāntim pratilabhya bodhisattva abhijñāsu sthāsyasi
translated: . Having attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas, you will stand in the higher knowledges of the bodhisattvas

original: sa tvam abhijñāsu sthitvā buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetraṃ saṃkramiṣyasi buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ
analyzed: sa tvam abhijñāsu sthitvā buddhakṣetreṇa buddhakṣetram saṃkramiṣyasi buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: . Having stood in the higher knowledges, you will go from buddha-field to buddha-field, to the blessed buddhas

original: satkaraṇāya gurukaraṇāya mānanāya pūjanāyārcanāyāpacāyanāya /
analyzed: satkaraṇāya gurukaraṇāya mānanāya pūjanāya arcanāya apacāyanāya
translated: for the sake of making them virtuous, for the sake of making them teachers, for the sake of honoring, worshipping, revering, and respecting them.

original: evam upadekṣyanti / evam upadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: evam upadekṣyanti evam upadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti
translated: Thus they will teach. Teaching thus, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ vā kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām vā kula duhitṛṇām vā evam upadekṣyanti
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will teach thus to those sons of good family or daughters of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle:

original: yaḥ kulaputraḥ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati
analyzed: yaḥ kula putraḥ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhīṣyati dhārayiṣyati vācayiṣyati paryavāpsyati
translated: That son of good family who will take up the perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, recite it, study it,

original: yoniśo manasikariṣyati so 'saṃkhyeyam aprameyam aparimāṇaṃ puṇyaskandhaṃ prasaviṣyati /
analyzed: yoniśas manasikariṣyati saḥ u saṃkhyeyam aprameyam aparimāṇam puṇya skandham prasaviṣyati
translated: and wisely attend to it will produce an incalculable, immeasurable, and infinite heap of merit.

original: evaṃ copadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ca upadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti
translated: Teaching thus, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām upadekṣyanti
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will instruct those sons of good family or daughters of good family who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle:

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām
translated: Come, son of good family, having rejoiced in the wholesome roots of the Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones of the past, future, and present,

original: yat kuśalamūlaṃ prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtānāṃ
analyzed: yat kuśala mūlam prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtānām
translated: from the production of the first thought of enlightenment up to the complete nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder,

original: tat sarvam anumodya ekataḥ piṇḍīkṛtyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmaya / evam
analyzed: tat sarvam anumodya ekatas piṇḍīkṛtya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmaya evam
translated: having combined them all into one, dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: upadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kulaputra vā kuladuhitaro vā prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: upadiśamānāḥ kauśika te kula putra vā kula duhitaraḥ vā prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti
translated: Instructing in this way, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will be teaching a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: śakra āha / katham upadiśantas te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ vā kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām
analyzed: śakraḥ āha katham upadiśantaḥ te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitānām kula putrāṇām vā kula duhitṛṇām vā na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām
translated: Śakra said: How, when instructing those sons of good family or daughters of good family who have set out in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, do they not teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: iha kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ bodhisattvayānasaṃprasthitānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: iha kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām bodhisattva yāna saṃprasthitānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām vā prajñāpāramitām upadekṣyanti
translated: Here, Kauśika, the sons or daughters of good family who will teach the perfection of wisdom to those sons or daughters of good family who have set out in the vehicle to the bodhisattvas, they should say this to them:🔽You, son of good family, should train in the perfection of wisdom in this way.

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvayamāno rūpam anityato mā drākṣīs / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvayamānaḥ rūpam anityataḥ mā drākṣīḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Here, Kauśika, those sons or daughters of good family who will teach the perfection of wisdom to those sons or daughters of good family who have set out in the vehicle to the bodhisattvas, saying: Come here, you son of good family! When you cultivate the perfection of wisdom, do not see form as impermanent. Why is that?

original: rūpaṃ rūpasvabhāvena śūnyaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam rūpa svabhāvena śūnyam
translated: Form is empty of the nature of form.

original: yaś ca rūpasvabhāvaḥ so 'bhāvo /
analyzed: yaḥ ca rūpa svabhāvaḥ saḥ
translated: And the nature of form is non-existence.

original: yaś cābhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca abhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And non-existence is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yā prajñāpāramitā tatra rūpan na nityam iti vā anityam iti vā vyapadiśyate / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: yā prajñāpāramitā tatra na nityam iti vā anityam iti vā vyapadiśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, form is not designated as either permanent or impermanent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi rūpam eva tatra na saṃvidyate / kuto nityaṃ vā anityaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi rūpam eva tatra na saṃvidyate kutas nityam vā anityam vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because form itself is not found there. How could it be either permanent or impermanent?

original: evaṃ copadiśantas te kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti / evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānam anityato
analyzed: evam ca upadiśantaḥ te kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam
translated: Teaching in this way, Kauśika, those sons or daughters of good family will not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom. In the same way, do not see feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness as impermanent,

original: mā drākṣīs / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: mā drākṣīḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: or as suffering, or as selfless, or as peaceful. Why is that?

original: vijñānaṃ vijñānasvabhāvena śūnyaṃ /
analyzed: vijñānam vijñāna svabhāvena śūnyam
translated: Consciousness is empty of the nature of consciousness.

original: yaś ca vijñānasvabhāvaḥ so 'bhāvo /
analyzed: yaḥ ca vijñāna svabhāvaḥ saḥ
translated: And the nature of consciousness is non-existent.

original: yaś cābhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca abhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And the non-existent is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yā prajñāpāramitā tatra vijñānaṃ na nityam iti vā anityam iti vā vyapadiśyate / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: yā prajñāpāramitā tatra vijñānam na nityam iti vā anityam iti vā vyapadiśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: In the perfection of wisdom, consciousness is not described as either permanent or impermanent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi vijñānam eva tatra na saṃvidyate / kuto nityaṃ vā anityaṃ vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi vijñānam eva tatra na saṃvidyate kutas nityam vā anityam vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because consciousness itself is not found there. How could it be either permanent or impermanent?🔽Kauśika, those sons or daughters of good family who teach in this way

original: evam upadiśantas te kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām
analyzed: evam upadiśantaḥ te kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām
translated: will not teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: upadekṣyanti / evaṃ vyastasamasteṣu skandhadhātvāyatanapratītyasamutpādāṅgeṣu sarvapāramitāsu
analyzed: upadekṣyanti evam vyasta samasteṣu skandha dhātu āyatana pratītyasamutpāda aṅgeṣu sarva pāramitāsu
translated: Thus in the separate and combined [teachings] on the aggregates, elements, sense fields, dependent origination, all perfections,

original: sarvaśūnyatāsu sarvasamādhiṣu sarvadhāraṇīmukheṣu saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu
analyzed: sarva śūnyatāsu sarva samādhiṣu sarva dhāraṇī mukheṣu saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu
translated: all emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations, all dhāraṇī gateways, the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: satyeṣv aṣṭavimokṣeṣu navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣv apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu
analyzed: satyeṣu aṣṭa vimokṣeṣu nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu
translated: the truths, the eight liberations, the nine successive meditative absorptions, the immeasurables, the dhyānas, and the formless attainments,

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣu ṣaṭsv abhijñāsu daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu ṣaṭsu abhijñāsu daśasu tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu
translated: in the six superknowledges, in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, in the four confidences,

original: catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsv aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣu kartavyam / ehi tvaṃ kulaputra
analyzed: catasṛṣu pratisaṃvitsu aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu kartavyam ehi tvam kula putra
translated: in the four unhindered knowledges, in the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha, should be done. Come, son of a good family,

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya mā ca tvaṃ kulaputra sarvajñatām anityato drākṣīs / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya mā ca tvam kula putra sarvajña tām anityataḥ drākṣīḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: cultivate the perfection of wisdom, and you, son of a good family, do not see all-knowledge as impermanent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sarvajñatā sarvajñatāsvabhāvena śūnyā /
analyzed: tathā hi sarvajña tā sarvajña tā svabhāvena śūnyā
translated: Because all-knowledge is empty of the intrinsic nature of all-knowledge.

original: yaṣ ca sarvajñatāyāḥ svabhāvaḥ so 'bhāvo /
analyzed: yaḥ ca sarvajña tāyāḥ svabhāvaḥ saḥ
translated: And the intrinsic nature of all-knowledge is non-existence.

original: yo 'bhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: yaḥ bhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And non-existence is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yā prajñāpāramitā na tatra sarvajñatāyā nityatā vā anityatā vā vyapadiśyate / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: yā prajñāpāramitā na tatra sarvajña tāyāḥ nitya tā vā anitya tā vā vyapadiśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: In that perfection of wisdom, all-knowledge is not designated as permanent or impermanent. Why is that?

original: tathā hi sarvajñataiva na saṃvidyate / kutaḥ punar nityatā vā anityatā vā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā hi sarvajña tā eva na saṃvidyate kutas punar nitya tā vā anitya tā vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Because all-knowledge itself does not exist, so how could there be permanence or impermanence?

original: evaṃ copadiśantaḥ / kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: evam ca upadiśantaḥ kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti
translated: And those who teach thus, Kauśika, the sons of good family or daughters of good family will not teach a counterfeit of the perfection of wisdom.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā teṣāṃ mahāyānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ vā kuladuhitṛṇāṃ vā evaṃ na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā teṣām mahāyānikānām kula putrāṇām vā kula duhitṛṇām vā evam na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family should not give a counterfeit perfection of wisdom to those sons of good family or daughters of good family who are in the Great Vehicle.

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitāṃ bhāvaya mā ca tvaṃ kaṃcid dharmaṃ drākṣīḥ /
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām bhāvaya mā ca tvam kaṃcid dharmam drākṣīḥ
translated: Come, son of good family, cultivate the perfection of wisdom, and do not see any dharma, and do not stand in any dharma.

original: mā ca kasmiṃcid dharme sthāḥ / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: mā ca kasmiṃcid dharme sthāḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi prajñāpāramitāyāṃ na sa dharmaḥ saṃvidyate yo dharmo draṣṭavyo yatra vā pratiṣṭhātavyaḥ / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tathā hi prajñāpāramitāyām na sa dharmaḥ saṃvidyate yaḥ dharmaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ yatra vā pratiṣṭhātavyaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because in the perfection of wisdom that dharma is not found which is to be seen or in which to stand. Why is that?

original: tathā hi kauśika sarvadharmā svabhāvena śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi kauśika sarva dharmāḥ svabhāvena śūnyāḥ
translated: Because, Kauśika, all dharmas are empty of their own-being.

original: yaś ca dharmaḥ svabhāvena śūnyaḥ so 'bhāvo /
analyzed: yaḥ ca dharmaḥ svabhāvena śūnyaḥ saḥ
translated: And that dharma which is empty of its own-being is a non-existence.

original: yaś cābhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: yaḥ ca abhāvaḥ sā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And that which is a non-existence is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yā prajñāpāramitā sā na kasyacid dharmasyāyuhalaṃ vā niryūhalaṃ vā utpādo vā nirodho
analyzed: yā prajñāpāramitā sā na kasyacid dharmasya āyuhalam vā niryūhalam vā utpādaḥ vā nirodhaḥ
translated: And that which is the perfection of wisdom is not the occasion for any dharma, for its being grasped or ungrasped, for its arising or ceasing,

original: vā ucchedo vā śaśvato vā ekārthatā vā nānārthatā vā āgamo vā nirgamo vā / evam upadiśantaḥ
analyzed: vā ucchedaḥ vā śaśvataḥ vā eka artha tā vā nānā artha tā vā āgamaḥ vā nirgamaḥ vā evam upadiśantaḥ
translated: for its being cut off or eternal, for its being the same or different, for its coming or going. Teaching thus,

original: kauśika te kulaputrā vā kuladuhitaro vā na prajñāpāramitāprativarṇikām upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: kauśika te kula putrāḥ vā kula duhitaraḥ vā na prajñāpāramitā prativarṇikām upadekṣyanti
translated: Kauśika, those sons of good family or daughters of good family will not teach a counterfeit perfection of wisdom.

original: tasmāt tarhi kauśika kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā evaṃ prajñāpāramitāyā artho vyapadeṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi kauśika kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā evam prajñāpāramitāyāḥ arthaḥ vyapadeṣṭavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, the meaning of the perfection of wisdom should be explained in this way to sons of good family or daughters of good family.

original: evam upadiśan kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasaviṣyati / na tv eva
analyzed: evam upadiśan kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasaviṣyati na tu eva
translated: Teaching in this way, a son of good family or a daughter of good family will produce much more merit, not just

original: te pūrvakāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca / ity aṣṭamī stobhamātrā
analyzed: te pūrvakāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca iti aṣṭamī stobha mātrā
translated: those previous sons of good family or daughters of good family. This is the eighth praise, merely a reiteration.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika ye jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvās tān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika ye jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ tān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kim manyase
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, if some son or daughter of good family were to establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the fruit of a stream-enterer, what do you think?

original: kauśikāpi nu sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kauśika api nu sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Kauśika, would that son or daughter of good family produce a lot of merit?

original: śakra āha / bahu bhagavan bahu sugata /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha bahu bhagavan bahu sugata
translated: Śakra said, A lot, Blessed One, a lot, Sugata!

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet / ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: atas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Kauśika, a son or daughter of good family would produce even more merit than that by teaching this perfection of wisdom in detail to others, explaining its meaning, revealing its import,

original: sārthāṃ savyañjanāṃ parebhyo naikaiḥ paryāyaiḥ kathayiṣyati deśayiṣyati vibhāvayiṣyati
analyzed: sa arthām sa vyañjanām parebhyaḥ na ekaiḥ paryāyaiḥ kathayiṣyati deśayiṣyati vibhāvayiṣyati
translated: He will teach it, demonstrate it, proclaim it, reveal it, explain it, and make it clear to others in many ways.

original: uttānīkariṣyati saṃprakāśayiṣyati / evaṃ ca vakṣyanti ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitām
analyzed: uttānīkariṣyati saṃprakāśayiṣyati evam ca vakṣyanti ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām
translated: He will say, ‘Come here, son of noble family! Take up the perfection of wisdom,

original: udgṛhṇīṣva paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśo manasikuru yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: udgṛhṇīṣva paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśas manasikuru yathā upadiṣṭāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: master it, bear it in mind, recite it, understand it correctly, and practice it just as it has been taught.

original: pratipadyasva / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: pratipadyasva tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And why is that?

original: ato hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ srotaāpannaś ca srotaāpattiphalaṃ ca prabhāvyate / tiṣṭhantu kauśika jāmbudvīpakāḥ sarvasattvāḥ srotaāpattiphale
analyzed: atas hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ srotaāpannaḥ ca srotaāpatti phalam ca prabhāvyate tiṣṭhantu kauśika jāmbudvīpakāḥ sarva sattvāḥ srotaāpatti phale
translated: Kauśika, it is because from the perfection of wisdom the stream-enterers and the fruit of stream-entry are manifested. Let alone all beings in Jambudvīpa established in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: tiṣṭhantu cāturdvīpakāḥ sarvasattvāḥ srotaāpattiphale vinītās /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu cāturdvīpakāḥ sarva sattvāḥ srotaāpatti phale vinītāḥ
translated: let alone all beings in the four continents established in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: tiṣṭhantu sāhasre lokadhātau sarvasattvāḥ srotaāpattiphale vinītās /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvāḥ srotaāpatti phale vinītāḥ
translated: let alone all beings in a world system consisting of a thousand worlds established in the fruit of stream-entry,

original: tiṣṭhantu dvisāhasre lokadhātau sarvasattvāḥ srotaāpattiphale vinītāḥ / tiṣṭhantu kauśika trisāhasramahāsāhasre lokadhātau sarvasattvsḥ srotaāpattiphale
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu dvi sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvāḥ srotaāpatti phale vinītāḥ tiṣṭhantu kauśika tri sāhasra mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvsaḥ srotaāpatti phale
translated: Let alone the beings in the world systems of the two-thousand-fold world-realm established in the fruit of stream-entry. Let alone, Kauśika, the beings in the world systems of the great-three-thousand-fold world-realm established in the fruit of stream-entry.

original: yāvantaḥ kauśika pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadivālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvās tān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ kauśika pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadi vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ tān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā
translated: As many beings as there are, Kauśika, in the world systems in the eastern direction, in world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges river, some son of a good family or daughter of a good family might establish them all in the fruit of stream-entry.

original: srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayet / evaṃ dakṣiṇasyāṃ paścimāyām uttarasyāṃ vidikṣūrdhvam🔽adho gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvās tān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā
analyzed: srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayet evam dakṣiṇasyām paścimāyām uttarasyām vidikṣu ūrdhvam  adhas gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ tān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā
translated: In the same way, in the southern, western, northern, in the intermediate directions, above and below,

original: vā srotaāpattiphale pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: vā srotaāpatti phale pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kim manyase
translated: in the world systems equal to the sands of the Ganges river, some son of a good family or daughter of a good family might establish the beings in the fruit of stream-entry. What do you think about this, Kauśika?

original: kauśikāpi nu sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kauśika api nu sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate a lot of merit on that basis?”

original: śakra āha / bahu bhagavan bahu sugata /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha bahu bhagavan bahu sugata
translated: Śakra said, “A lot, Blessed One, a lot, Sugata!”

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: ataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavati / ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ🔽parebhyaḥ / sārthāṃ savyañjanāṃ vistareṇa kathayed deśayed artham asyāḥ saṃprakāśayed
analyzed: atas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavati yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām  parebhyaḥ sa arthām sa vyañjanām vistareṇa kathayet deśayet artham asyāḥ saṃprakāśayet
translated: Therefore, Kauśika, that son of good family or daughter of good family generates much more merit, who for others🔽explains, teaches, reveals the meaning of this,

original: vibhajed vibhāvayed vicared uttānīkuryāt saṃprakāśayed /
analyzed: vibhajet vibhāvayet vicaret uttānīkuryāt saṃprakāśayet
translated: divides, illuminates, analyzes, elucidates, and makes clear this perfection of wisdom together with the meaning and the teaching,🔽and says this: 'Come here, son of good family! Take up the perfection of wisdom, study it, bear it in mind, recite it, properly pay attention to it,

original: evaṃ ca vaded ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīṣva paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśo manasikuru yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: evam ca vadet ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām udgṛhṇīṣva paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśas manasikuru yathā upadiṣṭāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: and practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: pratipadyasva / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: pratipadyasva tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ato hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ srotaāpannaḥ prabhāvyate /
analyzed: atas hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ srotaāpannaḥ prabhāvyate
translated: Because from this perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, the stream-enterer is manifested.

original: iti navamī stobhamātrety uktaḥ stobhaḥ
analyzed: iti navamī stobha mātrā iti uktaḥ stobhaḥ
translated: Thus the ninth praise is stated.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yāvanto jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvās tān sarvān sakṛdāgāmiphale pratiṣṭhapayet / iti prathamā praśaṃsāmātrā
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā yāvantaḥ jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ tān sarvān sakṛdāgāmi phale pratiṣṭhapayet iti prathamā praśaṃsā mātrā
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, a son of good family or daughter of good family who would establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the fruit of once-returning - this is the first mere praise.

original: yāvad anāgāmiphale pratiṣṭhāpayet / iti dvitīyā praśaṃsāmātrā
analyzed: yāvat anāgāmi phale pratiṣṭhāpayet iti dvitīyā praśaṃsā mātrā
translated: up to establishing them in the fruit of non-returner. This is the second mere praise.

original: yāvad arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: yāvat arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kim manyase
translated: up to establishing them in arhatship. What do you think, Kauśika?

original: kauśikāpi nu sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tatonidānaṃ bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: kauśika api nu sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tatonidānam bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: Would that son of a good family or daughter of a good family generate even more merit on that basis?

original: śakra āha / bahu bhagavan bahu sugata /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha bahu bhagavan bahu sugata
translated: Śakra said, Much, Blessed One, much, Sugata.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ataḥ sa kauśika kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet / ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: atas sa kauśika kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā bahutaram puṇyam prasavet yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām
translated: Kauśika, that son of a good family or daughter of a good family would generate even more merit than that, who,

original: sārthāṃ savyañjanāṃ vistareṇopadiśet kathayet saṃprakāśayed vibhajed vibhāvayed vicared uttānīkuryād /
analyzed: sa arthām sa vyañjanām vistareṇa upadiśet kathayet saṃprakāśayet vibhajet vibhāvayet vicaret uttānīkuryāt
translated: having taken up this perfection of wisdom with its meaning and its phrasing, would teach it extensively, explain it, make it clear, set it forth, reveal it, analyze it, and make it plain.

original: evaṃ vaded ehi tvaṃ kulaputra prajñāpāramitām udgṛhāṇa paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśo manasikuru yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ pratipadyasva /
analyzed: evam vadet ehi tvam kula putra prajñāpāramitām udgṛhāṇa paryavāpnuhi dhāraya vācaya yoniśas manasikuru yathā upadiṣṭāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām pratipadyasva
translated: He would say, 'Come here, son of a good family. Take up the perfection of wisdom. Master it. Bear it in mind. Read it aloud. Attend properly to it. And practice the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ato hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ prajñāyate /
analyzed: atas hi kauśika prajñāpāramitāyāḥ sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam prajñāyate
translated: Because from this perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, and arhatship are known.

original: tiṣṭhantu kauśika jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ sakṛdāgāmy anāgāmy arhattve vinītā yaḥ kaścit
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu kauśika jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ sakṛdāgāmī anāgāmī arhat tve vinītāḥ yaḥ kaścid
translated: Let alone the beings in Jambudvīpa trained in the state of once-returner, non-returner, and arhatship,

original: kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā cāturdvīpakān sarvasattvān arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet / sāhasre
analyzed: kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā cāturdvīpakān sarva sattvān arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet sāhasre
translated: if some son or daughter of good family were to establish all beings in the four continents in the state of arhatship,

original: lokadhātau sarvasattvān arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet / dvisāhasre lokadhātau sarvasattvān🔽arhattve pratiṣḥāpayet / trisāhasre /
analyzed: lokadhātau sarva sattvān arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet dvi sāhasre lokadhātau sarva sattvān  arhat tve pratiṣṭāpayet tri sāhasre
translated: in the world system of a thousand worlds, were to establish all beings in the state of arhatship, in the world system of two-thousand worlds, were to establish all beings🔽in the state of arhatship, in the world system of three-thousand great-thousand worlds, were to establish all beings

original: lokadhātau sarvasattvān arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet /
analyzed: lokadhātau sarva sattvān arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: in the state of arhatship.

original: yāvantaḥ kauśika pūrvasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvās tān
analyzed: yāvantaḥ kauśika pūrvasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ tān
translated: Kauśika, to the extent that in the eastern direction, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, all beings

original: sarvān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yāvad arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet / evaṃ
analyzed: sarvān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā yāvat arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet evam
translated: were all established by some son or daughter of good family up to the state of arhatship,

original: dakṣiṇasyāṃ diśi paścimāyām uttarasyāṃ diśi vidikṣūrdhvam adho gaṅgānadīvālukpameṣu
analyzed: dakṣiṇasyām diśi paścimāyām uttarasyām diśi vidikṣu ūrdhvam adhas gaṅgā nadī vālukpameṣu
translated: in the southern direction, in the western direction, in the northern direction, in the intermediate directions, above and below, in world systems numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvās tān sarvān yāvad arhattve pratiṣṭhāpayet / tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ tān sarvān yāvat arhat tve pratiṣṭhāpayet tat kim manyase
translated: were all established by all of them up to the state of arhatship. What do you think about this?

original: yāvad daśasu dikṣv ekaikasyāṃ diśi gangānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarvasattvās
analyzed: yāvat daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi gangā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu sarva sattvāḥ
translated: up to as many beings as there are in the world systems in the ten directions, in each direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: tān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhita vā avinivartanīyabhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayed /
analyzed: tān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhita vā a vinivartanīya bhūmau pratiṣṭhāpayet
translated: Some son of a good family or daughter of a good family would establish them in the irreversible stage.

original: yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ teṣāṃ sattvānām upadiśed yāvat saṃprakāśayet sārthāṃ savyañjanām /🔽evaṃ vaded ehi tvaṃ kulaputra imāṃ prajñāpāramitām udgṛhāṇa dhāraya vācaya deśaya
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām teṣām sattvānām upadiśet yāvat saṃprakāśayet sa arthām sa vyañjanām  evam vadet ehi tvam kula putra imām prajñāpāramitām udgṛhāṇa dhāraya vācaya deśaya
translated: And some son of a good family or daughter of a good family would teach this perfection of wisdom to those beings, would make it clear, together with its meaning and its phrasing, up to the point of demonstrating it.🔽He would say, 'Come here, son of a good family! Take up this perfection of wisdom, bear it in mind, read it aloud,

original: saṃprakāśaya paryavāpnuhi yoniśo manasikuru yathopadiṣṭāyāṃ ca prajñāpāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: saṃprakāśaya paryavāpnuhi yoniśas manasikuru yathā upadiṣṭāyām ca prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: teach it, make it clear, up to the point of reciting it. Thoroughly bring to mind the perfection of wisdom as it has been taught.

original: pratipadyasvātra hi tvaṃ pratipadyamāno 'vinivartanīyabhūmau sthāsyasi /
analyzed: pratipadyasva atra hi tvam pratipadyamānaḥ vinivartanīya bhūmau sthāsyasi
translated: Practicing here, you will stand in the irreversible stage.

original: anupūrveṇānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsyase
translated: In due course, you will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.'

original: ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet /
analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet
translated: This one would produce merit that is much greater than that.

original: punar aparaṃ kauśika yaḥ kaścit kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā yāvanto /
analyzed: punar aparam kauśika yaḥ kaścid kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā yāvantaḥ
translated: Furthermore, Kauśika, whoever some son of a good family or daughter of a good family

original: jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvās tān sarvān avinivartanīyatve sthāpayed anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau
analyzed: jāmbudvīpakāḥ sattvāḥ tān sarvān a vinivartanīya tve sthāpayet anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: would establish all the beings in Jambudvīpa in the irreversible stage with regard to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: tebhyaś ca prajñāpāramitām upadiśet saṃprakāśayed vibhāvayed vicared uttānīkuryād
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca prajñāpāramitām upadiśet saṃprakāśayet vibhāvayet vicaret uttānīkuryāt
translated: And to them he would teach the perfection of wisdom, would expound it, make it known, set it forth, explain it, analyze it, and make it clear;

original: vibhajet sārthāṃ savyañjanāṃ tebhyo 'nyatarebhyo brūyād ahaṃ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsya iti /
analyzed: vibhajet sārthām sa vyañjanām tebhyaḥ nyatarebhyaḥ brūyāt aham kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti
translated: he would say to them, 'I will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.'

original: tasmin kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā imāṃ prajñāpāramitāṃ vistareṇa sārthaṃ
analyzed: tasmin kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā imām prajñāpāramitām vistareṇa sārtham
translated: To that one, some son of a good family or daughter of a good family would teach this perfection of wisdom in detail, with its meaning,

original: savyañjanām upadiśed deśayet saṃprakāśayed vibhāvayed vibhajed vistareṇottānikuryād
analyzed: sa vyañjanām upadiśet deśayet saṃprakāśayet vibhāvayet vibhajet vistareṇa uttānikuryāt
translated: with its letters, would explain it, make it known, reveal it, analyze it, and make it clear in detail.

original: ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasaved yāvad daśasu dikṣv ekaikasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu
analyzed: ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet yāvat daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu
translated: This one would produce much more merit than that, up to in the ten directions, in each direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: lokadhātuṣu sattvās tān kaścid eva kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā avinivartanīyatve sthāpayet
analyzed: lokadhātuṣu sattvāḥ tān kaścid eva kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā a vinivartanīya tve sthāpayet
translated: if some son of a good family or daughter of a good family would establish those beings in irreversibility,

original: tebhyaḥ kaścid eva imāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadiśet tebhyaś caikaḥ kaścid evaṃ brūyād
analyzed: tebhyaḥ kaścid eva imām prajñāpāramitām upadiśet tebhyaḥ ca ekaḥ kaścid evam brūyāt
translated: and if some among them would teach this perfection of wisdom to them, and if one among them would say,

original: ahaṃ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsya iti /
analyzed: aham kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbhotsye iti
translated: 'I will quickly fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.'

original: yaś ca tasmai imāṃ prajñāpāramitām upadiśed deśayet saṃprakāśayed vibhāvayed vicared
analyzed: yaḥ ca tasmai imām prajñāpāramitām upadiśet deśayet saṃprakāśayet vibhāvayet vicaret
translated: And whoever teaches, explains, illuminates, analyzes,

original: uttānīkuryād vibhajet sārthāṃ savyañjanām ayam eva tato bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: uttānīkuryāt vibhajet sa arthām sa vyañjanām ayam eva tatas bahutaram puṇyam prasavet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: expounds, and divides this perfection of wisdom together with its meaning to them, he would produce even more merit than that. Why is that?

original: avaivartikebhyo hi bodhisattvebhyo 'tyarthaṃ dharma upadeṣṭavyo niyatā hi te saṃbodhiparāyaṇā
analyzed: avaivartikebhyaḥ hi bodhisattvebhyaḥ tyartham dharmaḥ upadeṣṭavyaḥ niyatāḥ hi te saṃbodhi parāyaṇāḥ
translated: Because the Dharma should be taught to the irreversible bodhisattvas to a great extent, for they are determined and intent on complete enlightenment.

original: na te bhūyo vinivartante 'nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodher amī bhūtkaṇṭhitāḥ saṃsārād mahākaruṇāsaṃpīḍitāś
analyzed: na te bhūyas vinivartante nuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ amī saṃsārāt mahā karuṇā saṃpīḍitāḥ
translated: They do not turn back again from unsurpassed complete enlightenment. They are eager for the sake of the world, greatly afflicted by great compassion.

original: ca / iti navamī praśaṃsāmātrety uktvā praśaṃsā
analyzed: ca iti navamī praśaṃsā mātrā iti uktvā praśaṃsā
translated: Thus, having said this is the ninth praise alone, he praises.

original: śakra āha / yathāyathā bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattva āsannībhavaty anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodhes
analyzed: śakraḥ āha yathā yathā bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ āsannībhavati anuttarāyāḥ samyaksaṃbodheḥ
translated: Śakra said: As a bodhisattva mahāsattva approaches unsurpassed complete enlightenment,

original: tathātathā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'vavaditavyo 'nuśāsanīyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: tathā tathā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ vavaditavyaḥ nuśāsanīyaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām dhyāna pāramitāyām
translated: to that extent a bodhisattva mahāsattva should be instructed and advised in the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration,

original: vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ dānapāramitāyām avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām dāna pāramitāyām avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ
translated: He should be advised and instructed in the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving.

original: sarvaśūnyatāsv avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva śūnyatāsu avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ
translated: He should be advised and instructed in all the emptinesses.

original: smṛtyupasthāṇeṣu samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgeṣv avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: smṛti upasthāṇeṣu samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgeṣu avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ
translated: He should be advised and instructed in the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣv āryasatyeṣu śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣv avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu ārya satyeṣu śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ
translated: He should be advised and instructed in the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless absorptions, the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: aṣṭavimokṣeṣu navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣv abhijñāsv avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣeṣu nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu abhijñāsu avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ
translated: He should be advised and instructed in the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions, and the superknowledges.

original: sarvasamādhiṣu sarvadhāraṇīmukheṣu daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu
analyzed: sarva samādhiṣu sarva dhāraṇī mukheṣu daśasu tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu
translated: He should be advised and instructed in all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses,

original: pratisaṃvitsv aṣṭādaśāsv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣv avavaditavyo 'nuśāsitavyaḥ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārair anugrāhyaḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃvitsu aṣṭādaśāsu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu avavaditavyaḥ nuśāsitavyaḥ cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ anugrāhyaḥ
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. He should be assisted with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for sicknesses, and with the requisites of a monk.

original: sa ca bodhisattvo mahāsattvo dharmāmiṣāsaṃgrahābhyām anugrahitavyaḥ / ayam eva dharmāmiṣānugrāhakas tato bahutaraṃ /
analyzed: sa ca bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ dharma āmiṣa asaṃgrahābhyām anugrahitavyaḥ ayam eva dharma āmiṣa anugrāhakaḥ tatas bahutaram
translated: And that bodhisattva mahāsattva should be favored with the Dharma and material gifts. This very one who favors with the Dharma and material gifts would produce much more

original: puṇyaṃ prasavet / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: puṇyam prasavet tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: merit than that. Why is that?

original: evam etad bhavati yad bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ pāramitāsv avavādyate 'nuśāsyate / sarvaśūnyatāsu🔽sarvabodhipakṣyeṣu dharmeṣv apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣv āryasatyeṣu śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣv
analyzed: evam etat bhavati yat bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ pāramitāsu avavādyate nuśāsyate sarva śūnyatāsu  sarva bodhi pakṣyeṣu dharmeṣu a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu ārya satyeṣu śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu
translated: It is so that the bodhisattva mahāsattva is instructed and advised in the perfections, in the emptinesses,

original: abhijñāsu samādhiṣu sarvadhāraṇīmukheṣu daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu vaiśāradyeṣu pratisaṃvitsv
analyzed: abhijñāsu samādhiṣu sarva dhāraṇī mukheṣu daśasu tathāgata baleṣu vaiśāradyeṣu pratisaṃvitsu
translated: in the factors of awakening, in the concentrations, the liberations, the samādhis, and the samāpattis, in the perfections, in the ten powers of the Tathāgata, in the four fearlessnesses, in the four discriminations,

original: aṣṭādaśasv āveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣv avabodhyate 'nuśāsyate /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśasu āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu avabodhyate nuśāsyate
translated: in the eighteen distinct attributes of a Buddha, in the thirty-two major marks of a great man, and in the eighty minor marks.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, lord of the gods:

original: sādhu sādhu kauśika yas tvaṃ bodhisattvayānikānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇāṃ cotsāhaṃ dadāsi /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu kauśika yaḥ tvam bodhisattva yānikānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām ca utsāham dadāsi
translated: Good, good, Kauśika! In that you give encouragement to the sons of the lineage and daughters of the lineage who are in the Bodhisattva Vehicle,

original: evam eva tvayā karaṇīyaṃ ya āryaśrāvakāḥ sattvān anugrahītukāmās te bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām anugrahaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: evam eva tvayā karaṇīyam ye ārya śrāvakāḥ sattvān anugrahītu kāmāḥ te bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām anugraham kurvanti
translated: In the same way, you should act. Those noble disciples who wish to benefit beings, they benefit the bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau anugṛhṇanti dharmāmiṣānugrahābhyāṃ cānupālayanti / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau anugṛhṇanti dharma āmiṣa anugrahābhyām ca anupālayanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: They assist in unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, and they protect through the assistance of Dharma and material things. Why is that?

original: ataḥ prabhavo hi bhagavataḥ śrāvakasaṃghaḥ /
analyzed: atas prabhavaḥ hi bhagavataḥ śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: Because the Blessed One's assembly of disciples originates from them.

original: ataḥ pratyekabuddhayānam ato mahāyānam / yadi hi bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ notpāditam abhaviṣyat /
analyzed: atas pratyekabuddha yānam atas mahāyānam yadi hi bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam na utpāditam abhaviṣyat
translated: From them comes the Pratyekabuddha-yāna, from them comes the Great Vehicle. If the mind for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment had not been generated by the bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: tadā bodhisattvo mahāsattvo nāśikṣiṣyat ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu na saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyeṣu
analyzed: tadā bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na aśikṣiṣyat ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu na saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyeṣu
translated: then the bodhisattva mahāsattva would not have trained in the six perfections, in the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment,

original: dharmeṣu nāryasatyeṣu nāṣṭasu vimokṣeṣu na navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣu nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣu
analyzed: dharmeṣu na ārya satyeṣu na aṣṭasu vimokṣeṣu na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu
translated: in the four noble truths, in the eight liberations, in the nine successive meditative absorptions, in the immeasurable, concentration, formless attainments,

original: na ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣu nādhyātmaśūnyatāyāṃ na bahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ
analyzed: na ṣaṭsu pāramitāsu na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu na adhyātma śūnyatāyām na bahirdhā śūnyatāyām
translated: in the six perfections, in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, in the inner emptiness, in the outer emptiness,
