original: kuśalamūlāny / anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmitāni bhavanti / kathaṃ cānumodanāsahagataṃ
analyzed: kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmitāni bhavanti katham ca anumodanā sahagatam
translated: and the roots of the wholesome are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. And how does a wholesome action that is accompanied by rejoicing,

original: puṇyakriyāvastu parigṛhya pariṇāmitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: puṇya kriyā vastu parigṛhya pariṇāmitam bhavati
translated: when taken up and dedicated, become great?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: sacet maitreya navayānasaṃprasthito bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ cariṣyati /
analyzed: saced maitreya nava yāna saṃprasthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām cariṣyati
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: tāṃ ca prajñāpāramitām anupalambhayogena grahīṣyati na nimittayogena / evaṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ /
analyzed: tām ca prajñāpāramitām anupalambha yogena grahīṣyati na nimitta yogena evam dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām
translated: and takes up that perfection of wisdom through the yoga of non-apprehension, not through the yoga of signs, and likewise the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitām anupalambhayogena grahīṣyati na nimittayogena / adhyātmaśūnyatāyām
analyzed: śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām anupalambha yogena grahīṣyati na nimitta yogena adhyātma śūnyatāyām
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving through the yoga of non-apprehension, not through the yoga of signs, and is very receptive to the emptiness of internal phenomena,

original: adhimuktibahulo bhavīṣyati / bahirdhāśūnyatāyām adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāyāṃ yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāyām
analyzed: adhimukti bahulaḥ bhavīṣyati bahirdhā śūnyatāyām adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyām yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyām
translated: the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence,

original: adhimuktibahulo bhaviṣyati / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiṣv āryasatyeṣv adhimuktibahulo
analyzed: adhimukti bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattiṣu ārya satyeṣu adhimukti bahulaḥ
translated: and is very receptive to the immeasurables, concentrations, formless absorptions, and noble truths,

original: bhaviṣyati / aṣṭavimokṣeṣu navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiṣv adhimuktibahulo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati aṣṭa vimokṣeṣu nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattiṣu adhimukti bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: will have great devotion to the eight liberations, the nine serial absorptions,

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihiteṣv adhimuktibahulo bhaviṣyati / abhijñāsu sarvasamādhiṣu sarvadhāraṇīmukheṣv🔽adhimuktibahulo bhaviṣyati / daśasu tathāgatabaleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihiteṣu adhimukti bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati abhijñāsu sarva samādhiṣu sarva dhāraṇī mukheṣu  adhimukti bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati daśasu tathāgata baleṣu caturṣu vaiśāradyeṣu catasṛṣu
translated: will have great devotion to emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, will have great devotion to the superknowledges, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: pratisaṃvitsv aṣṭādaśāveṇikeṣu buddhadharmeṣv adhimuktibahulo bhaviṣyati / kalyāṇamitraparigṛhitaś
analyzed: pratisaṃvitsu aṣṭādaśa āveṇikeṣu buddha dharmeṣu adhimukti bahulaḥ bhaviṣyati kalyāṇa mitra parigṛhitaḥ
translated: will have great devotion to the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha. He will be assisted by spiritual friends,

original: ca bhaviṣyati / tāni cāsya kalyāṇamitrāṇimām eva prajñāpāramitāṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyati tāni ca asya kalyāṇa mitrāṇi imām eva prajñāpāramitām dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām
translated: and those spiritual friends will teach him this perfection of wisdom, this perfection of concentration, this perfection of perseverance,

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ sārthāṃ savyañjanām upadekṣyanti / tathā
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām sa arthām sa vyañjanām upadekṣyanti tathā
translated: this perfection of patience, this perfection of morality, and this perfection of giving, along with their meanings and their etymologies. They will teach them

original: copadekṣyanti yathā prajñāpāramitayā avirahīto bhaviṣyaty evaṃ sarvābhiḥ pāramitābhir
analyzed: ca upadekṣyanti yathā prajñāpāramitayā avirahītaḥ bhaviṣyati evam sarvābhiḥ pāramitābhiḥ
translated: in such a way that he will not be separated from the perfection of wisdom, and in the same way he will not be separated from all the perfections,

original: avirahito bhaviṣyati / yāvat sarvaśūnyatābhiḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyair dharmair āryasatyair
analyzed: avirahitaḥ bhaviṣyati yāvat sarva śūnyatābhiḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyaiḥ dharmaiḥ ārya satyaiḥ
translated: He will not be separated from the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths,

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattibhiḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitair aṣṭābhir vimokṣair navabhir
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattibhiḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitaiḥ aṣṭābhiḥ vimokṣaiḥ navabhiḥ
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, the emptiness, signless, and wishless [gates to liberation], the eight liberations,

original: anupūrvavīhārasamāpattibhiḥ sarvasamādhiḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhair daśabhiḥ tathāgatabalaiś
analyzed: anupūrva vīhāra samāpattibhiḥ sarva samādhiḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhaiḥ daśabhiḥ tathāgata balaiḥ
translated: the nine serial absorptions, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: caturbhir vaiśāradyaiś catasṛbhiḥ pratisaṃvidbhir aṣṭābaśabhir āveṇikair buddhadharmair
analyzed: caturbhiḥ vaiśāradyaiḥ catasṛbhiḥ pratisaṃvidbhiḥ aṣṭābaśabhiḥ āveṇikaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: avirahito bhaviṣyati / yāvad bodhisattvanyāmam avakrānto bhaviṣyati / mārakarmāṇi copadekṣyanti /
analyzed: avirahitaḥ bhaviṣyati yāvat bodhisattva nyāmam avakrāntaḥ bhaviṣyati māra karmāṇi ca upadekṣyanti
translated: and he will not be separated from the bodhisattva stages until he has entered into the certainty of a bodhisattva. He will be taught the deeds of Māra.

original: tasya tāni mārakarmāṇi śrutvā na hānir na vṛddhir bhaviṣyati / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tasya tāni māra karmāṇi śrutvā na hāniḥ na vṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Having heard about those deeds of Māra, he will not decline nor will he progress. Why is that?

original: tathā hi teṣāṃ mārakarmaṇāṃ svabhāvo nopadṛśyate / buddhair bhagavadbhir avirahitaḥ
analyzed: tathā hi teṣām māra karmaṇām svabhāvaḥ na upadṛśyate buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ avirahitaḥ
translated: Because the intrinsic nature of those deeds of Māra is not seen. He will not be separated from the buddhas, the blessed ones,

original: syād yāvan bodhisattvanyāmam avakrānteti / tatra ca kuśalamūlāny avaropayiṣyati / taiś
analyzed: syāt yāvan bodhisattva nyāmam avakrāntā iti tatra ca kuśala mūlāni avaropayiṣyati taiḥ
translated: until he has entered into the certainty of a bodhisattva. There he will plant wholesome roots with those

original: ca kuśalamūlair bodhisattvakulaṃ grahīṣyati / tena ca bodhisattvakulena na jātu virahito
analyzed: ca kuśala mūlaiḥ bodhisattva kulam grahīṣyati tena ca bodhisattva kulena na jātu
translated: and will be born in the family of the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas. And he will never be separated from that family of the bodhisattvas.

original: bhaviṣyati yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: and will be born in the family of the bodhisattvas through the roots of virtue, and will never be separated from that family of the bodhisattvas until they have attained supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: punar aparaṃ navayānasaṃprasthitena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam nava yāna saṃprasthitena bodhisattvena mahāsattvena teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle should pay homage to those Buddhas, Blessed Ones,

original: chinnavartmanāṃ chinnavartmanīnāṃ chinnaprapañcabhavanetrikāṇāṃ paryāttabāṣpāṇāṃ
analyzed: chinna vartmanām chinna vartmanīnām chinna prapañca bhava netrikāṇām paryātta bāṣpāṇām
translated: whose path has been cut off, whose path has been cut off, whose web of conceptual thoughts has been cut off, whose tears have been exhausted,

original: marditakaṇṭakānām apahṛtabhārāṇām anuprāptasvakārthānāṃ parikṣīṇabhavasaṃyojanānāṃ
analyzed: mardita kaṇṭakānām apahṛta bhārāṇām anuprāpta svaka arthānām parikṣīṇa bhava saṃyojanānām
translated: whose thorns have been crushed, whose burdens have been laid down, who have attained their own goal, who have exhausted the fetters of existence,

original: samyagājñāsuvimukticittānāṃ sarvacetavaśiparamapāramitāprāptānāṃ /
analyzed: samyak ājñā su vimukti cittānām sarva ceta vaśi parama pāramitā prāptānām
translated: whose minds are well liberated by right knowledge, who have attained the highest perfection of all mental powers,

original: ye te daśasu dikṣv aprameyeṣv asaṃkhyeyeṣu tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhās tiṣṭhanti
analyzed: ye te daśasu dikṣu aprameyeṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones who are in the immeasurable, incalculable [Buddha] fields in the ten directions,🔽who are dwelling,

original: dhriyante yāpayanti dharmañ ca deśayanti teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ
analyzed: dhriyante yāpayanti dharmam ca deśayanti teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: who are maintaining [their existence], who are teaching the Dharma, to those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, together with their assemblies of disciples,

original: ye puṇyābhisaṃskārā yair vā tatra kuśalamulāny avaropitāni kṣatriyamahāśālakuleṣu /
analyzed: ye puṇya abhisaṃskārāḥ yaiḥ vā tatra kuśala mulāni avaropitāni kṣatriya mahāśāla kuleṣu
translated: or the wholesome roots that have been planted there by those who have created meritorious actions, in the families of the great warrior-nobles,

original: vā brāhmaṇamahāśālakuleṣu vā gṛhapatimahāśālakuleṣu vā cāturmahārājakāyikeṣu vā deveṣu /
analyzed: vā brāhmaṇa mahāśāla kuleṣu vā gṛhapati mahāśāla kuleṣu vā cāturmahārājakāyikeṣu vā deveṣu
translated: or in the families of the great brahmins, or in the families of the great householders, or among the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: trāyastriṃśeṣu vā yāmeṣu vā tuṣiteṣu vā nirmāṇaratiṣu vā paranirmitavaśavartiṣu vā deveṣu /
analyzed: trāyastriṃśeṣu vā yāmeṣu vā tuṣiteṣu vā nirmāṇaratiṣu vā paranirmitavaśavartiṣu vā deveṣu
translated: or among the Thirty-Three gods, or among the Yāma gods, or among the Tuṣita gods, or among the gods who delight in creation, or among the gods who control the creations of others,

original: brahmapārṣadyeṣu vā brahmapurohiteṣu vā mahābrahmasu vā parīttābheṣu vā apramāṇābheṣu
analyzed: brahma pārṣadyeṣu vā brahmapurohiteṣu vā mahābrahmasu vā parīttābheṣu vā apramāṇābheṣu
translated: or among the gods of Brahmā's retinue, or among the gods who are priests of Brahmā, or among the Mahā-Brahmā gods, or among the gods of limited radiance, or among the gods of unlimited radiance,

original: vā ābhāsvareṣu vā parīttaśubheṣu vā apramāṇaśubheṣu vā śubhakṛtsneṣu vā anabhrakeṣu
analyzed: vā ābhāsvareṣu vā parītta śubheṣu vā apramāṇa śubheṣu vā śubhakṛtsneṣu vā anabhrakeṣu
translated: or among the shining gods, or among the gods of limited beauty, or among the gods of unlimited beauty, or among the gods of complete beauty, or among the gods without affliction,

original: vā puṇyaprasaveṣu vā bṛhatphaleṣu vā suddhāvāseṣu vā avṛheṣu vā atapeṣu vā sudṛśeṣu
analyzed: vā puṇyaprasaveṣu vā bṛhatphaleṣu vā suddhāvāseṣu vā avṛheṣu vā atapeṣu vā sudṛśeṣu
translated: or among the gods of abundant merit, or among the gods of great fruit, or among the Śubhakṛtsna gods, or among the Avṛha gods, or among the Atapa gods, or among the Sudṛśa gods,

original: vā sudarśaneṣu vā akaniṣṭheṣu vā deveṣu kuśalamūlāny avaropitāni sarvāny abhisaṃkṣipya
analyzed: vā sudarśaneṣu vā akaniṣṭheṣu vā deveṣu kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni sarvāni abhisaṃkṣipya
translated: or among the Sudarśana gods, or among the Akaniṣṭha gods, all those wholesome roots, having collected them together,

original: piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā agrayānumodanayā śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā uttamayā
analyzed: piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā agrayā anumodanayā śreṣṭhayā jyeṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā uttamayā
translated: having combined them and weighed them, with the foremost rejoicing, the best, the highest, the most excellent, the supreme,

original: anuttamayā anumodanayā anumodetānumodya cānumodanāsahagataṃ kuśalamūlam anuttarāyai
analyzed: anuttamayā anumodanayā anumodeta anumodya ca anumodanā sahagatam kuśala mūlam anuttarāyai
translated: Having rejoiced with the highest rejoicing, he should dedicate the wholesome root endowed with rejoicing to the highest complete enlightenment.

original: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyam / ity anupalambhapariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyam iti anupalambha pariṇāmaḥ
translated: This is the dedication without apprehending.

original: maitreya āha /🔽saced bhadanta subhūte navayānasaṃprasthito bodhisattvo mahāsattvas teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ
analyzed: maitreyaḥ āha  saced bhadanta subhūte nava yāna saṃprasthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ teṣām buddhānām
translated: Maitreya said:

original: bhagavatāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ sarvakuśalamūlāni samanvāhṛtyāgrayā anumodanayā anumodate
analyzed: bhagavatām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām sarva kuśala mūlāni samanvāhṛtya agrayā anumodanayā anumodate
translated: If, Venerable Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has newly set out in the vehicle recollects all the wholesome roots of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, together with their assemblies of disciples, and rejoices in them with the highest rejoicing,

original: anumodya ca yāvad anuttamayā anumodanayā anumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: anumodya ca yāvat anuttamayā anumodanayā anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: and having rejoiced, dedicates them to the highest complete enlightenment with the highest dedication,

original: kathaṃ na bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñāviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: katham na bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva not have a mistaken perception,

original: na citta viparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: na citta viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: not have a mistaken thought,

original: na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: not have a mistaken view?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: sacet maitreya bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tān buddhān bhagavataḥ saśrāvakasaṃghān samanvāharati /
analyzed: saced maitreya bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān buddhān bhagavataḥ sa śrāvaka saṃghān samanvāharati
translated: Maitreya, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva recollects those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, together with their assemblies of disciples,

original: tatra na buddhasaṃjñī na śrāvakasaṃjñī bhavati /
analyzed: tatra na buddha saṃjñī na śrāvaka saṃjñī bhavati
translated: he should not have the perception of a Buddha, nor the perception of a disciple.

original: na kuśalamūlasaṃjñī bhavati / yenāpi cittena pariṇāmayati tatrāpi cittena cittasaṃjñī bhavaty /
analyzed: na kuśala mūla saṃjñī bhavati yena api cittena pariṇāmayati tatra api cittena citta saṃjñī bhavati
translated: He does not conceive of wholesome roots. And even with the mind by which he dedicates, he conceives of that mind.

original: evaṃ pariṇāmayato bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñāviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam pariṇāmayataḥ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: For a bodhisattva-mahāsattva who dedicates in this way, there is no perversion of perception,

original: na cittaviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: na citta viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: no perversion of mind,

original: na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: no perversion of view.

original: saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tān buddhān bhagavatas tāni ca kuśalamūlān samanvāhṛtya
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān buddhān bhagavataḥ tāni ca kuśala mūlān samanvāhṛtya
translated: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, having brought to mind those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and those wholesome roots,

original: nimittīkaroti nimittīkṛtyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayaty evaṃ pariṇāmayataḥ
analyzed: nimittīkaroti nimittīkṛtya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati evam pariṇāmayataḥ
translated: makes them into a sign, and having made them into a sign, dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, then in that case

original: saṃjñāviparyāsaś cittaviparyāso dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ citta viparyāsaḥ dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: there is a perversion of perception, a perversion of mind, and a perversion of view.

original: sacet punar bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tān buddhān bhagavatas tāni ca kuśalamūlāni yena
analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tān buddhān bhagavataḥ tāni ca kuśala mūlāni yena
translated: But if a bodhisattva-mahāsattva, having brought to mind those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and those wholesome roots,

original: ca cittena samanvāharati tāni tathaiva kṣīṇāni kṣīṇānīty evaṃ prajānāti / yac ca kṣīṇan
analyzed: ca cittena samanvāharati tāni tathā eva kṣīṇāni kṣīṇāni iti evam prajānāti yat ca kṣīṇan
translated: and with whatever mind he brings them to mind, he knows them just as they are, that they are exhausted, and that they are exhausted in that way. And whatever is exhausted

original: na tac chakyaṃ pariṇamayitum / yenāpi cittena pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: na tat śakyam pariṇamayitum yena api cittena pariṇāmayati
translated: cannot be transformed. And even with the mind by which he transforms,

original: tasyāpi cittasya saiva dharmatā / yatrāpi pariṇāmayati tasyāpi saiva dharmatā /
analyzed: tasya api cittasya sā eva dharma tā yatra api pariṇāmayati tasya api sā eva dharma tā
translated: And that mind also has that very nature, and that into which it is transformed also has that very nature.

original: saced evaṃ pariṇāmayati samena pariṇāmayati na viṣamena /
analyzed: saced evam pariṇāmayati samena pariṇāmayati na viṣamena
translated: If one transforms in this way, one transforms evenly, not unevenly.

original: na ca mithyā pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: na ca mithyā pariṇāmayati
translated: And one does not transform falsely.

original: evaṃ pariṇāmayitavyaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena /🔽saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ yāvat
analyzed: evam pariṇāmayitavyam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena  saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām yāvat
translated: In this way the Bodhisattva Mahasattva should transform.🔽If the Bodhisattva Mahasattva, from the arising of the first thought up to parinirvana, of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the past, future and present,

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya parinirvāṇaṃ yāvad ca saddharmāntardhānaṃ tac chrāvakāṇāṃ
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya parinirvāṇam yāvat ca saddharma antardhānam tat śrāvakāṇām
translated: and from the disappearance of the True Dharma of the Shravakas and

original: pratyekabuddhānāṃ ca yāvad yaiś ca tatra pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśalamūlāny avaropitāni /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhānām ca yāvat yaiḥ ca tatra pṛthagjanaiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: Pratyekabuddhas up to the wholesome roots planted there by ordinary beings,

original: yā ca dharmadeśanā śrutā śrutvā ca yaiś ca tatra devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragaiḥ kuśalamūlāny avaropitāni /
analyzed: yā ca dharma deśanā śrutā śrutvā ca yaiḥ ca tatra deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragaiḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and the Dharma teachings heard, and having heard, by which the wholesome roots were planted there by the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras and mahoragas,🔽by the great noble families of Kshatriyas,

original: kuśatriyamahāśālakulair vā brāhmaṇamahāśālakulair vā gṛhapatimahāśalakulair vā cāturmahārājakāyikair
analyzed: ku śatriya mahā śāla kulaiḥ vā brāhmaṇa mahā śāla kulaiḥ vā gṛhapati mahā śala kulaiḥ vā cāturmahārājakāyikaiḥ
translated: Brahmins, and householders, by the gods of the Four Kings,

original: vā devair yāvac chuddhāvāsakāyikair vā devaiḥ saddharmaḥ śrutaḥ kuśalamūlāny avaropitāni /
analyzed: vā devaiḥ yāvat śuddhāvāsa kāyikaiḥ vā devaiḥ saddharmaḥ śrutaḥ kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: or by the gods of the Heaven of Pure Abodes, the wholesome roots that have been planted,

original: cittaṃ cotpāditam anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā
analyzed: cittam ca utpāditam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā
translated: and the mind that has been generated for unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, all that, having combined it, having collected it,

original: tulayitvāgrayānumodanayānumodate jyeṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇitayā uttamayā
analyzed: tulayitvā agrayā anumodanayā anumodate jyeṣṭhayā śreṣṭhayā varayā pravarayā praṇitayā uttamayā
translated: having weighed it, he rejoices in it with the highest rejoicing, with the best, the most excellent, the foremost, the supreme,

original: anuttamayā asamayā asamasamayā anumodanayā anumodate anumodya tat sarvam anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: anuttamayā asamayā asamasamayā anumodanayā anumodate anumodya tat sarvam anuttarāyām
translated: the unequalled, the unequaled rejoicing, he rejoices. Having rejoiced, he dedicates all that to unsurpassed,

original: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau pariṇāmayati
translated: perfect, complete awakening.

original: sacet punar evaṃ saṃjānīte kṣīṇās te dharmā niruddhā vigatā vipariṇatā so 'pi dharmasvabhāvena
analyzed: saced punar evam saṃjānīte kṣīṇāḥ te dharmāḥ niruddhāḥ vigatāḥ vipariṇatā dharma svabhāvena
translated: If, moreover, he cognizes thus: 'Those dharmas have ceased, have disappeared, have vanished, have changed,' and that [dharma] is also empty of its own nature,

original: śūnyo yatrāpi pariṇāmayati / saced evaṃ pariṇāmayati pariṇāmitaṃ bhavaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: śūnyaḥ yatra api pariṇāmayati saced evam pariṇāmayati pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: where he dedicates, if he dedicates like this, it becomes dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sacet punar evaṃ saṃjānīte na ca dharmādharmān pariṇāmayanti / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: saced punar evam saṃjānīte na ca dharma adharmān pariṇāmayanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: If, moreover, he cognizes thus: 'Dharmas do not dedicate dharmas,' why is that?

original: tathā hi svabhāvaśūnyāḥ sarvadharmāḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi svabhāva śūnyāḥ sarva dharmāḥ
translated: Because all dharmas are empty of their own-nature.

original: saced evaṃ pariṇāmayati pariṇāmitaṃ bhavaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau / evaṃ hi bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carataḥ /
analyzed: saced evam pariṇāmayati pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau evam hi bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām carataḥ
translated: Thus, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva practices the perfection of wisdom,

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ carato na saṃjñāviparyāso na cittaviparyāso na dṛṣṭiviparyāso
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām dāna pāramitāyām carataḥ na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ na citta viparyāsaḥ na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ
translated: the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, he does not have the inversion of perception, the inversion of mind, or the inversion of view.

original: bhavati / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: bhavati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: tathā hi bodhisattvo mahāsattvas tāṃ pariṇāmanāṃ nābhiniviśate /
analyzed: tathā hi bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tām pariṇāmanām na abhiniviśate
translated: Because the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not settle down on that dedication.

original: tāni kuśalamūlāni tadbodhicittaṃ ca na samanupaśyati yatrābhiniveśeta /
analyzed: tāni kuśala mūlāni tat bodhi cittam ca na samanupaśyati yatra abhiniveśeta
translated: He does not see those wholesome roots or that thought of awakening where he would settle down.

original: idaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyānuttaraṃ pariṇāmanam / ity aviparyastalakṣaṇapariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: idam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya anuttaram pariṇāmanam iti aviparyasta lakṣaṇa pariṇāmaḥ
translated: This is the unsurpassed dedication of a bodhisattva mahāsattva. Thus is the dedication characterized by non-inversion.

original: sacet punar bodhisattvo mahāsattvas taṃ puṇyakriyāvastv abhisaṃskāraṃ viviktaṃ saṃjānīte skandhadhātvāyatanaiḥ /
analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ tam puṇya kriyā vastu abhisaṃskāram viviktam saṃjānīte skandha dhātu āyatanaiḥ
translated: If, moreover, a bodhisattva mahāsattva perceives that wholesome action and that conditioned thing as being separate from the aggregates, elements, and sense fields,

original: prajñāpāramitayā viviktaṃ saṃjānīte / evaṃ dhyānapāramitayā vīryapāramitayā kṣāntipāramitayā śīlapāramitayā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā viviktam saṃjānīte evam dhyāna pāramitayā vīrya pāramitayā kṣānti pāramitayā śīla pāramitayā
translated: He perceives the perfection of wisdom as isolated. Similarly, he perceives the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality,

original: dānapāramitayā viviktaṃ saṃjānīte / adhyātmaśūnyatayā viviktaṃ saṃjānīte yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā
analyzed: dāna pāramitayā viviktam saṃjānīte adhyātma śūnyatayā viviktam saṃjānīte yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā
translated: and the perfection of giving as isolated. He perceives [the perfections] as isolated up to the emptiness of essential nature of non-existence.

original: viviktaṃ saṃjānīte / saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣair dharmair viviktaṃ saṃjānīte / daśabhir
analyzed: viviktam saṃjānīte saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣaiḥ dharmaiḥ viviktam saṃjānīte daśabhiḥ
translated: He perceives the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment as isolated. He perceives

original: balaiś caturbhir vaiśāradyaiś catasṛbhiḥ pratisaṃvidbhir aṣṭādaśabhir āveṇikair buddhadharmair
analyzed: balaiḥ caturbhiḥ vaiśāradyaiḥ catasṛbhiḥ pratisaṃvidbhiḥ aṣṭādaśabhiḥ āveṇikaiḥ buddha dharmaiḥ
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha

original: viviktaṃ saṃjānīte / evaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena puṇyakriyāvastv abhisaṃskāraḥ
analyzed: viviktam saṃjānīte evam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena puṇya kriyā vastu abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: as isolated. Thus, the bodhisattva mahāsattva's creation of the basis of merit

original: pariṇāmito bhavaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: pariṇāmitaḥ bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: is dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sacet punar bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'numodanāsahagataṃ puṇyakriyāvastu svabhāvena viviktaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ numodanā sahagatam puṇya kriyā vastu svabhāvena viviktam saṃjānīte
translated: If the bodhisattva mahāsattva perceives the basis of merit connected with rejoicing as essentially isolated,

original: viviktās te buddhā bhagavanto buddhasvabhāvena /
analyzed: viviktāḥ te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ buddha svabhāvena
translated: those buddhas, bhagavats, are isolated by the nature of buddhas.

original: kuśalamūlāny api kuśalamūlasvabhāvena viviktāni /
analyzed: kuśala mūlāni api kuśala mūla svabhāvena viviktāni
translated: The roots of virtue are also isolated by the nature of the roots of virtue themselves.

original: abhisaṃskārā abhisaṃskārasvabhāvena viviktāḥ /
analyzed: abhisaṃskārāḥ abhisaṃskāra svabhāvena viviktāḥ
translated: The formative activities are isolated by the nature of the formative activities themselves.

original: bodhicittaṃ bodhicittasvabhāvena viviktaṃ /
analyzed: bodhi cittam bodhi citta svabhāvena viviktam
translated: The thought of awakening is isolated by the nature of the thought of awakening itself.

original: pariṇāmanācittaṃ pariṇāmanācittasvabhāvena viviktaṃ /
analyzed: pariṇāmanā cittam pariṇāmanā citta svabhāvena viviktam
translated: The thought of transformation is isolated by the nature of the thought of transformation itself.

original: bodhir api bodhisvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: bodhiḥ api bodhi svabhāvena viviktā
translated: Awakening is also isolated by the nature of awakening itself.

original: prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The perfection of wisdom is isolated by the nature of the perfection of wisdom itself.

original: dhyānapāramitā dhyānapāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /🔽vīryapāramitā vīryapāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: dhyāna pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā svabhāvena viviktā  vīrya pāramitā vīrya pāramitā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The perfection of concentration is isolated by the nature of the perfection of concentration itself.🔽The perfection of perseverance is isolated by the nature of the perfection of perseverance itself.

original: kṣāntipāramitā kṣāntipāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The perfection of patience is isolated by the nature of the perfection of patience itself.

original: śīlapāramitā śīlapāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: śīla pāramitā śīla pāramitā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The perfection of morality is isolated by the nature of the perfection of morality itself.

original: dānapāramitā dānapāramitāsvabhāvena viviktā /🔽adhyātmaśūnyatā adhyātmaśūnyatāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: dāna pāramitā dāna pāramitā svabhāvena viviktā  adhyātma śūnyatā adhyātma śūnyatā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The perfection of giving is isolated by the nature of the perfection of giving itself.🔽Internal emptiness is isolated by the nature of internal emptiness itself.

original: bahirdhāśūnyatā bhirdhāśūnyatāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: bahirdhā śūnyatā bhirdhā śūnyatā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: External emptiness is isolated by the nature of external emptiness itself.

original: adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatāsvabhāvena viviktā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāsvabhāvena viviktā /
analyzed: adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā svabhāvena viviktā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā svabhāvena viviktā
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is isolated from the emptiness of internal phenomena, and so on up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, which is isolated from the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: evaṃ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ catvāry āryasatyāny apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattavo
analyzed: evam saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: In the same way, the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the four noble truths, the immeasurables, the concentrations, the formless attainments,

original: 'ṣṭavimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni ṣaḍabhijñāḥ sarvasamādhayaḥ
analyzed: ṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni ṣaṣ abhijñāḥ sarva samādhayaḥ
translated: the eight liberations, the nine sequential attainments, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the six superknowledges, all the meditative absorptions,

original: sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido /
analyzed: sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ
translated: all the doors of retention, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā buddhadharmasvabhāvena viviktāḥ / evaṃ hi bodhisattvena
analyzed: ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ buddha dharma svabhāvena viviktāḥ evam hi bodhisattvena
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are isolated from the essential nature of the attributes of a buddha. In this way, the bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvena viviktāyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritavyam iyaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
analyzed: mahāsattvena viviktāyām prajñāpāramitāyām caritavyam iyam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya
translated: great being should practice the isolated perfection of wisdom. This is the bodhisattva great being's

original: prajñāpāramitā / iti viviktapariṇāmaḥ /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā iti vivikta pariṇāmaḥ
translated: perfection of wisdom. This is the transformation of isolation.

original: punar aparaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvena teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ yat kuśalamūlaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām yat kuśala mūlam
translated: Furthermore, the bodhisattva great being should, with regard to the wholesome roots of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: tat sarvam anusmaratā evaṃ pariṇāmayitavyaṃ yādṛśa eva sa pariṇāmas tādṛśam eva tac
analyzed: tat sarvam anusmaratā evam pariṇāmayitavyam yādṛśaḥ eva sa pariṇāmaḥ tādṛśam eva tat
translated: Remembering all that, it should be dedicated like this: just as is that dedication, so is that

original: cittaṃ yena pariṇāmayati tajjātikaṃ tatsvabhāvam /
analyzed: cittam yena pariṇāmayati tad jātikam tad svabhāvam
translated: mind by which one dedicates, of the same kind, of the same nature.

original: saced evaṃ saṃjānīte pariṇāmitaṃ bhavaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: saced evam saṃjānīte pariṇāmitam bhavati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: If one perceives in this way, it is dedicated to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ pariṇāmayato na saṃjñāviparyāso bhavati na cittaviparyāso bhavati na dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam pariṇāmayataḥ na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ bhavati na citta viparyāsaḥ bhavati na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: For one who dedicates in this way, there is no perversion of perception, no perversion of mind, no perversion of view.

original: sacet punar bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prañāpāramitāyāṃ caran nimittayogena /
analyzed: saced punar bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prañāpāramitāyām caran nimitta yogena
translated: Moreover, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, through the yoga of signs,

original: teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tāni kuśalamūlāni saṃjānīte /
analyzed: teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām tāni kuśala mūlāni saṃjānīte
translated: perceives those wholesome roots of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: na pariṇāmayaty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: na pariṇāmayati anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and does not dedicate them to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: ye cātītā buddhā bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtā animittā aviṣayāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca atītāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ parinirvṛtāḥ animittāḥ aviṣayāḥ
translated: and if those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones of the past, who have attained final nirvāṇa, are signless, objectless,

original: saced evam api samanvāharati nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: saced evam api samanvāharati nimittīkaroti
translated: and if one recollects them in this way, taking them as signs,

original: na pariṇāmayati tāni kuśalamūlāny anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: na pariṇāmayati tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: and does not dedicate those wholesome roots to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: evaṃ cāsya saṃjñāviparyāso bhavati cittaviparyāso bhavati dṛṣṭiviparyāso bhavati /
analyzed: evam ca asya saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ bhavati citta viparyāsaḥ bhavati dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, he has the perversion of perception, the perversion of mind, and the perversion of view.

original: sacet tān buddhān bhagavatas tāni kuśalamulāni tāṃś cābhisaṃskārāṃs tāṃś cittotpādān saṃjānīte na nimittīkaroti /
analyzed: saced tān buddhān bhagavataḥ tāni kuśala mulāni tān ca abhisaṃskārān tān citta utpādān saṃjānīte na nimittīkaroti
translated: If he perceives those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, those wholesome roots, those formative forces, and those thoughts, but does not take them as a sign,

original: pariṇāmitāni tāni kuśalamūlāny anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye bhavati / evaṃ ca bodhisattvasya
analyzed: pariṇāmitāni tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye bhavati evam ca bodhisattvasya
translated: then those wholesome roots are dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. In this way, the bodhisattva

original: mahāsattvasya na saṃjñāviparyāso bhavati na cittaviparyāso bhavati na dṛṣṭiviparyāso
analyzed: mahāsattvasya na saṃjñā viparyāsaḥ bhavati na citta viparyāsaḥ bhavati na dṛṣṭi viparyāsaḥ
translated: great being does not have the perversion of perception, does not have the perversion of mind, and does not have the perversion of view.

original: bhavati / iti buddhakuśalamulajātīyasvabhāvānusmṛtipariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: bhavati iti buddha kuśala mula jātīya svabhāva anusmṛti pariṇāmaḥ
translated: Thus is the dedication of recollection of the nature of the wholesome roots of the Buddhas.

original: maitreya āha /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ āha
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathaṃ bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na nimittīkaroti pariṇāmayati ca /
analyzed: katham bhadanta subhūte bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na nimittīkaroti pariṇāmayati ca
translated: Venerable Subhuti, how does a bodhisattva-mahāsattva not take signs but still dedicate?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: atra hi tāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām upāyakauśalāni śikṣitavyām / ata eva ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām
analyzed: atra hi tāni bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām upāya kauśalāni śikṣitavyām atas eva ca bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Here, a bodhisattva-mahāsattva should learn the skillful means of the perfection of wisdom. For this very reason, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's perfection of wisdom

original: upāyakauśalaṃ veditavyaṃ /
analyzed: upāya kauśalam veditavyam
translated: should be understood as skillful means.

original: na ca prajñāpāramitām anāgamya śakyaṃ puṇyakriyāvastu pariṇāmayitum /
analyzed: na ca prajñāpāramitām an āgamya śakyam puṇya kriyā vastu pariṇāmayitum
translated: And without coming to the perfection of wisdom, it is not possible to dedicate the object of merit.

original: maitreya āha /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ āha
translated: Maitreya said:

original: mā haivāsya syād bhadanta subhūte vacanīyam / na te buddhā bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ saṃvidyante / nāpi tāni kuśalamūlāni /
analyzed: mā ha eva asya syāt bhadanta subhūte vacanīyam na te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām saṃvidyante na api tāni kuśala mūlāni
translated: Venerable Subhūti, let it not be said of him that 'those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, do not exist in the perfection of wisdom, nor do those wholesome roots,

original: nāpi te 'bhisaṃskārā /
analyzed: na api te bhisaṃskārā
translated: nor do those formative activities,

original: nāpi te cittotpādā yāvan nānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: na api te citta utpādāḥ yāvat na anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: nor do those thoughts, up to the time of dedicating to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.'

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā evaṃ vyupaparīkṣitavyaṃ /
analyzed: tatra bodhisattvena mahāsattvena prajñāpāramitāyām caratā evam vyupaparīkṣitavyam
translated: There, a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom should investigate thus:

original: niruddhās te ātmabhāvā tāni ca kuśalamūlāni te cābhisaṃskārās te ca cittotpādāḥ /
analyzed: niruddhāḥ te ātma bhāvā tāni ca kuśala mūlāni te ca abhisaṃskārāḥ te ca citta utpādāḥ
translated: 'Those bodies, those wholesome roots, those formative activities, those thoughts are ceased.

original: atha ca punar nimittīkṛtya vikalpyante te buddhā bhagavantas tāni ca kuśalamūlāni
analyzed: atha ca punar nimittīkṛtya vikalpyante te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tāni ca kuśala mūlāni
translated: Yet, having taken them as a sign and conceptualized them, those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and those wholesome roots,

original: te cābhisaṃskārās te ca cittotpādā nimittīkṛtya vikalpyante / na ca tathāgatā arhantaḥ
analyzed: te ca abhisaṃskārāḥ te ca citta utpādāḥ nimittīkṛtya vikalpyante na ca tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ
translated: those formative activities, those thoughts are taken as a sign and conceptualized, but the Tathāgatas, Arhats,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhā evaṃ nimittayogena pariṇāmayato 'numodanām abhyanujānanti / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ evam nimitta yogena pariṇāmayataḥ numodanām abhyanujānanti tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: The perfectly enlightened ones approve of the rejoicing of those who dedicate in this way through the yoga of signs. Why is that?

original: eṣa evāsya mahān upalambho yat parinirvṛtān buddhān bhagavato nimittīkaroti vikalpayati
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva asya mahān upalambhaḥ yat parinirvṛtān buddhān bhagavataḥ nimittīkaroti vikalpayati
translated: This is his great perception, that he takes the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones who have attained parinirvāṇa, as a sign, conceptualizes them,

original: copalabhate tasmād bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitukāmena na
analyzed: ca upalabhate tasmāt bodhisattvena mahāsattvena kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitu kāmena na
translated: and perceives them. Therefore, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who wishes to dedicate wholesome roots

original: copalabhya nimittīkṛtya pariṇāmayitavyāni / na copalambhasaṃjñino na nimittasaṃjñinas /
analyzed: ca upalabhya nimittīkṛtya pariṇāmayitavyāni na ca upalambha saṃjñinaḥ na nimitta saṃjñinaḥ
translated: should not dedicate them while perceiving and taking them as a sign, and should not dedicate them with the perception of grasping and the perception of signs.

original: tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ pariṇāmatāṃ maharddhikām iti vadanti / tat hasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ pariṇāma tām maharddhikām iti vadanti tat hasya hetoḥ
translated: The Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Enlightened Ones say that such a dedication is very powerful. That is why.

original: saviṣaḥ saśalya eṣa pariṇāmaḥ /
analyzed: sa viṣaḥ sa śalyaḥ eṣa pariṇāmaḥ
translated: This dedication is like poison and a thorn.

original: ity upāyakauśalapariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: iti upāya kauśala pariṇāmaḥ
translated: Thus is the dedication of skillful means.

original: tadyathāpi nāma praṇītabhojanaṃ viṣasaṃsṛṣṭaṃ varṇena gandhena copetaṃ tad eva bālajātīyaḥ puruṣaḥ paribhoktavyaṃ manyeta /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma praṇīta bhojanam viṣa saṃsṛṣṭam varṇena gandhena ca upetam tat eva bāla jātīyaḥ puruṣaḥ paribhoktavyam manyeta
translated: For example, it is like a delicious food mixed with poison, endowed with color and smell. A person of foolish nature might think that it should be eaten.

original: tasya tat paribhuñjānasya varṇato 'pi gandhato 'pi roceta /
analyzed: tasya tat paribhuñjānasya varṇataḥ pi gandhataḥ pi roceta
translated: While he is eating it, it would be pleasing in color and smell.

original: pariṇāme ca duṣkhavipākaṃ syāt / evam eva ihaikatyā durgṛhītena durupalakṣitena duḥsvādhyātena cārtham ajānanto 'budhyamānā evam upadekṣyanti /
analyzed: pariṇāme ca duṣkha vipākam syāt evam eva iha ekatyāḥ durgṛhītena durupalakṣitena duḥsvādhyātena ca artham a jānantaḥ budhyamānāḥ evam upadekṣyanti
translated: In the same way, some here, not knowing the meaning due to wrong grasping, wrong observation, and wrong recitation, being ignorant, will teach thus:🔽Come, noble sir, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment

original: ehi tvaṃ kulaputra atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prathamacittotpādam
analyzed: ehi tvam kula putra atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām prathama citta utpādam
translated: up to the complete attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present,

original: upādāya yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvac ca nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau
analyzed: upādāya yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat ca nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau
translated: up to the parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder of those who have attained final nirvāṇa,

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ yāvac ca saddharmāṇāṃ antarhitaḥ /
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām yāvat ca saddharmāṇām antarhitaḥ
translated: up to the disappearance of the true Dharma,

original: yāny etasmin antare prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caradbhiḥ kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni /🔽evaṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ śīlapāramitāyāṃ dānapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: yāni etasmin antare prajñāpāramitāyām caradbhiḥ kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni  evam dhyāna pāramitāyām vīrya pāramitāyām kṣānti pāramitāyām śīla pāramitāyām dāna pāramitāyām
translated: the wholesome roots that are created while practicing the perfection of wisdom in the interval,🔽and likewise the wholesome roots that are created while practicing the perfection of concentration, the perfection of energy, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving,

original: caradbhiḥ kuśālamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni / yāni ca caturdhyānapratisaṃyuktāni caturapramāṇapratisaṃyuktāni
analyzed: caradbhiḥ kuśāla mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni yāni ca catur dhyāna pratisaṃyuktāni catur apramāṇa pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: and the wholesome roots connected with the four meditations, the four immeasurables,

original: caturārūpyasamāpattipratisaṃyuktāni saptatriṃśad bodhipakṣyadharma pratisaṃyuktāni
analyzed: catur ārūpya samāpatti pratisaṃyuktāni saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣya dharma pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: They are connected with the four formless attainments, the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: catur āryasatya pratisaṃyuktāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitapratisaṃyuktāny aṣṭavimokṣa
analyzed: catuḥ ārya satya pratisaṃyuktāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita pratisaṃyuktāni aṣṭa vimokṣa
translated: the four noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the eight liberations,

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattipratisaṃyuktāny abhijñāpratisaṃyuktāni sarvaśūnyatādhāraṇīmukhapratisaṃyuktāni
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti pratisaṃyuktāni abhijñā pratisaṃyuktāni sarva śūnyatā dhāraṇī mukha pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: the nine successive meditative absorptions, the superknowledges, the gateways of mnemonic incantation and meditative absorption associated with all the emptinesses,

original: daśatathāgatabalapratisaṃyuktāni caturvaiśāradyapratisaṃyuktāni /
analyzed: daśa tathāgata bala pratisaṃyuktāni catur vaiśāradya pratisaṃyuktāni
translated: the ten powers of the Tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness,

original: catuḥpratisaṃvitpratisaṃyuktāni kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: catur pratisaṃvid pratisaṃyuktāni kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: the four forms of unobstructed knowledge, and the four forms of unimpeded knowledge.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmapratisaṃyuktāni kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni /🔽yaiś ca kuśalamūlābhisaṃskārair buddhakṣetrāni pariśodhitāni sattvāś ca paripācitāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma pratisaṃyuktāni kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni  yaiḥ ca kuśala mūla abhisaṃskāraiḥ buddhakṣetrāni pariśodhitāni sattvāḥ ca paripācitāḥ
translated: They are connected with the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of analytical knowledge, the eighteen unique qualities of the Buddha, and the thirty-two major marks of a great person.

original: yaś ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho
analyzed: yaḥ ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ
translated: They are connected with the eighty minor marks, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of unimpeded knowledge, the six forms of supernormal knowledge, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four means of attracting disciples, the four forms of correct individual knowledge, the four forms of meditative absorption, the four forms of immeasurable equanimity, the four formless states, the five forms of correct knowledge, the five forms of spiritual faculties, the five forms of spiritual power, the seven forms of auxiliary practice, the eight forms of correct path, the nine forms of successive meditative absorption, the ten forms of universal equality, the ten forms of universal liberation, the ten forms of universal totality, the ten forms of universal sphere, the ten forms of universal meditative absorption, the ten forms of universal supernormal knowledge, the ten forms of universal emptiness, the ten forms of universal signlessness, the ten forms of universal wishlessness, the ten forms of universal non-action, the ten forms of universal non-birth, the ten forms of universal non-production, the ten forms of universal non-existence, the ten forms of universal non-appearance, the ten forms of universal non-manifestation, the ten forms of universal non-attainment, the ten forms of universal non-accomplishment, the ten forms of universal non-existence, the ten forms of universal non-appearance, the ten forms of universal non-manifestation, the ten forms of universal non-attainment, the ten forms of universal non-accomplishment, the ten forms of universal non-existence, the ten forms of universal non-appearance, the ten forms of universal non-manifestation, the ten forms of universal non-

original: vimuktijñānadarśanaskandhaḥ sarvākārajñatājñānam asaṃpramuṣitadharmatājñānaṃ sadopekṣāvihāritā
analyzed: vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ sarva ākāra jña tā jñānam asaṃpramuṣita dharmatā jñānam sadā upekṣāvihāri tā
translated: The aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation is the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of the nature of phenomena that is never confused, and the constant practice of equanimity.

original: teṣāṃ ca śrāvakāṇāṃ /
analyzed: teṣām ca śrāvakāṇām
translated: And of those disciples,

original: yaiś ca tatra kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni /
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tatra kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: Those who have created roots of goodness there,

original: ye ca pratyekabuddhatve vyākṛtā /
analyzed: ye ca pratyekabuddha tve vyākṛtā
translated: And those who have been prophesied to be pratyekabuddhas,

original: yaiś ca tatra devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragaiḥ kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni
analyzed: yaiḥ ca tatra deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoragaiḥ kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni
translated: And those gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who have created roots of goodness there,

original: tāni sarvāny abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati /
analyzed: tāni sarvāni abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā tulayitvā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati
translated: Having combined all those together, having collected them and weighed them, he dedicates them to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ hi pariṇāmo nimittayogenopalambhayogena ca pariṇāmito viṣatvāya kalpayate / tadyathāpi
analyzed: evam hi pariṇāmaḥ nimitta yogena upalambha yogena ca pariṇāmitaḥ viṣa tvāya kalpayate tat yathā api
translated: In this way, a dedication that is done through the method of signs and the method of perception becomes poisonous, just as

original: nāma tat saviṣaṃ bhojanaṃ nāsty upalambhasaṃjñinaḥ pariṇāmaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: nāma tat sa viṣam bhojanam na asti upalambha saṃjñinaḥ pariṇāmaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: For example, that poisoned food is not for one who has the perception of poison. Why is that?

original: saviṣo hy upalambhaḥ sanimittaḥ sahetukaḥ sapratyayo ya evaṃ pariṇāmayati tena tathāgato
analyzed: sa viṣaḥ hi upalambhaḥ sa nimittaḥ sa hetukaḥ sa pratyayaḥ yaḥ evam pariṇāmayati tena tathāgataḥ
translated: Because perception with poison, with signs, with causes, with conditions, is for one who dedicates in that way. Therefore, the Tathagata

original: 'bhyākhyāto bhavati / na ca sa tathāgatasyoktavādī bhavati na ca dharmavādī / tatra
analyzed: bhyākhyātaḥ bhavati na ca sa tathāgatasya ukta vādī bhavati na ca dharma vādī tatra
translated: One is a slanderer, and one is not a speaker of the Tathāgata’s word, nor a speaker of the Dharma.

original: bodhisattvayānikaiḥ kulaputraiḥ kuladuhitrbhiś ca naivaṃ śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: bodhisattva yānikaiḥ kula putraiḥ kula duhitrbhiḥ ca na evam śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, sons and daughters of good family belonging to the vehicle of the bodhisattvas should not train in this way.

original: ity animittapariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: iti animitta pariṇāmaḥ
translated: Thus, the dedication without signs.

original: maitreya āha /
analyzed: maitreyaḥ āha
translated: Maitreya said:

original: kathaṃ punar atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ kuśalamūlāny anumodya pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: katham punar atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām kuśala mūlāni anumodya pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: How, then, should one rejoice in and dedicate the wholesome roots of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present?

original: prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvad
analyzed: prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat
translated: Beginning from the production of the first thought of enlightenment up to the complete attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtānāṃ yāvac ca saddharmasthitiḥ saśrāvakasaṃghānām
analyzed: an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtānām yāvat ca saddharma sthitiḥ sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: up to the parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder, and up to the duration of the true Dharma of those together with the community of hearers,

original: etasminn antare yāni prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā kuśalamūlāny abhisaṃskṛtāni yāvat sarvajñatā
analyzed: etasmin antare yāni prajñāpāramitāyām caratā kuśala mūlāni abhisaṃskṛtāni yāvat sarvajña tā
translated: in the meantime, the wholesome roots that were created while practicing the perfection of wisdom up to the attainment of omniscience,

original: prāptā yāvad yaiś ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakiṃnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyaiḥ🔽kuśalamūlāny avaropitāni /
analyzed: prāptāḥ yāvat yaiḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kiṃnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ 🔽kuśala mūlāni avaropitāni
translated: and those wholesome roots that were planted by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans,

original: kathaṃ cānumodya pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: katham ca anumodya pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: And how should they be approved and dedicated?

original: kathaṃ ca pariṇāmayatas tāni kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmitāni bhavanty anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye /
analyzed: katham ca pariṇāmayataḥ tāni kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmitāni bhavanti anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: And how, when dedicating those wholesome roots, do they become dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

original: subhūtir aha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ aha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: iha mahāyānikena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā tathāgatam anabhyākhyātukāmena /
analyzed: iha mahāyānikena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām caratā tathāgatam an abhyākhyātu kāmena
translated: Here, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family in the Great Vehicle, practicing the perfection of wisdom, wishing not to misrepresent the Tathāgata,

original: evaṃ pariṇāmayitavyaṃ yathā te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā jānanti niruttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye /
analyzed: evam pariṇāmayitavyam yathā te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ jānanti niruttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: should dedicate [merit] like this: Just as those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones know unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: iha mahāyānikena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā tathāgatam anabhyākhyātukāmena /
analyzed: iha mahāyānikena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām caratā tathāgatam an abhyākhyātu kāmena
translated: Here, a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family in the Great Vehicle, practicing the perfection of wisdom, wishing not to misrepresent the Tathāgata,

original: evaṃ pariṇāmayitavyaṃ yathā te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā jānanti niruttareṇa buddhajñānena /
analyzed: evam pariṇāmayitavyam yathā te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ jānanti niruttareṇa buddha jñānena
translated: should dedicate [merit] like this: Just as those Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones know with unsurpassed Buddha-knowledge,

original: tāni ca kuśalamūlāni yajjātikāni yatsvabhāvāni yallakṣaṇāni yayā dharmatayā saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tāni ca kuśala mūlāni yad jātikāni yad svabhāvāni yad lakṣaṇāni yayā dharmatayā saṃvidyante
translated: and those wholesome roots, whatever their kind, whatever their nature, whatever their characteristics, whatever their reality, are,

original: tathāham apy anumode yathā te buddhā bhagavanto jānanti tathāham api pariṇāmayāmy
analyzed: tathā aham api anumode yathā te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ jānanti tathā aham api pariṇāmayāmi
translated: In the same way, I also rejoice. Just as those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, know, I also dedicate [my roots of virtue]

original: anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye / evaṃ mahāyānikena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tāni
analyzed: anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye evam mahāyānikena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tāni
translated: to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. In this way, a son or daughter of good family belonging to the Great Vehicle should dedicate those

original: kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāny anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye /
analyzed: kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ ca pariṇāmayitukāmena pariṇāmayitavyaṃ yathā te tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhā jānanti niruttareṇa buddhajñānena /
analyzed: evam ca pariṇāmayitu kāmena pariṇāmayitavyam yathā te tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ jānanti niruttareṇa buddha jñānena
translated: And one who wishes to dedicate in this way should dedicate [as follows]: Just as those Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones know with unsurpassed Buddha-knowledge,

original: tāni ca kuśalamūlāni yajjātikāni yatsvabhāvāni yallakṣaṇāni yayā dharmatayā saṃvidyante /
analyzed: tāni ca kuśala mūlāni yad jātikāni yad svabhāvāni yad lakṣaṇāni yayā dharmatayā saṃvidyante
translated: and those roots of virtue, whatever their type, whatever their nature, whatever their characteristics, by whatever truth they exist,

original: tathāham apy anumode yathā te buddhā bhagavanto jānanti tathāham api pariṇāmayāmy🔽anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye / evaṃ mahāyānikena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā tāni
analyzed: tathā aham api anumode yathā te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ jānanti tathā aham api pariṇāmayāmi  anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye evam mahāyānikena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā tāni
translated: in the same way, I also rejoice. Just as those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, know, I also dedicate [my roots of virtue]🔽to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. In this way, a son or daughter of good family belonging to the Great Vehicle should dedicate those

original: kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāny anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye / evaṃ ca pariṇāmayaṃs
analyzed: kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye evam ca pariṇāmayan
translated: roots of virtue to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. And one who dedicates in this way

original: tathāgatān nābhyācaṣṭe uktavādī ca bhavati / tathāgatasya dharmavādī /
analyzed: tathāgatān na abhyācaṣṭe ukta vādī ca bhavati tathāgatasya dharma vādī
translated: And he does not misrepresent the Tathāgatas, and he becomes one who speaks what has been said, and he becomes one who speaks the Dharma of the Tathāgata.

original: caivaṃ bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pariṇāmo nirviṣo bhavati /
analyzed: ca evam bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya pariṇāmaḥ nirviṣaḥ bhavati
translated: In this way, the dedication of the bodhisattva mahāsattva becomes free from poison.

original: iti buddhānujñātapariṇāmaḥ
analyzed: iti buddha anujñāta pariṇāmaḥ
translated: Thus is the dedication approved by the Buddhas.

original: punar aparaṃ mahāyānasaṃprasthitena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam mahāyāna saṃprasthitena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā vā prajñāpāramitāyām
translated: Moreover, a son of good family or a daughter of good family who has set out in the Great Vehicle, while practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: carataivaṃ tāni kuśalamūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: caratā evam tāni kuśala mūlāni pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: should dedicate those wholesome roots in this way.

original: yathā rūpam aparyāpannaṃ kāmadhātuṃ rūpadhātum ārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: yathā rūpam a paryāpannam kāmadhātum rūpadhātum ārūpya dhātum
translated: Just as form is not included in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm,

original: evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānam aparyāpannaṃ kāmadhātuṃ rūpadhātum ārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam a paryāpannam kāmadhātum rūpadhātum ārūpya dhātum
translated: in the same way, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are not included in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: evaṃ dhātava āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ prajñāpāramitāpy aparyāpannā kāmadhātuṃ rūpadhātum ārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: evam dhātavaḥ āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ prajñāpāramitā api a paryāpannā kāmadhātum rūpadhātum ārūpya dhātum
translated: In the same way, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, and the perfection of wisdom are not included in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: evaṃ dhyānapāramitā vīryapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā śīlapāramitā dānapāramitāpy aparyāpannā kāmadhātuṃ rūpadhātum ārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: evam dhyāna pāramitā vīrya pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā śīla pāramitā dāna pāramitā api a paryāpannā kāmadhātum rūpadhātum ārūpya dhātum
translated: In the same way, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving are not included in the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: yā cāparyāpannā na sātītā nānāgatā na pratyutpannā /🔽evam adhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā aparyāpannā kāmarūpārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: yā ca a paryāpannā na sā atītā na anāgatā na pratyutpannā  evam adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā a paryāpannā kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: And that which does not fall into the realms does not belong to the past, future, or present.🔽In the same way, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities does not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattaya āryasatyāny aparyāpannāni kāmarūpārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ ārya satyāni a paryāpannāni kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: The immeasurables, concentrations, and formless absorptions, and the noble truths do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: aṣṭavimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo 'paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: The eight liberations and the nine successive meditative absorptions do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni ṣaḍabhijāā aparyāpannāḥ kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni ṣaṭ abhijāāḥ a paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the six forms of clairvoyance do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāny aparyāpannāni kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni a paryāpannāni kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: All the concentrations and all the doors of retention do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: daśabalāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmā aparyāpannāḥ kāmarūpārūpyadhātum /
analyzed: daśa balāni catvāri vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ a paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: The ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of unhindered knowledge, and the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: evaṃ tathatā avitathatā anayatathatā dharmatā dharmadhātur dharmaniyāmatā dharmasthititā bhūtakoṭir acintyadhātur aparyāpannaḥ kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: evam tathatā avitatha tā anaya tathatā dharmatā dharmadhātuḥ dharma niyāma tā dharma sthiti tā bhūtakoṭiḥ acintya dhātuḥ a paryāpannaḥ kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Thusness, non-otherwise-ness, non-erroneous thusness, the nature of dharmas, the dharma-element, the establishment of dharmas, the determined nature of dharmas, the very limit of reality, the inconceivable element, the unincluded element, are not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: śīlasamādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanāni sarvākārajñatā asaṃpramuṣitadharmatā sadā copekṣāvihāritā aparyāpannā kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: śīla samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśanāni sarva ākāra jña tā a saṃpramuṣita dharma tā sadā ca upekṣāvihāri tā a paryāpannā kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Morality, concentration, wisdom, liberation, the vision, cognition, and realization of liberation, the knowledge of all modes, the unconfused nature of dharmas, and always abiding in equanimity, are not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: yac cāparyāpannaṃ tan nātītaṃ nānāgataṃ na pratyutpannaṃ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: yat ca a paryāpannam tat na atītam na anāgatam na pratyutpannam tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: And what is not included is not past, not future, not present. Why is that?

original: yathaiva tad aparyāpannam evaṃ pariṇāmo 'py aparyāpanno /
analyzed: yathā eva tat a paryāpannam evam pariṇāmaḥ pi a paryāpannaḥ
translated: Just as that is not included, so too the transformation is not included.

original: yatrāpi dharme pariṇāmayati te 'pi dharmā aparyāpannā /
analyzed: yatra api dharme pariṇāmayati te pi dharmāḥ a paryāpannā
translated: In whatever dharma one transforms, those dharmas are also not included.

original: yo 'pi pariṇāmayati so 'py aparyāpannas /
analyzed: yaḥ pi pariṇāmayati saḥ pi a paryāpannaḥ
translated: And whoever transforms, he too is not included.

original: te 'pi buddhā bhagavanto 'paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: te pi buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ paryāpannāḥ kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, are also not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: tāny api kuśalamūlāny aparyāpannāni kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: tāni api kuśala mūlāni a paryāpannāni kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Those wholesome roots are also not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: te 'pi śrāvakapratyekabuddhā aparyāpannāḥ kāmarūpārūpya dhātuṃ /
analyzed: te pi śrāvaka pratyekabuddhāḥ a paryāpannāḥ dhātum
translated: Those śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are also not included in the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: teṣām api tāni kuśalamūlāny aparyāpannāni kāmarūpārūpyadhātuṃ /
analyzed: teṣām api tāni kuśala mūlāni a paryāpannāni kāmarūpa ārūpya dhātum
translated: Those wholesome roots also do not fall into the desire, form, or formless realms.

original: yac cāparyāpannaṃ tan nātītan nānāgatan na pratyutpannam /
analyzed: yat ca a paryāpannam tat na atītan na anāgatan na pratyutpannam
translated: And what does not fall is not past, not future, not present.

original: saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evam saṃjānīte
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, cognizes thus:

original: yad rūpaṃ tat kāmadhāturūpadhātvārūpyadhātum aparyāpamam /
analyzed: yat rūpam tat kāmadhātu rūpadhātu ārūpya dhātum a paryāpamam
translated: That form does not fall into the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā yad vijñānaṃ tat kāmadhāturūpadhātvārūpyadhātum aparyāpannam /
analyzed: evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ yat vijñānam tat kāmadhātu rūpadhātu ārūpya dhātum a paryāpannam
translated: Thus, feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness do not fall into the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: evaṃ dhātava āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ pratītyasamutpādāṅgānīti kāmadhāturūpadhātvārūpyadhātvaparyāpannāni /🔽saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evaṃ saṃjānīte / yad /
analyzed: evam dhātavaḥ āyatanāni pratītyasamutpādaḥ pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni iti kāmadhātu rūpadhātu ārūpya dhātu a paryāpannāni  saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evam saṃjānīte yat
translated: Thus, the elements, the sense bases, dependent origination, and the factors of dependent origination do not fall into the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: rūpaṃ tat kāmadhāturūpadhātvārūpyadhātum aparyāpannaṃ /
analyzed: rūpam tat kāmadhātu rūpadhātu ārūpya dhātum a paryāpannam
translated: If a bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom, cognizes thus: That form does not fall into the desire realm, form realm, or formless realm.

original: tan nātītan tan nānāgatan na pratyutpannan tan na śakyaṃ nimittayogena copalambhayogena vā pariṇāmayitum / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat na atītan tat na anāgatan na pratyutpannan tat na śakyam nimitta yogena ca upalambha yogena vā pariṇāmayitum tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: It is not past, not future, not present. It cannot be transformed by the yoga of signs or the yoga of apprehension. Why is that?

original: na hi tasya svabhāvaḥ saṃvidyate / yasya ca svabhāvo na saṃvidyate so 'bhāvo / na cābhāvo
analyzed: na hi tasya svabhāvaḥ saṃvidyate yasya ca svabhāvaḥ na saṃvidyate saḥ bhāvaḥ na ca abhāvaḥ
translated: Because it does not exist as its own nature. And what does not exist as its own nature is non-existent. And a non-existent thing

original: 'bhāvena śakyaḥ pariṇāmayitum / evaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānaṃ dhātava āyatanāni
analyzed: bhāvena śakyaḥ pariṇāmayitum evam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñānam dhātavaḥ āyatanāni
translated: cannot be transformed by a non-existent thing. Thus feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness; the elements; the sense bases;

original: pratītyasamutpādaḥ pratītyasamutpādāṅgāny /

analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān cāturmahārājakāyikān deva putrān yāvat akaniṣṭhān deva putrān āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, up to the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm:

original: yadi devaputrā ye trisāharamahāsāhasre lokadhātau sattvās te sarve 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitā bhaveyus /
analyzed: yadi deva putrāḥ ye trisāhara mahā sāhasre lokadhātau sattvāḥ te sarve nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau saṃprasthitāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If, gods, all the beings in the trichiliocosm were to set out for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment,

original: te sarve 'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ
analyzed: te sarve tīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: and if all of them, from the past, future, and present Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their assemblies of disciples,

original: sapratyekabuddhānāṃ yāni kuśalamūlāni prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad anuttarāṃ
analyzed: sa pratyekabuddhānām yāni kuśala mūlāni prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat anuttarām
translated: and the Pratyekabuddhas, from the arising of the first thought of enlightenment up to

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvac ca nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtānāṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat ca nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtānām
translated: the complete attainment of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and as far as the parinirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa without remainder,

original: yāvat saddharmasthitir etasminn antare teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ teṣāṃ ca śrāvakāṇāṃ
analyzed: yāvat saddharma sthitiḥ etasmin antare teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām teṣām ca śrāvakāṇām
translated: As long as the true Dharma remains, during that time, of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, and their disciples,

original: teṣāṃ ca pratyekabuddhānāṃ tato 'nyeṣāṃ ca sarvasattvānāṃ yat kuśalamūlaṃ dānapāramitā🔽nirjātam evaṃ śīlapāramitākṣāntipāramitāvīryapāramitādhyānapāramitāprajñāpāramitānirjātaṃ
analyzed: teṣām ca pratyekabuddhānām tatas nyeṣām ca sarva sattvānām yat kuśala mūlam dāna pāramitā  nirjātam evam śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramitā dhyāna pāramitā prajñāpāramitā nirjātam
translated: and of those Pratyekabuddhas and all other beings, whatever roots of virtue there are, arisen from the perfection of giving,🔽arisen from the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, concentration, and wisdom,

original: śīlaskandhaḥ samādhiskandhaḥ prajñāskandho vimuktiskandho vimuktijñānadarśanaskandho
analyzed: śīla skandhaḥ samādhi skandhaḥ prajñā skandhaḥ vimukti skandhaḥ vimukti jñāna darśana skandhaḥ
translated: the aggregate of morality, the aggregate of concentration, the aggregate of wisdom, the aggregate of liberation, the aggregate of the knowledge and vision of liberation,

original: 'nye cāparimāṇā buddhadharmās tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipyānumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
analyzed: nye ca aparimāṇāḥ buddha dharmāḥ tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipya anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: and all the immeasurable other Buddha-dharmas, having combined and rejoiced in all that, they would dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: pariṇāmayeyur upalambhayogena / yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau🔽saṃprasthito bhavet so 'tītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ
analyzed: pariṇāmayeyuḥ upalambha yogena yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau  saṃprasthitaḥ bhavet saḥ tīta anāgata pratyutpannānām buddhānām bhagavatām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: by way of apprehending. And if a son of good family or daughter of good family,🔽who has set out for unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, would, from the time of first arousing the mind of enlightenment,🔽of the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, together with the community of disciples,

original: sapratyekabuddhānāṃ prathamacittotpādam upādāya /
analyzed: sa pratyekabuddhānām prathama citta utpādam upādāya
translated: and together with the Pratyekabuddhas, of the past, future, and present,

original: yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvad anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau
analyzed: yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau
translated: up to the attainment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, up to the parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without remainder,

original: parinirvṛtānāṃ yāvat saddharmasthitir etasminn antare teṣāṃ sarveṣām anyeṣāṃ ca sarvasattvānāṃ
analyzed: parinirvṛtānām yāvat saddharma sthitiḥ etasmin antare teṣām sarveṣām anyeṣām ca sarva sattvānām
translated: up to the duration of the true Dharma, during that time, of all those and all other beings,

original: yat kuśalamūlaṃ dānapāramitā śīlapāramitā kṣāntipāramitā vīryapāramita dhyānapāramitā
analyzed: yat kuśala mūlam dāna pāramitā śīla pāramitā kṣānti pāramitā vīrya pāramita dhyāna pāramitā
translated: whatever roots of virtue there are, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration,

original: prajñāpāramitā yāvad aparimāṇā buddhadharmās tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā yāvat aparimāṇāḥ buddha dharmāḥ tat sarvam abhisaṃkṣipya piṇḍayitvā
translated: the perfection of wisdom, up to the immeasurable qualities of the Buddha, having combined all that together, having made it into one lump,

original: tulayitvā anupalambhayogenādvayayogenānimittayogena nirupalepayogena nirīhadharmayogena /
analyzed: tulayitvā an upalambha yogena a dvaya yogena a nimitta yogena nirupalepa yogena nirīha dharma yogena
translated: having weighed it, by the yoga of non-apprehension, by the yoga of non-duality, by the yoga of signlessness, by the yoga of non-attachment, by the yoga of the inactive nature of phenomena,

original: agrayānumodanayānumodita anumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayed /🔽evaṃ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā teṣāṃ pūrvakānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ kuladuhitṛṇām antikād
analyzed: agrayā anumodanayā anumodita anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayet  evam sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā teṣām pūrvakānām kula putrāṇām kula duhitṛṇām antikāt
translated: having rejoiced with the highest rejoicing, having rejoiced, he should dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.🔽Thus, that son of good family or daughter of good family would produce much more merit

original: bahutaraṃ puṇyaṃ prasavet / idaṃ ca kuśalamūlaṃ tasya pūrvakasya kuśalamūlasya śatatamīm
analyzed: bahutaram puṇyam prasavet idam ca kuśala mūlam tasya pūrvakasya kuśala mūlasya śatatamīm
translated: than those previous sons of good family or daughters of good family. This root of virtue of his would surpass by a hundred times,

original: api kalāṃ nopaiti yāvad upaniṣadam api na kṣamate / idaṃ bodhisattvena mahāsattvenānupalambhayogena
analyzed: api kalām nā upaiti yāvat upaniṣadam api na kṣamate idam bodhisattvena mahāsattvena anupalambha yogena
translated: It does not even approach a fraction, it is not even a hundredth or a thousandth of it, up to it is not even conceivable by analogy.

original: pariṇāmitam agram ākhyāyate yāvad niruttaram ākhyāyate /
analyzed: pariṇāmitam agram ākhyāyate yāvat niruttaram ākhyāyate
