translated: This is called the supreme dedication, up to it is called unsurpassed.

original: iti pariṇāmakāritram ity uktaḥ pariṇāmamanaskāraḥ
analyzed: iti pariṇāma kāritram iti uktaḥ pariṇāma manaskāraḥ
translated: Thus is the activity of dedication. Thus the mental attention of dedication has been explained.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti said to the Blessed One:

original: yo bhagavaṃs tasya kulaputrasya vā kuladuhitur vā sa ca kuśalamūlānumodanāpariṇāmanāpuṇyaskandha
analyzed: yaḥ bhagavan tasya kula putrasya vā kula duhituḥ vā sa ca kuśala mūla anumodanā pariṇāmanā puṇya skandha
translated: Blessed One, the wholesome roots of that son or daughter of good family, the mass of merit from rejoicing and dedicating that rejoicing,

original: ekataḥ piṇḍīkṛto 'grayānumodanayā numoditaḥ / kathaṃ bhagavann agrānumodanā bhavati
analyzed: ekatas piṇḍīkṛtaḥ grayā anumodanayā numoditaḥ katham bhagavan agrā anumodanā bhavati
translated: when combined into one, when rejoiced in with the foremost rejoicing, Blessed One, how does it become the foremost rejoicing,

original: yāvan niruttarānumodanā bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat niruttarā anumodanā bhavati
translated: up to how does it become the unsurpassed rejoicing?

original: bhagavān āha /🔽yadā sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ arhatāṃ
analyzed: bhagavān āha  yadā sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽When that son or daughter of good family rejoices in the wholesome roots of the Tathagatas, Arhats,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ sapratyekabuddhānām anyeṣāṃ ca sarvasattvānāṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhānām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām sa pratyekabuddhānām anyeṣām ca sarva sattvānām
translated: Perfectly Enlightened Ones of the past, future, and present, together with their assemblies of disciples and Pratyekabuddhas, and of all other beings,

original: kuśalān dharmān na gṛhṇāti na muñcati na manyate nāvamanyate nopalabhate / evaṃ cāsya
analyzed: kuśalān dharmān na gṛhṇāti na muñcati na manyate na avamanyate na upalabhate evam ca asya
translated: He does not grasp or release wholesome dharmas, does not think of them, does not despise them, does not perceive them. And he thinks like this:

original: bhavati naivātra kaścid dharma utpadyate na nirudhyate na saṃkliśyate na vyavadāyate /
analyzed: bhavati na eva atra kaścid dharmaḥ utpadyate na nirudhyate na saṃkliśyate na vyavadāyate
translated: Here, no dharma arises or ceases, is defiled or purified.

original: na ca teṣāṃ dharmāṇāṃ hānir na vṛddhir nāgamo na nirgamo na rāśir nābhāvaḥ /🔽etena paryāyeṇa yac caiṣām atītānāgatapratyutpannāṃ dharmāṇāṃ tathatāvitathatānanyatathatā
analyzed: na ca teṣām dharmāṇām hāniḥ na vṛddhiḥ na āgamaḥ na nirgamaḥ na rāśiḥ na abhāvaḥ  etena paryāyeṇa yat ca eṣām atīta anāgata pratyutpannām dharmāṇām tathatā avitathatā an anya tathatā
translated: And for those dharmas there is no decrease, no increase, no coming, no going, no accumulation, no non-existence.🔽By this method, the suchness, non-falseness, unaltered suchness,

original: dharmatā dharmasthititā dharmaniyāmatā tathāham anumode anumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye🔽pariṇāmayāmīti pariṇāmayet / evam anumodamānasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasyagrānumodanā
analyzed: dharma tā dharma sthiti tā dharma niyāma tā tathā aham anumode anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye  pariṇāmayāmi iti pariṇāmayet evam anumodamānasya bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya agrā anumodanā
translated: nature of dharmas, establishment of dharmas, determination of dharmas of those past, future, and present dharmas,🔽I rejoice in that way, and having rejoiced, I dedicate it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment. If he dedicates like this, then that bodhisattva mahāsattva's foremost rejoicing

original: bhavati yāvan niruttarānumodanā bhavati / asyāḥ khalu punaḥ subhūte anumodanāyā anyā
analyzed: bhavati yāvat niruttarā anumodanā bhavati asyāḥ khalu punar subhūte anumodanāyāḥ anyā
translated: becomes the unsurpassed rejoicing. Compared to that rejoicing,

original: yā anumodanās tāḥ / sarvā śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopayānti yāvad upaniṣadam api na kṣamante /
analyzed: yāḥ anumodanāḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ śatatamīm api kalām na upayānti yāvat upaniṣadam api na kṣamante
translated: all other rejoicings do not approach even a hundredth part, do not amount even to a fraction.🔽Subhūti, this rejoicing is the foremost rejoicing, the best, the most excellent, the most sublime, the highest, the utmost, the unequalled rejoicing.

original: iyaṃ cānumodanā anyābhyo 'numodanābhyo 'gra ākhyāyate /
analyzed: iyam ca anumodanā anyābhyaḥ numodanābhyaḥ gre ākhyāyate
translated: And this rejoicing is declared to be the foremost of all rejoicings.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte navayānasaṃprasthitena kulaputreṇa vā kuladuhitrā /
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte nava yāna saṃprasthitena kula putreṇa vā kula duhitrā
translated: Moreover, Subhuti, a son or daughter of good family who has newly set out in the vehicle,

original: vā teṣāṃ atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ tathāgatānām arhatāṃ samyaksaṃbuddhānāṃ saśrāvakasaṃghānāṃ
analyzed: vā teṣām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām tathāgatānām arhatām samyaksaṃbuddhānām sa śrāvaka saṃghānām
translated: should rejoice in the wholesome roots of all those past, future, and present Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their Shravaka Sanghas,

original: sapratyekabuddhānāṃ prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvac cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: sa pratyekabuddhānām prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: from the production of the first thought of enlightenment up to the attainment of the supreme enlightenment,

original: abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvad anupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtānāṃ yāvat saddharmasthitir
analyzed: abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat an upadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtānām yāvat saddharma sthitiḥ
translated: up to the parinirvana in the realm of Nirvana which leaves nothing behind of those who have attained the supreme enlightenment, up to the establishment of the true Dharma,

original: etasminn antare yat kuśalamūlaṃ dānapāramitāpratisaṃyuktam evaṃ śilaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ
analyzed: etasmin antare yat kuśala mūlam dāna pāramitā pratisaṃyuktam evam śilam kṣāntim vīryam
translated: in the meantime, whatever wholesome roots there are connected with the perfection of giving, and likewise with morality, patience, vigor,

original: dhyānaṃ prajñāpāramitāpratisaṃyuktaṃ yāvad aparimāṇabuddhadharmapratisaṃyuktaṃ /
analyzed: dhyānam prajñāpāramitā pratisaṃyuktam yāvat aparimāṇa buddha dharma pratisaṃyuktam
translated: meditation, and wisdom, up to the unlimited Buddha-dharmas,

original: tato 'nyeṣām api sarvasattvānāṃ yāni kuśalamūlāni dānamayāni śilamayāni bhāvanāmayāni tāni sarvāṇy anumoditukāmena evam anumoditavyam / yathādhimuktis
analyzed: tatas nyeṣām api sarva sattvānām yāni kuśala mūlāni dāna mayāni śila mayāni bhāvanā mayāni tāni sarvāṇi anumoditu kāmena evam anumoditavyam yathā adhimuktiḥ
translated: Then, one who wishes to rejoice in all the wholesome roots of other beings as well, such as those consisting of giving, morality, and meditation, should rejoice thus: 'Just as is one's faith,

original: tathā dānam /
analyzed: tathā dānam
translated: so is one's giving.

original: evaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ yathādhimuktis tathā prajñā /
analyzed: evam śīlam kṣāntim vīryam dhyānam yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā prajñā
translated: Thus, morality, patience, vigor, and meditation. Just as is one's faith, so is one's wisdom.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā rūpaṃ vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārāḥ yathādhimuktis tathā vijñānaṃ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā rūpam vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā vijñānam
translated: Just as is one's faith, so is one's form, feeling, perception, volitional formations. Just as is one's faith, so is one's consciousness.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā dhātava āyatanāni yathādhimuktis tathā pratītyasamutpādaḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā dhātavaḥ āyatanāni yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā pratītyasamutpādaḥ
translated: Just as is one's faith, so are the elements and sense bases. Just as is one's faith, so is dependent origination.

original: yathādhimuktis tathādhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūnyatādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvāśūnyatā /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūnyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva aśūnyatā
translated: Just as is one's faith, so are the emptinesses, from the emptiness of internal phenomena up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: Just as is one's faith, so are the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: yathādhimuktis tathāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ
translated: Just as is one's faith, so are the immeasurable, concentration, and formless attainments.

original: yathādhimuktis tathāryasatyāny aṣṭavimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā ārya satyāni aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ
translated: Just as is one's faith, so are the noble truths, the eight liberations, and the nine successive abodes of concentration.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitavimokṣamukhāni ṣaḍabhijñāḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihita vimokṣa mukhāni ṣaḍabhijñāḥ
translated: As is one’s faith, so are the doors to freedom in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, and the six superknowledges.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni
translated: As is one’s faith, so are all the meditative stabilizations and all the doors of dhāraṇī.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā daśabalavaiśāradyapratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā daśa bala vaiśāradya pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśā āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: As is one’s faith, so are the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā vimuktijñānadarśanaṃ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā vimukti jñāna darśanam
translated: As is one’s faith, so is the knowledge and insight of freedom.

original: yathādhimuktis tathānumodanā /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā anumodanā
translated: As is one’s faith, so is rejoicing.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā te 'tītānāgatapratyutpannā buddhadharmāḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā te tīta anāgata pratyutpannāḥ buddha dharmāḥ
translated: As is one’s faith, so are those past, future, and present buddhadharmas.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā buddhā bhagavantaḥ /🔽yathādhimuktis tathā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatām abhisaṃbodhiḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ  yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām abhisaṃbodhiḥ
translated: As is one’s faith, so are the lord buddhas.🔽As is one’s faith, so is the full awakening of those lord buddhas.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ parinirvāṇaṃ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām parinirvāṇam
translated: As is one’s faith, so is the complete nirvāṇa of those lord buddhas.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ śrāvakāḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām śrāvakāḥ pratyekabuddhāḥ
translated: As is one’s faith, so are the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas of those lord buddhas.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā śrāvakapratyekabuddhaparirvāṇaṃ /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā śrāvaka pratyekabuddha parirvāṇam
translated: As is one’s faith, so is the nirvāṇa of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmatā /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām dharmatā
translated: As is the nature of those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, according to their inclination.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā teṣāṃ śrāvakapratyekabuddhānāṃ dharmatā /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā teṣām śrāvaka pratyekabuddhānām dharmatā
translated: As is the nature of their śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, according to their inclination.

original: yathādhimuktis tathā sarvadharmāṇāṃ sarvasattvānāṃ muktānām aśāntānām akliṣṭānām aviśuddhānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dharmatā /
analyzed: yathā adhimuktiḥ tathā sarva dharmāṇām sarva sattvānām muktānām aśāntānām akliṣṭānām aviśuddhānām dharmāṇām dharma tā
translated: As is the nature of all dharmas, of all beings, of the liberated, the non-liberated, the afflicted, the unafflicted, the pure, and the impure dharmas, according to their inclination.

original: ajātānām asaṃjātānām anutpannānām aniruddhānāṃ dharmāṇāṃ dharmatā /
analyzed: a jātānām a saṃjātānām an utpannānām a niruddhānām dharmāṇām dharma tā
translated: As is the nature of the unborn, unarisen, unproduced, unceased dharmas.

original: 'tathānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayaty asaṃkrāntyavināśitām upādāya / iyaṃ🔽sā subhūte bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām agrā anumodanā yāvan niruttarā anumodanā /
analyzed: tathā anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayati a saṃkrānti a vināśi tām upādāya iyam  sā subhūte bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām agrā anumodanā yāvat niruttarā anumodanā
translated: He dedicates [merit] to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, considering the non-transference and non-destruction [of dharmas].🔽This, Subhūti, is the foremost rejoicing of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, up to the unsurpassed rejoicing.

original: anayā ca subhūte anumodanayā samanvāgato bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarāṃ /
analyzed: anayā ca subhūte anumodanayā samanvāgataḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ kṣipram anuttarām
translated: Endowed with this rejoicing, Subhūti, the bodhisattva-mahāsattva quickly awakens to unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: punar aparaṃ subhūte daśasu dikṣv ekaikasyāṃ diśi gaṅgānadīvālukopameṣu lokadhātuṣu ye te buddhā bhagavantaḥ / saśrāvakasaṃghās tiṣṭhanti dhriyante
analyzed: punar aparam subhūte daśasu dikṣu ekaikasyām diśi gaṅgā nadī vālukā upameṣu lokadhātuṣu ye te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sa śrāvaka saṃghāḥ tiṣṭhanti dhriyante
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, in the ten directions, in each direction, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, there are those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, together with their assemblies of śrāvakas, who abide and endure.

original: tān kaścid eva mahāyānasaṃprasthitaḥ / kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā tathāgatan arhataḥ
analyzed: tān kaścid eva mahāyāna saṃprasthitaḥ kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā tathāgatan arhataḥ
translated: Some great being who has set out in the Great Vehicle, whether a son of good family or a daughter of good family, should honor those Tathāgatas, Arhats,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhān saśrāvakasaṃghān yāvajjīvaṃ sarvasukhopadhānena satkuryād gurukuryād🔽mānayet pūjayec cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ parinirvṛtānāṃ
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhān sa śrāvaka saṃghān yāvajjīvam sarva sukha upadhānena satkuryāt gurukuryāt  mānayet pūjayet cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ parinirvṛtānām
translated: Perfectly Awakened Ones, together with their assemblies of śrāvakas, for as long as they live, with all the requisites of happiness, and should respect them, revere them,🔽and make offerings to them with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for illness, and personal belongings, and to those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, who have attained parinirvāṇa,

original: ca teṣāṃ buddhāṃ bhagavatāṃ rātriṃdivam autsukyam āpadyeta satkaraṇagurukaraṇamānanapūjanaiḥ
analyzed: ca teṣām buddhām bhagavatām rātriṃdivam autsukyam āpadyeta satkaraṇa gurukaraṇa mānana pūjanaiḥ
translated: he should apply himself with eagerness day and night to honor them, respect them, revere them, and make offerings to them,

original: puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanacūrṇacīvaracchatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana cūrṇa cīvara chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: with flowers, incense, perfume, garlands, ointments, powders, robes, parasols, banners, and flags.

original: śīle ca tiṣṭhed upalambhayogena kṣāntiṃ bhāvayed vīryam ārabheta dhyānaṃ samāpadyeta prajñāṃ ca bhāvayed upalambhayogena /
analyzed: śīle ca tiṣṭhet upalambha yogena kṣāntim bhāvayet vīryam ārabheta dhyānam samāpadyeta prajñām ca bhāvayet upalambha yogena
translated: And he should abide in morality, possessing the yoga of apprehension, he should cultivate patience, he should undertake vigor, he should enter into meditation, and he should cultivate wisdom, possessing the yoga of apprehension.

original: yaś ca kulaputro vā kuladuhita vā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodḥau saṃprasthito dānapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā kula duhita vā anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodḍau saṃprasthitaḥ dāna pāramitāyām
translated: And if a son of a good family or a daughter of a good family who has set out for complete enlightenment,

original: caran śīlapāramitāyāṃ caran kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caran vīryapāramitāyāṃ caran dhyānapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: caran śīla pāramitāyām caran kṣānti pāramitāyām caran vīrya pāramitāyām caran dhyāna pāramitāyām
translated: practicing the perfection of giving, practicing the perfection of morality, practicing the perfection of patience, practicing the perfection of perseverance, practicing the perfection of concentration,

original: caran prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann anupalambhayogena tāni kuśalamūlāny anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
analyzed: caran prajñāpāramitāyām caran an upalambha yogena tāni kuśala mūlāni anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye
translated: practicing the perfection of wisdom, dedicates those wholesome roots to complete unsurpassed enlightenment by way of nonapprehension,

original: pariṇāmayati / asya puṇyābhisaṃskārasya kuśalamūlābhisaṃskārasya cāsau paurvakaḥ puṇyābhisaṃskāraḥ
analyzed: pariṇāmayati asya puṇya abhisaṃskārasya kuśala mūla abhisaṃskārasya ca asau paurvakaḥ puṇya abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: compared to the production of the merit of this wholesome production of merit,

original: śatatamīm api kalāṃ nopaiti yāvad upaniṣadam api na kṣamate / ayaṃ sa pariṇāmaḥ /
analyzed: śatatamīm api kalām nā upaiti yāvat upaniṣadam api na kṣamate ayam sa pariṇāmaḥ
translated: this former production of merit does not reach even a hundredth part, and so on up to: it cannot bear comparison. This is the dedication.

original: agra ākhyāyate yāvad niruttara ākhyāyate / evaṃ hi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
analyzed: agre ākhyāyate yāvat niruttare ākhyāyate evam hi subhūte bodhisattvena mahāsattvena
translated: It is called the foremost, and so on up to: it is called unsurpassed. In this way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva

original: dānapāramitāyāṃ caratā śīlapāramitāyāṃ caratā kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caratā vīryapāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: dāna pāramitāyām caratā śīla pāramitāyām caratā kṣānti pāramitāyām caratā vīrya pāramitāyām
translated: who practices the perfection of giving, who practices the perfection of morality, who practices the perfection of patience, who practices the perfection of perseverance,

original: caratā dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caratā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caratā upāyakauśalenānupalambhayogena
analyzed: caratā dhyāna pāramitāyām caratā prajñāpāramitāyām caratā upāya kauśalena anupalambha yogena
translated: while practicing the perfection of meditation, while practicing the perfection of wisdom, through skillful means, without apprehending anything,

original: tāni kuśalamūlāny anumodyānuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyāni /
analyzed: tāni kuśala mūlāni anumodya anuttarāyai samyaksaṃbodhaye pariṇāmayitavyāni
translated: having rejoiced, those wholesome roots should be dedicated to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: ity anumodanāmanaskāra ity ukto 'numodanāmanaskāraḥ
analyzed: iti anumodanā manaskāraḥ iti uktaḥ numodanā manaskāraḥ
translated: Thus has been explained the mental attention of rejoicing.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: avabhāsakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽namaskaraṇīyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: avabhāsa karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  namaskaraṇīyā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom illuminates.🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is to be bowed to.

original: namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai /
analyzed: namaskaromi bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyai
translated: Blessed One, I bow to the perfection of wisdom.

original: anupaliptā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: an upaliptā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unstained.

original: sarvatraidhātukena vitimirakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sarva traidhātukena vitimira karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom removes the darkness of all the three realms.

original: sarvakleśadṛṣṭyandhakāraprahāṇāya /
analyzed: sarva kleśa dṛṣṭi andhakāra prahāṇāya
translated: In order to abandon the darkness of all afflictions and views.

original: agrakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /🔽sarveṣāṃ bodhipakṣyāṇāṃ dharmāṇāṃ kṣemakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: agra karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā  sarveṣām bodhi pakṣyāṇām dharmāṇām kṣema karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is foremost.

original: sarvabhayabhairavopadravaprahāṇāya /
analyzed: sarva bhaya bhairava upadrava prahāṇāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is secure, in order to abandon all fears, terrors, and calamities.

original: ālokakari bhagavan prajñāpāramitā pañcacakṣuḥparigrahāya /
analyzed: āloka kari bhagavan prajñāpāramitā pañca cakṣuḥ parigrahāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the maker of light, because it is the basis for the five eyes.

original: sattvānāṃ mārgadarśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: sattvānām mārga darśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the one that shows the path to beings.

original: kumārgaprayātānāiḥ sattvānām antadvayavivarjanatayā /
analyzed: sattvānām anta dvaya vivarjana tayā
translated: Because it avoids the two extremes for beings who have set out on the wrong path.

original: sarvākārajñatākaraṇī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvavāsanānusaṃdhikleśaprahāṇatām upādāya /
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā karaṇī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarva vāsanā anusaṃdhi kleśa prahāṇa tām upādāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the maker of the knowledge of all aspects, because it leads to the abandonment of all afflictions that are latent tendencies.

original: mātā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mātā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the mother.

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ buddhadharmajananatām upādāya /🔽anutpannā niruddhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā svalakṣaṇaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām buddha dharma janana tām upādāya  anutpannā niruddhā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sva lakṣaṇa śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because it gives birth to the Buddhadharmas of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas.🔽Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is unborn and unceasing, because it is empty of its own mark.

original: saṃsāravimokṣā bhagavan prajñāpāramitākūṭasthāvināśitām upādāya /
analyzed: saṃsāra vimokṣāḥ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā kūṭastha avināśi tām upādāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the liberation from saṃsāra, because it is unchangeable and indestructible.

original: anāthānāṃ sattvānāṃ nāthakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvadharmaratnadātrītām upādāya /
analyzed: anāthānām sattvānām nātha karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarva dharma ratna dātrī tām upādāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the protector of beings without a protector, because it gives the jewel of all dharmas.

original: daśabalakarī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā anavamardanīyatām upādāya /
analyzed: daśa bala karī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā an avamardanīya tām upādāya
translated: Blessed One, the perfection of wisdom is the maker of the ten powers, because it is invincible.

original: triparivartadvādaśākāradharmacakrapravartayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā apravartanānivartanatām upādāya /
analyzed: tri parivarta dvādaśa ākāra dharma cakra pravartayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā a pravartana a nivartana tām upādāya
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the one that sets in motion the wheel of the Dharma with its three revolutions and twelve aspects, because of not causing anything to revolve or not causing anything to be revolved.

original: sarvadharmāṇāṃ svabhāvasaṃdarśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya / iti svabhayaḥ /
analyzed: sarva dharmāṇām svabhāva saṃdarśayitrī bhagavan prajñāpāramitā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya iti sva bhayaḥ
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is the one that shows the intrinsic nature of all dharmas, because of the emptiness of the intrinsic nature of non-existence. Thus it is the intrinsic nature.

original: kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyam /
analyzed: katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: How, Blessed One, should one stand in the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yathā śāriputra śāstari tathā prajñāpāramitāyāṃ sthātavyaṃ /
analyzed: yathā śāriputra śāstari tathā prajñāpāramitāyām sthātavyam
translated: Just as, Śāriputra, one should stand in the perfection of wisdom as in the Teacher.

original: yathā śāstā namaskartavyas tathā prajñāpāramitā namaskatavyā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: yathā śāstā namaskartavyaḥ tathā prajñāpāramitā namaskatavyā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Just as the Teacher should be honored, so the perfection of wisdom should be honored. Why is that?

original: eṣaiva prajñāpāramitā śāstā /
analyzed: eṣā eva prajñāpāramitā śāstā
translated: This very perfection of wisdom is the Teacher.

original: na cānyaḥ śāstā anyā prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: na ca anyaḥ śāstā anyā prajñāpāramitā
translated: And the Teacher is not different from the perfection of wisdom.

original: śāstaiva prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitaiva śāstā / ato hi śariputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
analyzed: śāstā eva prajñāpāramitā prajñāpāramitā eva śāstā atas hi śariputra prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: The Teacher is just the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is just the Teacher. Therefore, Śāriputra, from this perfection of wisdom

original: sarve tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ prabhāvyante bodhisattvāś ca mahāsattvāḥ
analyzed: sarve tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ prabhāvyante bodhisattvāḥ ca mahāsattvāḥ
translated: all Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones are manifested, and also the Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas

original: pratyekabuddhāś cārhantaś cānāgāminaś ca sakṛdāgāminaś ca srotaāpannāś ca prabhāvyante /
analyzed: pratyekabuddhāḥ ca arhantaḥ ca anāgāminaḥ ca sakṛdāgāminaḥ ca srotaāpannāḥ ca prabhāvyante
translated: and the pratyekabuddhas, the arhats, the non-returners, the once-returners, and the stream-enterers are manifested.

original: ataś ca daśakuśalāḥ karmapathāḥ prabhāvyante / catvāri dhyānāni catvāry apramāṇāni
analyzed: atas ca daśa kuśalāḥ karma pathāḥ prabhāvyante catvāri dhyānāni catvāri apramāṇāni
translated: And from that, the ten wholesome courses of action are manifested, and the four meditations, the four immeasurables,

original: catasra ārūpyasamāpattayaḥ prabhāvyante / pañcābhijñāḥ /
analyzed: catasraḥ ārūpya samāpattayaḥ prabhāvyante pañca abhijñāḥ
translated: and the four formless attainments are manifested, and the five superknowledges.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatā bahirdhāśūyatā adhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā bahirdhā śūyatā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both internal and external phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, the thirty-seven factors of awakening,

original: āryasatyāni śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāny aṣṭavimokṣā navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayaḥ sarvapāramitāḥ
analyzed: ārya satyāni śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ sarva pāramitāḥ
translated: the noble truths, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, the eight liberations, the nine successive meditative absorptions, all the perfections,

original: sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvadhāraṇīmukhāni daśabodhisattvabhūmayaḥ prabhāvyante / daśatathāgatabalāni
analyzed: sarva samādhayaḥ sarva dhāraṇī mukhāni daśa bodhisattva bhūmayaḥ prabhāvyante daśa tathāgata balāni
translated: all the meditative absorptions, all the doors of retention, and the ten bodhisattva stages are manifested. The ten powers of the tathāgatas

original: vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvido 'ṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ prabhāvyante yāvat
analyzed: vaiśāradyāni catasraḥ pratisaṃvidaḥ ṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ prabhāvyante yāvat
translated: and the four fearlessnesses, the four unobstructed knowledges, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the buddhas are manifested, up to

original: sarvākārajñatā prabhāvyate
analyzed: sarva ākāra jña tā prabhāvyate
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is manifested.

original: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasyaitad abhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu śakrasya devānām indrasya etat abhūt
translated: Then indeed this occurred to Śakra, lord of the gods:

original: kuta iyam āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā kiṃnidānā vā /
analyzed: kutas iyam āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā kiṃnidānā vā
translated: Where did this question of the Venerable Śāriputra arise, or what is its basis?

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śariputraḥ sakrasya devānām indrasya cetasaiva cetaḥparivitarkam ājñāya śakraṃ devānām indram etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śari putraḥ sakrasya devānām indrasya cetasā eva cetaḥ parivitarkam ājñāya śakram devānām indram etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra, having understood the thought of Śakra, Lord of the Devas, said this to Śakra, Lord of the Devas:

original: yat kauśikaivaṃ vitarkayasi /
analyzed: yat kauśika evam vitarkayasi
translated: Kauśika, you are thinking thus:

original: kuta iyam āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā kiṃnidānā veti / prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītāḥ
analyzed: kutas iyam āyuṣmataḥ śāriputrasya pṛcchā jātā kiṃnidānā vā iti prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītāḥ
translated: Where did this question of the Venerable Śāriputra arise, or what is its basis? Kauśika, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas who are embraced by the perfection of wisdom,

original: kauśika bodhisattvā mahāsattvā upāyakauśalena ca teṣām atītānāgatapratyutpannānāṃ
analyzed: kauśika bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ upāya kauśalena ca teṣām atīta anāgata pratyutpannānām
translated: with skillful means, dedicate all the wholesome roots of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of the past, future, and present,

original: buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ prathamacittotpādam upādāya yāvad anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim🔽abhisaṃbuddhānāṃ yāvat saddharmasthitir etasminn antare yat kiṃcit kuśalaṃ tat sarvākārajñatāyai
analyzed: buddhānām bhagavatām prathama citta utpādam upādāya yāvat anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim  abhisaṃbuddhānām yāvat saddharma sthitiḥ etasmin antare yat kiṃcid kuśalam tat sarva ākāra jña tāyai
translated: from the production of the first thought of enlightenment up to the complete accomplishment of unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment,

original: pariṇāmayantīty etannidānā me pṛcchā jātā / iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvānāṃ /
analyzed: pariṇāmayanti iti etad nidānā me pṛcchā jātā iyam prajñāpāramitā kauśika bodhisattvānām
translated: and as long as the true Dharma endures, to the knowledge of all aspects for the sake of beings. It is on the basis of this that my question arose. This perfection of wisdom, Kauśika, for the bodhisattvas,

original: mahāsattvānāṃ dānapāramitām abhibhavati / evaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ dhyānapāramitām🔽abhibhavati / tadyathāpi nāma kauśika jātyandhānāṃ śataṃ vā sahasraṃ vā śatasahasraṃ
analyzed: mahāsattvānām dāna pāramitām abhibhavati evam śīlam kṣāntim vīryam dhyāna pāramitām  abhibhavati tat yathā api nāma kauśika jāti andhānām śatam vā sahasram vā śata sahasram
translated: It surpasses the perfection of giving of the great beings. Likewise, it surpasses the perfections of morality, patience, effort, and concentration.

original: vā pariṇāyakam abhavyaṃ mārgāvatārāya kuta eva nagarapraveśāya /
analyzed: vā pariṇāyakam abhavyam mārga avatārāya kutas eva nagara praveśāya
translated: Just as, Kauśika, a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand blind people without an eye-leader are incapable of going on a journey, much less of entering a city.

original: evam eva kauśika imā pañcapāramitā jātyandhabhūtā bhavanti prajñāpāramitāṃ vinā pariṇāyakā abhavyā mārgāvatārāya kuta eva sarvākārajñatāmahānagaram
analyzed: evam eva kauśika imāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ jāti andha bhūtāḥ bhavanti prajñāpāramitām vinā pariṇāyakāḥ abhavyāḥ mārga avatārāya kutas eva sarva ākārajña tā mahā nagaram
translated: In the same way, Kauśika, these five perfections are like blind people without the perfection of wisdom as their eye-leader, incapable of entering the path, much less of entering the great city of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: yadā punaḥ kauśika pañcapāramitāḥ prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītā bhavanti tadā pañcapāramitāḥ sacakṣuskā bhavanti pāramitānāmadheyaṃ ca pratilabhante /
analyzed: yadā punar kauśika pañca pāramitāḥ prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītāḥ bhavanti tadā pañca pāramitāḥ sa cakṣuskāḥ bhavanti pāramitā nāmadheyam ca pratilabhante
translated: But when, Kauśika, the five perfections are taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, then the five perfections have eyes and obtain the name of perfections.

original: śakra āha / yad bhadanta śāriputra evam āha /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha yat bhadanta śāriputra evam āha
translated: Śakra said: Venerable Śāriputra, you have said:

original: prajñāpāramitāparigṛhītāḥ pañcapāramitā pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante / na ca bhadanta
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā parigṛhītāḥ pañca pāramitā pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante na ca bhadanta
translated: The five perfections, when taken hold of by the perfection of wisdom, obtain the name of perfections. But, Venerable One,

original: śariputra dānapāramitāparigṛhītāḥ pañcapāramitāḥ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante / evaṃ
analyzed: śariputra dāna pāramitā parigṛhītāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante evam
translated: Śāriputra, the five perfections that are embraced by the perfection of generosity obtain the name of perfections.

original: na śīlakṣāntivīryadhyānapāramitāparigṛhītāḥ pañcapāramitāḥ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante /
analyzed: na śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna pāramitā parigṛhītāḥ pañca pāramitāḥ pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante
translated: In the same way, the five perfections that are embraced by the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration obtain the name of perfections.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: evam etat kauśikaivam etat / na dānapāramitāparigṛhītāḥ kauśika pañcapāramitāḥ pāramitānāmadheyaṃ🔽labhante / evaṃ na śīlakṣāntivīryadhyānapāramitāparigṛhītāḥ kauśika pañcapāramitāḥ
analyzed: evam etat kauśika evam etat na dāna pāramitā parigṛhītāḥ kauśika pañca pāramitāḥ pāramitā nāmadheyam  labhante evam na śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna pāramitā parigṛhītāḥ kauśika pañca pāramitāḥ
translated: It is so, Kauśika, it is so. The five perfections that are embraced by the perfection of generosity, Kauśika, do not obtain the name of perfections.🔽In the same way, the five perfections that are embraced by the perfections of morality, patience, perseverance, and concentration, Kauśika,

original: pāramitānāmadheyaṃ labhante / tasmāt tarhi kauśika prajñāpāramitaiva pañcānāṃ pāramitānām
analyzed: pāramitā nāmadheyam labhante tasmāt tarhi kauśika prajñāpāramitā eva pañcānām pāramitānām
translated: do not obtain the name of perfections. Therefore, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom alone

original: agrā ākhyāyate śreṣṭhā ākhyāyate jyeṣṭhā ākhyāyate varā ākhyāyate pravarā ākhyāyate
analyzed: agrāḥ ākhyāyate śreṣṭhāḥ ākhyāyate jyeṣṭhāḥ ākhyāyate varāḥ ākhyāyate pravarāḥ ākhyāyate
translated: is declared to be the foremost of the five perfections, it is declared to be the best, the highest, the most excellent, the most sublime,

original: uttamā ākhyāyate anuttamā ākhyāyate asamā ākhyāyate asamasamā ākhyāyate /
analyzed: uttamā ākhyāyate anuttamā ākhyāyate asamā ākhyāyate asamasamā ākhyāyate
translated: the supreme, the unsurpassed, the unequalled, the equal of the unequaled.

original: iti śreṣṭhatā
analyzed: iti śreṣṭha tā
translated: Thus is its supremacy.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: How, Blessed One, should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: rūpasya śāriputrānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ
analyzed: rūpasya śāriputra an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā vedanāyāḥ saṃjñāyāḥ
translated: Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished for the non-accomplishment of form, for the non-accomplishment of feeling, perception,

original: saṃskārāṇāṃ vijñānasyānabhinirhārāyā prajñāpāramiṭābhinirhartvyā / evaṃ dhātūnām āyatanānāṃ
analyzed: saṃskārāṇām vijñānasya an abhinirhārāyāḥ prajñāpāramiṭā abhinirhartvyāḥ evam dhātūnām āyatanānām
translated: volitional formations, and consciousness. Thus, for the non-accomplishment of the elements, the sense bases,

original: pratītyasamutpādāṅgānāṃ dānapāramitānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda aṅgānām dāna pāramitā an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: the factors of dependent origination, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished for the non-accomplishment of the perfection of generosity.

original: evaṃ śīlakṣāntivīryadhyānapāramitānabhinirhārāya prajñāpramitābhinirhartavyā / adhyātmaśūyatānabhinirhārāya
analyzed: evam śīla kṣānti vīrya dhyāna pāramitā an abhinirhārāya prajñāpramitā abhinirhartavyā adhyātma śūya tā an abhinirhārāya
translated: Thus, for the non-accomplishment of the perfections of morality, patience, diligence, and concentration, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished. For the non-accomplishment of inner emptiness

original: prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished, up to for the non-accomplishment of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā / daśabalavaiśāradyāveṇikabuddhadharmānabhinirhārāya
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyā dharma an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā daśa bala vaiśāradya āveṇika buddha dharma an abhinirhārāya
translated: For the non-accomplishment of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished. For the non-accomplishment of the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the unique qualities of the Buddha,

original: prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā / sarvadharmānabhinirhārāya prajñāpramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā sarva dharma an abhinirhārāya prajñāpramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished for the non-accomplishment of all dharmas.

original: evaṃ yāvāt sarvākārajñatānabhinirhārāya /
analyzed: evam yāvāt sarva ākārajña tā an abhinirhārāya
translated: Thus up to the accomplishment of the knowledge of all modes.

original: prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: śariputra āha /
analyzed: śariputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan rūpasyānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: katham bhagavan rūpasya an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: Blessed One, how should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished for the non-accomplishment of form?

original: kathaṃ bhagavan yāvat sarvākārajñatānabhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: katham bhagavan yāvat sarva ākārajña tā an abhinirhārāya prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: Blessed One, how should the perfection of wisdom be accomplished for the non-accomplishment of the knowledge of all modes?

original: bhagvān āha /🔽rūpasyānabhisaṃskārato 'nutpādato 'bhāvato 'jātito 'vināśato 'nupalabdhitaḥ /
analyzed: bhagvān āha  rūpasya an abhisaṃskārataḥ n utpādataḥ bhāvataḥ jātitaḥ vināśataḥ n upalabdhitaḥ
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yāvat sarvākārajñatānabhisaṃskārato 'nutpādato 'bhāvato 'jātito 'vināśato 'nupalabdhitaḥ prajñāpāramitābhinirhartavyā /
analyzed: yāvat sarva ākārajña tā an abhisaṃskārataḥ n utpādataḥ bhāvataḥ jātitaḥ vināśataḥ n upalabdhitaḥ prajñāpāramitā abhinirhartavyā
translated: For the non-production, non-existence, non-birth, non-destruction, and non-apprehension of form, up to the non-production, non-existence, non-birth, non-destruction, and non-apprehension of the knowledge of all modes, the perfection of wisdom should be accomplished.

original: iti sarvadharmānabhisaṃskāraḥ
analyzed: iti sarva dharma an abhisaṃskāraḥ
translated: Thus there is no production of all dharmas.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: evam abhinirhṛtā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā katamaṃ dharmam arpayati /
analyzed: evam abhinirhṛtā bhagavan prajñāpāramitā katamam dharmam arpayati
translated: Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is thus accomplished, what dharma does it give up?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evam abhinirhṛtā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati /
analyzed: evam abhinirhṛtā śāriputra prajñāpāramitā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: In this way, Śāriputra, the perfection of wisdom, having been thus accomplished, does not bestow any dharma.

original: yato na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati tasmāt prajñāpāramiteti saṃkhyāṃ gacchati /
analyzed: yatas na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati tasmāt prajñāpāramitā iti saṃkhyām gacchati
translated: Because it does not bestow any dharma, therefore it is reckoned as the perfection of wisdom.

original: śāriputra āha /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: katamaṃ dharmaṃ nārpayati /
analyzed: katamam dharmam na arpayati
translated: What dharma does it not bestow?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na kuśalaṃ dharmam arpayati nākuśalaṃ dharmam arpayati / evaṃ na sāvadyaṃ nānavadyaṃ
analyzed: na kuśalam dharmam arpayati na akuśalam dharmam arpayati evam na sāvadyam na anavadyam
translated: It does not bestow a wholesome dharma, it does not bestow an unwholesome dharma. Thus it does not bestow one with offense, nor one without offense,

original: na sāsravaṃ nānāsravaṃ na saṃskṛtaṃ nāsaṃskṛtaṃ na saṃkleśaṃ na niḥkleśaṃ na laukikaṃ
analyzed: na sa āsravam na anāsravam na saṃskṛtam na asaṃskṛtam na saṃkleśam na niḥkleśam na laukikam
translated: not one with outflows, nor one without outflows, not one conditioned, nor one unconditioned, not one defiled, nor one undefiled, not one worldly,

original: na lokottaraṃ na saṃkliṣṭaṃ na vyavadānaṃ na saṃsāraṃ na nirvāṇam arpayati / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: na lokottaram na saṃkliṣṭam na vyavadānam na saṃsāram na nirvāṇam arpayati tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: not one supramundane, not one defiled, nor one purified, not saṃsāra, nor nirvāṇa. Why is that?

original: na hi prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasyopalambhayogena pratyupasthitā tena kāraṇena na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati /
analyzed: na hi prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasya upalambha yogena pratyupasthitā tena kāraṇena na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati
translated: Because the perfection of wisdom does not stand in the way of the apprehension of any dharma. For that reason, it does not bestow any dharma.

original: atha khalu śakro devānām indro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu śakraḥ devānām indraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, said this to the Blessed One:

original: kim iyaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvākārajñatām api nārpayati /
analyzed: kim iyam bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarva ākāra jña tām api na arpayati
translated: Blessed One, does this perfection of wisdom not bestow even the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yat kauśika evaṃ vadasi /
analyzed: yat kauśikaḥ evam vadasi
translated: Kauśika, as you say,

original: kim iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā sarvākārajñatām api nārpayatīti / evam etat kauśikaivam etat /
analyzed: kim iyam prajñāpāramitā sarva ākāra jña tām api na arpayati iti evam etat kauśika evam etat
translated: Does this perfection of wisdom not even lead to the knowledge of all aspects? It is just so, Kauśika, it is just so.

original: prajñāpāramitā kauśika na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati nopalabhate sarvākārajñatām api nārpayati nopalabhate /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā kauśika na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati na upalabhate sarva ākāra jña tām api na arpayati na upalabhate
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom does not lead to anything, does not apprehend anything, not even the knowledge of all aspects.

original: devendra āha /
analyzed: devendraḥ āha
translated: The Lord of gods said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarvākārajñatām api nārpayati nopalabhate /
analyzed: katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitā sarva ākāra jña tām api na arpayati na upalabhate
translated: Blessed One, how does the perfection of wisdom not even lead to the knowledge of all aspects?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na hi kauśika prajñāpramitā yathā nāma yathā nimittaṃ yathābhisaṃskāras tathārpayati /
analyzed: na hi kauśika prajñāpramitā yathā nāma yathā nimittam yathā abhisaṃskāraḥ tathā arpayati
translated: Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom does not lead to anything as a name, as a sign, as a designation.

original: devendra āha /
analyzed: devendraḥ āha
translated: The Lord of gods said:

original: kathaiḥ punar bhagavann arpayati /
analyzed: kathaiḥ punar bhagavan arpayati
translated: Blessed One, how then does it lead?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yathā nopaiti nopādadāti nadhitiṣṭhati na prajahāti nābhiniviśate /
analyzed: yathā na upaiti na upādadāti na adhitiṣṭhati na prajahāti na abhiniviśate
translated: As it does not approach, does not grasp, does not abide, does not abandon, does not become attached,

original: tathārpayati yathā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati muñcati na pratigṛhṇāti / evaṃ hi kauśika prajñāpāramitā sarvadharmān nārpayati na muñcati na
analyzed: tathā arpayati yathā na kaṃcid dharmam arpayati muñcati na pratigṛhṇāti evam hi kauśika prajñāpāramitā sarva dharmān na arpayati na muñcati na
translated: it leads in such a way that it does not lead to anything, does not release anything, does not take anything up. In this way, Kauśika, the perfection of wisdom does not lead to any dharma, does not release any dharma, does not take up any dharma.

original: śakra āha / āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvad iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā sarvadharmāṇām anutpādāya anirodhāya anabhisaṃskārāya anupalabdhaye avināśāya pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: śakraḥ āha āścaryam bhagavan yāvat iyam prajñāpāramitā sarva dharmāṇām an utpādāya a nirodhāya an abhisaṃskārāya an upalabdhaye a vināśāya pratyupasthitā
translated: Shakra said: It is wonderful, Blessed One, that this perfection of wisdom is present for the non-production, non-cessation, non-manifestation, non-apprehension, and non-destruction of all dharmas.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhuti said to the Blessed One:

original: saced bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evaṃ saṃjñāsyati /
analyzed: saced bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evam saṃjñāsyati
translated: Blessed One, if a bodhisattva mahasattva practicing the perfection of wisdom thinks like this:

original: prajñāpāramitā sarvadharmān nārpayatīti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā sarva dharmān na arpayati iti
translated: 'The perfection of wisdom does not lead to the relinquishment of all dharmas,'

original: riñciṣyati bhagavan prajñāpāramitāṃ dūrīkariṣyati bhagavan prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: riñciṣyati bhagavan prajñāpāramitām dūrīkariṣyati bhagavan prajñāpāramitām
translated: Blessed One, that bodhisattva mahasattva will abandon the perfection of wisdom, will distance themselves from the perfection of wisdom.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: asti subhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvo mahāsattvo riñcan prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: asti subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ riñcan prajñāpāramitām
translated: Subhuti, there is a way in which a bodhisattva mahasattva, by that way, will abandon the perfection of wisdom,

original: dūrīkuryān prajñāpāramitām / saced bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carann evaṃ saṃjñāsyati /
analyzed: dūrīkuryān prajñāpāramitām saced bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caran evam saṃjñāsyati
translated: will distance themselves from the perfection of wisdom. If a bodhisattva mahasattva practicing the perfection of wisdom thinks like this:

original: rikteyaṃ prajñāpāramiteyaṃ tucchā asārā vaśikeyaṃ prajñāpāramiteti /
analyzed: riktā iyam prajñāpāramitā iyam tucchā asārā vaśikā iyam prajñāpāramitā iti
translated: 'This perfection of wisdom is empty, this perfection of wisdom is false, this perfection of wisdom is insubstantial, this perfection of wisdom is powerless,'

original: riñciṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitāṃ dūrīkariṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ
analyzed: riñciṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām dūrīkariṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva will abandon the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva mahāsattva will relegate the perfection of wisdom to a distance.

original: prajñāpāramitām / ayaṃ subhūte paryāyo yena paryāyeṇa riñciṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām ayam subhūte paryāyaḥ yena paryāyeṇa riñciṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ
translated: This, Subhūti, is the method by which the bodhisattva mahāsattva will abandon

original: prajñāpāramitāṃ dūrīkariṣyati bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitām dūrīkariṣyati bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām
translated: the perfection of wisdom, the bodhisattva mahāsattva will relegate the perfection of wisdom to a distance.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavan pratyarpitayā katame dharmāḥ pratyarpitā bhavanti /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā bhagavan pratyarpitayā katame dharmāḥ pratyarpitāḥ bhavanti
translated: Blessed One, when the perfection of wisdom is returned, which dharmas are returned?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: prajñāpāramitayā subhūte pratyarpitayā na rūpaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitayā subhūte pratyarpitayā na rūpam pratyarpitam bhavati
translated: Subhūti, when the perfection of wisdom is returned, form is not returned.

original: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / na cakṣuḥ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na vedanā na saṃjñā na saṃskārāḥ na vijñānam pratyarpitam bhavati na cakṣuḥ pratyarpitam bhavati
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not returned. The eyes are not returned.

original: na śrotraṃ na ghrāṇaṃ na jihvā na kāyo na manaḥ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / na rūpaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na śrotram na ghrāṇam na jihvā na kāyaḥ na manaḥ pratyarpitam bhavati na rūpam pratyarpitam bhavati
translated: The ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are not returned. Form is not returned.

original: na śabdo na gandho na raso na spraṣṭavyaṃ na dharmāḥ pratyarpitā bhavanti / na dānapāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati /
analyzed: na śabdaḥ na gandhaḥ na rasaḥ na spraṣṭavyam na dharmāḥ pratyarpitāḥ bhavanti na dāna pāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati
translated: Sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are not given back. The perfection of giving is not given back.

original: na śīlapāramitā na kṣāntipāramitā na vīryapāramitā na dhyānapāramitā na prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: na śīla pāramitā na kṣānti pāramitā na vīrya pāramitā na dhyāna pāramitā na prajñāpāramitā
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom

original: pratyarpitā bhavati / nādhyātmaśūnyatā pratyarpitā bhavati / na bahirdhāśūnyatā pratyarpitā
analyzed: pratyarpitā bhavati na adhyātma śūnyatā pratyarpitā bhavati na bahirdhā śūnyatā pratyarpitā
translated: are not given back. The emptiness of internal phenomena is not given back. The emptiness of external phenomena is not given back.

original: bhavati / nādhyātmabahirdhāśūnyatā pratyarpitā bhavati yāvan nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā
analyzed: bhavati nā adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatā pratyarpitā bhavati yāvat nā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā
translated: The emptiness of both internal and external phenomena is not given back, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence

original: pratyarpitā bhavati / na saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ pratyarpitā bhavanti / na
analyzed: pratyarpitā bhavati na saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ pratyarpitāḥ bhavanti na
translated: is not given back. The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are not given back.

original: daśabalavaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāṣṭādaśāveṇikā buddhadharmāḥ pratyarpitā bhavanti /
analyzed: daśa bala vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na aṣṭādaśa āveṇikāḥ buddha dharmāḥ pratyarpitāḥ bhavanti
translated: The ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the analytical knowledges, and the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha are not given back.

original: na srotaāpattiphalṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / na sakṛdāgāmiphalaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na srotaāpatti phalm pratyarpitam bhavati na sakṛdāgāmi phalam pratyarpitam bhavati
translated: The fruit of stream-entry is not given back. The fruit of once-returning is not given back.

original: nānāgāmiphalaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / nārhattvaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / na pratyekabuddhatvaṃ
analyzed: na anāgāmi phalam pratyarpitam bhavati na arhat tvam pratyarpitam bhavati na pratyekabuddha tvam
translated: the fruit of non-returner is not given back, the fruit of arhatship is not given back, the state of a pratyekabuddha

original: pratyarpitaṃ bhavati / nānuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ pratyarpitā bhavati /
analyzed: pratyarpitam bhavati na anuttarā samyaksaṃbodhiḥ pratyarpitā bhavati
translated: is not given back, and unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment is not given back.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: kathaṃ bhagavan prajñāpāramitayā pratyarpitayā na rūpaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati yāvad na sarvākārajñatā pratyarpitā bhavati /
analyzed: katham bhagavan prajñāpāramitayā pratyarpitayā na rūpam pratyarpitam bhavati yāvat na sarva ākārajña tā pratyarpitā bhavati
translated: How, Blessed One, is form not given back when the perfection of wisdom is given back, up to how is the knowledge of all aspects not given back?

original: bhagavān āha /🔽rūpasya subhūte 'nupalabdhyā prajñāpāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati yāvat sarvākārajñatānupalabdhyā
analyzed: bhagavān āha  rūpasya subhūte n upalabdhyā prajñāpāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati yāvat sarva ākāra jña tā an upalabdhyā
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom is given back by the non-apprehension of form, up to

original: prajñāpāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati / evaṃ khalu subhūte prajñāpāramitayā pratyarpitayā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā pratyarpitā bhavati evam khalu subhūte prajñāpāramitayā pratyarpitayā
translated: the perfection of wisdom is given back by the non-apprehension of the knowledge of all aspects. Thus, Subhūti, when the perfection of wisdom is given back,

original: na rūpaṃ pratyarpitaṃ bhavati yāvad na sarvākārajñatā pratyarpita bhavati /
analyzed: na rūpam pratyarpitam bhavati yāvat na sarva ākārajña tā bhavati
translated: form is not given back, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not given back.

original: iti sarvadharmānupalambhābhisamayārpyaṇā
analyzed: iti sarva dharma anupalambha abhisamaya arpyaṇā
translated: Thus is the giving back through the realization of the non-apprehension of all dharmas.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: This perfection of wisdom, Blessed One, is a great perfection.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tat kiṃ manyase /
analyzed: tat kim manyase
translated: What do you think about this?

original: subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: subhūte katamena paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: Subhūti, by what method is this the great perfection, namely the perfection of wisdom?

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: na bhagavan rūpaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti /
analyzed: na bhagavan rūpam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: Blessed One, it does not make form great or small.

original: vedanāṃ saṃjñāṃ saṃskārān na vijñānaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / evaṃ dhātūn āyatanāni
analyzed: vedanām saṃjñām saṃskārān na vijñānam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti evam dhātūn āyatanāni
translated: It does not make feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness great or small. In the same way, it does not make the elements, the sense bases,

original: pratītyasamutpādāṅgāni na mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na dānapāramitāṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti /
analyzed: pratītyasamutpāda aṅgāni na mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na dāna pāramitām mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: the factors of dependent origination great or small. It does not make the perfection of generosity great or small.

original: evaṃ śīlaṃ kṣāntiṃ vīryaṃ dhyānaṃ na prajñāpāramitāṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / nādhyātmaśūnyatāṃ
analyzed: evam śīlam kṣāntim vīryam dhyānam na prajñāpāramitām mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na adhyātma śūnyatām
translated: In the same way, it does not make morality, patience, vigor, or concentration great or small. It does not make the perfection of wisdom great or small. It does not make the emptiness of internal phenomena

original: mahatkaroti nālpīkatoti yāvan nābhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatāṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na
analyzed: mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti yāvat na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na
translated: great or small, up to it does not make the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence great or small. It does not make

original: saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyān dharmān mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / nāryasatyāni nāpramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattīḥ
analyzed: saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyān dharmān mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na ārya satyāni na apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīḥ
translated: the thirty-seven factors of awakening great or small. It does not make the noble truths, the immeasurable, concentration, formless attainments,

original: na śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni nābhijñā mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na tathāgatabalāni
analyzed: na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni na abhijñāḥ mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na tathāgata balāni
translated: the emptiness, signless, and wishless, or the superknowledges great or small. It does not make the powers of the Tathāgata

original: na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvido nāṣṭādaśāveṇikān buddhadharmān mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti /
analyzed: na vaiśāradyāni na pratisaṃvidaḥ na aṣṭādaśa āveṇikān buddha dharmān mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti
translated: does not make the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha great or small.

original: na bodhiṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na buddhadharmaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / yāvan
analyzed: na bodhim mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na buddha dharmam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti yāvan
translated: does not make awakening great or small, does not make the Dharma of a Buddha great or small, and so on up to

original: na buddhaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na rūpaṃ vipulīkaroti na parittīkaroti / na rūpaṃ
analyzed: na buddham mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na rūpam vipulīkaroti na parittīkaroti na rūpam
translated: does not make a Buddha great or small. does not make form extensive or limited, does not make form

original: balavatkaroti na durbalīkaroti / anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ
analyzed: balavatkaroti na durbalīkaroti anena bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām
translated: strong or weak. For this reason, Blessed One, this perfection is a great perfection for bodhisattva great beings,

original: mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā / sacet punar navayānasaṃprasthito bodhisattvo
analyzed: mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā saced punar nava yāna saṃprasthitaḥ bodhisattvaḥ
translated: namely, the perfection of wisdom. If a bodhisattva great being who has newly set out in the vehicle

original: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām āgamya dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ kṣāntipāramitāṃ
analyzed: mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām āgamya dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām kṣānti pāramitām
translated: having relied on the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience,

original: śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitām āgamya evaṃ jñāsyati na prajñāpāramitā rūpaṃ mahatkaroti
analyzed: śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām āgamyaḥ evam jñāsyati na prajñāpāramitā rūpam mahatkaroti
translated: the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving, will know thus: the perfection of wisdom does not make form great

original: nālpīkaroti yāvan na buddhadharmaṃ mahatkaroti nālpīkaroti / na rūpaṃ balavatkaroti
analyzed: na alpīkaroti yāvat na buddha dharmam mahatkaroti na alpīkaroti na rūpam balavatkaroti
translated: or small, and so on up to does not make the Dharma of a Buddha great or small. does not make form strong🔽or weak.

original: na durbalīkaroti / evaṃ saṃjānan bodhisattvo mahāsattvo na carati prajñāpāramitāyāṃ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: na durbalīkaroti evam saṃjānan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ na carati prajñāpāramitāyām tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Thus knowing, the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not practice the perfection of wisdom. Why is that?

original: naiṣa bhagavan niṣyandaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ / yad rūpaṃ mahad alpaṃ vā kuryād yāvad buddhadharmaṃ mahad alpaṃ vā kuryān naiṣa prajñāpāramitāyā
analyzed: na eṣa bhagavat nisyandaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāḥ yat rūpam mahat alpam vā kuryāt yāvat buddha dharmam mahat alpam vā kuryāt na eṣa prajñāpāramitāyāḥ
translated: Blessed One, that the perfection of wisdom would make form either great or small is not its outflow. That it would make the Buddha-dharmas either great or small is not the outflow of the perfection of wisdom.

original: niṣyandaḥ / tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: nisyandaḥ tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: na hy upalambhasaṃjñino bodhisattvās tathā sattvājātitayā prajñāpāramitā draṣṭavyā / rūpājātitaḥ prajñāpāramitājātitā /
analyzed: na hi upalambha saṃjñinaḥ bodhisattvāḥ tathā sattva ajāti tayā prajñāpāramitā draṣṭavyā rūpa ajātitaḥ prajñāpāramitā jāti tā
translated: Because bodhisattvas who have the notion of an object do not see the perfection of wisdom as the non-arising of beings. The non-arising of form should be seen as the non-arising of the perfection of wisdom.

original: draṣṭavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānājātitaḥ prajñāpāramitājātitā draṣṭavyā yāvad
analyzed: draṣṭavyāḥ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñāna a jātitaḥ prajñāpāramitā jāti tā draṣṭavyā yāvat
translated: The non-arising of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness should be seen as the non-arising of the perfection of wisdom. Up to

original: buddhājātitaḥ prajñāpāramitājātitā draṣṭavyā / sattvāsvabhāvatayā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvatā
analyzed: buddha ajātitaḥ prajñāpāramitā jāti tā draṣṭavyā sattva asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā
translated: the non-arising of the Buddha should be seen as the non-arising of the perfection of wisdom. The nature of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as the nature of beings.

original: draṣṭavyā / rūpāsvabhāvatayā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvatā draṣṭavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā
analyzed: draṣṭavyā rūpa asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā draṣṭavyā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: The nature of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as the nature of form. The nature of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as the nature of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness.

original: vijñānāsvabhāvatayā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvatā draṣṭayyā yāvad buddhāsvabhāvatayā prajñāpāramitāsvabhāvatā
analyzed: vijñāna asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā draṣṭayyā yāvat buddha asvabhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā svabhāva tā
translated: The nature of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as the nature of consciousness, up to the nature of the perfection of wisdom should be seen as the nature of a buddha.

original: draṣṭavyā / rūpābhāvatayā prajñāpāramitābhāvatā veditavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānābhāvatayā
analyzed: draṣṭavyā rūpa abhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā bhāva tā veditavyā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñāna abhāva tayā
translated: The absence of form should be known as the absence of the perfection of wisdom. The absence of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness

original: prajñāpāramitābhāvatā veditavyā yāvad buddhābhāvatayā prajñāpāramitābhāvatā veditavyā /🔽sattvaśūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā veditavyā / rūpaśūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā bhāva tā veditavyā yāvat buddha abhāva tayā prajñāpāramitā bhāva tā veditavyā  sattva śūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā veditavyā rūpa śūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā
translated: should be known as the absence of the perfection of wisdom. Up to the absence of a buddha should be known as the absence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: veditavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānaśūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā veditavyā
analyzed: veditavyāḥ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñāna śūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyatā veditavyā
translated: The emptiness of beings should be known as the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. The emptiness of form should be known as the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. The emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness

original: yāvad buddhaśūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyata veditavyā / evaṃ sattvānimittatayā sattvāpraṇihitatayā
analyzed: yāvat buddha śūnyatayā prajñāpāramitā śūnyata veditavyā evam sattva animitta tayā sattva apraṇihita tayā
translated: should be known as the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. Up to the emptiness of a buddha should be known as the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom. In the same way, the signlessness of beings, the wishlessness of beings,🔽the signlessness and wishlessness of the perfection of wisdom. The signlessness and wishlessness of form,

original: prajñāpāramitānimittatāpraṇihitatā / rūpānimittatayāpraṇihitatayā prajñāpāramitānimittatāpraṇihitatā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā nimitta tā a praṇihita tā rūpa a nimitta tayā a praṇihita tayā prajñāpāramitā nimitta tā a praṇihita tā
translated: the signlessness and wishlessness of the perfection of wisdom.

original: vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānānimittatayāpraṇihitatayā prajñāpāramitānimittatāpraṇihitatā
analyzed: vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñāna a nimitta tayā a praṇihita tayā prajñāpāramitā nimitta tā a praṇihita tā
translated: The non-sign and non-resolve of feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness are the non-sign and non-resolve of the perfection of wisdom.

original: yāvad buddhānimittatayāpraṇihitatayā prajñāpāramitānimittatāpraṇihitatā / evaṃ sattvāsattayā
analyzed: yāvat buddha a nimitta tayā a praṇihita tayā prajñāpāramitā nimitta tā a praṇihita tā evam sattva asattayā
translated: Up to the non-sign and non-resolve of the Buddhas are the non-sign and non-resolve of the perfection of wisdom. Thus, the non-existence of the perfection of wisdom should be known through the non-existence of beings.

original: prajñāpāramitāsattā veditavyā / sattvācintyatayā prajñāpāramitācintyatā veditavyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā sattā veditavyā sattva acintya tayā prajñāpāramitā acintya tā veditavyā
translated: The inconceivability of the perfection of wisdom should be known through the inconceivability of beings.

original: sattvāvināśitayā prajñāpāramitāvināśitā veditavyā / sattvānabhisaṃbodhanatayā prajñāpāramitānabhisaṃbodhanatā
analyzed: sattva avināśi tayā prajñāpāramitā vināśi tā veditavyā sattva an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā
translated: The indestructibility of the perfection of wisdom should be known through the indestructibility of beings. The non-realization of the perfection of wisdom

original: veditavyā / rūpānabhisaṃbodhanatayā prajñāpāramitānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā
analyzed: veditavyā rūpa an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārā
translated: should be known through the non-realization of beings. The non-realization of the perfection of wisdom should be known through the non-realization of form. The non-realization of feeling, perception, volitional formations,

original: vijñānānabhisaṃbodhanatayā prajñāpāramitānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditvayā yāvad buddhānabhisaṃbodhanatayā
analyzed: vijñāna an abhisaṃbodhana tayā prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditvayā yāvat buddha an abhisaṃbodhana tayā
translated: and consciousness should be known through the non-realization of the perfection of wisdom. Up to the non-realization of the Buddhas🔽should be known through the non-realization of the perfection of wisdom. The perfection of wisdom

original: prajñāpāramitānabhisaṃbodhanatā veditavyā / sattvabalāsamanvāgatatayā prajñāpāramitā
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā an abhisaṃbodhana tā veditavyā sattva bala a samanvāgata tayā prajñāpāramitā
translated: should be known through the non-possession of the power of beings.

original: balāsamanvāgatatā veditavyā / rūpabalāsamanvāgatatayā prajñāpāramitā balāsamanvāgatatā🔽veditavyā / vedanāsaṃjñāsaṃskārā vijñānabalāsamanvāgatayā prajñāpāramitā balāsamanvāgatatā
analyzed: bala a samanvāgata tā veditavyā rūpa bala a samanvāgata tayā prajñāpāramitā bala a samanvāgata tā  veditavyāḥ vedanā saṃjñā saṃskārāḥ vijñāna bala a samanvāgatayā prajñāpāramitā bala a samanvāgata tā
translated: The lack of vigor should be understood as the lack of vigor in form.🔽The lack of vigor in feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness should be understood as the lack of vigor in the perfection of wisdom.

original: veditavyā yāvad buddhabalāsamanvāgatatayā prajñāpāramitā balāsamanvāgatatā vedjtavyā /
analyzed: veditavyā yāvat buddha bala a samanvāgata tayā prajñāpāramitā bala a samanvāgata tā vedjtavyā
translated: The lack of vigor in the powers should be understood as the lack of vigor in the perfection of wisdom.

original: anenāpi bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahāpāramiteyaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ yad uta prajñāpāramitā /
analyzed: anena api bhagavan paryāyeṇa mahā pāramitā iyam bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām yat uta prajñāpāramitā
translated: For this reason, Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva-mahāsattvas is a great perfection.

original: iti mahārthatety ukto 'bhinirhāraḥ
analyzed: iti mahārtha tā iti uktaḥ bhinirhāraḥ
translated: Thus, the accomplishment of great purpose has been explained.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān śāriputro bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Śāriputra said this to the Blessed One:

original: yo 'yaṃ bhagavan bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣyate /
analyzed: yaḥ yam bhagavan bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitām adhimokṣyate
translated: Blessed One, this bodhisattva-mahāsattva who will aspire to the perfection of wisdom,

original: kutaś cyutvā sa ihāgato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kutas cyutvā saḥ iha āgataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: having died from where will he come here?

original: kiyaccirasaṃprasthitaḥ sa kulaputro vā kuladuhitā vā abhūd anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: kiyat cira saṃprasthitaḥ sa kula putraḥ vā kula duhitā vā abhūt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: For how long has that son or daughter of good family been set out for supreme perfect enlightenment?

original: kiyanto vānena tathāgatāḥ paryupāsitāḥ /
analyzed: kiyantaḥ vā anena tathāgatāḥ paryupāsitāḥ
translated: How many Tathāgatas has he attended upon?

original: kiyacciraṃ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram
translated: For how long?

original: sa dānapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ /
analyzed: sa dāna pāramitāyām caritaḥ
translated: He has practiced the perfection of generosity.

original: kiyacciraṃ śīlapāramitāṃ caritaḥ /🔽kiyacciraṃ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram śīla pāramitām caritaḥ  kiyat ciram kṣānti pāramitāyām caritaḥ
translated: For how long has he practiced the perfection of morality?🔽For how long has he practiced the perfection of patience?

original: kiyacciraṃ vīryapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram vīrya pāramitāyām caritaḥ
translated: For how long has he practiced the perfection of effort?

original: kiyacciraṃ dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ /
analyzed: kiyat ciram dhyāna pāramitāyām caritaḥ
translated: For how long has he practiced the perfection of concentration?

original: kiyacciraṃ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ carito ya imāṃ prajñāpāramitām arthataś ca nayataś cādhimokṣyate /
analyzed: kiyat ciram prajñāpāramitāyām caritaḥ yaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām arthataḥ ca nayataḥ ca adhimokṣyate
translated: For how long has he practiced the perfection of wisdom, who will have confidence in this perfection of wisdom both in terms of its meaning and its teaching?

original: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam śāriputram etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the Venerable Śāriputra:

original: sa khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo daśasu dikṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān paryupāsyehāgata ihopapanno bhaviṣyati / iti
analyzed: sa khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ daśasu dikṣu tathāgatān arhataḥ samyaksaṃbuddhān paryupāsya iha āgataḥ iha upapannaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, having attended upon the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones in the ten directions, will come here and be reborn here.

original: yaḥ khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvo 'saṃkhyeyāny aprameyāṇi kalpakoṭīniyutaśatasahasrāṇi samudāgato 'bhūd anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: yaḥ khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ saṃkhyeyāni aprameyāṇi kalpa koṭī niyuta śata sahasrāṇi samudāgataḥ bhūt anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Śāriputra, that bodhisattva mahāsattva who has been developing the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment for countless, incalculable hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of eons,

original: sa prathamacittotpādam upādāya dānapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ śīlapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ kṣāntipāramitāyāṃ
analyzed: sa prathama citta utpādam upādāya dāna pāramitāyām caritaḥ śīla pāramitāyām caritaḥ kṣānti pāramitāyām
translated: He, having practiced the perfection of giving, having practiced the perfection of morality, having practiced the perfection of patience,

original: carito vīryapāramitāyāṃ carito dhyānapāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ prajñāpāramitāyāṃ caritaḥ🔽sann ihāgato bhaviṣyati / sa khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā
analyzed: caritaḥ vīrya pāramitāyām caritaḥ dhyāna pāramitāyām caritaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām caritaḥ  san iha āgataḥ bhaviṣyati sa khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ prajñāpāramitayā
translated: having practiced the perfection of effort, having practiced the perfection of concentration, having practiced the perfection of wisdom,

original: dṛṣṭayā śrutayā vā śāstā mayā dṛṣṭa iti cittam utpādayiṣyati /
analyzed: dṛṣṭayā śrutayā vā śāstā mayā dṛṣṭaḥ iti cittam utpādayiṣyati
translated: having come here, that bodhisattva mahāsattva, Śāriputra, having seen or heard this perfection of wisdom, will produce the thought, 'The Teacher has been seen by me.'🔽He will produce the thought, 'The Teacher has been heard by me.' That bodhisattva mahāsattva, Śāriputra, will understand this perfection of wisdom

original: śāstā mayā śruta iti cittam utpādayiṣyati / sa khalu punaḥ śāriputra bodhisattvo mahāsattva imāṃ prajñāpāramitām arthataś ca nayataś cādhigamiṣyaty
analyzed: śāstā mayā śrutaḥ iti cittam utpādayiṣyati sa khalu punar śāriputra bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ imām prajñāpāramitām arthataḥ ca nayataḥ ca adhigamiṣyati
translated: in terms of its meaning and method.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān subhūtir bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti said this to the Blessed One:

original: śakyā punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā draṣṭuṃ vā śrotuṃ vā /
analyzed: śakyā punar bhagavan prajñāpāramitā draṣṭum vā śrotum vā
translated: Blessed One, is it possible to see or hear the perfection of wisdom?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: no hīdaṃ subhūte na hi subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śrotāro draṣṭāro na prajñāpāramitāṃ
analyzed: no hi idam subhūte na hi subhūte prajñāpāramitāyāḥ śrotāraḥ draṣṭāraḥ na prajñāpāramitām
translated: No, Subhūti. The perfection of wisdom has no hearers or seers. The perfection of wisdom

original: te paśyanti na śṛṇvanti dharmajaḍatām upādaya / evaṃ dhyānapāramitāṃ vīryapāramitāṃ
analyzed: te paśyanti na śṛṇvanti dharma jaḍa tām upādayaḥ evam dhyāna pāramitām vīrya pāramitām
translated: They do not see or hear the perfection of meditation, the perfection of perseverance,

original: kṣāntipāramitāṃ śīlapāramitāṃ dānapāramitāṃ te na paśyanti na śṛṇvanti dharmajaḍatām
analyzed: kṣānti pāramitām śīla pāramitām dāna pāramitām te na paśyanti na śṛṇvanti dharma jaḍa tām
