analyzed: na bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ na adhyātma bahirdhā śūnyatāyāḥ dāyikā vā chorikā vā  yāvat na abhāva svabhāva śūnyatāyāḥ dāyikā vā chorikā vā na a pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattīnām  dāyikāḥ vā chorikāḥ vā na caturṇām ārya satyānām na aṣṭānām vimokṣāṇām na nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattīnām  na śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: nor is it one that gives or takes away outer emptiness, nor inner and outer emptiness.

original: na ṣaṇṇām abhijñānāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /🔽na daśānāṃ bodhisattvabhūmīnāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na ṣaṇṇām abhijñānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā 🔽na daśānām bodhisattva bhūmīnām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of emptiness, nor the emptiness of the great, nor the ultimate emptiness, nor the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, nor the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, nor the emptiness of the unlimited, nor the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, nor the emptiness of non-discarded phenomena, nor the emptiness of inherent nature, nor the emptiness of all phenomena, nor the emptiness of its own characteristics. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of other phenomena, nor is it one that gives or takes away the emptiness of its own characteristics. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of all phenomena, nor the emptiness of other phenomena, nor the emptiness of its own characteristics, nor the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of other phenomena, nor is it one that gives or takes away the emptiness of its own characteristics. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of all phenomena, nor the emptiness of other phenomena, nor the emptiness of its own characteristics, nor the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of other phenomena, nor is it one that gives or takes away the emptiness of its own characteristics. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of all phenomena, nor the emptiness of other phenomena, nor the emptiness of its own characteristics, nor the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of other phenomena, nor is it one that gives or takes away the emptiness of its own characteristics. It is not one that gives or takes away the emptiness of inherent nature. It is not one that gives or

original: na daśānāṃ tathāgatabalānāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na daśānām tathāgata balānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the ten powers of the Tathāgata.🔽It is not the giver or the taker of the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: na smṛtyupasthānānāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā / evaṃ na samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgamārgānāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā / na balānāṃ /
analyzed: na smṛti upasthānānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā evam na samyakprahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅga mārgānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā na balānām
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: na vaiśāradyānāṃ na pratisaṃvidāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na vaiśāradyānām na pratisaṃvidām dāyikāḥ vā chorikāḥ vā
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the emptiness, signless, and wishless gateways.

original: nāṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānāṃ buddhadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na aṣṭādaśānām āveṇikānām buddha dharmāṇām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the ten wholesome actions.

original: na samādhīnāṃ na dhāraṇīmukhānāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /🔽na srotaāpattiphalasya dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na samādhīnām na dhāraṇī mukhānām dāyikā vā chorikā vā  na srotaāpatti phalasya dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, or four formless absorptions.

original: na sakṛdāgāmiphalasya nānāgāmiphalasya nārhattvasya na pratyekabuddhatvasya na sarvajñatāyā dāyikā vā cchorikā vā / iti dvitiyaṃ mārgajñatādhikārasamāptidīpanam
analyzed: na sakṛdāgāmi phalasya na anāgāmi phalasya na arhat tvasya na pratyekabuddha tvasya na sarvajña tāyāḥ dāyikā vā chorikā vā iti dvitiyam mārga jña tā adhikāra samāpti dīpanam
translated: It is not the giver or the taker of the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, or the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sā khalu punar iyaṃ subhūte prajñāpāramitā na buddhadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: sā khalu punar iyam subhūte prajñāpāramitā na buddha dharmāṇām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: This perfection of wisdom is not the giver or the taker of the buddhadharmas.

original: na pṛthagjanadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na pṛthagjana dharmāṇām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: She is not a giver or a taker of the qualities of ordinary people.

original: na śrāvakapratyekabuddhadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: na śrāvaka pratyekabuddha dharmāṇām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: She is not a giver or a taker of the qualities of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: nāpi buddhadharmāṇāṃ dāyikā vā cchorikā vā /
analyzed: nā api buddha dharmāṇām dāyikā vā chorikā vā
translated: Nor is she a giver or a taker of the qualities of buddhas.

original: na saṃskṛtadhātor dāyikā vā cchorikā vā / tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: na saṃskṛta dhātoḥ dāyikā vā chorikā vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: She is not a giver or a taker of the conditioned realm. Why is that?

original: utpādād vā tathāgatānām anutpādād vā tathāgatānāṃ sthitaivaiṣā dharmāṇāṃ dharmatā
analyzed: utpādāt vā tathāgatānām anutpādāt vā tathāgatānām sthitā eva eṣā dharmāṇām dharma tā
translated: Whether tathāgatas arise or whether tathāgatas do not arise, this dharma-constituent of dharmas just remains.

original: dharmadhātur dharmasthititā dharmaniyāmatā / tāṃ tathāgato 'bhisaṃbudhyate 'py abhisamety
analyzed: dharma dhātuḥ dharma sthiti tā dharma niyāma tā tām tathāgataḥ abhisaṃbudhyate pi abhisameti
translated: The dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the stability of dharmas, the dharma-hood of dharmas, the dharma-nature, the established order of dharmas, the connectedness of dharmas, the very powerful connectedness of dharmas—

original: apy abhisaṃbudhyābhisamety ācaṣṭe deśayati vivṛṇoti vibhajaty uttānīkaroti saṃprakāśayati /
analyzed: api abhisaṃbudhya abhisameti ācaṣṭe deśayati vivṛṇoti vibhajati uttānīkaroti saṃprakāśayati
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to that, and having fully awakened to it, he proclaims it, teaches it, explains it, establishes it, analyzes it, elucidates it, and reveals it.

original: atha khalu saṃbahulāni devaputraśatasahasrāṇy upary antarīkṣe sthitvā kilikilāprakṣveḍitāny
analyzed: atha khalu saṃbahulāni deva putra śata sahasrāṇi upari antarīkṣe sthitvā kilikilā prakṣveḍitāni
translated: Then many hundreds of thousands of gods, standing in the sky above, cried out in cheers and

original: akārṣur divyāni cotpalakumudapuṇḍarīkapadmamāndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi kṣipanti sma / evaṃ ca vācam abhāṣanta /
analyzed: akārṣuḥ divyāni ca utpala kumuda puṇḍarīka padma māndāravāṇi puṣpāṇi kṣipanti smaḥ evam ca vācam abhāṣanta
translated: threw down divine blue lotus, lotus, white water lily, white lotus, and mandārava flowers, and spoke this kind of speech:

original: dvitīyaṃ batedaṃ dharmacakrapravartanaṃ jāmbūdvīpe paśyāmaḥ / prajñāpāramitāyāṃ nirdiśya mānāyāṃ tatrānekāni devaputrasahasrāṇy anutpattikeṣu
analyzed: dvitīyam bata idam dharma cakra pravartanam jāmbūdvīpe paśyāmaḥ prajñāpāramitāyām nirdiśya mānāyām tatra anekāni deva putra sahasrāṇi anutpattikeṣu
translated: We see this second turning of the wheel of Dharma in Jambudvipa. When the perfection of wisdom was being taught, many thousands of gods there attained the acceptance that dharmas are not produced.

original: dharmeṣu kṣāntiṃ pratilabhante sma /
analyzed: dharmeṣu kṣāntim pratilabhante sma
translated: We see this second turning of the wheel of Dharma in Jambudvipa, when the perfection of wisdom is being taught, and there many thousands of gods attain acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: atha khalu bhagavān sthaviraṃ subhūtim āmantrayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān sthaviram subhūtim āmantrayāmāsa
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the elder Subhuti:

original: nedaṃ subhūte dvitiyaṃ dharmacakrapravartanaṃ nāpy ekaṃ nāpīyaṃ prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasya pravartanāya vā nivartanāya vā pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: na idam subhūte dvitiyam dharma cakra pravartanam na api ekam na api iyam prajñāpāramitā kasyacid dharmasya pravartanāya vā nivartanāya vā pratyupasthitā
translated: Subhuti, this is not a second turning of the wheel of Dharma, nor is it one. And this perfection of wisdom does not stand for the purpose of making anything arise or cease.

original: tat kasya hetor /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatām upādāya /
analyzed: abhāva svabhāva śūnyatām upādāya
translated: Because of the emptiness of the nature of non-existence.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: katamā bhagavann abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā yad iyaṃ prajñāpāramitā na kasyacid dharmasya pravartanāya vā nivartanāya vā pratyupasthitā /
analyzed: katamā bhagavan abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā yat iyam prajñāpāramitā na kasyacid dharmasya pravartanāya vā nivartanāya vā pratyupasthitā
translated: Blessed One, what is the emptiness of the nature of non-existence, by which this perfection of wisdom does not stand for the purpose of making anything arise or cease?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: prajñāpāramitā subhūte prajñāpāramitayā śūnyā / evaṃ dhyānaṃ vīryaṃ kṣāntiṃ śīlaṃ dānapāramitā dānapāramitayā śūnyā /
analyzed: prajñāpāramitā subhūte prajñāpāramitayā śūnyā evam dhyānam vīryam kṣāntim śīlam dāna pāramitā dāna pāramitayā śūnyā
translated: The perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, is empty of the perfection of wisdom. Thus, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of generosity are empty of the perfection of generosity.

original: adhyātmaśūnyatā adhyātmaśūnyatayā śūnyā yāvad abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatā abhāvasvabhāvaśūnyatayā śūnyā /
analyzed: adhyātma śūnyatā adhyātma śūnyatayā śūnyā yāvat abhāva svabhāva śūnyatā abhāva svabhāva śūnyatayā śūnyā
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is empty of the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence is empty of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: smṛtyupasthānāni smṛtyupasthānaśūnyatayā śūnyāni / evaṃ samyakprahāṇarddhipādendriyabalabodhyaṅgāni mārgā mārgaśūnyatayā /
analyzed: smṛti upasthānāni smṛti upasthāna śūnyatayā śūnyāni evam samyak prahāṇa ṛddhipāda indriya bala bodhyaṅgāni mārgāḥ mārga śūnyatayā
translated: The applications of mindfulness are empty of the emptiness of the applications of mindfulness. Thus, the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, factors of awakening, and the path are empty of the path.

original: śūnyāḥ / apramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattayo 'pramāṇadhyānārūpyasamāpattiśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: śūnyāḥ apramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpattayaḥ pramāṇa dhyāna ārūpya samāpatti śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The immeasurable, concentration, and formless absorptions are empty of the emptiness of the immeasurable, concentration, and formless absorptions.

original: āryasatyāny āryasatyaśūnyatayā śūnyāny /
analyzed: ārya satyāni ārya satya śūnyatayā śūnyāni
translated: The noble truths are empty of the emptiness of the noble truths.

original: aṣṭavimokṣā aṣṭavimokṣaśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭa vimokṣāḥ aṣṭa vimokṣa śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The eight liberations are empty of the emptiness of the eight liberations.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattayo navānupūrvavihārasamāpattiśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpattayaḥ nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The nine serial absorptions are empty of the emptiness of the nine serial absorptions.

original: śūnyatānimittāpraṇihitāni śūnyatānimittapraṇihitaśūnyatayā śūnyāni /
analyzed: śūnyatā nimitta apraṇihitāni śūnyatā nimitta praṇihita śūnyatayā śūnyāni
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are empty of the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: ṣaḍabhijñāḥ ṣaḍabhijñāśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: ṣaḍabhijñāḥ ṣaḍabhijñā śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The six higher knowledges are empty of the emptiness of the six higher knowledges.

original: sarvasamādhayaḥ sarvasamādhiśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: sarva samādhayaḥ sarva samādhi śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: All meditative absorptions are empty of all meditative absorptions.

original: dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukhaśūnyatayā śūnyāṃ /
analyzed: dhāraṇīmukhāni dhāraṇīmukha śūnyatayā śūnyām
translated: The dhāraṇī gateways are empty of the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: daśabalāni daśabalaśūnyatayā śūnyāni /🔽vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradyaśūnyatayā śūnyāni /
analyzed: daśa balāni daśa bala śūnyatayā śūnyāni  vaiśāradyāni vaiśāradya śūnyatayā śūnyāni
translated: The ten powers are empty of the ten powers.🔽The fearlessnesses are empty of the fearlessnesses.

original: pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvicchūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃvidaḥ pratisaṃvid śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The detailed and thorough knowledges are empty of the detailed and thorough knowledges.

original: aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmā aṣṭādaśāveṇikabuddhadharmaśūnyatayā śūnyāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharmāḥ aṣṭādaśa āveṇika buddha dharma śūnyatayā śūnyāḥ
translated: The eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: srotaāpattiphalaṃ srotaāpattiphalaśūnyatayā śūnyaṃ /
analyzed: srotaāpatti phalam srotaāpatti phala śūnyatayā śūnyam
translated: The fruit of entering the stream is empty of the fruit of entering the stream.

original: evaṃ sakṛdāgāmiphalam anāgāmiphalam arhattvaṃ pratyekabuddhatvaṃ sarvajñatā sarvajñatāśūnyatayā śūnyā /
analyzed: evam sakṛdāgāmi phalam anāgāmi phalam arhat tvam pratyekabuddha tvam sarvajña tā sarvajña tā śūnyatayā śūnyā
translated: In the same way, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and omniscience are empty of omniscience.

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said,

original: mahāpāramiteyaṃ bhagavan yad uta prajñāpāramitā / sarvadharmasvabhāvāś ca sarvadharmasvabhāvaiḥ
analyzed: mahā pāramitā iyam bhagavan yat uta prajñāpāramitā sarva dharma svabhāvāḥ ca sarva dharma svabhāvaiḥ
translated: Blessed One, this perfection of wisdom is a great perfection, because the intrinsic nature of all dharmas is empty of the intrinsic nature of all dharmas.

original: śūnyāḥ / bodhisattvāś ca mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitām āgamyānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim
analyzed: śūnyāḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca mahāsattvāḥ prajñāpāramitām āgamya anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim
translated: Bodhisattva-mahāsattvas, having relied on the perfection of wisdom, fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: abhisaṃbudhyante / na kaṃcid dharmam abhisaṃbudhyante dharmacakraṃ pravartanti /
analyzed: abhisaṃbudhyante na kaṃcid dharmam abhisaṃbudhyante dharmacakram pravartanti
translated: They attain perfect enlightenment. They do not attain any dharma. They turn the wheel of Dharma.

original: na kaṃcid dharmaṃ pravartayanti nivartayanti vā / na ca taiḥ kaścid dharmaḥ saṃdṛśyate /
analyzed: na kaṃcid dharmam pravartayanti nivartayanti vā na ca taiḥ kaścid dharmaḥ saṃdṛśyate
translated: They do not cause any dharma to turn or cease. And by them, no dharma is seen.

original: na kaścid dharmo dṛśyate / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: na kaścid dharmaḥ dṛśyate tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: No dharma is seen. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hi sarvadharmā nopalabhyante ye dharmāḥ pravartante vā nivartante vā / tat kasya hetos /
analyzed: tathā hi sarva dharmāḥ na upalabhyante ye dharmāḥ pravartante vā nivartante vā tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Because all dharmas that turn or cease are not apprehended. What is the reason for that?

original: tathā hy atyantānabhiniviṣṭāḥ sarvadharmāḥ / na hi śūnyatā pravartikā vā nivartikā vā /
analyzed: tathā hi atyanta anabhiniviṣṭāḥ sarva dharmāḥ na hi śūnyatā pravartikā vā nivartikā vā
translated: Because all dharmas are utterly non-apprehended. For emptiness does not cause turning or ceasing.

original: nānimittaṃ pravartakaṃ vā nivartakaṃ vā /🔽nāpraṇihitaṃ pravartakaṃ vā nivartakaṃ vā / yā evaṃdeśanā sā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ prakāśanā kathanā prajñāpanā prasthāpanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā sūcanā
analyzed: na animittam pravartakam vā nivartakam vā  na apraṇihitam pravartakam vā nivartakam vā yā evaṃdeśanā sā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ prakāśanā kathanā prajñāpanā prasthāpanā vivaraṇā vibhajanā sūcanā
translated: The signless does not cause turning or ceasing.🔽The wishless does not cause turning or ceasing. That teaching is the illumination, the explanation, the teaching, the establishment, the analysis, the division, the indication,

original: uttānīkaraṇaṃ saṃprakāśanā /
analyzed: uttānīkaraṇam saṃprakāśanā
translated: the raising up, the full explanation of the perfection of wisdom.

original: iyaṃ sā pariśuddhā prajñāpāramitāyā deśanā / yā ca prajñāpāramitāyā deśanā na kenacid deśitā na kenacit pratīcchitā /
analyzed: iyam sā pariśuddhā prajñāpāramitāyāḥ deśanā yā ca prajñāpāramitāyāḥ deśanā na kenacid deśitā na kenacid pratīcchitā
translated: This is the teaching of the pure perfection of wisdom, which is not taught by anyone and not accepted by anyone.

original: sā na kenacit sākṣātkṛtā / yā na kenacit sākṣātkṛtā na tatra kaścit parinirvṛto nāpi tayā dharmadeśanayā kaścid dakṣiṇīyaḥ kṛtaḥ /🔽iti tṛtiyaṃ sarvākārajñatādhikārasamāptidīpanam ity uktā sarvajñatā
analyzed: sā na kenacid sākṣātkṛtā yā na kenacid sākṣātkṛtā na tatra kaścid parinirvṛtaḥ na api tayā dharma deśanayā kaścid dakṣiṇīyaḥ kṛtaḥ  iti tṛtiyam sarva ākāra jña tā adhikāra samāpti dīpanam iti uktā sarvajña tā
translated: That which is not realized by anyone, in that there is no one who has attained final nirvāṇa, and by that teaching of the Dharma no one has been made worthy of offerings.

original: āryapañcaviṃśatiśāhasrikāyāṃ bhagavatyāṃ prajñāpāramitāyām abhisamayālaṃkārānusāreṇa saṃśodhitāyāṃ sarvajñatādhikāracaryāviśeṣaparivartaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
analyzed: ārya pañcaviṃśati śāhasrikāyām bhagavatyām prajñāpāramitāyām abhisamaya alaṃkāra anusāreṇa saṃśodhitāyām sarvajña tā adhikāra caryā viśeṣa parivartaḥ tṛtīyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter on the completion of the section on the knowledge of all aspects, as illuminated in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines, purified according to the Abhisamayālaṅkāra, the chapter on the special practices of the section on the knowledge of all aspects.
